Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַבָּאִ֖ים מִצְרָ֑יְמָה אֵ֣ת יַעֲקֹ֔ב אִ֥ישׁ וּבֵית֖וֹ בָּֽאוּ׃
Translated: These are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt with Jacob, each coming with his household:
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot veney yisherael havaiym mitserayemah et yaakov iysh uveytvo vau

Hebrew: רְאוּבֵ֣ן שִׁמְע֔וֹן לֵוִ֖י וִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;
Transliteration: reuven shimevon leviy viyhudah

Hebrew: יִשָּׂשכָ֥ר זְבוּלֻ֖ן וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;
Transliteration: yishashkhar zevulun uvineyamin

Hebrew: דָּ֥ן וְנַפְתָּלִ֖י גָּ֥ד וְאָשֵֽׁר׃
Translated: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
Transliteration: dan venafetaliy gad veasher

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י כׇּל־נֶ֛פֶשׁ יֹצְאֵ֥י יֶֽרֶךְ־יַעֲקֹ֖ב שִׁבְעִ֣ים נָ֑פֶשׁ וְיוֹסֵ֖ף הָיָ֥ה בְמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: The total number of persons that were of Jacob’s issue came to seventy, Joseph being already in Egypt.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-nefesh yotseey yerekhe-yaakov shiveiym nafesh veyvosef hayah vemitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤מׇת יוֹסֵף֙ וְכׇל־אֶחָ֔יו וְכֹ֖ל הַדּ֥וֹר הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: Joseph died, and all his brothers, and all that generation.
Transliteration: vayamׇt yvosef vekhׇl-echayv vekhol hadvor hahu

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל פָּר֧וּ וַֽיִּשְׁרְצ֛וּ וַיִּרְבּ֥וּ וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ אֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: But the Israelites were fertile and prolific; they multiplied and increased very greatly, so that the land was filled with them.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael faru vayisheretsu vayirevu vayaatsemu vimeod meod vatimale haarets otam {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קׇם מֶֽלֶךְ־חָדָ֖שׁ עַל־מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע אֶת־יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: A new king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.
Transliteration: vayakׇm melekhe-chadash al-mitserayiim asher lo-yada et-yvosef

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֶל־עַמּ֑וֹ הִנֵּ֗ה עַ֚ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רַ֥ב וְעָצ֖וּם מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: And he said to his people, “Look, the Israelite people are much too numerous for us.
Transliteration: vayomer el-amvo hineh am veney yisherael rav veatsum mimenu

Hebrew: הָ֥בָה נִֽתְחַכְּמָ֖ה ל֑וֹ פֶּן־יִרְבֶּ֗ה וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־תִקְרֶ֤אנָה מִלְחָמָה֙ וְנוֹסַ֤ף גַּם־הוּא֙ עַל־שֹׂ֣נְאֵ֔ינוּ וְנִלְחַם־בָּ֖נוּ וְעָלָ֥ה מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Let us deal shrewdly with them, so that they may not increase; otherwise in the event of war they may join our enemies in fighting against us and rise from the ground.”
Transliteration: havah nitechakhemah lvo fen-yireveh vehayah khiy-tikerenah milechamah venvosaf gam-hu al-shoneeynu venilecham-vanu vealah min-haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֤ימוּ עָלָיו֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מִסִּ֔ים לְמַ֥עַן עַנֹּת֖וֹ בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם וַיִּ֜בֶן עָרֵ֤י מִסְכְּנוֹת֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה אֶת־פִּתֹ֖ם וְאֶת־רַעַמְסֵֽס׃
Translated: So they set taskmasters over them to oppress them with forced labor; and they built garrison cities for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.
Transliteration: vayashiymu alayv sharey misiym lemaan anotvo vesivelotam vayiven arey misekhenvot lefareoh et-fitom veet-raameses

Hebrew: וְכַאֲשֶׁר֙ יְעַנּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ כֵּ֥ן יִרְבֶּ֖ה וְכֵ֣ן יִפְרֹ֑ץ וַיָּקֻ֕צוּ מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But the more they were oppressed, the more they increased and spread out, so that the [Egyptians] came to dread the Israelites.
Transliteration: vekhaasher yeanu otvo khen yireveh vekhen yiferots vayakutsu mifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבִ֧דוּ מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: The Egyptians ruthlessly imposed upon the Israelites
Transliteration: vayaavidu mitserayiim et-veney yisherael vefarekhe

Hebrew: וַיְמָרְר֨וּ אֶת־חַיֵּיהֶ֜ם בַּעֲבֹדָ֣ה קָשָׁ֗ה בְּחֹ֙מֶר֙ וּבִלְבֵנִ֔ים וּבְכׇל־עֲבֹדָ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־עֲבֹ֣דָתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־עָבְד֥וּ בָהֶ֖ם בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: the various labors that they made them perform. Ruthlessly they made life bitter for them with harsh labor at mortar and bricks and with all sorts of tasks in the field.
Transliteration: vayemareru et-chayeyhem vaavodah kashah vechomer uvileveniym uvekhׇl-avodah vashadeh et khׇl-avodatam asher-avedu vahem vefarekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאַחַת֙ שִׁפְרָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית פּוּעָֽה׃
Translated: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, one of whom was named Shiphrah and the other Puah,
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe mitserayiim lameyaledot haiveriyot asher shem haachat shiferah veshem hasheniyt fuah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בְּיַלֶּדְכֶן֙ אֶת־הָֽעִבְרִיּ֔וֹת וּרְאִיתֶ֖ן עַל־הָאׇבְנָ֑יִם אִם־בֵּ֥ן הוּא֙ וַהֲמִתֶּ֣ן אֹת֔וֹ וְאִם־בַּ֥ת הִ֖וא וָחָֽיָה׃
Translated: saying, “When you deliver the Hebrew women, look at the birthstool: if it is a boy, kill him; if it is a girl, let her live.”
Transliteration: vayomer veyaledekhen et-haiveriyyvot ureiyten al-haׇvenayiim im-ven hu vahamiten otvo veim-vat hiv vachayah

Hebrew: וַתִּירֶ֤אןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְלֹ֣א עָשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ן מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
Translated: The midwives, fearing God, did not do as the king of Egypt had told them; they let the boys live.
Transliteration: vatiyrena hameyaledot et-haElohimm velo ashu khaasher diver aleyhen melekhe mitserayiim vatechayeyna et-hayeladiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֔ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ן מַדּ֥וּעַ עֲשִׂיתֶ֖ן הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
Translated: So the king of Egypt summoned the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing, letting the boys live?”
Transliteration: vayikera melekhe-mitserayiim lameyaledot vayomer lahen madua ashiyten hadavar hazeh vatechayeyna et-hayeladiym

Hebrew: וַתֹּאמַ֤רְןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה כִּ֣י לֹ֧א כַנָּשִׁ֛ים הַמִּצְרִיֹּ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת כִּֽי־חָי֣וֹת הֵ֔נָּה בְּטֶ֨רֶם תָּב֧וֹא אֲלֵהֶ֛ן הַמְיַלֶּ֖דֶת וְיָלָֽדוּ׃
Translated: The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women: they are vigorous. Before the midwife can come to them, they have given birth.”
Transliteration: vatomarena hameyaledot el-fareoh khiy lo khanashiym hamitseriyot haiveriyot khiy-chayvot henah veterem tavvo alehen hameyaledet veyaladu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥יטֶב אֱלֹהִ֖ים לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֑ת וַיִּ֧רֶב הָעָ֛ם וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: And God dealt well with the midwives; and the people multiplied and increased greatly.
Transliteration: vayeytev Elohim lameyaledot vayirev haam vayaatsemu meod

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כִּֽי־יָרְא֥וּ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם בָּתִּֽים׃
Translated: And [God] established households for the midwives, because they feared God.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-yareu hameyaledot et-haElohim vayaash lahem vatiym

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו פַּרְעֹ֔ה לְכׇל־עַמּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר כׇּל־הַבֵּ֣ן הַיִּלּ֗וֹד הַיְאֹ֙רָה֙ תַּשְׁלִיכֻ֔הוּ וְכׇל־הַבַּ֖ת תְּחַיּֽוּן׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, “Every boy that is born you shall throw into the Nile, but let every girl live.”
Transliteration: vayetsav fareoh lekhׇl-amvo lemor khׇl-haven hayilvod hayeorah tasheliykhuhu vekhׇl-havat techayyun {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִ֖ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית לֵוִ֑י וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־בַּת־לֵוִֽי׃
Translated: A certain member of the house of Levi went and took [into his household as his wife] a woman of Levi.
Transliteration: vayelekhe iysh miveyt leviy vayikach et-vat-leviy

Hebrew: וַתַּ֥הַר הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֹתוֹ֙ כִּי־ט֣וֹב ה֔וּא וַֽתִּצְפְּנֵ֖הוּ שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה יְרָחִֽים׃
Translated: The woman conceived and bore a son; and when she saw how beautiful he was, she hid him for three months.
Transliteration: vatahar haishah vateled ven vatere otvo khiy-tvov hu vatitsefenehu sheloshah yerachiym

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכְלָ֣ה עוֹד֮ הַצְּפִינוֹ֒ וַתִּֽקַּֽח־לוֹ֙ תֵּ֣בַת גֹּ֔מֶא וַתַּחְמְרָ֥הֿ בַחֵמָ֖ר וּבַזָּ֑פֶת וַתָּ֤שֶׂם בָּהּ֙ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וַתָּ֥שֶׂם בַּסּ֖וּף עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
Translated: When she could hide him no longer, she got a wicker basket for him and caulked it with bitumen and pitch. She put the child into it and placed it among the reeds by the bank of the Nile.
Transliteration: velo-yakhelah vod hatsefiynvo vatikach-lvo tevat gome vatachemerahֿ vachemar uvazafet vatashem vah et-hayeled vatashem vasuf al-shefat hayeor

Hebrew: וַתֵּתַצַּ֥ב אֲחֹת֖וֹ מֵרָחֹ֑ק לְדֵעָ֕ה מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And his sister stationed herself at a distance, to learn what would befall him.
Transliteration: vatetatsav achotvo merachok ledeah mah-yeasheh lvo

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤רֶד בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֙ לִרְחֹ֣ץ עַל־הַיְאֹ֔ר וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֥יהָ הֹלְכֹ֖ת עַל־יַ֣ד הַיְאֹ֑ר וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֶת־הַתֵּבָה֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַסּ֔וּף וַתִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֶת־אֲמָתָ֖הּ וַתִּקָּחֶֽהָ׃
Translated: The daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe in the Nile, while her maidens walked along the Nile. She spied the basket among the reeds and sent her slave girl to fetch it.
Transliteration: vatered vat-fareoh lirechots al-hayeor venaaroteyha holekhot al-yad hayeor vatere et-hatevah vetvokhe hasuf vatishelach et-amatah vatikacheha

Hebrew: וַתִּפְתַּח֙ וַתִּרְאֵ֣הוּ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וְהִנֵּה־נַ֖עַר בֹּכֶ֑ה וַתַּחְמֹ֣ל עָלָ֔יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מִיַּלְדֵ֥י הָֽעִבְרִ֖ים זֶֽה׃
Translated: When she opened it, she saw that it was a child, a boy crying. She took pity on it and said, “This must be a Hebrew child.”
Transliteration: vatifetach vatireehu et-hayeled vehineh-naar vokheh vatachemol alayv vatomer miyaledey haiveriym zeh

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֲחֹתוֹ֮ אֶל־בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֒ הַאֵלֵ֗ךְ וְקָרָ֤אתִי לָךְ֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה מֵינֶ֔קֶת מִ֖ן הָעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת וְתֵינִ֥ק לָ֖ךְ אֶת־הַיָּֽלֶד׃
Translated: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and get you a Hebrew nurse to suckle the child for you?”
Transliteration: vatomer achotvo el-vat-fareoh haelekhe vekaratiy lakhe ishah meyneket min haiveriyot veteynik lakhe et-hayaled

Hebrew: וַתֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵ֑כִי וַתֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ הָֽעַלְמָ֔ה וַתִּקְרָ֖א אֶת־אֵ֥ם הַיָּֽלֶד׃
Translated: And Pharaoh’s daughter answered, “Yes.” So the girl went and called the child’s mother.
Transliteration: vatomer-lah vat-fareoh lekhiy vatelekhe haalemah vatikera et-em hayaled

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר לָ֣הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֗ה הֵילִ֜יכִי אֶת־הַיֶּ֤לֶד הַזֶּה֙ וְהֵינִקִ֣הוּ לִ֔י וַאֲנִ֖י אֶתֵּ֣ן אֶת־שְׂכָרֵ֑ךְ וַתִּקַּ֧ח הָאִשָּׁ֛ה הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַתְּנִיקֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child and nurse it for me, and I will pay your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed it.
Transliteration: vatomer lah vat-fareoh heyliykhiy et-hayeled hazeh veheynikihu liy vaaniy eten et-shekharekhe vatikach haishah hayeled vateniykehu

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּ֣ל הַיֶּ֗לֶד וַתְּבִאֵ֙הוּ֙ לְבַת־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַֽיְהִי־לָ֖הּ לְבֵ֑ן וַתִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַתֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֥י מִן־הַמַּ֖יִם מְשִׁיתִֽהוּ׃
Translated: When the child grew up, she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, who made him her son. She named him Moses, explaining, “I drew him out of the water.”
Transliteration: vayigedal hayeled vateviehu levat-fareoh vayehiy-lah leven vatikera shemvo mosheh vatomer khiy min-hamayiim meshiytihu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֗ם וַיִּגְדַּ֤ל מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֵּצֵ֣א אֶל־אֶחָ֔יו וַיַּ֖רְא בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם וַיַּרְא֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י מַכֶּ֥ה אִישׁ־עִבְרִ֖י מֵאֶחָֽיו׃
Translated: Some time after that, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his kinsfolk and witnessed their labors. He saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his kinsmen.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayamiym hahem vayigedal mosheh vayetse el-echayv vayare vesivelotam vayare iysh mitseriy makheh iysh-iveriy meechayv

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤פֶן כֹּה֙ וָכֹ֔ה וַיַּ֖רְא כִּ֣י אֵ֣ין אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־הַמִּצְרִ֔י וַֽיִּטְמְנֵ֖הוּ בַּחֽוֹל׃
Translated: He turned this way and that and, seeing no one about, he struck down the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.
Transliteration: vayifen khoh vakhoh vayare khiy eyn iysh vayakhe et-hamitseriy vayitemenehu vachvol

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וְהִנֵּ֛ה שְׁנֵֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֥ים עִבְרִ֖ים נִצִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לָֽרָשָׁ֔ע לָ֥מָּה תַכֶּ֖ה רֵעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: When he went out the next day, he found two Hebrews fighting; so he said to the offender, “Why do you strike your fellow?”
Transliteration: vayetse vayyvom hasheniy vehineh sheney-anashiym iveriym nitsiym vayomer larasha lamah takheh reekha

Hebrew: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר מִ֣י שָֽׂמְךָ֞ לְאִ֨ישׁ שַׂ֤ר וְשֹׁפֵט֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ הַלְהׇרְגֵ֙נִי֙ אַתָּ֣ה אֹמֵ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָרַ֖גְתָּ אֶת־הַמִּצְרִ֑י וַיִּירָ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אָכֵ֖ן נוֹדַ֥ע הַדָּבָֽר׃
Translated: He retorted, “Who made you chief and ruler over us? Do you mean to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses was frightened, and thought: Then the matter is known!
Transliteration: vayomer miy shamekha leiysh shar veshofet aleynu halehׇregeniy atah omer khaasher harageta et-hamitseriy vayiyra mosheh vayomar akhen nvoda hadavar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ לַהֲרֹ֣ג אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּבְרַ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִדְיָ֖ן וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב עַֽל־הַבְּאֵֽר׃
Translated: When Pharaoh learned of the matter, he sought to kill Moses; but Moses fled from Pharaoh. He arrived in the land of Midian, and sat down beside a well.
Transliteration: vayishema fareoh et-hadavar hazeh vayevakesh laharog et-mosheh vayiverach mosheh mifeney fareoh vayeshev veerets-mideyan vayeshev al-haveer

Hebrew: וּלְכֹהֵ֥ן מִדְיָ֖ן שֶׁ֣בַע בָּנ֑וֹת וַתָּבֹ֣אנָה וַתִּדְלֶ֗נָה וַתְּמַלֶּ֙אנָה֙ אֶת־הָ֣רְהָטִ֔ים לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת צֹ֥אן אֲבִיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. They came to draw water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock;
Transliteration: ulekhohen mideyan sheva vanvot vatavonah vatidelenah vatemalenah et-harehatiym lehashekvot tson aviyhen

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָרֹעִ֖ים וַיְגָרְשׁ֑וּם וַיָּ֤קׇם מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיּ֣וֹשִׁעָ֔ן וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־צֹאנָֽם׃
Translated: but shepherds came and drove them off. Moses rose to their defense, and he watered their flock.
Transliteration: vayavou haroiym vayegareshum vayakׇm mosheh vayyvoshian vayasheke et-tsonam

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֕אנָה אֶל־רְעוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִיהֶ֑ן וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַדּ֛וּעַ מִהַרְתֶּ֥ן בֹּ֖א הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: When they returned to their father Reuel, he said, “How is it that you have come back so soon today?”
Transliteration: vatavonah el-reuel aviyhen vayomer madua mihareten vo hayyvom

Hebrew: וַתֹּאמַ֕רְןָ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י הִצִּילָ֖נוּ מִיַּ֣ד הָרֹעִ֑ים וְגַם־דָּלֹ֤ה דָלָה֙ לָ֔נוּ וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: They answered, “An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds; he even drew water for us and watered the flock.”
Transliteration: vatomarena iysh mitseriy hitsiylanu miyad haroiym vegam-daloh dalah lanu vayasheke et-hatson

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֶל־בְּנֹתָ֖יו וְאַיּ֑וֹ לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ עֲזַבְתֶּ֣ן אֶת־הָאִ֔ישׁ קִרְאֶ֥ן ל֖וֹ וְיֹ֥אכַל לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: He said to his daughters, “Where is he then? Why did you leave the man? Ask him in to break bread.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-venotayv veayyvo lamah zeh azaveten et-haiysh kireen lvo veyokhal lachem

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹאֶל מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אֶת־הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיִּתֵּ֛ן אֶת־צִפֹּרָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ לְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Moses consented to stay with the man, and he gave Moses his daughter Zipporah as wife.
Transliteration: vayyvoel mosheh lashevet et-haiysh vayiten et-tsiforah vitvo lemosheh

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ גֵּרְשֹׁ֑ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר גֵּ֣ר הָיִ֔יתִי בְּאֶ֖רֶץ נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: She bore a son whom he named Gershom, for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land.”
Transliteration: vateled ven vayikera et-shemvo gereshom khiy amar ger hayiytiy veerets nׇkheriyah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַיָּמִ֨ים הָֽרַבִּ֜ים הָהֵ֗ם וַיָּ֙מׇת֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיֵּאָנְח֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מִן־הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה וַיִּזְעָ֑קוּ וַתַּ֧עַל שַׁוְעָתָ֛ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים מִן־הָעֲבֹדָֽה׃
Translated: A long time after that, the king of Egypt died. The Israelites were groaning under the bondage and cried out; and their cry for help from the bondage rose up to God.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayamiym haraviym hahem vayamׇt melekhe mitserayiim vayeanechu veney-yisherael min-haavodah vayizeaku vataal shaveatam el-haElohim min-haavodah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־נַאֲקָתָ֑ם וַיִּזְכֹּ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־בְּרִית֔וֹ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־יִצְחָ֥ק וְאֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: God heard their moaning, and God remembered the covenant with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.
Transliteration: vayishema Elohim et-naakatam vayizekhor Elohim et-veriytvo et-averaham et-yitsechak veet-yaakov

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֖דַע אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: God looked upon the Israelites, and God took notice of them.
Transliteration: vayare Elohim et-veney yisherael vayeda Elohim {s}

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֗ה הָיָ֥ה רֹעֶ֛ה אֶת־צֹ֛אן יִתְר֥וֹ חֹתְנ֖וֹ כֹּהֵ֣ן מִדְיָ֑ן וַיִּנְהַ֤ג אֶת־הַצֹּאן֙ אַחַ֣ר הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר וַיָּבֹ֛א אֶל־הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים חֹרֵֽבָה׃
Translated: Now Moses, tending the flock of his father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian, drove the flock into the wilderness, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
Transliteration: umosheh hayah roeh et-tson yitervo chotenvo khohen mideyan vayinehag et-hatson achar hamidevar vayavo el-har haElohim chorevah

Hebrew: וַ֠יֵּרָ֠א מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֵלָ֛יו בְּלַבַּת־אֵ֖שׁ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַסְּנֶ֑ה וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַסְּנֶה֙ בֹּעֵ֣ר בָּאֵ֔שׁ וְהַסְּנֶ֖ה אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אֻכָּֽל׃
Translated: A messenger of יהוה appeared to him in a blazing fire out of a bush. He gazed, and there was a bush all aflame, yet the bush was not consumed.
Transliteration: vayera maleakhe yehovah elayv velavat-esh mitvokhe haseneh vayare vehineh haseneh voer vaesh vehaseneh eynenu ukhal

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אָסֻֽרָה־נָּ֣א וְאֶרְאֶ֔ה אֶת־הַמַּרְאֶ֥ה הַגָּדֹ֖ל הַזֶּ֑ה מַדּ֖וּעַ לֹא־יִבְעַ֥ר הַסְּנֶֽה׃
Translated: Moses said, “I must turn aside to look at this marvelous sight; why doesn’t the bush burn up?”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh asurah-na veereeh et-hamareeh hagadol hazeh madua lo-yivear haseneh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יְהֹוָ֖ה כִּ֣י סָ֣ר לִרְא֑וֹת וַיִּקְרָא֩ אֵלָ֨יו אֱלֹהִ֜ים מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַסְּנֶ֗ה וַיֹּ֛אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֥ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: When יהוה saw that he had turned aside to look, God called to him out of the bush: “Moses! Moses!” He answered, “Here I am.”
Transliteration: vayare yehovah khiy sar lirevot vayikera elayv Elohim mitvokhe haseneh vayomer mosheh mosheh vayomer hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תִּקְרַ֣ב הֲלֹ֑ם שַׁל־נְעָלֶ֙יךָ֙ מֵעַ֣ל רַגְלֶ֔יךָ כִּ֣י הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ עוֹמֵ֣ד עָלָ֔יו אַדְמַת־קֹ֖דֶשׁ הֽוּא׃
Translated: And [God] said, “Do not come closer! Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place on which you stand is holy ground!”
Transliteration: vayomer al-tikerav halom shal-nealeykha meal rageleykha khiy hamakvom asher atah vomed alayv ademat-kodesh hu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אָנֹכִי֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֔יךָ אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֖ק וֵאלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיַּסְתֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ פָּנָ֔יו כִּ֣י יָרֵ֔א מֵהַבִּ֖יט אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: and continued, “I am the God of your father’s [house]—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look at God.
Transliteration: vayomer anokhiy elohey aviykha elohey averaham elohey yitsechak velohey yaakov vayaseter mosheh fanayv khiy yare mehaviyt el-haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה רָאֹ֥ה רָאִ֛יתִי אֶת־עֳנִ֥י עַמִּ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־צַעֲקָתָ֤ם שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י נֹֽגְשָׂ֔יו כִּ֥י יָדַ֖עְתִּי אֶת־מַכְאֹבָֽיו׃
Translated: And יהוה continued, “I have marked well the plight of My people in Egypt and have heeded their outcry because of their taskmasters; yes, I am mindful of their sufferings.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah raoh raiytiy et-oniy amiy asher vemitserayiim veet-tsaakatam shamaetiy mifeney nogeshayv khiy yadaetiy et-makheovayv

Hebrew: וָאֵרֵ֞ד לְהַצִּיל֣וֹ ׀ מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרַ֗יִם וּֽלְהַעֲלֹתוֹ֮ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַהִוא֒ אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ טוֹבָה֙ וּרְחָבָ֔ה אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ אֶל־מְק֤וֹם הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
Translated: I have come down to rescue them from the Egyptians and to bring them out of that land to a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey, the region of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
Transliteration: vaered lehatsiylvo miyad mitserayiim ulehaalotvo min-haarets hahiv el-erets tvovah urechavah el-erets zavat chalav udevash el-mekvom hakhenaaniy vehachitiy vehaemoriy vehaferiziy vehachiviy vehayevusiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנֵּ֛ה צַעֲקַ֥ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּ֣אָה אֵלָ֑י וְגַם־רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הַלַּ֔חַץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִצְרַ֖יִם לֹחֲצִ֥ים אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Now the cry of the Israelites has reached Me; moreover, I have seen how the Egyptians oppress them.
Transliteration: veatah hineh tsaakat veney-yisherael vaah elay vegam-raiytiy et-halachats asher mitserayiim lochatsiym otam

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה לְכָ֔ה וְאֶֽשְׁלָחֲךָ֖ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְהוֹצֵ֛א אֶת־עַמִּ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Come, therefore, I will send you to Pharaoh, and you shall free My people, the Israelites, from Egypt.”
Transliteration: veatah lekhah veeshelachakha el-fareoh vehvotse et-amiy veney-yisherael mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים מִ֣י אָנֹ֔כִי כִּ֥י אֵלֵ֖ךְ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְכִ֥י אוֹצִ֛יא אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: But Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and free the Israelites from Egypt?”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-haElohimm miy anokhiy khiy elekhe el-fareoh vekhiy votsiy et-veney yisherael mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כִּֽי־אֶֽהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ וְזֶה־לְּךָ֣ הָא֔וֹת כִּ֥י אָנֹכִ֖י שְׁלַחְתִּ֑יךָ בְּהוֹצִֽיאֲךָ֤ אֶת־הָעָם֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם תַּֽעַבְדוּן֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים עַ֖ל הָהָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And [God] said, “I will be with you; that shall be your sign that it was I who sent you. And when you have freed the people from Egypt, you shall worship God at this mountain.”
Transliteration: vayomer khiy-eheyeh imakhe vezeh-lekha havot khiy anokhiy shelachetiykha vehvotsiyakha et-haam mimitserayiim taavedun et-haElohimm al hahar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֣י בָא֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְאָמַרְתִּ֣י לָהֶ֔ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְאָֽמְרוּ־לִ֣י מַה־שְּׁמ֔וֹ מָ֥ה אֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: Moses said to God, “When I come to the Israelites and say to them, ‘The God of your fathers’ [house] has sent me to you,’ and they ask me, ‘What is [God’s] name?’ what shall I say to them?”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-haElohimm hineh anokhiy va el-veney yisherael veamaretiy lahem elohey avvoteykhem shelachaniy aleykhem veameru-liy mah-shemvo mah omar alehem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶֽהְיֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And God said to Moses, “Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh,” continuing, “Thus shall you say to the Israelites, ‘Ehyeh sent me to you.’”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-mosheh eheyeh asher eheyeh vayomer khoh tomar liveney yisherael eheyeh shelachaniy aleykhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ע֨וֹד אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כֹּֽה־תֹאמַר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֛ק וֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם זֶה־שְּׁמִ֣י לְעֹלָ֔ם וְזֶ֥ה זִכְרִ֖י לְדֹ֥ר דֹּֽר׃
Translated:
And God said further to Moses, “Thus shall you speak to the Israelites: יהוה, the God of your fathers’ [house]—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob—has sent me to you:
This shall be My name forever,
This My appellation for all eternity.
Transliteration: vayomer vod Elohim el-mosheh khoh-tomar el-veney yisherael yehovah elohey avoteykhem elohey averaham elohey yitsechak velohey yaakov shelachaniy aleykhem zeh-shemiy leolam vezeh zikheriy ledor dor

Hebrew: לֵ֣ךְ וְאָֽסַפְתָּ֞ אֶת־זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֤ אֲלֵהֶם֙ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ נִרְאָ֣ה אֵלַ֔י אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם יִצְחָ֥ק וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר פָּקֹ֤ד פָּקַ֙דְתִּי֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הֶעָשׂ֥וּי לָכֶ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: “Go and assemble the elders of Israel and say to them: יהוה, the God of your fathers’ [house]—the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—has appeared to me and said, ‘I have taken note of you and of what is being done to you in Egypt,
Transliteration: lekhe veasafeta et-zikeney yisherael veamareta alehem yehovah elohey avoteykhem nireah elay elohey averaham yitsechak veyaakov lemor fakod fakadetiy etekhem veet-heashuy lakhem vemitserayiim

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר אַעֲלֶ֣ה אֶתְכֶם֮ מֵעֳנִ֣י מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: and I have declared: I will take you out of the misery of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.’
Transliteration: vaomar aaleh etekhem meoniy mitserayiim el-erets hakhenaaniy vehachitiy vehaemoriy vehaferiziy vehachiviy vehayevusiy el-erets zavat chalav udevash

Hebrew: וְשָׁמְע֖וּ לְקֹלֶ֑ךָ וּבָאתָ֡ אַתָּה֩ וְזִקְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֗יִם וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָֽעִבְרִיִּים֙ נִקְרָ֣ה עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה נֵֽלְכָה־נָּ֞א דֶּ֣רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְנִזְבְּחָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: They will listen to you; then you shall go with the elders of Israel to the king of Egypt and you shall say to him, ‘יהוה, the God of the Hebrews, became manifest to us. Now therefore, let us go a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to our God יהוה.’
Transliteration: veshameu lekolekha uvata atah vezikeney yisherael el-melekhe mitserayiim vaamaretem elayv yehovah elohey haiveriyiym nikerah aleynu veatah nelekhah-na derekhe sheloshet yamiym vamidevar venizevechah layhovah eloheynu

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֠י לֹֽא־יִתֵּ֥ן אֶתְכֶ֛ם מֶ֥לֶךְ מִצְרַ֖יִם לַהֲלֹ֑ךְ וְלֹ֖א בְּיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
Translated: Yet I know that the king of Egypt will let you go only because of a greater might.
Transliteration: vaaniy yadaetiy khiy lo-yiten etekhem melekhe mitserayiim lahalokhe velo veyad chazakah

Hebrew: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֤י אֶת־יָדִי֙ וְהִכֵּיתִ֣י אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּכֹל֙ נִפְלְאֹתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: So I will stretch out My hand and smite Egypt with various wonders which I will work upon them; after that he shall let you go.
Transliteration: veshalachetiy et-yadiy vehikheytiy et-mitserayiim vekhol nifeleotay asher eesheh vekirevvo veacharey-khen yeshalach etekhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֛י אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָֽעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה בְּעֵינֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָיָה֙ כִּ֣י תֵֽלֵכ֔וּן לֹ֥א תֵלְכ֖וּ רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated: And I will dispose the Egyptians favorably toward this people, so that when you go, you will not go away empty-handed.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-chen haam-hazeh veeyney mitserayiim vehayah khiy telekhun lo telekhu reykam

Hebrew: וְשָׁאֲלָ֨ה אִשָּׁ֤ה מִשְּׁכֶנְתָּהּ֙ וּמִגָּרַ֣ת בֵּיתָ֔הּ כְּלֵי־כֶ֛סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב וּשְׂמָלֹ֑ת וְשַׂמְתֶּ֗ם עַל־בְּנֵיכֶם֙ וְעַל־בְּנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְנִצַּלְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Each woman shall borrow from her neighbor and the lodger in her house objects of silver and gold, and clothing, and you shall put these on your sons and daughters, thus stripping the Egyptians.”
Transliteration: veshaalah ishah mishekhenetah umigarat veytah kheley-khesef ukheley zahav ushemalot veshametem al-veneykhem veal-venoteykhem venitsaletem et-mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר וְהֵן֙ לֹֽא־יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לִ֔י וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְע֖וּ בְּקֹלִ֑י כִּ֣י יֹֽאמְר֔וּ לֹֽא־נִרְאָ֥ה אֵלֶ֖יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But Moses spoke up and said, “What if they do not believe me and do not listen to me, but say: יהוה did not appear to you?”
Transliteration: vayaan mosheh vayomer vehen lo-yaamiynu liy velo yishemeu vekoliy khiy yomeru lo-nireah eleykha yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלָ֛יו יְהֹוָ֖ה (מזה) [מַה־זֶּ֣ה] בְיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מַטֶּֽה׃
Translated: יהוה said to him, “What is that in your hand?” And he replied, “A rod.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv yehovah (mzh) [mah-zeh] veyadekha vayomer mateh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַשְׁלִיכֵ֣הוּ אַ֔רְצָה וַיַּשְׁלִכֵ֥הוּ אַ֖רְצָה וַיְהִ֣י לְנָחָ֑שׁ וַיָּ֥נׇס מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: [God] said, “Cast it on the ground.” He cast it on the ground and it became a snake; and Moses recoiled from it.
Transliteration: vayomer hasheliykhehu aretsah vayashelikhehu aretsah vayehiy lenachash vayanׇs mosheh mifanayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה שְׁלַח֙ יָֽדְךָ֔ וֶאֱחֹ֖ז בִּזְנָב֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיַּ֣חֲזֶק בּ֔וֹ וַיְהִ֥י לְמַטֶּ֖ה בְּכַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Put out your hand and grasp it by the tail”—he put out his hand and seized it, and it became a rod in his hand—
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh shelach yadekha veechoz vizenavvo vayishelach yadvo vayachazek vvo vayehiy lemateh vekhafvo

Hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן יַאֲמִ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־נִרְאָ֥ה אֵלֶ֛יךָ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתָ֑ם אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֖ק וֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: “that they may believe that יהוה, the God of their ancestors, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did appear to you.”
Transliteration: lemaan yaamiynu khiy-nireah eleykha yehovah elohey avotam elohey averaham elohey yitsechak velohey yaakov

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה ל֜וֹ ע֗וֹד הָֽבֵא־נָ֤א יָֽדְךָ֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַיָּבֵ֥א יָד֖וֹ בְּחֵיק֑וֹ וַיּ֣וֹצִאָ֔הּ וְהִנֵּ֥ה יָד֖וֹ מְצֹרַ֥עַת כַּשָּֽׁלֶג׃
Translated: יהוה said to him further, “Put your hand into your bosom.” He put his hand into his bosom; and when he took it out, his hand was encrusted with snowy scales!
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah lvo vod have-na yadekha vecheykekha vayave yadvo vecheykvo vayyvotsiah vehineh yadvo metsoraat khashaleg

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הָשֵׁ֤ב יָֽדְךָ֙ אֶל־חֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַיָּ֥שֶׁב יָד֖וֹ אֶל־חֵיק֑וֹ וַיּֽוֹצִאָהּ֙ מֵֽחֵיק֔וֹ וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֖בָה כִּבְשָׂרֽוֹ׃
Translated: And [God] said, “Put your hand back into your bosom.”—He put his hand back into his bosom; and when he took it out of his bosom, there it was again like the rest of his body.—
Transliteration: vayomer hashev yadekha el-cheykekha vayashev yadvo el-cheykvo vayyvotsiah mecheykvo vehineh-shavah khivesharvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ אִם־לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לָ֔ךְ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּ לְקֹ֖ל הָאֹ֣ת הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן וְהֶֽאֱמִ֔ינוּ לְקֹ֖ל הָאֹ֥ת הָאַחֲרֽוֹן׃
Translated: “And if they do not believe you or pay heed to the first sign, they will believe the second.
Transliteration: vehayah im-lo yaamiynu lakhe velo yishemeu lekol haot harishvon veheemiynu lekol haot haacharvon

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה אִם־לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֡ינוּ גַּם֩ לִשְׁנֵ֨י הָאֹת֜וֹת הָאֵ֗לֶּה וְלֹ֤א יִשְׁמְעוּן֙ לְקֹלֶ֔ךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֙ מִמֵּימֵ֣י הַיְאֹ֔ר וְשָׁפַכְתָּ֖ הַיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְהָי֤וּ הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּקַּ֣ח מִן־הַיְאֹ֔ר וְהָי֥וּ לְדָ֖ם בַּיַּבָּֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: And if they are not convinced by both these signs and still do not heed you, take some water from the Nile and pour it on the dry ground, and it—the water that you take from the Nile—will turn to blood on the dry ground.”
Transliteration: vehayah im-lo yaamiynu gam lisheney haotvot haeleh velo yishemeun lekolekha velakacheta mimeymey hayeor veshafakheta hayavashah vehayu hamayiim asher tikach min-hayeor vehayu ledam vayavashet

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־יְהֹוָה֮ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנָי֒ לֹא֩ אִ֨ישׁ דְּבָרִ֜ים אָנֹ֗כִי גַּ֤ם מִתְּמוֹל֙ גַּ֣ם מִשִּׁלְשֹׁ֔ם גַּ֛ם מֵאָ֥ז דַּבֶּרְךָ֖ אֶל־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֧י כְבַד־פֶּ֛ה וּכְבַ֥ד לָשׁ֖וֹן אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: But Moses said to יהוה, “Please, O my lord, I have never been a man of words, either in times past or now that You have spoken to Your servant; I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-yehovah viy adonay lo iysh devariym anokhiy gam mitemvol gam mishileshom gam meaz daverekha el-avedekha khiy khevad-feh ukhevad lashvon anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו מִ֣י שָׂ֣ם פֶּה֮ לָֽאָדָם֒ א֚וֹ מִֽי־יָשׂ֣וּם אִלֵּ֔ם א֣וֹ חֵרֵ֔שׁ א֥וֹ פִקֵּ֖חַ א֣וֹ עִוֵּ֑ר הֲלֹ֥א אָנֹכִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And יהוה said to him, “Who gives humans speech? Who makes them dumb or deaf, seeing or blind? Is it not I, יהוה?
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elayv miy sham feh laadam vo miy-yashum ilem vo cheresh vo fikecha vo iver halo anokhiy yehovah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה לֵ֑ךְ וְאָנֹכִי֙ אֶֽהְיֶ֣ה עִם־פִּ֔יךָ וְהוֹרֵיתִ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: Now go, and I will be with you as you speak and will instruct you what to say.”
Transliteration: veatah lekhe veanokhiy eheyeh im-fiykha vehvoreytiykha asher tedaver

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר בִּ֣י אֲדֹנָ֑י שְֽׁלַֽח־נָ֖א בְּיַד־תִּשְׁלָֽח׃
Translated: But he said, “Please, O my lord, make someone else Your agent.”
Transliteration: vayomer viy adonay shelach-na veyad-tishelach

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֨ף יְהֹוָ֜ה בְּמֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הֲלֹ֨א אַהֲרֹ֤ן אָחִ֙יךָ֙ הַלֵּוִ֔י יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּֽי־דַבֵּ֥ר יְדַבֵּ֖ר ה֑וּא וְגַ֤ם הִנֵּה־הוּא֙ יֹצֵ֣א לִקְרָאתֶ֔ךָ וְרָאֲךָ֖ וְשָׂמַ֥ח בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: יהוה became angry with Moses and said, “There is your brother Aaron the Levite. He, I know, speaks readily. Even now he is setting out to meet you, and he will be happy to see you.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah vemosheh vayomer halo aharon achiykha haleviy yadaetiy khiy-daver yedaver hu vegam hineh-hu yotse likeratekha veraakha veshamach velivvo

Hebrew: וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים בְּפִ֑יו וְאָנֹכִ֗י אֶֽהְיֶ֤ה עִם־פִּ֙יךָ֙ וְעִם־פִּ֔יהוּ וְהוֹרֵיתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃
Translated: You shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth—I will be with you and with him as you speak, and tell both of you what to do—
Transliteration: vedivareta elayv veshameta et-hadevariym vefiyv veanokhiy eheyeh im-fiykha veim-fiyhu vehvoreytiy etekhem et asher taashun

Hebrew: וְדִבֶּר־ה֥וּא לְךָ֖ אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וְהָ֤יָה הוּא֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לְּךָ֣ לְפֶ֔ה וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶה־לּ֥וֹ לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: and he shall speak for you to the people. Thus he shall serve as your spokesman, with you playing the role of God to him.
Transliteration: vediver-hu lekha el-haam vehayah hu yiheyeh-lekha lefeh veatah tiheyeh-lvo lelohiym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמַּטֶּ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה תִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂה־בּ֖וֹ אֶת־הָאֹתֹֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: And take with you this rod, with which you shall perform the signs.”
Transliteration: veet-hamateh hazeh tikach veyadekha asher taasheh-vvo et-haotot {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֜ה וַיָּ֣שׇׁב ׀ אֶל־יֶ֣תֶר חֹֽתְנ֗וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אֵ֣לְכָה נָּ֗א וְאָשׁ֙וּבָה֙ אֶל־אַחַ֣י אֲשֶׁר־בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֶרְאֶ֖ה הַעוֹדָ֣ם חַיִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יִתְר֛וֹ לְמֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵ֥ךְ לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Moses went back to his father-in-law Jether and said to him, “Let me go back to my kinsfolk in Egypt and see how they are faring.” And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”
Transliteration: vayelekhe mosheh vayashׇv el-yeter chotenvo vayomer lvo elekhah na veashuvah el-achay asher-vemitserayiim veereeh havodam chayiym vayomer yitervo lemosheh lekhe leshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ בְּמִדְיָ֔ן לֵ֖ךְ שֻׁ֣ב מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּי־מֵ֙תוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים הַֽמְבַקְשִׁ֖ים אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses in Midian, “Go back to Egypt, for all those who sought to kill you are dead.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh vemideyan lekhe shuv mitserayiim khiy-metu khׇl-haanashiym hamevakeshiym et-nafeshekha

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֣וֹ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֗יו וַיַּרְכִּבֵם֙ עַֽל־הַחֲמֹ֔ר וַיָּ֖שׇׁב אַ֣רְצָה מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־מַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Moses took his wife and sons, mounted them on an ass, and went back to the land of Egypt; and Moses took the rod of God with him.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-ishetvo veet-vanayv vayarekhivem al-hachamor vayashׇv aretsah mitserayiim vayikach mosheh et-mateh haElohim veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֙ לָשׁ֣וּב מִצְרַ֔יְמָה רְאֵ֗ה כׇּל־הַמֹּֽפְתִים֙ אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי בְיָדֶ֔ךָ וַעֲשִׂיתָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַאֲנִי֙ אֲחַזֵּ֣ק אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “When you return to Egypt, see that you perform before Pharaoh all the marvels that I have put within your power. I, however, will stiffen his heart so that he will not let the people go.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh velekhetekha lashuv mitserayemah reeh khׇl-hamofetiym asher-shametiy veyadekha vaashiytam lifeney fareoh vaaniy achazek et-livvo velo yeshalach et-haam

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּנִ֥י בְכֹרִ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says יהוה: Israel is My first-born son.
Transliteration: veamareta el-fareoh khoh amar yehovah veniy vekhoriy yisherael

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֵלֶ֗יךָ שַׁלַּ֤ח אֶת־בְּנִי֙ וְיַֽעַבְדֵ֔נִי וַתְּמָאֵ֖ן לְשַׁלְּח֑וֹ הִנֵּה֙ אָנֹכִ֣י הֹרֵ֔ג אֶת־בִּנְךָ֖ בְּכֹרֶֽךָ׃
Translated: I have said to you, “Let My son go, that he may worship Me,” yet you refuse to let him go. Now I will slay your first-born son.’”
Transliteration: vaomar eleykha shalach et-veniy veyaavedeniy vatemaen leshalechvo hineh anokhiy horeg et-vinekha vekhorekha

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בַדֶּ֖רֶךְ בַּמָּל֑וֹן וַיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֣הוּ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ הֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: At a night encampment on the way, יהוה encountered him and sought to kill him.
Transliteration: vayehiy vaderekhe vamalvon vayifegeshehu yehovah vayevakesh hamiytvo

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֨ח צִפֹּרָ֜ה צֹ֗ר וַתִּכְרֹת֙ אֶת־עׇרְלַ֣ת בְּנָ֔הּ וַתַּגַּ֖ע לְרַגְלָ֑יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֧י חֲתַן־דָּמִ֛ים אַתָּ֖ה לִֽי׃
Translated: So Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son’s foreskin, and touched his legs with it, saying, “You are truly a bridegroom of blood to me!”
Transliteration: vatikach tsiforah tsor vatikherot et-ׇrelat venah vataga leragelayv vatomer khiy chatan-damiym atah liy

Hebrew: וַיִּ֖רֶף מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אָ֚ז אָֽמְרָ֔ה חֲתַ֥ן דָּמִ֖ים לַמּוּלֹֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: And when [God] let him alone, she added, “A bridegroom of blood because of the circumcision.”
Transliteration: vayiref mimenu az amerah chatan damiym lamulot {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן לֵ֛ךְ לִקְרַ֥את מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּ֑רָה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַֽיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֛הוּ בְּהַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וַיִּשַּׁק־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Aaron, “Go to meet Moses in the wilderness.” He went and met him at the mountain of God, and he kissed him.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-aharon lekhe likerat mosheh hamidevarah vayelekhe vayifegeshehu vehar haElohim vayishak-lvo

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ לְאַֽהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֛ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁלָח֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָאֹתֹ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Moses told Aaron about all the things that יהוה had committed to him and all the signs about which he had been instructed.
Transliteration: vayaged mosheh leaharon et khׇl-diverey yehovah asher shelachvo veet khׇl-haotot asher tsivahu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיַּ֣אַסְפ֔וּ אֶת־כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then Moses and Aaron went and assembled all the elders of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayelekhe mosheh veaharon vayaasefu et-khׇl-zikeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָאֹתֹ֖ת לְעֵינֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Aaron repeated all the words that יהוה had spoken to Moses, and he performed the signs in the sight of those assembled,
Transliteration: vayedaver aharon et khׇl-hadevariym asher-diver yehovah el-mosheh vayaash haotot leeyney haam

Hebrew: וַֽיַּאֲמֵ֖ן הָעָ֑ם וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֡וּ כִּֽי־פָקַ֨ד יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְכִ֤י רָאָה֙ אֶת־עׇנְיָ֔ם וַֽיִּקְּד֖וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
Translated: and the assembly was convinced. When they heard that יהוה had taken note of the Israelites and that [God] had seen their plight, they bowed low in homage.
Transliteration: vayaamen haam vayishemeu khiy-fakad yehovah et-veney yisherael vekhiy raah et-ׇneyam vayikedu vayishetachavu

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֗ר בָּ֚אוּ מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְיָחֹ֥גּוּ לִ֖י בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, “Thus says יהוה, the God of Israel: Let My people go that they may celebrate a festival for Me in the wilderness.”
Transliteration: veachar vau mosheh veaharon vayomeru el-fareoh khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael shalach et-amiy veyachogu liy vamidevar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה מִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶשְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹל֔וֹ לְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹ֤א יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְגַ֥ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֥א אֲשַׁלֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: But Pharaoh said, “Who is יהוה that I should heed him and let Israel go? I do not know יהוה, nor will I let Israel go.”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh miy yehovah asher eshema vekolvo leshalach et-yisherael lo yadaetiy et-yehovah vegam et-yisherael lo ashalecha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָעִבְרִ֖ים נִקְרָ֣א עָלֵ֑ינוּ נֵ֣לְכָה נָּ֡א דֶּ֩רֶךְ֩ שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת יָמִ֜ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר וְנִזְבְּחָה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ פֶּ֨ן־יִפְגָּעֵ֔נוּ בַּדֶּ֖בֶר א֥וֹ בֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: They answered, “The God of the Hebrews has become manifest to us. Let us go, we pray, a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to our God יהוה, lest [God] strike us with pestilence or sword.”
Transliteration: vayomeru elohey haiveriym nikera aleynu nelekhah na derekhe sheloshet yamiym vamidevar venizevechah layhovah eloheynu fen-yifegaenu vadever vo vecharev

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לָ֚מָּה מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן תַּפְרִ֥יעוּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם מִֽמַּעֲשָׂ֑יו לְכ֖וּ לְסִבְלֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: But the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you distract the people from their tasks? Get to your labors!”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem melekhe mitserayiim lamah mosheh veaharon taferiyu et-haam mimaashayv lekhu lesiveloteykhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה הֵן־רַבִּ֥ים עַתָּ֖ה עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁבַּתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֖ם מִסִּבְלֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And Pharaoh continued, “The people of the land are already so numerous, and you would have them cease from their labors!”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh hen-raviym atah am haarets vehishevatem otam misivelotam

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו פַּרְעֹ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא אֶת־הַנֹּגְשִׂ֣ים בָּעָ֔ם וְאֶת־שֹׁטְרָ֖יו לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: That same day Pharaoh charged the taskmasters and overseers of the people, saying,
Transliteration: vayetsav fareoh vayyvom hahu et-hanogeshiym vaam veet-shoterayv lemor

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תֹאסִפ֞וּן לָתֵ֨ת תֶּ֧בֶן לָעָ֛ם לִלְבֹּ֥ן הַלְּבֵנִ֖ים כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם הֵ֚ם יֵֽלְכ֔וּ וְקֹשְׁשׁ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
Translated: “You shall no longer provide the people with straw for making bricks as heretofore; let them go and gather straw for themselves.
Transliteration: lo tosifun latet teven laam lilevon haleveniym khitemvol shileshom hem eilekhu vekosheshu lahem teven

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מַתְכֹּ֨נֶת הַלְּבֵנִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵם֩ עֹשִׂ֨ים תְּמ֤וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁם֙ תָּשִׂ֣ימוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תִגְרְע֖וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־נִרְפִּ֣ים הֵ֔ם עַל־כֵּ֗ן הֵ֤ם צֹֽעֲקִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לֵאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: But impose upon them the same quota of bricks as they have been making heretofore; do not reduce it, for they are shirkers; that is why they cry, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God!’
Transliteration: veet-matekhonet haleveniym asher hem oshiym temvol shileshom tashiymu aleyhem lo tigereu mimenu khiy-nirefiym hem al-khen hem tsoakiym lemor nelekhah nizevechah leloheynu

Hebrew: תִּכְבַּ֧ד הָעֲבֹדָ֛ה עַל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וְיַעֲשׂוּ־בָ֑הּ וְאַל־יִשְׁע֖וּ בְּדִבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated: Let heavier work be laid upon those involved; let them keep at it and not pay attention to deceitful promises.”
Transliteration: tikhevad haavodah al-haanashiym veyaashu-vah veal-yisheu vediverey-shaker

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ נֹגְשֵׂ֤י הָעָם֙ וְשֹׁ֣טְרָ֔יו וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֶל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֵינֶ֛נִּי נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
Translated: So the taskmasters and overseers of the people went out and said to the people, “Thus says Pharaoh: I will not give you any straw.
Transliteration: vayetseu nogeshey haam veshoterayv vayomeru el-haam lemor khoh amar fareoh eyneniy noten lakhem teven

Hebrew: אַתֶּ֗ם לְכ֨וּ קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ תֶּ֔בֶן מֵאֲשֶׁ֖ר תִּמְצָ֑אוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין נִגְרָ֛ע מֵעֲבֹדַתְכֶ֖ם דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: You must go and get the straw yourselves wherever you can find it; but there shall be no decrease whatever in your work.”
Transliteration: atem lekhu kechu lakhem teven measher timetsau khiy eyn nigera meavodatekhem davar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥פֶץ הָעָ֖ם בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְקֹשֵׁ֥שׁ קַ֖שׁ לַתֶּֽבֶן׃
Translated: Then the people scattered throughout the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
Transliteration: vayafets haam vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim lekoshesh kash lateven

Hebrew: וְהַנֹּגְשִׂ֖ים אָצִ֣ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּלּ֤וּ מַעֲשֵׂיכֶם֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּהְי֥וֹת הַתֶּֽבֶן׃
Translated: And the taskmasters pressed them, saying, “You must complete the same work assignment each day as when you had straw.”
Transliteration: vehanogeshiym atsiym lemor khalu maasheykhem devar-yvom veyvomvo khaasher viheyvot hateven

Hebrew: וַיֻּכּ֗וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣מוּ עֲלֵהֶ֔ם נֹגְשֵׂ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֡וּעַ לֹא֩ כִלִּיתֶ֨ם חׇקְכֶ֤ם לִלְבֹּן֙ כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם גַּם־תְּמ֖וֹל גַּם־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: And the overseers of the Israelites, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten. “Why,” they were asked, “did you not complete the prescribed amount of bricks, either yesterday or today, as you did before?”
Transliteration: vayukhu shoterey veney yisherael asher-shamu alehem nogeshey fareoh lemor madua lo khiliytem chׇkekhem lilevon khitemvol shileshom gam-temvol gam-hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֧מָּה תַעֲשֶׂ֦ה כֹ֖ה לַעֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Then the overseers of the Israelites came to Pharaoh and cried: “Why do you deal thus with your servants?
Transliteration: vayavou shoterey veney yisherael vayitseaku el-fareoh lemor lamah taasheh khoh laavadeykha

Hebrew: תֶּ֗בֶן אֵ֤ין נִתָּן֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ וּלְבֵנִ֛ים אֹמְרִ֥ים לָ֖נוּ עֲשׂ֑וּ וְהִנֵּ֧ה עֲבָדֶ֛יךָ מֻכִּ֖ים וְחָטָ֥את עַמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: No straw is issued to your servants, yet they demand of us: Make bricks! Thus your servants are being beaten, when the fault is with your own people.”
Transliteration: teven eyn nitan laavadeykha uleveniym omeriym lanu ashu vehineh avadeykha mukhiym vechatat amekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר נִרְפִּ֥ים אַתֶּ֖ם נִרְפִּ֑ים עַל־כֵּן֙ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹֽמְרִ֔ים נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He replied, “You are shirkers, shirkers! That is why you say, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to יהוה.’
Transliteration: vayomer nirefiym atem nirefiym al-khen atem omeriym nelekhah nizevechah layhovah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ לְכ֣וּ עִבְד֔וּ וְתֶ֖בֶן לֹא־יִנָּתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וְתֹ֥כֶן לְבֵנִ֖ים תִּתֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated: Be off now to your work! No straw shall be issued to you, but you must produce your quota of bricks!”
Transliteration: veatah lekhu ivedu veteven lo-yinaten lakhem vetokhen leveniym titenu

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֞וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵ֧י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֹתָ֖ם בְּרָ֣ע לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־תִגְרְע֥וּ מִלִּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now the overseers of the Israelites found themselves in trouble because of the order, “You must not reduce your daily quantity of bricks.”
Transliteration: vayireu shoterey veney-yisherael otam vera lemor lo-tigereu miliveneykhem devar-yvom veyvomvo

Hebrew: וַֽיִּפְגְּעוּ֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן נִצָּבִ֖ים לִקְרָאתָ֑ם בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֵ֥ת פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: As they left Pharaoh’s presence, they came upon Moses and Aaron standing in their path,
Transliteration: vayifegeu et-mosheh veet-aharon nitsaviym likeratam vetsetam meet fareoh

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם יֵ֧רֶא יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וְיִשְׁפֹּ֑ט אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִבְאַשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־רֵיחֵ֗נוּ בְּעֵינֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ וּבְעֵינֵ֣י עֲבָדָ֔יו לָֽתֶת־חֶ֥רֶב בְּיָדָ֖ם לְהׇרְגֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: and they said to them, “May יהוה look upon you and punish you for making us loathsome to Pharaoh and his courtiers—putting a sword in their hands to slay us.”
Transliteration: vayomeru alehem eire yehovah aleykhem veyishefot asher hiveashetem et-reychenu veeyney fareoh uveeyney avadayv latet-cherev veyadam lehׇregenu

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שׇׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֗י לָמָ֤ה הֲרֵעֹ֙תָה֙ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה שְׁלַחְתָּֽנִי׃
Translated: Then Moses returned to יהוה and said, “O my lord, why did You bring harm upon this people? Why did You send me?
Transliteration: vayashׇv mosheh el-yehovah vayomar adonay lamah hareotah laam hazeh lamah zeh shelachetaniy

Hebrew: וּמֵאָ֞ז בָּ֤אתִי אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר בִּשְׁמֶ֔ךָ הֵרַ֖ע לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה וְהַצֵּ֥ל לֹא־הִצַּ֖לְתָּ אֶת־עַמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Ever since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has dealt worse with this people; and still You have not delivered Your people.”
Transliteration: umeaz vatiy el-fareoh ledaver vishemekha hera laam hazeh vehatsel lo-hitsaleta et-amekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַתָּ֣ה תִרְאֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה לְפַרְעֹ֑ה כִּ֣י בְיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ יְשַׁלְּחֵ֔ם וּבְיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה יְגָרְשֵׁ֖ם מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “You shall soon see what I will do to Pharaoh: he shall let them go because of a greater might; indeed, because of a greater might he shall drive them from his land.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh atah tireeh asher eesheh lefareoh khiy veyad chazakah yeshalechem uveyad chazakah yegareshem mearetsvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: God spoke to Moses and said to him, “I am יהוה.
Transliteration: vayedaver Elohim el-mosheh vayomer elayv aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וָאֵרָ֗א אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק וְאֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּאֵ֣ל שַׁדָּ֑י וּשְׁמִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לֹ֥א נוֹדַ֖עְתִּי לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: I appeared to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as El Shaddai, but I did not make Myself known to them by My name יהוה.
Transliteration: vaera el-averaham el-yitsechak veel-yaakov veel shaday ushemiy yehovah lo nvodaetiy lahem

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם הֲקִמֹ֤תִי אֶת־בְּרִיתִי֙ אִתָּ֔ם לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֖ם אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן אֵ֛ת אֶ֥רֶץ מְגֻרֵיהֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־גָּ֥רוּ בָֽהּ׃
Translated: I also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land in which they lived as sojourners.
Transliteration: vegam hakimotiy et-veriytiy itam latet lahem et-erets khenaan et erets megureyhem asher-garu vah

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם ׀ אֲנִ֣י שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֶֽת־נַאֲקַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִצְרַ֖יִם מַעֲבִדִ֣ים אֹתָ֑ם וָאֶזְכֹּ֖ר אֶת־בְּרִיתִֽי׃
Translated: I have now heard the moaning of the Israelites because the Egyptians are holding them in bondage, and I have remembered My covenant.
Transliteration: vegam aniy shamaetiy et-naakat veney yisherael asher mitserayiim maavidiym otam vaezekhor et-veriytiy

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֱמֹ֥ר לִבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ וְהוֹצֵאתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֗ם מִתַּ֙חַת֙ סִבְלֹ֣ת מִצְרַ֔יִם וְהִצַּלְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵעֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וְגָאַלְתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ בִּזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבִשְׁפָטִ֖ים גְּדֹלִֽים׃
Translated: Say, therefore, to the Israelite people: I am יהוה. I will free you from the labors of the Egyptians and deliver you from their bondage. I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and through extraordinary chastisements.
Transliteration: lakhen emor liveney-yisherael aniy yehovah vehvotsetiy etekhem mitachat sivelot mitserayiim vehitsaletiy etekhem meavodatam vegaaletiy etekhem vizervoa netuyah uvishefatiym gedoliym

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתִּ֨י אֶתְכֶ֥ם לִי֙ לְעָ֔ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָכֶ֖ם לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וִֽידַעְתֶּ֗ם כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם הַמּוֹצִ֣יא אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת סִבְל֥וֹת מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And I will take you to be My people, and I will be your God. And you shall know that I, יהוה, am your God who freed you from the labors of the Egyptians.
Transliteration: velakachetiy etekhem liy leam vehayiytiy lakhem lelohiym viydaetem khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem hamvotsiy etekhem mitachat sivelvot mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י לָתֵ֣ת אֹתָ֔הּ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֑ב וְנָתַתִּ֨י אֹתָ֥הּ לָכֶ֛ם מוֹרָשָׁ֖ה אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will bring you into the land which I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and I will give it to you for a possession, I יהוה.”
Transliteration: vehevetiy etekhem el-haarets asher nashatiy et-yadiy latet otah leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov venatatiy otah lakhem mvorashah aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֛ה כֵּ֖ן אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֤א שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִקֹּ֣צֶר ר֔וּחַ וּמֵעֲבֹדָ֖ה קָשָֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: But when Moses told this to the Israelites, they would not listen to Moses, their spirits crushed by cruel bondage.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh khen el-veney yisherael velo shameu el-mosheh mikotser rucha umeavodah kashah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: בֹּ֣א דַבֵּ֔ר אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וִֽישַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Go and tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites depart from his land.”
Transliteration: vo daver el-fareoh melekhe mitserayiim viyshalach et-veney-yisherael mearetsvo

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵ֤ן בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֹֽא־שָׁמְע֣וּ אֵלַ֔י וְאֵיךְ֙ יִשְׁמָעֵ֣נִי פַרְעֹ֔ה וַאֲנִ֖י עֲרַ֥ל שְׂפָתָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: But Moses appealed to יהוה, saying, “The Israelites would not listen to me; how then should Pharaoh heed me, me—who gets tongue-tied!”
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh lifeney yehovah lemor hen veney-yisherael lo-shameu elay veeykhe yishemaeniy fareoh vaaniy aral shefatayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ וַיְצַוֵּם֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְהוֹצִ֥יא אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: So יהוה spoke to both Moses and Aaron in regard to the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt, instructing them to deliver the Israelites from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon vayetsavem el-veney yisherael veel-fareoh melekhe mitserayiim lehvotsiy et-veney-yisherael meerets mitserayiim {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֣י בֵית־אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּנֵ֨י רְאוּבֵ֜ן בְּכֹ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל חֲנ֤וֹךְ וּפַלּוּא֙ חֶצְרֹ֣ן וְכַרְמִ֔י אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת רְאוּבֵֽן׃
Translated: The following are the heads of their respective clans. The sons of Reuben, Israel’s first-born: Enoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi; those are the families of Reuben.
Transliteration: eleh rashey veyt-avotam veney reuven vekhor yisherael chanvokhe ufalu chetseron vekharemiy eleh mishefechot reuven

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֗וֹן יְמוּאֵ֨ל וְיָמִ֤ין וְאֹ֙הַד֙ וְיָכִ֣ין וְצֹ֔חַר וְשָׁא֖וּל בֶּן־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֑ית אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Saul the son of a Canaanite woman; those are the families of Simeon.
Transliteration: uveney shimevon yemuel veyamiyn veohad veyakhiyn vetsochar veshaul ven-hakhenaaniyt eleh mishefechot shimevon

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה שְׁמ֤וֹת בְּנֵֽי־לֵוִי֙ לְתֹ֣לְדֹתָ֔ם גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן וּקְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִ֑י וּשְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י לֵוִ֔י שֶׁ֧בַע וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: These are the names of Levi’s sons by their lineage: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari; and the span of Levi’s life was 137 years.
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot veney-leviy letoledotam gereshvon ukehat umerariy usheney chayey leviy sheva usheloshiym umeat shanah

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י גֵרְשׁ֛וֹן לִבְנִ֥י וְשִׁמְעִ֖י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, by their families.
Transliteration: veney gereshvon liveniy veshimeiy lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י קְהָ֔ת עַמְרָ֣ם וְיִצְהָ֔ר וְחֶבְר֖וֹן וְעֻזִּיאֵ֑ל וּשְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י קְהָ֔ת שָׁלֹ֧שׁ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel; and the span of Kohath’s life was 133 years.
Transliteration: uveney kehat ameram veyitsehar vechevervon veuziyel usheney chayey kehat shalosh usheloshiym umeat shanah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י מְרָרִ֖י מַחְלִ֣י וּמוּשִׁ֑י אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַלֵּוִ֖י לְתֹלְדֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites by their lineage.
Transliteration: uveney merariy macheliy umushiy eleh mishefechot haleviy letoledotam

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח עַמְרָ֜ם אֶת־יוֹכֶ֤בֶד דֹּֽדָתוֹ֙ ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֔ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֔וֹ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְאֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וּשְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י עַמְרָ֔ם שֶׁ֧בַע וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Amram took into his [household] as wife his father’s sister Jochebed, and she bore him Aaron and Moses; and the span of Amram’s life was 137 years.
Transliteration: vayikach ameram et-yvokheved dodatvo lvo leishah vateled lvo et-aharon veet-mosheh usheney chayey ameram sheva usheloshiym umeat shanah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יִצְהָ֑ר קֹ֥רַח וָנֶ֖פֶג וְזִכְרִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Izhar: Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.
Transliteration: uveney yitsehar korach vanefeg vezikheriy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י עֻזִּיאֵ֑ל מִֽישָׁאֵ֥ל וְאֶלְצָפָ֖ן וְסִתְרִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Uzziel: Mishael, Elzaphan, and Sithri.
Transliteration: uveney uziyel miyshael veeletsafan vesiteriy

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־אֱלִישֶׁ֧בַע בַּת־עַמִּינָדָ֛ב אֲח֥וֹת נַחְשׁ֖וֹן ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֗וֹ אֶת־נָדָב֙ וְאֶת־אֲבִיה֔וּא אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאֶת־אִֽיתָמָֽר׃
Translated: Aaron took into his [household] as wife Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab and sister of Nahshon, and she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
Transliteration: vayikach aharon et-eliysheva vat-amiynadav achvot nacheshvon lvo leishah vateled lvo et-nadav veet-aviyhu et-eleazar veet-iytamar

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י קֹ֔רַח אַסִּ֥יר וְאֶלְקָנָ֖ה וַאֲבִיאָסָ֑ף אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַקׇּרְחִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Korah: Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. Those are the families of the Korahites.
Transliteration: uveney korach asiyr veelekanah vaaviyasaf eleh mishefechot hakׇrechiy

Hebrew: וְאֶלְעָזָ֨ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֜ן לָקַֽח־ל֨וֹ מִבְּנ֤וֹת פּֽוּטִיאֵל֙ ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד ל֖וֹ אֶת־פִּֽינְחָ֑ס אֵ֗לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֛י אֲב֥וֹת הַלְוִיִּ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And Aaron’s son Eleazar took into his [household] as wife one of Putiel’s daughters, and she bore him Phinehas. Those are the heads of the ancestral houses of the Levites by their families.
Transliteration: veeleazar ven-aharon lakach-lvo mivenvot futiyel lvo leishah vateled lvo et-fiynechas eleh rashey avvot haleviyim lemishefechotam

Hebrew: ה֥וּא אַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֹשֶׁ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם הוֹצִ֜יאוּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם עַל־צִבְאֹתָֽם׃
Translated: It is the same Aaron and Moses to whom יהוה said, “Bring forth the Israelites from the land of Egypt, troop by troop.”
Transliteration: hu aharon umosheh asher amar yehovah lahem hvotsiyu et-veney yisherael meerets mitserayiim al-tsiveotam

Hebrew: הֵ֗ם הַֽמְדַבְּרִים֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם לְהוֹצִ֥יא אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם ה֥וּא מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: It was they who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt to free the Israelites from the Egyptians; these are the same Moses and Aaron.
Transliteration: hem hamedaveriym el-fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim lehvotsiy et-veney-yisherael mimitserayiim hu mosheh veaharon

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּי֨וֹם דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: For when יהוה spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt
Transliteration: vayehiy veyvom diver yehovah el-mosheh veerets mitserayiim {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹ֖ר אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה דַּבֵּ֗ר אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י דֹּבֵ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: and יהוה said to Moses, “I am יהוה; speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I will tell you,”
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor aniy yehovah daver el-fareoh melekhe mitserayiim et khׇl-asher aniy dover eleykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הֵ֤ן אֲנִי֙ עֲרַ֣ל שְׂפָתַ֔יִם וְאֵ֕יךְ יִשְׁמַ֥ע אֵלַ֖י פַּרְעֹֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses appealed to יהוה, saying, “See, I get tongue-tied; how then should Pharaoh heed me!”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh lifeney yehovah hen aniy aral shefatayiim veeykhe yishema elay fareoh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה רְאֵ֛ה נְתַתִּ֥יךָ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִ֖יךָ יִהְיֶ֥ה נְבִיאֶֽךָ׃
Translated: יהוה replied to Moses, “See, I place you in the role of God to Pharaoh, with your brother Aaron as your prophet.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh reeh netatiykha Elohim lefareoh veaharon achiykha yiheyeh neviyekha

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה תְדַבֵּ֔ר אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲצַוֶּ֑ךָּ וְאַהֲרֹ֤ן אָחִ֙יךָ֙ יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְשִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall repeat all that I command you, and your brother Aaron shall speak to Pharaoh to let the Israelites depart from his land.
Transliteration: atah tedaver et khׇl-asher atsavekha veaharon achiykha yedaver el-fareoh veshilach et-veney-yisherael mearetsvo

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֥י אַקְשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֧י אֶת־אֹתֹתַ֛י וְאֶת־מוֹפְתַ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: But I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, that I may multiply My signs and marvels in the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vaaniy akesheh et-lev fareoh vehireveytiy et-ototay veet-mvofetay veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִשְׁמַ֤ע אֲלֵכֶם֙ פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶת־יָדִ֖י בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְהוֹצֵאתִ֨י אֶת־צִבְאֹתַ֜י אֶת־עַמִּ֤י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בִּשְׁפָטִ֖ים גְּדֹלִֽים׃
Translated: When Pharaoh does not heed you, I will lay My hand upon Egypt and deliver My ranks, My people the Israelites, from the land of Egypt with extraordinary chastisements.
Transliteration: velo-yishema alekhem fareoh venatatiy et-yadiy vemitserayiim vehvotsetiy et-tsiveotay et-amiy veney-yisherael meerets mitserayiim vishefatiym gedoliym

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֤וּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּנְטֹתִ֥י אֶת־יָדִ֖י עַל־מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהוֹצֵאתִ֥י אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִתּוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: And the Egyptians shall know that I am יהוה, when I stretch out My hand over Egypt and bring out the Israelites from their midst.”
Transliteration: veyadeu mitserayiim khiy-aniy yehovah vinetotiy et-yadiy al-mitserayiim vehvotsetiy et-veney-yisherael mitvokham

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֹתָ֖ם כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: This Moses and Aaron did; as יהוה commanded them, so they did.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh veaharon khaasher tsivah yehovah otam khen ashu

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁה֙ בֶּן־שְׁמֹנִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַֽהֲרֹ֔ן בֶּן־שָׁלֹ֥שׁ וּשְׁמֹנִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה בְּדַבְּרָ֖ם אֶל־פַּרְעֹֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses was eighty years old and Aaron eighty-three, when they made their demand on Pharaoh.
Transliteration: umosheh ven-shemoniym shanah veaharon ven-shalosh ushemoniym shanah vedaveram el-fareoh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses and Aaron,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: כִּי֩ יְדַבֵּ֨ר אֲלֵכֶ֤ם פַּרְעֹה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תְּנ֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם מוֹפֵ֑ת וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֧ח אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֛ וְהַשְׁלֵ֥ךְ לִפְנֵֽי־פַרְעֹ֖ה יְהִ֥י לְתַנִּֽין׃
Translated: “When Pharaoh speaks to you and says, ‘Produce your marvel,’ you shall say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod and cast it down before Pharaoh.’ It shall turn into a serpent.”
Transliteration: khiy yedaver alekhem fareoh lemor tenu lakhem mvofet veamareta el-aharon kach et-matekha vehashelekhe lifeney-fareoh yehiy letaniyn

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיַּ֣עֲשׂוּ כֵ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּשְׁלֵ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־מַטֵּ֗הוּ לִפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹ֛ה וְלִפְנֵ֥י עֲבָדָ֖יו וַיְהִ֥י לְתַנִּֽין׃
Translated: So Moses and Aaron came before Pharaoh and did just as יהוה had commanded: Aaron cast down his rod in the presence of Pharaoh and his courtiers, and it turned into a serpent.
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh veaharon el-fareoh vayaashu khen khaasher tsivah yehovah vayashelekhe aharon et-matehu lifeney fareoh velifeney avadayv vayehiy letaniyn

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֙ גַּם־פַּרְעֹ֔ה לַֽחֲכָמִ֖ים וְלַֽמְכַשְּׁפִ֑ים וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֨וּ גַם־הֵ֜ם חַרְטֻמֵּ֥י מִצְרַ֛יִם בְּלַהֲטֵיהֶ֖ם כֵּֽן׃
Translated: Then Pharaoh, for his part, summoned the sages and the sorcerers; and the Egyptian magician-priests, in turn, did the same with their spells:
Transliteration: vayikera gam-fareoh lachakhamiym velamekhashefiym vayaashu gam-hem charetumey mitserayiim velahateyhem khen

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁלִ֙יכוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מַטֵּ֔הוּ וַיִּהְי֖וּ לְתַנִּינִ֑ם וַיִּבְלַ֥ע מַטֵּֽה־אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶת־מַטֹּתָֽם׃
Translated: each cast down his rod, and they turned into serpents. But Aaron’s rod swallowed their rods.
Transliteration: vayasheliykhu iysh matehu vayiheyu letaniynim vayivela mateh-aharon et-matotam

Hebrew: וַיֶּֽחֱזַק֙ לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Yet Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he did not heed them, as יהוה had said.
Transliteration: vayechezak lev fareoh velo shama alehem khaasher diver yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כָּבֵ֖ד לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה מֵאֵ֖ן לְשַׁלַּ֥ח הָעָֽם׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “Pharaoh is stubborn; he refuses to let the people go.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh khaved lev fareoh meen leshalach haam

Hebrew: לֵ֣ךְ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֞ה בַּבֹּ֗קֶר הִנֵּה֙ יֹצֵ֣א הַמַּ֔יְמָה וְנִצַּבְתָּ֥ לִקְרָאת֖וֹ עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְאֹ֑ר וְהַמַּטֶּ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ לְנָחָ֖שׁ תִּקַּ֥ח בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Go to Pharaoh in the morning, as he is coming out to the water, and station yourself before him at the edge of the Nile, taking with you the rod that turned into a snake.
Transliteration: lekhe el-fareoh vavoker hineh yotse hamayemah venitsaveta likeratvo al-shefat hayeor vehamateh asher-nehefakhe lenachash tikach veyadekha

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָעִבְרִים֙ שְׁלָחַ֤נִי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְיַֽעַבְדֻ֖נִי בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְהִנֵּ֥ה לֹא־שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ עַד־כֹּֽה׃
Translated: And say to him, ‘יהוה, the God of the Hebrews, sent me to you to say, “Let My people go that they may worship Me in the wilderness.” But you have paid no heed until now.
Transliteration: veamareta elayv yehovah elohey haiveriym shelachaniy eleykha lemor shalach et-amiy veyaaveduniy vamidevar vehineh lo-shamaeta ad-khoh

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּזֹ֣את תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֖י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י מַכֶּ֣ה ׀ בַּמַּטֶּ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָדִ֗י עַל־הַמַּ֛יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּיְאֹ֖ר וְנֶהֶפְכ֥וּ לְדָֽם׃
Translated: Thus says יהוה, “By this you shall know that I am יהוה.” See, I shall strike the water in the Nile with the rod that is in my hand, and it will be turned into blood;
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah vezot teda khiy aniy yehovah hineh anokhiy makheh vamateh asher-veyadiy al-hamayiim asher vayeor venehefekhu ledam

Hebrew: וְהַדָּגָ֧ה אֲשֶׁר־בַּיְאֹ֛ר תָּמ֖וּת וּבָאַ֣שׁ הַיְאֹ֑ר וְנִלְא֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת מַ֖יִם מִן־הַיְאֹֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: and the fish in the Nile will die. The Nile will stink so that the Egyptians will find it impossible to drink the water of the Nile.’”
Transliteration: vehadagah asher-vayeor tamut uvaash hayeor venileu mitserayiim lishetvot mayiim min-hayeor {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֱמֹ֣ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֡ן קַ֣ח מַטְּךָ֣ וּנְטֵֽה־יָדְךָ֩ עַל־מֵימֵ֨י מִצְרַ֜יִם עַֽל־נַהֲרֹתָ֣ם ׀ עַל־יְאֹרֵיהֶ֣ם וְעַל־אַגְמֵיהֶ֗ם וְעַ֛ל כׇּל־מִקְוֵ֥ה מֵימֵיהֶ֖ם וְיִֽהְיוּ־דָ֑ם וְהָ֤יָה דָם֙ בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וּבָעֵצִ֖ים וּבָאֲבָנִֽים׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “Say to Aaron: Take your rod and hold out your arm over the waters of Egypt—its rivers, its canals, its ponds, all its bodies of water—that they may turn to blood; there shall be blood throughout the land of Egypt, even in vessels of wood and stone.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh emor el-aharon kach matekha uneteh-yadekha al-meymey mitserayiim al-naharotam al-yeoreyhem veal-agemeyhem veal khׇl-mikeveh meymeyhem veyiheyu-dam vehayah dam vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim uvaetsiym uvaavaniym

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאַהֲרֹ֜ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיָּ֤רֶם בַּמַּטֶּה֙ וַיַּ֤ךְ אֶת־הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּיְאֹ֔ר לְעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וּלְעֵינֵ֖י עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיֵּהָ֥פְכ֛וּ כׇּל־הַמַּ֥יִם אֲשֶׁר־בַּיְאֹ֖ר לְדָֽם׃
Translated: Moses and Aaron did just as יהוה commanded: he lifted up the rod and struck the water in the Nile in the sight of Pharaoh and his courtiers, and all the water in the Nile was turned into blood
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen mosheh veaharon khaasher tsivah yehovah vayarem vamateh vayakhe et-hamayiim asher vayeor leeyney fareoh uleeyney avadayv vayehafekhu khׇl-hamayiim asher-vayeor ledam

Hebrew: וְהַדָּגָ֨ה אֲשֶׁר־בַּיְאֹ֥ר מֵ֙תָה֙ וַיִּבְאַ֣שׁ הַיְאֹ֔ר וְלֹא־יָכְל֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת מַ֖יִם מִן־הַיְאֹ֑ר וַיְהִ֥י הַדָּ֖ם בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: and the fish in the Nile died. The Nile stank so that the Egyptians could not drink water from the Nile; and there was blood throughout the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vehadagah asher-vayeor metah vayiveash hayeor velo-yakhelu mitserayiim lishetvot mayiim min-hayeor vayehiy hadam vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֛ן חַרְטֻמֵּ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּלָטֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֶּחֱזַ֤ק לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But when the Egyptian magician-priests did the same with their spells, Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he did not heed them—as יהוה had spoken.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen charetumey mitserayiim velateyhem vayechezak lev-fareoh velo-shama alehem khaasher diver yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣פֶן פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וְלֹא־שָׁ֥ת לִבּ֖וֹ גַּם־לָזֹֽאת׃
Translated: Pharaoh turned and went into his palace, paying no regard even to this.
Transliteration: vayifen fareoh vayavo el-veytvo velo-shat livvo gam-lazot

Hebrew: וַיַּחְפְּר֧וּ כׇל־מִצְרַ֛יִם סְבִיבֹ֥ת הַיְאֹ֖ר מַ֣יִם לִשְׁתּ֑וֹת כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָֽכְלוּ֙ לִשְׁתֹּ֔ת מִמֵּימֵ֖י הַיְאֹֽר׃
Translated: And all the Egyptians had to dig round about the Nile for drinking water, because they could not drink the water of the Nile.
Transliteration: vayacheferu khׇl-mitserayiim seviyvot hayeor mayiim lishetvot khiy lo yakhelu lishetot mimeymey hayeor

Hebrew: וַיִּמָּלֵ֖א שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים אַחֲרֵ֥י הַכּוֹת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הַיְאֹֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: When seven days had passed after יהוה struck the Nile,
Transliteration: vayimale shiveat yamiym acharey hakhvot-yehovah et-hayeor {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֹּ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says יהוה: Let My people go that they may worship Me.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh vo el-fareoh veamareta elayv khoh amar yehovah shalach et-amiy veyaaveduniy

Hebrew: וְאִם־מָאֵ֥ן אַתָּ֖ה לְשַׁלֵּ֑חַ הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִ֗י נֹגֵ֛ף אֶת־כׇּל־גְּבוּלְךָ֖ בַּֽצְפַרְדְּעִֽים׃
Translated: If you refuse to let them go, then I will plague your whole country with frogs.
Transliteration: veim-maen atah leshalecha hineh anokhiy nogef et-khׇl-gevulekha vatsefaredeiym

Hebrew: וְשָׁרַ֣ץ הַיְאֹר֮ צְפַרְדְּעִים֒ וְעָלוּ֙ וּבָ֣אוּ בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ וּבַחֲדַ֥ר מִשְׁכָּבְךָ֖ וְעַל־מִטָּתֶ֑ךָ וּבְבֵ֤ית עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וּבְעַמֶּ֔ךָ וּבְתַנּוּרֶ֖יךָ וּבְמִשְׁאֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: The Nile shall swarm with frogs, and they shall come up and enter your palace, your bedchamber and your bed, the houses of your courtiers and your people, and your ovens and your kneading bowls.
Transliteration: vesharats hayeor tsefaredeiym vealu uvau veveytekha uvachadar mishekhavekha veal-mitatekha uveveyt avadeykha uveamekha uvetanureykha uvemishearvoteykha

Hebrew: וּבְכָ֥ה וּֽבְעַמְּךָ֖ וּבְכׇל־עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ יַעֲל֖וּ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִֽים׃
Translated: The frogs shall come up on you and on your people and on all your courtiers.’”
Transliteration: uvekhah uveamekha uvekhׇl-avadeykha yaalu hatsefaredeiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ אֱמֹ֣ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן נְטֵ֤ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֙ בְּמַטֶּ֔ךָ עַ֨ל־הַנְּהָרֹ֔ת עַל־הַיְאֹרִ֖ים וְעַל־הָאֲגַמִּ֑ים וְהַ֥עַל אֶת־הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֖ים עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “Say to Aaron: Hold out your arm with the rod over the rivers, the canals, and the ponds, and bring up the frogs on the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh emor el-aharon neteh et-yadekha vematekha al-haneharot al-hayeoriym veal-haagamiym vehaal et-hatsefaredeiym al-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤ט אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ עַ֖ל מֵימֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם וַתַּ֙עַל֙ הַצְּפַרְדֵּ֔עַ וַתְּכַ֖ס אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Aaron held out his arm over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayet aharon et-yadvo al meymey mitserayiim vataal hatsefaredea vatekhas et-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֥ן הַֽחַרְטֻמִּ֖ים בְּלָטֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּעֲל֥וּ אֶת־הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֖ים עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: But the magician-priests did the same with their spells, and brought frogs upon the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen hacharetumiym velateyhem vayaalu et-hatsefaredeiym al-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֜ה לְמֹשֶׁ֣ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַעְתִּ֣ירוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיָסֵר֙ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֔ים מִמֶּ֖נִּי וּמֵֽעַמִּ֑י וַאֲשַׁלְּחָה֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְיִזְבְּח֖וּ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Plead with יהוה to remove the frogs from me and my people, and I will let the people go to sacrifice to יהוה.”
Transliteration: vayikera fareoh lemosheh uleaharon vayomer haetiyru el-yehovah veyaser hatsefaredeiym mimeniy umeamiy vaashalechah et-haam veyizevechu layhovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה לְפַרְעֹה֮ הִתְפָּאֵ֣ר עָלַי֒ לְמָתַ֣י ׀ אַעְתִּ֣יר לְךָ֗ וְלַעֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וּֽלְעַמְּךָ֔ לְהַכְרִית֙ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֔ים מִמְּךָ֖ וּמִבָּתֶּ֑יךָ רַ֥ק בַּיְאֹ֖ר תִּשָּׁאַֽרְנָה׃
Translated: And Moses said to Pharaoh, “You may have this triumph over me: for what time shall I plead in behalf of you and your courtiers and your people, that the frogs be cut off from you and your houses, to remain only in the Nile?”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh lefareoh hitefaer alay lematay aetiyr lekha velaavadeykha uleamekha lehakheriyt hatsefaredeiym mimekha umivateykha rak vayeor tishaarenah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לְמָחָ֑ר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כִּדְבָ֣רְךָ֔ לְמַ֣עַן תֵּדַ֔ע כִּי־אֵ֖ין כַּיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “For tomorrow,” he replied. And [Moses] said, “As you say—that you may know that there is none like our God יהוה;
Transliteration: vayomer lemachar vayomer khidevarekha lemaan teda khiy-eyn khayhovah eloheynu

Hebrew: וְסָר֣וּ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֗ים מִמְּךָ֙ וּמִבָּ֣תֶּ֔יךָ וּמֵעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וּמֵעַמֶּ֑ךָ רַ֥ק בַּיְאֹ֖ר תִּשָּׁאַֽרְנָה׃
Translated: the frogs shall retreat from you and your courtiers and your people; they shall remain only in the Nile.”
Transliteration: vesaru hatsefaredeiym mimekha umivateykha umeavadeykha umeamekha rak vayeor tishaarenah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן מֵעִ֣ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיִּצְעַ֤ק מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־דְּבַ֥ר הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֖ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֥ם לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Then Moses and Aaron left Pharaoh’s presence, and Moses cried out to יהוה in the matter of the frogs which had been inflicted upon Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vayetse mosheh veaharon meim fareoh vayitseak mosheh el-yehovah al-devar hatsefaredeiym asher-sham lefareoh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֖ה כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיָּמֻ֙תוּ֙ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֔ים מִן־הַבָּתִּ֥ים מִן־הַחֲצֵרֹ֖ת וּמִן־הַשָּׂדֹֽת׃
Translated: And יהוה did as Moses asked; the frogs died out in the houses, the courtyards, and the fields.
Transliteration: vayaash yehovah khidevar mosheh vayamutu hatsefaredeiym min-havatiym min-hachatserot umin-hashadot

Hebrew: וַיִּצְבְּר֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם חֳמָרִ֣ם חֳמָרִ֑ם וַתִּבְאַ֖שׁ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And they piled them up in heaps, till the land stank.
Transliteration: vayitseveru otam chomarim chomarim vativeash haarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא פַּרְעֹ֗ה כִּ֤י הָֽיְתָה֙ הָֽרְוָחָ֔ה וְהַכְבֵּד֙ אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: But when Pharaoh saw that there was relief, he became stubborn and would not heed them, as יהוה had spoken.
Transliteration: vayare fareoh khiy hayetah harevachah vehakheved et-livvo velo shama alehem khaasher diver yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ אֱמֹר֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן נְטֵ֣ה אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֔ וְהַ֖ךְ אֶת־עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהָיָ֥ה לְכִנִּ֖ם בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Say to Aaron: Hold out your rod and strike the dust of the earth, and it shall turn to lice throughout the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh emor el-aharon neteh et-matekha vehakhe et-afar haarets vehayah lekhinim vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֗ן וַיֵּט֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־יָד֤וֹ בְמַטֵּ֙הוּ֙ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ וַתְּהִי֙ הַכִּנָּ֔ם בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה כׇּל־עֲפַ֥ר הָאָ֛רֶץ הָיָ֥ה כִנִּ֖ים בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And they did so. Aaron held out his arm with the rod and struck the dust of the earth, and vermin came upon human and beast; all the dust of the earth turned to lice throughout the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen vayet aharon et-yadvo vematehu vayakhe et-afar haarets vatehiy hakhinam vaadam uvavehemah khׇl-afar haarets hayah khiniym vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֨ן הַחַרְטֻמִּ֧ים בְּלָטֵיהֶ֛ם לְהוֹצִ֥יא אֶת־הַכִּנִּ֖ים וְלֹ֣א יָכֹ֑לוּ וַתְּהִי֙ הַכִּנָּ֔ם בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: The magician-priests did the like with their spells to produce lice, but they could not. The vermin remained upon human and beast;
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen hacharetumiym velateyhem lehvotsiy et-hakhiniym velo yakholu vatehiy hakhinam vaadam uvavehemah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ הַֽחַרְטֻמִּם֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֶצְבַּ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים הִ֑וא וַיֶּחֱזַ֤ק לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְלֹֽא־שָׁמַ֣ע אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and the magician-priests said to Pharaoh, “This is the finger of God!” But Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he would not heed them, as יהוה had spoken.
Transliteration: vayomeru hacharetumim el-fareoh etseva Elohim hiv vayechezak lev-fareoh velo-shama alehem khaasher diver yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הַשְׁכֵּ֤ם בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וְהִתְיַצֵּב֙ לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה הִנֵּ֖ה יוֹצֵ֣א הַמָּ֑יְמָה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שַׁלַּ֥ח עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “Early in the morning present yourself to Pharaoh, as he is coming out to the water, and say to him, ‘Thus says יהוה: Let My people go that they may worship Me.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hashekhem vavoker vehiteyatsev lifeney fareoh hineh yvotse hamayemah veamareta elayv khoh amar yehovah shalach amiy veyaaveduniy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־אֵינְךָ֮ מְשַׁלֵּ֣חַ אֶת־עַמִּי֒ הִנְנִי֩ מַשְׁלִ֨יחַ בְּךָ֜ וּבַעֲבָדֶ֧יךָ וּֽבְעַמְּךָ֛ וּבְבָתֶּ֖יךָ אֶת־הֶעָרֹ֑ב וּמָ֨לְא֜וּ בָּתֵּ֤י מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרֹ֔ב וְגַ֥ם הָאֲדָמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥ם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: For if you do not let My people go, I will let loose swarms of insects against you and your courtiers and your people and your houses; the houses of the Egyptians, and the very ground they stand on, shall be filled with swarms of insects.
Transliteration: khiy im-eynekha meshalecha et-amiy hineniy masheliycha vekha uvaavadeykha uveamekha uvevateykha et-hearov umaleu vatey mitserayiim et-hearov vegam haadamah asher-hem aleyha

Hebrew: וְהִפְלֵיתִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֗שֶׁן אֲשֶׁ֤ר עַמִּי֙ עֹמֵ֣ד עָלֶ֔יהָ לְבִלְתִּ֥י הֱיֽוֹת־שָׁ֖ם עָרֹ֑ב לְמַ֣עַן תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
