Translated: But on that day I will set apart the region of Goshen, where My people dwell, so that no swarms of insects shall be there, that you may know that I יהוה am in the midst of the land.
Transliteration: vehifeleytiy vayyvom hahu et-erets goshen asher amiy omed aleyha leviletiy heyvot-sham arov lemaan teda khiy aniy yehovah vekerev haarets

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י פְדֻ֔ת בֵּ֥ין עַמִּ֖י וּבֵ֣ין עַמֶּ֑ךָ לְמָחָ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה הָאֹ֥ת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And I will make a distinction between My people and your people. Tomorrow this sign shall come to pass.’”
Transliteration: veshametiy fedut veyn amiy uveyn amekha lemachar yiheyeh haot hazeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יְהֹוָה֙ כֵּ֔ן וַיָּבֹא֙ עָרֹ֣ב כָּבֵ֔ד בֵּ֥יתָה פַרְעֹ֖ה וּבֵ֣ית עֲבָדָ֑יו וּבְכׇל־אֶ֧רֶץ מִצְרַ֛יִם תִּשָּׁחֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ מִפְּנֵ֥י הֶעָרֹֽב׃
Translated: And יהוה did so. Heavy swarms of insects invaded Pharaoh’s palace and the houses of his courtiers; throughout the country of Egypt the land was ruined because of the swarms of insects.
Transliteration: vayaash yehovah khen vayavo arov khaved veytah fareoh uveyt avadayv uvekhׇl-erets mitserayiim tishachet haarets mifeney hearov

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א פַרְעֹ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְכ֛וּ זִבְח֥וּ לֵאלֹֽהֵיכֶ֖ם בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Go and sacrifice to your God within the land.”
Transliteration: vayikera fareoh el-mosheh uleaharon vayomer lekhu zivechu leloheykhem vaarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה לֹ֤א נָכוֹן֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת כֵּ֔ן כִּ֚י תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת מִצְרַ֔יִם נִזְבַּ֖ח לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ הֵ֣ן נִזְבַּ֞ח אֶת־תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת מִצְרַ֛יִם לְעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א יִסְקְלֻֽנוּ׃
Translated: But Moses replied, “It would not be right to do this, for what we sacrifice to our God יהוה is untouchable to the Egyptians. If we sacrifice that which is untouchable to the Egyptians before their very eyes, will they not stone us?
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh lo nakhvon laashvot khen khiy tvoavat mitserayiim nizevach layhovah eloheynu hen nizevach et-tvoavat mitserayiim leeyneyhem velo yisekelunu

Hebrew: דֶּ֚רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים נֵלֵ֖ךְ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְזָבַ֙חְנוּ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר יֹאמַ֥ר אֵלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: So we must go a distance of three days into the wilderness and sacrifice to יהוה as our God may command us.”
Transliteration: derekhe sheloshet yamiym nelekhe vamidevar vezavachenu layhovah eloheynu khaasher yomar eleynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֗ה אָנֹכִ֞י אֲשַׁלַּ֤ח אֶתְכֶם֙ וּזְבַחְתֶּ֞ם לַיהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר רַ֛ק הַרְחֵ֥ק לֹא־תַרְחִ֖יקוּ לָלֶ֑כֶת הַעְתִּ֖ירוּ בַּעֲדִֽי׃
Translated: Pharaoh said, “I will let you go to sacrifice to your God יהוה in the wilderness; but do not go very far. Plead, then, for me.”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh anokhiy ashalach etekhem uzevachetem layhovah eloheykhem vamidevar rak harechek lo-tarechiyku lalekhet haetiyru vaadiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י יוֹצֵ֤א מֵֽעִמָּךְ֙ וְהַעְתַּרְתִּ֣י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְסָ֣ר הֶעָרֹ֗ב מִפַּרְעֹ֛ה מֵעֲבָדָ֥יו וּמֵעַמּ֖וֹ מָחָ֑ר רַ֗ק אַל־יֹסֵ֤ף פַּרְעֹה֙ הָתֵ֔ל לְבִלְתִּי֙ שַׁלַּ֣ח אֶת־הָעָ֔ם לִזְבֹּ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And Moses said, “When I leave your presence, I will plead with יהוה that the swarms of insects depart tomorrow from Pharaoh and his courtiers and his people; but let not Pharaoh again act deceitfully, not letting the people go to sacrifice to יהוה.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh hineh anokhiy yvotse meimakhe vehaetaretiy el-yehovah vesar hearov mifareoh meavadayv umeamvo machar rak al-yosef fareoh hatel leviletiy shalach et-haam lizevocha layhovah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א מֹשֶׁ֖ה מֵעִ֣ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיֶּעְתַּ֖ר אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So Moses left Pharaoh’s presence and pleaded with יהוה.
Transliteration: vayetse mosheh meim fareoh vayeetar el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יְהֹוָה֙ כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיָּ֙סַר֙ הֶעָרֹ֔ב מִפַּרְעֹ֖ה מֵעֲבָדָ֣יו וּמֵעַמּ֑וֹ לֹ֥א נִשְׁאַ֖ר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: And יהוה did as Moses asked—removing the swarms of insects from Pharaoh, from his courtiers, and from his people; not one remained.
Transliteration: vayaash yehovah khidevar mosheh vayasar hearov mifareoh meavadayv umeamvo lo nishear echad

Hebrew: וַיַּכְבֵּ֤ד פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ גַּ֖ם בַּפַּ֣עַם הַזֹּ֑את וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: But Pharaoh became stubborn this time also, and would not let the people go.
Transliteration: vayakheved fareoh et-livvo gam vafaam hazot velo shilach et-haam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֹּ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעִבְרִ֔ים שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says יהוה, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go to worship Me.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh vo el-fareoh vedivareta elayv khoh-amar yehovah elohey haiveriym shalach et-amiy veyaaveduniy

Hebrew: כִּ֛י אִם־מָאֵ֥ן אַתָּ֖ה לְשַׁלֵּ֑חַ וְעוֹדְךָ֖ מַחֲזִ֥יק בָּֽם׃
Translated: For if you refuse to let them go, and continue to hold them,
Transliteration: khiy im-maen atah leshalecha vevodekha machaziyk vam

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה יַד־יְהֹוָ֜ה הוֹיָ֗ה בְּמִקְנְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה בַּסּוּסִ֤ים בַּֽחֲמֹרִים֙ בַּגְּמַלִּ֔ים בַּבָּקָ֖ר וּבַצֹּ֑אן דֶּ֖בֶר כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: then the hand of יהוה will strike your livestock in the fields—the horses, the asses, the camels, the cattle, and the sheep—with a very severe pestilence.
Transliteration: hineh yad-yehovah hvoyah vemikenekha asher vashadeh vasusiym vachamoriym vagemaliym vavakar uvatson dever khaved meod

Hebrew: וְהִפְלָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה בֵּ֚ין מִקְנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּבֵ֖ין מִקְנֵ֣ה מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹ֥א יָמ֛וּת מִכׇּל־לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: But יהוה will make a distinction between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of the Egyptians, so that nothing shall die of all that belongs to the Israelites.
Transliteration: vehifelah yehovah veyn mikeneh yisherael uveyn mikeneh mitserayiim velo yamut mikhׇl-liveney yisherael davar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׂם יְהֹוָ֖ה מוֹעֵ֣ד לֵאמֹ֑ר מָחָ֗ר יַעֲשֶׂ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: יהוה has fixed the time: tomorrow יהוה will do this thing in the land.’”
Transliteration: vayashem yehovah mvoed lemor machar yaasheh yehovah hadavar hazeh vaarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיָּ֕מׇת כֹּ֖ל מִקְנֵ֣ה מִצְרָ֑יִם וּמִמִּקְנֵ֥ה בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹא־מֵ֥ת אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: And יהוה did so the next day: all the livestock of the Egyptians died, but of the livestock of the Israelites not a beast died.
Transliteration: vayaash yehovah et-hadavar hazeh mimׇchorat vayamׇt khol mikeneh mitserayiim umimikeneh veney-yisherael lo-met echad

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֗ה לֹא־מֵ֛ת מִמִּקְנֵ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַד־אֶחָ֑ד וַיִּכְבַּד֙ לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: When Pharaoh inquired, he found that not a head of the livestock of Israel had died; yet Pharaoh remained stubborn, and he would not let the people go.
Transliteration: vayishelach fareoh vehineh lo-met mimikeneh yisherael ad-echad vayikhevad lev fareoh velo shilach et-haam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ מְלֹ֣א חׇפְנֵיכֶ֔ם פִּ֖יחַ כִּבְשָׁ֑ן וּזְרָק֥וֹ מֹשֶׁ֛ה הַשָּׁמַ֖יְמָה לְעֵינֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses and Aaron, “Each of you take handfuls of soot from the kiln, and let Moses throw it toward the sky in the sight of Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon kechu lakhem melo chׇfeneykhem fiycha khiveshan uzerakvo mosheh hashamayemah leeyney fareoh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה לְאָבָ֔ק עַ֖ל כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָיָ֨ה עַל־הָאָדָ֜ם וְעַל־הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה לִשְׁחִ֥ין פֹּרֵ֛חַ אֲבַעְבֻּעֹ֖ת בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: It shall become a fine dust all over the land of Egypt, and cause an inflammation breaking out in boils on human and beast throughout the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vehayah leavak al khׇl-erets mitserayiim vehayah al-haadam veal-havehemah lishechiyn forecha avaevuot vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ אֶת־פִּ֣יחַ הַכִּבְשָׁ֗ן וַיַּֽעַמְדוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיִּזְרֹ֥ק אֹת֛וֹ מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יְמָה וַיְהִ֗י שְׁחִין֙ אֲבַעְבֻּעֹ֔ת פֹּרֵ֕חַ בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: So they took soot of the kiln and appeared before Pharaoh; Moses threw it toward the sky, and it caused an inflammation breaking out in boils on human and beast.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-fiycha hakhiveshan vayaamedu lifeney fareoh vayizerok otvo mosheh hashamayemah vayehiy shechiyn avaevuot forecha vaadam uvavehemah

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יָכְל֣וּ הַֽחַרְטֻמִּ֗ים לַעֲמֹ֛ד לִפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִפְּנֵ֣י הַשְּׁחִ֑ין כִּֽי־הָיָ֣ה הַשְּׁחִ֔ין בַּֽחַרְטֻמִּ֖ם וּבְכׇל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: The magician-priests were unable to confront Moses because of the inflammation, for the inflammation afflicted the magician-priests as well as all the other Egyptians.
Transliteration: velo-yakhelu hacharetumiym laamod lifeney mosheh mifeney hashechiyn khiy-hayah hashechiyn vacharetumim uvekhׇl-mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֤ק יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: But יהוה stiffened the heart of Pharaoh, and he would not heed them, just as יהוה had told Moses.
Transliteration: vayechazek yehovah et-lev fareoh velo shama alehem khaasher diver yehovah el-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעִבְרִ֔ים שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Early in the morning present yourself to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says יהוה, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go to worship Me.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hashekhem vavoker vehiteyatsev lifeney fareoh veamareta elayv khoh-amar yehovah elohey haiveriym shalach et-amiy veyaaveduniy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ בַּפַּ֣עַם הַזֹּ֗את אֲנִ֨י שֹׁלֵ֜חַ אֶת־כׇּל־מַגֵּפֹתַי֙ אֶֽל־לִבְּךָ֔ וּבַעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וּבְעַמֶּ֑ךָ בַּעֲב֣וּר תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין כָּמֹ֖נִי בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: For this time I will send all My plagues upon your person, and your courtiers, and your people, in order that you may know that there is none like Me in all the world.
Transliteration: khiy vafaam hazot aniy sholecha et-khׇl-magefotay el-livekha uvaavadeykha uveamekha vaavur teda khiy eyn khamoniy vekhׇl-haarets

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ שָׁלַ֣חְתִּי אֶת־יָדִ֔י וָאַ֥ךְ אוֹתְךָ֛ וְאֶֽת־עַמְּךָ֖ בַּדָּ֑בֶר וַתִּכָּחֵ֖ד מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: I could have stretched forth My hand and stricken you and your people with pestilence, and you would have been effaced from the earth.
Transliteration: khiy atah shalachetiy et-yadiy vaakhe votekha veet-amekha vadaver vatikhached min-haarets

Hebrew: וְאוּלָ֗ם בַּעֲב֥וּר זֹאת֙ הֶעֱמַדְתִּ֔יךָ בַּעֲב֖וּר הַרְאֹתְךָ֣ אֶת־כֹּחִ֑י וּלְמַ֛עַן סַפֵּ֥ר שְׁמִ֖י בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Nevertheless I have spared you for this purpose: in order to show you My power, and in order that My fame may resound throughout the world.
Transliteration: veulam vaavur zot heemadetiykha vaavur hareotekha et-khochiy ulemaan safer shemiy vekhׇl-haarets

Hebrew: עוֹדְךָ֖ מִסְתּוֹלֵ֣ל בְּעַמִּ֑י לְבִלְתִּ֖י שַׁלְּחָֽם׃
Translated: Yet you continue to thwart My people, and do not let them go!
Transliteration: vodekha misetvolel veamiy leviletiy shalecham

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֤י מַמְטִיר֙ כָּעֵ֣ת מָחָ֔ר בָּרָ֖ד כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־הָיָ֤ה כָמֹ֙הוּ֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם לְמִן־הַיּ֥וֹם הִוָּסְדָ֖הֿ וְעַד־עָֽתָּה׃
Translated: This time tomorrow I will rain down a very heavy hail, such as has not been in Egypt from the day it was founded until now.
Transliteration: hineniy mametiyr khaet machar varad khaved meod asher lo-hayah khamohu vemitserayiim lemin-hayyvom hivasedahֿ vead-atah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁלַ֤ח הָעֵז֙ אֶֽת־מִקְנְךָ֔ וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְךָ֖ בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה כׇּל־הָאָדָ֨ם וְהַבְּהֵמָ֜ה אֲשֶֽׁר־יִמָּצֵ֣א בַשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְלֹ֤א יֵֽאָסֵף֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וְיָרַ֧ד עֲלֵהֶ֛ם הַבָּרָ֖ד וָמֵֽתוּ׃
Translated: Therefore, order your livestock and everything you have in the open brought under shelter; every human and beast that is found outside, not having been brought indoors, shall perish when the hail comes down upon them!’”
Transliteration: veatah shelach haez et-mikenekha veet khׇl-asher lekha vashadeh khׇl-haadam vehavehemah asher-yimatse vashadeh velo eiasef havayetah veyarad alehem havarad vametu

Hebrew: הַיָּרֵא֙ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵֽעַבְדֵ֖י פַּרְעֹ֑ה הֵנִ֛יס אֶת־עֲבָדָ֥יו וְאֶת־מִקְנֵ֖הוּ אֶל־הַבָּתִּֽים׃
Translated: Those among Pharaoh’s courtiers who feared יהוה’s word brought their slaves and livestock indoors to safety;
Transliteration: hayare et-devar yehovah meavedey fareoh heniys et-avadayv veet-mikenehu el-havatiym

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־שָׂ֛ם לִבּ֖וֹ אֶל־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲזֹ֛ב אֶת־עֲבָדָ֥יו וְאֶת־מִקְנֵ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: but those who paid no regard to the word of יהוה left their slaves and livestock in the open.
Transliteration: vaasher lo-sham livvo el-devar yehovah vayaazov et-avadayv veet-mikenehu vashadeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה נְטֵ֤ה אֶת־יָֽדְךָ֙ עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וִיהִ֥י בָרָ֖ד בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־הָאָדָ֣ם וְעַל־הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה וְעַ֛ל כׇּל־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that hail may fall on all the land of Egypt, upon human and beast and all the grasses of the field in the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh neteh et-yadekha al-hashamayiim viyhiy varad vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim al-haadam veal-havehemah veal khׇl-eshev hashadeh veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־מַטֵּ֘הוּ֮ עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֒יִם֒ וַֽיהֹוָ֗ה נָתַ֤ן קֹלֹת֙ וּבָרָ֔ד וַתִּ֥הֲלַךְ אֵ֖שׁ אָ֑רְצָה וַיַּמְטֵ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּרָ֖ד עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: So Moses held out his rod toward the sky, and יהוה sent thunder and hail, and fire streamed down to the ground, as יהוה rained down hail upon the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayet mosheh et-matehu al-hashamayiim vayhovah natan kolot uvarad vatihalakhe esh aretsah vayameter yehovah varad al-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בָרָ֔ד וְאֵ֕שׁ מִתְלַקַּ֖חַת בְּת֣וֹךְ הַבָּרָ֑ד כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־הָיָ֤ה כָמֹ֙הוּ֙ בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵאָ֖ז הָיְתָ֥ה לְגֽוֹי׃
Translated: The hail was very heavy—fire flashing in the midst of the hail—such as had not fallen on the land of Egypt since it had become a nation.
Transliteration: vayehiy varad veesh mitelakachat vetvokhe havarad khaved meod asher lo-hayah khamohu vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim meaz hayetah legvoy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨ךְ הַבָּרָ֜ד בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה מֵאָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־עֵ֤שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶה֙ הִכָּ֣ה הַבָּרָ֔ד וְאֶת־כׇּל־עֵ֥ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה שִׁבֵּֽר׃
Translated: Throughout the land of Egypt the hail struck down all that were in the open, both human and beast; the hail also struck down all the grasses of the field and shattered all the trees of the field.
Transliteration: vayakhe havarad vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim et khׇl-asher vashadeh meadam vead-vehemah veet khׇl-eshev hashadeh hikhah havarad veet-khׇl-ets hashadeh shiver

Hebrew: רַ֚ק בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹ֥א הָיָ֖ה בָּרָֽד׃
Translated: Only in the region of Goshen, where the Israelites were, there was no hail.
Transliteration: rak veerets goshen asher-sham veney yisherael lo hayah varad

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח פַּרְעֹ֗ה וַיִּקְרָא֙ לְמֹשֶׁ֣ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֖ם חָטָ֣אתִי הַפָּ֑עַם יְהֹוָה֙ הַצַּדִּ֔יק וַאֲנִ֥י וְעַמִּ֖י הָרְשָׁעִֽים׃
Translated: Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron and said to them, “I stand guilty this time. יהוה is in the right, and I and my people are in the wrong.
Transliteration: vayishelach fareoh vayikera lemosheh uleaharon vayomer alehem chatatiy hafaam yehovah hatsadiyk vaaniy veamiy hareshaiym

Hebrew: הַעְתִּ֙ירוּ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְרַ֕ב מִֽהְיֹ֛ת קֹלֹ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֖ים וּבָרָ֑ד וַאֲשַׁלְּחָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תֹסִפ֖וּן לַעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated: Plead with יהוה that there may be an end of God’s thunder and of hail. I will let you go; you need stay no longer.”
Transliteration: haetiyru el-yehovah verav miheyot kolot Elohim uvarad vaashalechah etekhem velo tosifun laamod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כְּצֵאתִי֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר אֶפְרֹ֥שׂ אֶת־כַּפַּ֖י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה הַקֹּל֣וֹת יֶחְדָּל֗וּן וְהַבָּרָד֙ לֹ֣א יִֽהְיֶה־ע֔וֹד לְמַ֣עַן תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֥י לַיהֹוָ֖ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Moses said to him, “As I go out of the city, I shall spread out my hands to יהוה; the thunder will cease and the hail will fall no more, so that you may know that the earth is יהוה’s.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv mosheh khetsetiy et-haiyr eferosh et-khafay el-yehovah hakolvot yechedalun vehavarad lo yiheyeh-vod lemaan teda khiy layhovah haarets

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֖ה וַעֲבָדֶ֑יךָ יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּ֚י טֶ֣רֶם תִּֽירְא֔וּן מִפְּנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: But I know that you and your courtiers do not yet fear God יהוה.”—
Transliteration: veatah vaavadeykha yadaetiy khiy terem tiyreun mifeney yehovah Elohim

Hebrew: וְהַפִּשְׁתָּ֥ה וְהַשְּׂעֹרָ֖ה נֻכָּ֑תָה כִּ֤י הַשְּׂעֹרָה֙ אָבִ֔יב וְהַפִּשְׁתָּ֖ה גִּבְעֹֽל׃
Translated: Now the flax and barley were ruined, for the barley was in the ear and the flax was in bud;
Transliteration: vehafishetah vehasheorah nukhatah khiy hasheorah aviyv vehafishetah giveol

Hebrew: וְהַחִטָּ֥ה וְהַכֻּסֶּ֖מֶת לֹ֣א נֻכּ֑וּ כִּ֥י אֲפִילֹ֖ת הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: but the wheat and the emmer were not hurt, for they ripen late.—
Transliteration: vehachitah vehakhusemet lo nukhu khiy afiylot henah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה מֵעִ֤ם פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר וַיִּפְרֹ֥שׂ כַּפָּ֖יו אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחְדְּל֤וּ הַקֹּלוֹת֙ וְהַבָּרָ֔ד וּמָטָ֖ר לֹא־נִתַּ֥ךְ אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: Leaving Pharaoh, Moses went outside the city and spread out his hands to יהוה: the thunder and the hail ceased, and no rain came pouring down upon the earth.
Transliteration: vayetse mosheh meim fareoh et-haiyr vayiferosh khafayv el-yehovah vayachedelu hakolvot vehavarad umatar lo-nitakhe aretsah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא פַּרְעֹ֗ה כִּֽי־חָדַ֨ל הַמָּטָ֧ר וְהַבָּרָ֛ד וְהַקֹּלֹ֖ת וַיֹּ֣סֶף לַחֲטֹ֑א וַיַּכְבֵּ֥ד לִבּ֖וֹ ה֥וּא וַעֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated: But when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunder had ceased, he became stubborn and reverted to his guilty ways, as did his courtiers.
Transliteration: vayare fareoh khiy-chadal hamatar vehavarad vehakolot vayosef lachato vayakheved livvo hu vaavadayv

Hebrew: וַיֶּֽחֱזַק֙ לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: So Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he would not let the Israelites go, just as יהוה had foretold through Moses.
Transliteration: vayechezak lev fareoh velo shilach et-veney yisherael khaasher diver yehovah veyad-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֹּ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כִּֽי־אֲנִ֞י הִכְבַּ֤דְתִּי אֶת־לִבּוֹ֙ וְאֶת־לֵ֣ב עֲבָדָ֔יו לְמַ֗עַן שִׁתִ֛י אֹתֹתַ֥י אֵ֖לֶּה בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh. For I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his courtiers, in order that I may display these My signs among them,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh vo el-fareoh khiy-aniy hikhevadetiy et-livvo veet-lev avadayv lemaan shitiy ototay eleh vekirevvo

Hebrew: וּלְמַ֡עַן תְּסַפֵּר֩ בְּאׇזְנֵ֨י בִנְךָ֜ וּבֶן־בִּנְךָ֗ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִתְעַלַּ֙לְתִּי֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֶת־אֹתֹתַ֖י אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי בָ֑ם וִֽידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and that you may recount in the hearing of your child and of your child’s child how I made a mockery of the Egyptians and how I displayed My signs among them—in order that you may know that I am יהוה.”
Transliteration: ulemaan tesafer veׇzeney vinekha uven-vinekha et asher hitealaletiy vemitserayiim veet-ototay asher-shametiy vam viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹן֮ אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֒ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעִבְרִ֔ים עַד־מָתַ֣י מֵאַ֔נְתָּ לֵעָנֹ֖ת מִפָּנָ֑י שַׁלַּ֥ח עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
Translated: So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said to him, “Thus says יהוה, the God of the Hebrews, ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go that they may worship Me.
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh veaharon el-fareoh vayomeru elayv khoh-amar yehovah elohey haiveriym ad-matay meaneta leanot mifanay shalach amiy veyaaveduniy

Hebrew: כִּ֛י אִם־מָאֵ֥ן אַתָּ֖ה לְשַׁלֵּ֣חַ אֶת־עַמִּ֑י הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֥יא מָחָ֛ר אַרְבֶּ֖ה בִּגְבֻלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: For if you refuse to let My people go, tomorrow I will bring locusts on your territory.
Transliteration: khiy im-maen atah leshalecha et-amiy hineniy meviy machar areveh vigevulekha

Hebrew: וְכִסָּה֙ אֶת־עֵ֣ין הָאָ֔רֶץ וְלֹ֥א יוּכַ֖ל לִרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאָכַ֣ל ׀ אֶת־יֶ֣תֶר הַפְּלֵטָ֗ה הַנִּשְׁאֶ֤רֶת לָכֶם֙ מִן־הַבָּרָ֔ד וְאָכַל֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעֵ֔ץ הַצֹּמֵ֥חַ לָכֶ֖ם מִן־הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: They shall cover the surface of the land, so that no one will be able to see the land. They shall devour the surviving remnant that was left to you after the hail; and they shall eat away all your trees that grow in the field.
Transliteration: vekhisah et-eyn haarets velo yukhal lireot et-haarets veakhal et-yeter hafeletah hanisheeret lakhem min-havarad veakhal et-khׇl-haets hatsomecha lakhem min-hashadeh

Hebrew: וּמָלְא֨וּ בָתֶּ֜יךָ וּבָתֵּ֣י כׇל־עֲבָדֶ֘יךָ֮ וּבָתֵּ֣י כׇל־מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־רָא֤וּ אֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ וַאֲב֣וֹת אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ מִיּ֗וֹם הֱיוֹתָם֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיִּ֥פֶן וַיֵּצֵ֖א מֵעִ֥ם פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Moreover, they shall fill your palaces and the houses of all your courtiers and of all the Egyptians—something that neither your fathers nor fathers’ fathers have seen from the day they appeared on earth to this day.’” With that he turned and left Pharaoh’s presence.
Transliteration: umaleu vateykha uvatey khׇl-avadeykha uvatey khׇl-mitserayiim asher lo-rau avoteykha vaavvot avoteykha miyyvom heyvotam al-haadamah ad hayyvom hazeh vayifen vayetse meim fareoh

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ עַבְדֵ֨י פַרְעֹ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו עַד־מָתַי֙ יִהְיֶ֨ה זֶ֥ה לָ֙נוּ֙ לְמוֹקֵ֔שׁ שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְיַֽעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם הֲטֶ֣רֶם תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֥י אָבְדָ֖ה מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Pharaoh’s courtiers said to him, “How long shall this one be a snare to us? Let a delegation go to worship their God יהוה ! Are you not yet aware that Egypt is lost?”
Transliteration: vayomeru avedey fareoh elayv ad-matay yiheyeh zeh lanu lemvokesh shalach et-haanashiym veyaavedu et-yehovah eloheyhem haterem teda khiy avedah mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיּוּשַׁ֞ב אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לְכ֥וּ עִבְד֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם מִ֥י וָמִ֖י הַהֹלְכִֽים׃
Translated: So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh and he said to them, “Go, worship your God יהוה ! Who are the ones to go?”
Transliteration: vayyushav et-mosheh veet-aharon el-fareoh vayomer alehem lekhu ivedu et-yehovah eloheykhem miy vamiy haholekhiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה בִּנְעָרֵ֥ינוּ וּבִזְקֵנֵ֖ינוּ נֵלֵ֑ךְ בְּבָנֵ֨ינוּ וּבִבְנוֹתֵ֜נוּ בְּצֹאנֵ֤נוּ וּבִבְקָרֵ֙נוּ֙ נֵלֵ֔ךְ כִּ֥י חַג־יְהֹוָ֖ה לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: Moses replied, “We will all go—regardless of social station —we will go with our sons and daughters, our flocks and herds; for we must observe יהוה’s festival.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh vineareynu uvizekeneynu nelekhe vevaneynu uvivenvotenu vetsonenu uvivekarenu nelekhe khiy chag-yehovah lanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם יְהִ֨י כֵ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר אֲשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם וְאֶֽת־טַפְּכֶ֑ם רְא֕וּ כִּ֥י רָעָ֖ה נֶ֥גֶד פְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: But he said to them, “יהוה be with you—the same as I mean to let your dependents go with you! Clearly, you are bent on mischief.
Transliteration: vayomer alehem yehiy khen yehovah imakhem khaasher ashalach etekhem veet-tafekhem reu khiy raah neged feneykhem

Hebrew: לֹ֣א כֵ֗ן לְכֽוּ־נָ֤א הַגְּבָרִים֙ וְעִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אֹתָ֖הּ אַתֶּ֣ם מְבַקְשִׁ֑ים וַיְגָ֣רֶשׁ אֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת פְּנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: No! You gentlemen go and worship יהוה, since that is what you want.” And they were expelled from Pharaoh’s presence.
Transliteration: lo khen lekhu-na hagevariym veivedu et-yehovah khiy otah atem mevakeshiym vayegaresh otam meet feney fareoh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה נְטֵ֨ה יָדְךָ֜ עַל־אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בָּֽאַרְבֶּ֔ה וְיַ֖עַל עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְיֹאכַל֙ אֶת־כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָ֔רֶץ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁאִ֖יר הַבָּרָֽד׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come upon the land of Egypt and eat up all the grasses in the land, whatever the hail has left.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh neteh yadekha al-erets mitserayiim vaareveh veyaal al-erets mitserayiim veyokhal et-khׇl-eshev haarets et khׇl-asher hisheiyr havarad

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־מַטֵּ֘הוּ֮ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ וַֽיהֹוָ֗ה נִהַ֤ג רֽוּחַ־קָדִים֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ כׇּל־הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וְכׇל־הַלָּ֑יְלָה הַבֹּ֣קֶר הָיָ֔ה וְר֙וּחַ֙ הַקָּדִ֔ים נָשָׂ֖א אֶת־הָאַרְבֶּֽה׃
Translated: So Moses held out his rod over the land of Egypt, and יהוה drove an east wind over the land all that day and all night; and when morning came, the east wind had brought the locusts.
Transliteration: vayet mosheh et-matehu al-erets mitserayiim vayhovah nihag rucha-kadiym vaarets khׇl-hayyvom hahu vekhׇl-halayelah havoker hayah verucha hakadiym nasha et-haareveh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל הָֽאַרְבֶּ֗ה עַ֚ל כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיָּ֕נַח בְּכֹ֖ל גְּב֣וּל מִצְרָ֑יִם כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד לְ֠פָנָ֠יו לֹא־הָ֨יָה כֵ֤ן אַרְבֶּה֙ כָּמֹ֔הוּ וְאַחֲרָ֖יו לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־כֵּֽן׃
Translated: Locusts invaded all the land of Egypt and settled within all the territory of Egypt in a thick mass; never before had there been so many, nor will there ever be so many again.
Transliteration: vayaal haareveh al khׇl-erets mitserayiim vayanach vekhol gevul mitserayiim khaved meod lefanayv lo-hayah khen areveh khamohu veacharayv lo yiheyeh-khen

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֞ס אֶת־עֵ֣ין כׇּל־הָאָ֘רֶץ֮ וַתֶּחְשַׁ֣ךְ הָאָ֒רֶץ֒ וַיֹּ֜אכַל אֶת־כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָ֗רֶץ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־פְּרִ֣י הָעֵ֔ץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹתִ֖יר הַבָּרָ֑ד וְלֹא־נוֹתַ֨ר כׇּל־יֶ֧רֶק בָּעֵ֛ץ וּבְעֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They hid all the land from view, and the land was darkened; and they ate up all the grasses of the field and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left, so that nothing green was left, of tree or grass of the field, in all the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayekhas et-eyn khׇl-haarets vatecheshakhe haarets vayokhal et-khׇl-eshev haarets veet khׇl-feriy haets asher hvotiyr havarad velo-nvotar khׇl-yerek vaets uveeshev hashadeh vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֣ר פַּרְעֹ֔ה לִקְרֹ֖א לְמֹשֶׁ֣ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיֹּ֗אמֶר חָטָ֛אתִי לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֖ם וְלָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Pharaoh hurriedly summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “I stand guilty before your God יהוה and before you.
Transliteration: vayemaher fareoh likero lemosheh uleaharon vayomer chatatiy layhovah eloheykhem velakhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שָׂ֣א נָ֤א חַטָּאתִי֙ אַ֣ךְ הַפַּ֔עַם וְהַעְתִּ֖ירוּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְיָסֵר֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י רַ֖ק אֶת־הַמָּ֥וֶת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Forgive my offense just this once, and plead with your God יהוה that this death but be removed from me.”
Transliteration: veatah sha na chatatiy akhe hafaam vehaetiyru layhovah eloheykhem veyaser mealay rak et-hamavet hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֖א מֵעִ֣ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיֶּעְתַּ֖ר אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So he left Pharaoh’s presence and pleaded with יהוה.
Transliteration: vayetse meim fareoh vayeetar el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּהֲפֹ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֤ה רֽוּחַ־יָם֙ חָזָ֣ק מְאֹ֔ד וַיִּשָּׂא֙ אֶת־הָ֣אַרְבֶּ֔ה וַיִּתְקָעֵ֖הוּ יָ֣מָּה סּ֑וּף לֹ֤א נִשְׁאַר֙ אַרְבֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד בְּכֹ֖ל גְּב֥וּל מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: יהוה caused a shift to a very strong west wind, which lifted the locusts and hurled them into the Sea of Reeds; not a single locust remained in all the territory of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayahafokhe yehovah rucha-yam chazak meod vayisha et-haareveh vayitekaehu yamah suf lo nishear areveh echad vekhol gevul mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֥ק יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: But יהוה stiffened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let the Israelites go.
Transliteration: vayechazek yehovah et-lev fareoh velo shilach et-veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה נְטֵ֤ה יָֽדְךָ֙ עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וִ֥יהִי חֹ֖שֶׁךְ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְיָמֵ֖שׁ חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that there may be darkness upon the land of Egypt, a darkness that can be touched.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh neteh yadekha al-hashamayiim viyhiy choshekhe al-erets mitserayiim veyamesh choshekhe

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥ט מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־יָד֖וֹ עַל־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיְהִ֧י חֹֽשֶׁךְ־אֲפֵלָ֛ה בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: Moses held out his arm toward the sky and thick darkness descended upon all the land of Egypt for three days.
Transliteration: vayet mosheh et-yadvo al-hashamayiim vayehiy choshekhe-afelah vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim sheloshet yamiym

Hebrew: לֹֽא־רָא֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אָחִ֗יו וְלֹא־קָ֛מוּ אִ֥ישׁ מִתַּחְתָּ֖יו שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וּֽלְכׇל־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָ֥יָה א֖וֹר בְּמוֹשְׁבֹתָֽם׃
Translated: People could not see one another, and for three days no one could move about; but all the Israelites enjoyed light in their dwellings.
Transliteration: lo-rau iysh et-achiyv velo-kamu iysh mitachetayv sheloshet yamiym ulekhׇl-veney yisherael hayah vor vemvoshevotam

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְכוּ֙ עִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה רַ֛ק צֹאנְכֶ֥ם וּבְקַרְכֶ֖ם יֻצָּ֑ג גַּֽם־טַפְּכֶ֖ם יֵלֵ֥ךְ עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: Pharaoh then summoned Moses and said, “Go, worship יהוה ! Only your flocks and your herds shall be left behind; even your dependents may go with you.”
Transliteration: vayikera fareoh el-mosheh vayomer lekhu ivedu et-yehovah rak tsonekhem uvekarekhem yutsag gam-tafekhem eilekhe imakhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה גַּם־אַתָּ֛ה תִּתֵּ֥ן בְּיָדֵ֖נוּ זְבָחִ֣ים וְעֹלֹ֑ת וְעָשִׂ֖ינוּ לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: But Moses said, “You yourself must provide us with sacrifices and burnt offerings to offer up to our God יהוה;
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh gam-atah titen veyadenu zevachiym veolot veashiynu layhovah eloheynu

Hebrew: וְגַם־מִקְנֵ֜נוּ יֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֗נוּ לֹ֤א תִשָּׁאֵר֙ פַּרְסָ֔ה כִּ֚י מִמֶּ֣נּוּ נִקַּ֔ח לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ לֹֽא־נֵדַ֗ע מַֽה־נַּעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַד־בֹּאֵ֖נוּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: our own livestock, too, shall go along with us—not a hoof shall remain behind: for we must select from it for the worship of our God יהוה; and we shall not know with what we are to worship יהוה until we arrive there.”
Transliteration: vegam-mikenenu eilekhe imanu lo tishaer faresah khiy mimenu nikach laavod et-yehovah eloheynu vaanachenu lo-neda mah-naavod et-yehovah ad-voenu shamah

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֥ק יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לְשַׁלְּחָֽם׃
Translated: But יהוה stiffened Pharaoh’s heart and he would not agree to let them go.
Transliteration: vayechazek yehovah et-lev fareoh velo avah leshalecham

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵ֣ךְ מֵעָלָ֑י הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ אַל־תֹּ֙סֶף֙ רְא֣וֹת פָּנַ֔י כִּ֗י בְּי֛וֹם רְאֹתְךָ֥ פָנַ֖י תָּמֽוּת׃
Translated: Pharaoh said to him, “Be gone from me! Take care not to see me again, for the moment you look upon my face you shall die.”
Transliteration: vayomer-lvo fareoh lekhe mealay hishamer lekha al-tosef revot fanay khiy veyvom reotekha fanay tamut

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֣ן דִּבַּ֑רְתָּ לֹא־אֹסִ֥ף ע֖וֹד רְא֥וֹת פָּנֶֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: And Moses replied, “You have spoken rightly. I shall not see your face again!”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh khen divareta lo-osif vod revot faneykha {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה ע֣וֹד נֶ֤גַע אֶחָד֙ אָבִ֤יא עַל־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְעַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֕ן יְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּ֑ה כְּשַׁ֨לְּח֔וֹ כָּלָ֕ה גָּרֵ֛שׁ יְגָרֵ֥שׁ אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will bring but one more plague upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt; after that he shall let you go from here; indeed, when he lets you go, he will drive you out of here one and all.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh vod nega echad aviy al-fareoh veal-mitserayiim acharey-khen yeshalach etekhem mizeh kheshalechvo khalah garesh yegaresh etekhem mizeh

Hebrew: דַּבֶּר־נָ֖א בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וְיִשְׁאֲל֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ ׀ מֵאֵ֣ת רֵעֵ֗הוּ וְאִשָּׁה֙ מֵאֵ֣ת רְעוּתָ֔הּ כְּלֵי־כֶ֖סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Tell the people to borrow, each man from his neighbor and each woman from hers, objects of silver and gold.”
Transliteration: daver-na veׇzeney haam veyishealu iysh meet reehu veishah meet reutah kheley-khesef ukheley zahav

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָעָ֖ם בְּעֵינֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם גַּ֣ם ׀ הָאִ֣ישׁ מֹשֶׁ֗ה גָּד֤וֹל מְאֹד֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּעֵינֵ֥י עַבְדֵֽי־פַרְעֹ֖ה וּבְעֵינֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: יהוה disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people. Moreover, Moses himself was much esteemed in the land of Egypt, among Pharaoh’s courtiers and among the people.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah et-chen haam veeyney mitserayiim gam haiysh mosheh gadvol meod veerets mitserayiim veeyney avedey-fareoh uveeyney haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּחֲצֹ֣ת הַלַּ֔יְלָה אֲנִ֥י יוֹצֵ֖א בְּת֥וֹךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Moses said, “Thus says יהוה: Toward midnight I will go forth among the Egyptians,
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh khoh amar yehovah khachatsot halayelah aniy yvotse vetvokhe mitserayiim

Hebrew: וּמֵ֣ת כׇּל־בְּכוֹר֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ מִבְּכ֤וֹר פַּרְעֹה֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ עַ֚ד בְּכ֣וֹר הַשִּׁפְחָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר אַחַ֣ר הָרֵחָ֑יִם וְכֹ֖ל בְּכ֥וֹר בְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: and every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sits on his throne to the first-born of the slave girl who is behind the millstones; and all the first-born of the cattle.
Transliteration: umet khׇl-vekhvor veerets mitserayiim mivekhvor fareoh hayoshev al-khisevo ad vekhvor hashifechah asher achar harechayiim vekhol vekhvor vehemah

Hebrew: וְהָ֥יְתָ֛ה צְעָקָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּמֹ֙הוּ֙ לֹ֣א נִהְיָ֔תָה וְכָמֹ֖הוּ לֹ֥א תֹסִֽף׃
Translated: And there shall be a loud cry in all the land of Egypt, such as has never been or will ever be again;
Transliteration: vehayetah tseakah gedolah vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim asher khamohu lo niheyatah vekhamohu lo tosif

Hebrew: וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֹ֤א יֶֽחֱרַץ־כֶּ֙לֶב֙ לְשֹׁנ֔וֹ לְמֵאִ֖ישׁ וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה לְמַ֙עַן֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּן אֲשֶׁר֙ יַפְלֶ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה בֵּ֥ין מִצְרַ֖יִם וּבֵ֥ין יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: but not a dog shall snarl at any of the Israelites, at human or beast—in order that you may know that יהוה makes a distinction between Egypt and Israel.
Transliteration: ulekhol veney yisherael lo yecherats-khelev leshonvo lemeiysh vead-vehemah lemaan tedeun asher yafeleh yehovah veyn mitserayiim uveyn yisherael

Hebrew: וְיָרְד֣וּ כׇל־עֲבָדֶ֩יךָ֩ אֵ֨לֶּה אֵלַ֜י וְהִשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־לִ֣י לֵאמֹ֗ר צֵ֤א אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־בְּרַגְלֶ֔יךָ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן אֵצֵ֑א וַיֵּצֵ֥א מֵֽעִם־פַּרְעֹ֖ה בׇּחֳרִי־אָֽף׃ {ס}
Translated: “Then all these courtiers of yours shall come down to me and bow low to me, saying, ‘Depart, you and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will depart.” And he left Pharaoh’s presence in hot anger.
Transliteration: veyaredu khׇl-avadeykha eleh elay vehishetachavu-liy lemor tse atah vekhׇl-haam asher-verageleykha veacharey-khen etse vayetse meim-fareoh vׇchoriy-af {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה לֹא־יִשְׁמַ֥ע אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה לְמַ֛עַן רְב֥וֹת מוֹפְתַ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Now יהוה had said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not heed you, in order that My marvels may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh lo-yishema aleykhem fareoh lemaan revvot mvofetay veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֗ן עָשׂ֛וּ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמֹּפְתִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיְחַזֵּ֤ק יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹֽא־שִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Moses and Aaron had performed all these marvels before Pharaoh, but יהוה had stiffened the heart of Pharaoh so that he would not let the Israelites go from his land.
Transliteration: umosheh veaharon ashu et-khׇl-hamofetiym haeleh lifeney fareoh vayechazek yehovah et-lev fareoh velo-shilach et-veney-yisherael mearetsvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt:
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon veerets mitserayiim lemor

Hebrew: הַחֹ֧דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם רֹ֣אשׁ חֳדָשִׁ֑ים רִאשׁ֥וֹן הוּא֙ לָכֶ֔ם לְחׇדְשֵׁ֖י הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
Translated: This month shall mark for you the beginning of the months; it shall be the first of the months of the year for you.
Transliteration: hachodesh hazeh lakhem rosh chodashiym rishvon hu lakhem lechׇdeshey hashanah

Hebrew: דַּבְּר֗וּ אֶֽל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֤ת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בֶּעָשֹׂ֖ר לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וְיִקְח֣וּ לָהֶ֗ם אִ֛ישׁ שֶׂ֥ה לְבֵית־אָבֹ֖ת שֶׂ֥ה לַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: Speak to the community leadership of Israel and say that on the tenth of this month each of them shall take a lamb to a family, a lamb to a household.
Transliteration: daveru el-khׇl-adat yisherael lemor veashor lachodesh hazeh veyikechu lahem iysh sheh leveyt-avot sheh lavayiit

Hebrew: וְאִם־יִמְעַ֣ט הַבַּ֘יִת֮ מִהְי֣וֹת מִשֶּׂה֒ וְלָקַ֣ח ה֗וּא וּשְׁכֵנ֛וֹ הַקָּרֹ֥ב אֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ בְּמִכְסַ֣ת נְפָשֹׁ֑ת אִ֚ישׁ לְפִ֣י אׇכְל֔וֹ תָּכֹ֖סּוּ עַל־הַשֶּֽׂה׃
Translated: But if the household is too small for a lamb, let it share one with a neighbor who dwells nearby, in proportion to the number of persons: you shall contribute for the lamb according to what each household will eat.
Transliteration: veim-yimeat havayiit miheyvot misheh velakach hu ushekhenvo hakarov el-veytvo vemikhesat nefashot iysh lefiy ׇkhelvo takhosu al-hasheh

Hebrew: שֶׂ֥ה תָמִ֛ים זָכָ֥ר בֶּן־שָׁנָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם מִן־הַכְּבָשִׂ֥ים וּמִן־הָעִזִּ֖ים תִּקָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a yearling male; you may take it from the sheep or from the goats.
Transliteration: sheh tamiym zakhar ven-shanah yiheyeh lakhem min-hakhevashiym umin-haiziym tikachu

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה לָכֶם֙ לְמִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת עַ֣ד אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וְשָׁחֲט֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ כֹּ֛ל קְהַ֥ל עֲדַֽת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall keep watch over it until the fourteenth day of this month; and all the assembled congregation of the Israelites shall slaughter it at twilight.
Transliteration: vehayah lakhem lemishemeret ad arevaah ashar yvom lachodesh hazeh veshachatu otvo khol kehal adat-yisherael veyn haarevayiim

Hebrew: וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ מִן־הַדָּ֔ם וְנָ֥תְנ֛וּ עַל־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַמְּזוּזֹ֖ת וְעַל־הַמַּשְׁק֑וֹף עַ֚ל הַבָּ֣תִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יֹאכְל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: They shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and the lintel of the houses in which they are to eat it.
Transliteration: velakechu min-hadam venatenu al-shetey hamezuzot veal-hamashekvof al havatiym asher-yokhelu otvo vahem

Hebrew: וְאָכְל֥וּ אֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַזֶּ֑ה צְלִי־אֵ֣שׁ וּמַצּ֔וֹת עַל־מְרֹרִ֖ים יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: They shall eat the flesh that same night; they shall eat it roasted over the fire, with unleavened bread and with bitter herbs.
Transliteration: veakhelu et-havashar valayelah hazeh tseliy-esh umatsvot al-meroriym yokheluhu

Hebrew: אַל־תֹּאכְל֤וּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ נָ֔א וּבָשֵׁ֥ל מְבֻשָּׁ֖ל בַּמָּ֑יִם כִּ֣י אִם־צְלִי־אֵ֔שׁ רֹאשׁ֥וֹ עַל־כְּרָעָ֖יו וְעַל־קִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Do not eat any of it raw, or cooked in any way with water, but roasted—head, legs, and entrails—over the fire.
Transliteration: al-tokhelu mimenu na uvashel mevushal vamayiim khiy im-tseliy-esh roshvo al-kheraayv veal-kirevvo

Hebrew: וְלֹא־תוֹתִ֥ירוּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֑קֶר וְהַנֹּתָ֥ר מִמֶּ֛נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר בָּאֵ֥שׁ תִּשְׂרֹֽפוּ׃
Translated: You shall not leave any of it over until morning; if any of it is left until morning, you shall burn it.
Transliteration: velo-tvotiyru mimenu ad-voker vehanotar mimenu ad-voker vaesh tisherofu

Hebrew: וְכָ֘כָה֮ תֹּאכְל֣וּ אֹתוֹ֒ מׇתְנֵיכֶ֣ם חֲגֻרִ֔ים נַֽעֲלֵיכֶם֙ בְּרַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם וּמַקֶּלְכֶ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֑ם וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בְּחִפָּז֔וֹן פֶּ֥סַח ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: This is how you shall eat it: your loins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and you shall eat it hurriedly: it is a passover offering to יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhakhah tokhelu otvo mׇteneykhem chaguriym naaleykhem verageleykhem umakelekhem veyedekhem vaakhaletem otvo vechifazvon fesach hu layhovah

Hebrew: וְעָבַרְתִּ֣י בְאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֘יִם֮ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַזֶּה֒ וְהִכֵּיתִ֤י כׇל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵאָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה וּבְכׇל־אֱלֹהֵ֥י מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה שְׁפָטִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: For that night I will go through the land of Egypt and strike down every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, both human and beast; and I will mete out punishments to all the gods of Egypt, I יהוה.
Transliteration: veavaretiy veerets-mitserayiim valayelah hazeh vehikheytiy khׇl-vekhvor veerets mitserayiim meadam vead-vehemah uvekhׇl-elohey mitserayiim eesheh shefatiym aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ הַדָּ֨ם לָכֶ֜ם לְאֹ֗ת עַ֤ל הַבָּתִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתֶּ֣ם שָׁ֔ם וְרָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וּפָסַחְתִּ֖י עֲלֵכֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֨ה בָכֶ֥ם נֶ֙גֶף֙ לְמַשְׁחִ֔ית בְּהַכֹּתִ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And the blood on the houses where you are staying shall be a sign for you: when I see the blood I will pass over you, so that no plague will destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vehayah hadam lakhem leot al havatiym asher atem sham veraiytiy et-hadam ufasachetiy alekhem velo-yiheyeh vakhem negef lemashechiyt vehakhotiy veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ הַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֤ה לָכֶם֙ לְזִכָּר֔וֹן וְחַגֹּתֶ֥ם אֹת֖וֹ חַ֣ג לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם תְּחׇגֻּֽהוּ׃
Translated: This day shall be to you one of remembrance: you shall celebrate it as a festival to יהוה throughout the ages; you shall celebrate it as an institution for all time.
Transliteration: vehayah hayyvom hazeh lakhem lezikharvon vechagotem otvo chag layhovah ledoroteykhem chukat volam techׇguhu

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ מַצּ֣וֹת תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ אַ֚ךְ בַּיּ֣וֹם הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן תַּשְׁבִּ֥יתוּ שְּׂאֹ֖ר מִבָּתֵּיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ כׇּל־אֹכֵ֣ל חָמֵ֗ץ וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ הַהִוא֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשֹׁ֖ן עַד־י֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
Translated: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread; on the very first day you shall remove leaven from your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day to the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym matsvot tokhelu akhe vayyvom harishvon tasheviytu sheor mivateykhem khiy khׇl-okhel chamets venikheretah hanefesh hahiv miyisherael miyyvom harishon ad-yvom hasheviiy

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֤וֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ מִקְרָא־קֹ֔דֶשׁ וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִקְרָא־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כׇּל־מְלָאכָה֙ לֹא־יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם אַ֚ךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵאָכֵ֣ל לְכׇל־נֶ֔פֶשׁ ה֥וּא לְבַדּ֖וֹ יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall celebrate a sacred occasion on the first day, and a sacred occasion on the seventh day; no work at all shall be done on them; only what every person is to eat, that alone may be prepared for you.
Transliteration: uvayyvom harishvon mikera-kodesh uvayyvom hasheviyiy mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melakhah lo-eiasheh vahem akhe asher eiakhel lekhׇl-nefesh hu levadvo eiasheh lakhem

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֮ אֶת־הַמַּצּוֹת֒ כִּ֗י בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶת־צִבְאוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֞ם אֶת־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֖ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: You shall observe the [Feast of] Unleavened Bread, for on this very day I brought your ranks out of the land of Egypt; you shall observe this day throughout the ages as an institution for all time.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-hamatsvot khiy veetsem hayyvom hazeh hvotsetiy et-tsivevoteykhem meerets mitserayiim ushemaretem et-hayyvom hazeh ledoroteykhem chukat volam

Hebrew: בָּרִאשֹׁ֡ן בְּאַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֤וֹם לַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב תֹּאכְל֖וּ מַצֹּ֑ת עַ֠ד י֣וֹם הָאֶחָ֧ד וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים לַחֹ֖דֶשׁ בָּעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: In the first month, from the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
Transliteration: varishon vearevaah ashar yvom lachodesh vaerev tokhelu matsot ad yvom haechad veesheriym lachodesh vaarev

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים שְׂאֹ֕ר לֹ֥א יִמָּצֵ֖א בְּבָתֵּיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ כׇּל־אֹכֵ֣ל מַחְמֶ֗צֶת וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ הַהִוא֙ מֵעֲדַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּגֵּ֖ר וּבְאֶזְרַ֥ח הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: No leaven shall be found in your houses for seven days. For whoever eats what is leavened, that person—whether a stranger or a citizen of the country—shall be cut off from the community of Israel.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym sheor lo yimatse vevateykhem khiy khׇl-okhel machemetset venikheretah hanefesh hahiv meadat yisherael vager uveezerach haarets

Hebrew: כׇּל־מַחְמֶ֖צֶת לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ בְּכֹל֙ מוֹשְׁבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תֹּאכְל֖וּ מַצּֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your settlements you shall eat unleavened bread.
Transliteration: khׇl-machemetset lo tokhelu vekhol mvoshevoteykhem tokhelu matsvot {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה לְכׇל־זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם מִֽשְׁכ֗וּ וּקְח֨וּ לָכֶ֥ם צֹ֛אן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתֵיכֶ֖ם וְשַׁחֲט֥וּ הַפָּֽסַח׃
Translated: Moses then summoned all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Go, pick out lambs for your families, and slaughter the passover offering.
Transliteration: vayikera mosheh lekhׇl-zikeney yisherael vayomer alehem mishekhu ukechu lakhem tson lemishefechoteykhem veshachatu hafasach

Hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֞ם אֲגֻדַּ֣ת אֵז֗וֹב וּטְבַלְתֶּם֮ בַּדָּ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־בַּסַּף֒ וְהִגַּעְתֶּ֤ם אֶל־הַמַּשְׁקוֹף֙ וְאֶל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַמְּזוּזֹ֔ת מִן־הַדָּ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסָּ֑ף וְאַתֶּ֗ם לֹ֥א תֵצְא֛וּ אִ֥ישׁ מִפֶּֽתַח־בֵּית֖וֹ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: Take a bunch of hyssop, dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and apply some of the blood that is in the basin to the lintel and to the two doorposts. None of you shall go outside the door of your house until morning.
Transliteration: ulekachetem agudat ezvov utevaletem vadam asher-vasaf vehigaetem el-hamashekvof veel-shetey hamezuzot min-hadam asher vasaf veatem lo tetseu iysh mifetach-veytvo ad-voker

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ לִנְגֹּ֣ף אֶת־מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ וְרָאָ֤ה אֶת־הַדָּם֙ עַל־הַמַּשְׁק֔וֹף וְעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֣י הַמְּזוּזֹ֑ת וּפָסַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־הַפֶּ֔תַח וְלֹ֤א יִתֵּן֙ הַמַּשְׁחִ֔ית לָבֹ֥א אֶל־בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם לִנְגֹּֽף׃
Translated: For יהוה, when going through to smite the Egyptians, will see the blood on the lintel and the two doorposts, and יהוה will pass over the door and not let the Destroyer enter and smite your home.
Transliteration: veavar yehovah linegof et-mitserayiim veraah et-hadam al-hamashekvof veal shetey hamezuzot ufasach yehovah al-hafetach velo yiten hamashechiyt lavo el-vateykhem linegof

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה לְחׇק־לְךָ֥ וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: “You shall observe this as an institution for all time, for you and for your descendants.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-hadavar hazeh lechׇk-lekha ulevaneykha ad-volam

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־תָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: And when you enter the land that יהוה will give you, as promised, you shall observe this rite.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-tavou el-haarets asher yiten yehovah lakhem khaasher diver ushemaretem et-haavodah hazot

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כִּֽי־יֹאמְר֥וּ אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּנֵיכֶ֑ם מָ֛ה הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: And when your children ask you, ‘What do you mean by this rite?’
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yomeru aleykhem veneykhem mah haavodah hazot lakhem

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֡ם זֶֽבַח־פֶּ֨סַח ה֜וּא לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּ֠סַ֠ח עַל־בָּתֵּ֤י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם בְּנׇגְפּ֥וֹ אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּ֣ינוּ הִצִּ֑יל וַיִּקֹּ֥ד הָעָ֖ם וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
Translated: you shall say, ‘It is the passover sacrifice to יהוה, who passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt when smiting the Egyptians, but saved our houses.’ Those assembled then bowed low in homage.
Transliteration: vaamaretem zevach-fesach hu layhovah asher fasach al-vatey veney-yisherael vemitserayiim venׇgefvo et-mitserayiim veet-vateynu hitsiyl vayikod haam vayishetachavu

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And the Israelites went and did so; just as יהוה had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
Transliteration: vayelekhu vayaashu veney yisherael khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh veaharon khen ashu {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּחֲצִ֣י הַלַּ֗יְלָה וַֽיהֹוָה֮ הִכָּ֣ה כׇל־בְּכוֹר֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ מִבְּכֹ֤ר פַּרְעֹה֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ עַ֚ד בְּכ֣וֹר הַשְּׁבִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית הַבּ֑וֹר וְכֹ֖ל בְּכ֥וֹר בְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: In the middle of the night יהוה struck down all the [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sat on the throne to the first-born of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the first-born of the cattle.
Transliteration: vayehiy vachatsiy halayelah vayhovah hikhah khׇl-vekhvor veerets mitserayiim mivekhor fareoh hayoshev al-khisevo ad vekhvor hasheviy asher veveyt havvor vekhol vekhvor vehemah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם פַּרְעֹ֜ה לַ֗יְלָה ה֤וּא וְכׇל־עֲבָדָיו֙ וְכׇל־מִצְרַ֔יִם וַתְּהִ֛י צְעָקָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם כִּֽי־אֵ֣ין בַּ֔יִת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽין־שָׁ֖ם מֵֽת׃
Translated: And Pharaoh arose in the night, with all his courtiers and all the Egyptians—because there was a loud cry in Egypt; for there was no house where there was not someone dead.
Transliteration: vayakׇm fareoh layelah hu vekhׇl-avadayv vekhׇl-mitserayiim vatehiy tseakah gedolah vemitserayiim khiy-eyn vayiit asher eyn-sham met

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֩ לְמֹשֶׁ֨ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֜ן לַ֗יְלָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ ק֤וּמוּ צְּאוּ֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ עַמִּ֔י גַּם־אַתֶּ֖ם גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּלְכ֛וּ עִבְד֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּדַבֶּרְכֶֽם׃
Translated: He summoned Moses and Aaron in the night and said, “Up, depart from among my people, you and the Israelites with you! Go, worship יהוה as you said!
Transliteration: vayikera lemosheh uleaharon layelah vayomer kumu tseu mitvokhe amiy gam-atem gam-veney yisherael ulekhu ivedu et-yehovah khedaverekhem

Hebrew: גַּם־צֹאנְכֶ֨ם גַּם־בְּקַרְכֶ֥ם קְח֛וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּרְתֶּ֖ם וָלֵ֑כוּ וּבֵֽרַכְתֶּ֖ם גַּם־אֹתִֽי׃
Translated: Take also your flocks and your herds, as you said, and begone! And may you bring a blessing upon me also!”
Transliteration: gam-tsonekhem gam-vekarekhem kechu khaasher divaretem valekhu uverakhetem gam-otiy

Hebrew: וַתֶּחֱזַ֤ק מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ עַל־הָעָ֔ם לְמַהֵ֖ר לְשַׁלְּחָ֣ם מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּ֥י אָמְר֖וּ כֻּלָּ֥נוּ מֵתִֽים׃
Translated: The Egyptians urged the people on, impatient to have them leave the country, for they said, “We shall all be dead.”
Transliteration: vatechezak mitserayiim al-haam lemaher leshalecham min-haarets khiy ameru khulanu metiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א הָעָ֛ם אֶת־בְּצֵק֖וֹ טֶ֣רֶם יֶחְמָ֑ץ מִשְׁאֲרֹתָ֛ם צְרֻרֹ֥ת בְּשִׂמְלֹתָ֖ם עַל־שִׁכְמָֽם׃
Translated: So the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading bowls wrapped in their cloaks upon their shoulders.
Transliteration: vayisha haam et-vetsekvo terem yechemats mishearotam tserurot veshimelotam al-shikhemam

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עָשׂ֖וּ כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַֽיִּשְׁאֲלוּ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם כְּלֵי־כֶ֛סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב וּשְׂמָלֹֽת׃
Translated: The Israelites had done Moses’ bidding and borrowed from the Egyptians objects of silver and gold, and clothing.
Transliteration: uveney-yisherael ashu khidevar mosheh vayishealu mimitserayiim kheley-khesef ukheley zahav ushemalot

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֞ה נָתַ֨ן אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָעָ֛ם בְּעֵינֵ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם וַיַּשְׁאִל֑וּם וַֽיְנַצְּל֖וּ אֶת־מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: And יהוה had disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people, and they let them have their request; thus they stripped the Egyptians.
Transliteration: vayhovah natan et-chen haam veeyney mitserayiim vayasheilum vayenatselu et-mitserayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵרַעְמְסֵ֖ס סֻכֹּ֑תָה כְּשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֨וֹת אֶ֧לֶף רַגְלִ֛י הַגְּבָרִ֖ים לְבַ֥ד מִטָּֽף׃
Translated: The Israelites journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand fighting men on foot, aside from noncombatants.
Transliteration: vayiseu veney-yisherael meraemeses sukhotah kheshesh-mevot elef rageliy hagevariym levad mitaf

Hebrew: וְגַם־עֵ֥רֶב רַ֖ב עָלָ֣ה אִתָּ֑ם וְצֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר מִקְנֶ֖ה כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Moreover, a mixed multitude went up with them, and very much livestock, both flocks and herds.
Transliteration: vegam-erev rav alah itam vetson uvakar mikeneh khaved meod

Hebrew: וַיֹּאפ֨וּ אֶת־הַבָּצֵ֜ק אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצִ֧יאוּ מִמִּצְרַ֛יִם עֻגֹ֥ת מַצּ֖וֹת כִּ֣י לֹ֣א חָמֵ֑ץ כִּֽי־גֹרְשׁ֣וּ מִמִּצְרַ֗יִם וְלֹ֤א יָֽכְלוּ֙ לְהִתְמַהְמֵ֔הַּ וְגַם־צֵדָ֖ה לֹא־עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough that they had taken out of Egypt, for it was not leavened, since they had been driven out of Egypt and could not delay; nor had they prepared any provisions for themselves.
Transliteration: vayofu et-havatsek asher hvotsiyu mimitserayiim ugot matsvot khiy lo chamets khiy-goreshu mimitserayiim velo yakhelu lehitemahemeha vegam-tsedah lo-ashu lahem

Hebrew: וּמוֹשַׁב֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָשְׁב֖וּ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: The length of time that the Israelites lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years;
Transliteration: umvoshav veney yisherael asher yashevu vemitserayiim sheloshiym shanah veareva mevot shanah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקֵּץ֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה יָ֥צְא֛וּ כׇּל־צִבְא֥וֹת יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: at the end of the four hundred and thirtieth year, to the very day, all the ranks of יהוה departed from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets sheloshiym shanah veareva mevot shanah vayehiy veetsem hayyvom hazeh yatseu khׇl-tsivevot yehovah meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: לֵ֣יל שִׁמֻּרִ֥ים הוּא֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לְהוֹצִיאָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הֽוּא־הַלַּ֤יְלָה הַזֶּה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה שִׁמֻּרִ֛ים לְכׇל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: That was for יהוה a night of vigil to bring them out of the land of Egypt; that same night is יהוה’s, one of vigil for all the children of Israel throughout the ages.
Transliteration: leyl shimuriym hu layhovah lehvotsiyam meerets mitserayiim hu-halayelah hazeh layhovah shimuriym lekhׇl-veney yisherael ledorotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן זֹ֖את חֻקַּ֣ת הַפָּ֑סַח כׇּל־בֶּן־נֵכָ֖ר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses and Aaron: This is the law of the passover offering: No foreigner shall eat of it.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veaharon zot chukat hafasach khׇl-ven-nekhar lo-yokhal vvo

Hebrew: וְכׇל־עֶ֥בֶד אִ֖ישׁ מִקְנַת־כָּ֑סֶף וּמַלְתָּ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ אָ֖ז יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But any householder’s purchased male slave may eat of it once he has been circumcised.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-eved iysh mikenat-khasef umaletah otvo az yokhal vvo

Hebrew: תּוֹשָׁ֥ב וְשָׂכִ֖יר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: No bound or hired laborer shall eat of it.
Transliteration: tvoshav veshakhiyr lo-yokhal vvo

Hebrew: בְּבַ֤יִת אֶחָד֙ יֵאָכֵ֔ל לֹא־תוֹצִ֧יא מִן־הַבַּ֛יִת מִן־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר ח֑וּצָה וְעֶ֖צֶם לֹ֥א תִשְׁבְּרוּ־בֽוֹ׃
Translated: It shall be eaten in one house: you shall not take any of the flesh outside the house; nor shall you break a bone of it.
Transliteration: vevayiit echad eiakhel lo-tvotsiy min-havayiit min-havashar chutsah veetsem lo tisheveru-vvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יַעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The whole community of Israel shall offer it.
Transliteration: khׇl-adat yisherael yaashu otvo

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָג֨וּר אִתְּךָ֜ גֵּ֗ר וְעָ֣שָׂה פֶ֘סַח֮ לַיהֹוָה֒ הִמּ֧וֹל ל֣וֹ כׇל־זָכָ֗ר וְאָז֙ יִקְרַ֣ב לַעֲשֹׂת֔וֹ וְהָיָ֖ה כְּאֶזְרַ֣ח הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכׇל־עָרֵ֖ל לֹֽא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If a male stranger who dwells with you would offer the passover to יהוה, all his males must be circumcised; then he shall be admitted to offer it; he shall then be as a citizen of the country. But no uncircumcised man may eat of it.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yagur itekha ger veashah fesach layhovah himvol lvo khׇl-zakhar veaz yikerav laashotvo vehayah kheezerach haarets vekhׇl-arel lo-yokhal vvo

Hebrew: תּוֹרָ֣ה אַחַ֔ת יִהְיֶ֖ה לָֽאֶזְרָ֑ח וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
Translated: There shall be one law for the citizen and for the stranger who dwells among you.
Transliteration: tvorah achat yiheyeh laezerach velager hagar vetvokhekhem

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֖ן כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And all the Israelites did so; as יהוה had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
Transliteration: vayaashu khׇl-veney yisherael khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh veet-aharon khen ashu {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה הוֹצִ֨יא יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם עַל־צִבְאֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: That very day יהוה freed the Israelites from the land of Egypt, troop by troop.
Transliteration: vayehiy veetsem hayyvom hazeh hvotsiy yehovah et-veney yisherael meerets mitserayiim al-tsiveotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke further to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: קַדֶּשׁ־לִ֨י כׇל־בְּכ֜וֹר פֶּ֤טֶר כׇּל־רֶ֙חֶם֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה לִ֖י הֽוּא׃
Translated: “Consecrate to Me every male first-born; human and beast, the first [male] issue of every womb among the Israelites is Mine.”
Transliteration: kadesh-liy khׇl-vekhvor feter khׇl-rechem viveney yisherael vaadam uvavehemah liy hu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־הָעָ֗ם זָכ֞וֹר אֶת־הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצָאתֶ֤ם מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּ֑ה וְלֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל חָמֵֽץ׃
Translated: And Moses said to the people,“Remember this day, on which you went free from Egypt, the house of bondage, how יהוה freed you from it with a mighty hand: no leavened bread shall be eaten.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-haam zakhvor et-hayyvom hazeh asher yetsatem mimitserayiim miveyt avadiym khiy vechozek yad hvotsiy yehovah etekhem mizeh velo eiakhel chamets

Hebrew: הַיּ֖וֹם אַתֶּ֣ם יֹצְאִ֑ים בְּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הָאָבִֽיב׃
Translated: You go free on this day, in the month of Abib.
Transliteration: hayyvom atem yotseiym vechodesh haaviyv

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה כִֽי־יְבִיאֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֡ה אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽ֠כְּנַעֲנִ֠י וְהַחִתִּ֨י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֜י וְהַחִוִּ֣י וְהַיְבוּסִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֣תֶת לָ֔ךְ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ וְעָבַדְתָּ֛ אֶת־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: So, when יהוה has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which was sworn to your fathers to be given you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you shall observe in this month the following practice:
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yeviyakha yehovah el-erets hakhenaaniy vehachitiy vehaemoriy vehachiviy vehayevusiy asher nisheva laavoteykha latet lakhe erets zavat chalav udevash veavadeta et-haavodah hazot vachodesh hazeh

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תֹּאכַ֣ל מַצֹּ֑ת וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י חַ֖ג לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a festival of יהוה.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym tokhal matsot uvayyvom hasheviyiy chag layhovah

Hebrew: מַצּוֹת֙ יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֨ה לְךָ֜ חָמֵ֗ץ וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ שְׂאֹ֖ר בְּכׇל־גְּבֻלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Throughout the seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten; no leavened bread shall be found with you, and no leaven shall be found in all your territory.
Transliteration: matsvot eiakhel et shiveat hayamiym velo-eiraeh lekha chamets velo-eiraeh lekha sheor vekhׇl-gevulekha

Hebrew: וְהִגַּדְתָּ֣ לְבִנְךָ֔ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּעֲב֣וּר זֶ֗ה עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לִ֔י בְּצֵאתִ֖י מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And you shall explain to your child on that day, ‘It is because of what יהוה did for me when I went free from Egypt.’
Transliteration: vehigadeta levinekha vayyvom hahu lemor vaavur zeh ashah yehovah liy vetsetiy mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ לְךָ֨ לְא֜וֹת עַל־יָדְךָ֗ וּלְזִכָּרוֹן֙ בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֔יךָ לְמַ֗עַן תִּהְיֶ֛ה תּוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּפִ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה הוֹצִֽאֲךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: “And this shall serve you as a sign on your hand and as a reminder on your forehead —in order that the Teaching of יהוה may be in your mouth—that with a mighty hand יהוה freed you from Egypt.
Transliteration: vehayah lekha levot al-yadekha ulezikharvon veyn eyneykha lemaan tiheyeh tvorat yehovah vefiykha khiy veyad chazakah hvotsiakha yehovah mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֛ אֶת־הַחֻקָּ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְמוֹעֲדָ֑הּ מִיָּמִ֖ים יָמִֽימָה׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall keep this institution at its set time from year to year.
Transliteration: veshamareta et-hachukah hazot lemvoadah miyamiym yamiymah {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יְבִאֲךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לְךָ֖ וְלַֽאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וּנְתָנָ֖הּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: “And when יהוה has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, as [God] swore to you and to your fathers, and has given it to you,
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yeviakha yehovah el-erets hakhenaaniy khaasher nisheva lekha velaavoteykha unetanah lakhe

Hebrew: וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ֥ כׇל־פֶּֽטֶר־רֶ֖חֶם לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־פֶּ֣טֶר ׀ שֶׁ֣גֶר בְּהֵמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ הַזְּכָרִ֖ים לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: you shall set apart for יהוה every first issue of the womb: every male firstling that your cattle drop shall be יהוה’s.
Transliteration: vehaavareta khׇl-feter-rechem layhovah vekhׇl-feter sheger vehemah asher yiheyeh lekha hazekhariym layhovah

Hebrew: וְכׇל־פֶּ֤טֶר חֲמֹר֙ תִּפְדֶּ֣ה בְשֶׂ֔ה וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה וַעֲרַפְתּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֨ל בְּכ֥וֹר אָדָ֛ם בְּבָנֶ֖יךָ תִּפְדֶּֽה׃
Translated: But every firstling ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every male first-born among your children.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-feter chamor tifedeh vesheh veim-lo tifedeh vaarafetvo vekhol vekhvor adam vevaneykha tifedeh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֥ בִנְךָ֛ מָחָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֣ר מַה־זֹּ֑את וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֗ד הוֹצִיאָ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: And when, in time to come, a child of yours asks you, saying, ‘What does this mean?’ you shall reply, ‘It was with a mighty hand that יהוה brought us out from Egypt, the house of bondage.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yishealekha vinekha machar lemor mah-zot veamareta elayv vechozek yad hvotsiyanu yehovah mimitserayiim miveyt avadiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּֽי־הִקְשָׁ֣ה פַרְעֹה֮ לְשַׁלְּחֵ֒נוּ֒ וַיַּהֲרֹ֨ג יְהֹוָ֤ה כׇּל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִבְּכֹ֥ר אָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּהֵמָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֩ אֲנִ֨י זֹבֵ֜חַ לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־פֶּ֤טֶר רֶ֙חֶם֙ הַזְּכָרִ֔ים וְכׇל־בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנַ֖י אֶפְדֶּֽה׃
Translated: When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, יהוה slew every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, the first-born of both human and beast. Therefore I sacrifice to יהוה every first male issue of the womb, but redeem every male first-born among my children.’
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-hikeshah fareoh leshalechenu vayaharog yehovah khׇl-vekhvor veerets mitserayiim mivekhor adam vead-vekhvor vehemah al-khen aniy zovecha layhovah khׇl-feter rechem hazekhariym vekhׇl-vekhvor vanay efedeh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה לְאוֹת֙ עַל־יָ֣דְכָ֔ה וּלְטוֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִיאָ֥נוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: “And so it shall be as a sign upon your hand and as a symbol on your forehead that with a mighty hand יהוה freed us from Egypt.”
Transliteration: vehayah levot al-yadekhah uletvotafot veyn eyneykha khiy vechozek yad hvotsiyanu yehovah mimitserayiim {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁלַּ֣ח פַּרְעֹה֮ אֶת־הָעָם֒ וְלֹא־נָחָ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים דֶּ֚רֶךְ אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כִּ֥י קָר֖וֹב ה֑וּא כִּ֣י ׀ אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים פֶּֽן־יִנָּחֵ֥ם הָעָ֛ם בִּרְאֹתָ֥ם מִלְחָמָ֖ה וְשָׁ֥בוּ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: Now when Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines, although it was nearer; for God said, “The people may have a change of heart when they see war, and return to Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayehiy veshalach fareoh et-haam velo-nacham Elohim derekhe erets felishetiym khiy karvov hu khiy amar Elohim fen-yinachem haam vireotam milechamah veshavu mitserayemah

Hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֨ב אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֶת־הָעָ֛ם דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר יַם־ס֑וּף וַחֲמֻשִׁ֛ים עָל֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: So God led the people round about, by way of the wilderness at the Sea of Reeds. Now the Israelites went up armed out of the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayasev Elohim <small></small> et-haam derekhe hamidevar yam-suf vachamushiym alu veney-yisherael meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־עַצְמ֥וֹת יוֹסֵ֖ף עִמּ֑וֹ כִּי֩ הַשְׁבֵּ֨עַ הִשְׁבִּ֜יעַ אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֧ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֛י מִזֶּ֖ה אִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: And Moses took with him the bones of Joseph, who had exacted an oath from the children of Israel, saying, “God will be sure to take notice of you: then you shall carry up my bones from here with you.”
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-atsemvot yvosef imvo khiy hashevea hisheviya et-veney yisherael lemor fakod yifekod Elohim etekhem vehaaliytem et-atsemotay mizeh itekhem

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִסֻּכֹּ֑ת וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְאֵתָ֔ם בִּקְצֵ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: They set out from Succoth, and encamped at Etham, at the edge of the wilderness.
Transliteration: vayiseu misukhot vayachanu veetam viketseh hamidevar

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֡ה הֹלֵךְ֩ לִפְנֵיהֶ֨ם יוֹמָ֜ם בְּעַמּ֤וּד עָנָן֙ לַנְחֹתָ֣ם הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְלַ֛יְלָה בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ לְהָאִ֣יר לָהֶ֑ם לָלֶ֖כֶת יוֹמָ֥ם וָלָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: יהוה went before them in a pillar of cloud by day, to guide them along the way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light, that they might travel day and night.
Transliteration: vayhovah holekhe lifeneyhem yvomam veamud anan lanechotam haderekhe velayelah veamud esh lehaiyr lahem lalekhet yvomam valayelah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָמִ֞ישׁ עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְעַמּ֥וּד הָאֵ֖שׁ לָ֑יְלָה לִפְנֵ֖י הָעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The pillar of cloud by day and the pillar of fire by night did not depart from before the people.
Transliteration: lo-yamiysh amud heanan yvomam veamud haesh layelah lifeney haam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְיָשֻׁ֗בוּ וְיַחֲנוּ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ פִּ֣י הַחִירֹ֔ת בֵּ֥ין מִגְדֹּ֖ל וּבֵ֣ין הַיָּ֑ם לִפְנֵי֙ בַּ֣עַל צְפֹ֔ן נִכְח֥וֹ תַחֲנ֖וּ עַל־הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: Tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon; you shall encamp facing it, by the sea.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veyashuvu veyachanu lifeney fiy hachiyrot veyn migedol uveyn hayam lifeney vaal tsefon nikhechvo tachanu al-hayam

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֤ר פַּרְעֹה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְבֻכִ֥ים הֵ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ סָגַ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Pharaoh will say of the Israelites, “They are astray in the land; the wilderness has closed in on them.”
Transliteration: veamar fareoh liveney yisherael nevukhiym hem vaarets sagar aleyhem hamidevar

Hebrew: וְחִזַּקְתִּ֣י אֶת־לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֮ וְרָדַ֣ף אַחֲרֵיהֶם֒ וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכׇל־חֵיל֔וֹ וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵֽן׃
Translated: Then I will stiffen Pharaoh’s heart and he will pursue them, that I may gain glory through Pharaoh and all his host; and the Egyptians shall know that I am יהוה. And they did so.
Transliteration: vechizaketiy et-lev-fareoh veradaf achareyhem veikhavedah vefareoh uvekhׇl-cheylvo veyadeu mitserayiim khiy-aniy yehovah vayaashu-khen

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּד֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֥י בָרַ֖ח הָעָ֑ם וַ֠יֵּהָפֵ֠ךְ לְבַ֨ב פַּרְעֹ֤ה וַעֲבָדָיו֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־שִׁלַּ֥חְנוּ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעׇבְדֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his courtiers had a change of heart about the people and said, “What is this we have done, releasing Israel from our service?”
Transliteration: vayugad lemelekhe mitserayiim khiy varach haam vayehafekhe levav fareoh vaavadayv el-haam vayomeru mah-zot ashiynu khiy-shilachenu et-yisherael meׇvedenu

Hebrew: וַיֶּאְסֹ֖ר אֶת־רִכְבּ֑וֹ וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לָקַ֥ח עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He ordered his chariot and took his force with him;
Transliteration: vayeesor et-rikhevvo veet-amvo lakach imvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֗ח שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת רֶ֙כֶב֙ בָּח֔וּר וְכֹ֖ל רֶ֣כֶב מִצְרָ֑יִם וְשָׁלִשִׁ֖ם עַל־כֻּלּֽוֹ׃
Translated: he took six hundred of his picked chariots, and the rest of the chariots of Egypt, with officers in all of them.
Transliteration: vayikach shesh-mevot rekhev vachur vekhol rekhev mitserayiim veshalishim al-khulvo

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֣ק יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־לֵ֤ב פַּרְעֹה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּרְדֹּ֕ף אַחֲרֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יֹצְאִ֖ים בְּיָ֥ד רָמָֽה׃
Translated: יהוה stiffened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he gave chase to the Israelites. As the Israelites were departing defiantly,
Transliteration: vayechazek yehovah et-lev fareoh melekhe mitserayiim vayiredof acharey veney yisherael uveney yisherael yotseiym veyad ramah

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיַּשִּׂ֤יגוּ אוֹתָם֙ חֹנִ֣ים עַל־הַיָּ֔ם כׇּל־סוּס֙ רֶ֣כֶב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וּפָרָשָׁ֖יו וְחֵיל֑וֹ עַל־פִּי֙ הַֽחִירֹ֔ת לִפְנֵ֖י בַּ֥עַל צְפֹֽן׃
Translated: the Egyptians gave chase to them, and all the chariot horses of Pharaoh, his riders, and his warriors overtook them encamped by the sea, near Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
Transliteration: vayiredefu mitserayiim achareyhem vayashiygu votam choniym al-hayam khׇl-sus rekhev fareoh ufarashayv vecheylvo al-fiy hachiyrot lifeney vaal tsefon

Hebrew: וּפַרְעֹ֖ה הִקְרִ֑יב וַיִּשְׂאוּ֩ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל אֶת־עֵינֵיהֶ֜ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה מִצְרַ֣יִם ׀ נֹסֵ֣עַ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיִּֽירְאוּ֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: As Pharaoh drew near, the Israelites caught sight of the Egyptians advancing upon them. Greatly frightened, the Israelites cried out to יהוה.
Transliteration: ufareoh hikeriyv vayisheu veney-yisherael et-eyneyhem vehineh mitserayiim nosea achareyhem vayiyreu meod vayitseaku veney-yisherael el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ הֲֽמִבְּלִ֤י אֵין־קְבָרִים֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם לְקַחְתָּ֖נוּ לָמ֣וּת בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר מַה־זֹּאת֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֔נוּ לְהוֹצִיאָ֖נוּ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And they said to Moses, “Was it for want of graves in Egypt that you brought us to die in the wilderness? What have you done to us, taking us out of Egypt?
Transliteration: vayomeru el-mosheh hamiveliy eyn-kevariym vemitserayiim lekachetanu lamut vamidevar mah-zot ashiyta lanu lehvotsiyanu mimitserayiim

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבַּ֨רְנוּ אֵלֶ֤יךָ בְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר חֲדַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ וְנַֽעַבְדָ֣ה אֶת־מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י ט֥וֹב לָ֙נוּ֙ עֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מִמֻּתֵ֖נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Is this not the very thing we told you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us be, and we will serve the Egyptians, for it is better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness’?”
Transliteration: halo-zeh hadavar asher divarenu eleykha vemitserayiim lemor chadal mimenu venaavedah et-mitserayiim khiy tvov lanu avod et-mitserayiim mimutenu vamidevar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָ֒אוּ֒ הִֽתְיַצְּב֗וּ וּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־יְשׁוּעַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם כִּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר רְאִיתֶ֤ם אֶת־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם לֹ֥א תֹסִ֛פוּ לִרְאֹתָ֥ם ע֖וֹד עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: But Moses said to the people, “Have no fear! Stand by, and witness the deliverance which יהוה will work for you today; for the Egyptians whom you see today you will never see again.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-haam al-tiyrau hiteyatsevu ureu et-yeshuat yehovah asher-yaasheh lakhem hayyvom khiy asher reiytem et-mitserayiim hayyvom lo tosifu lireotam vod ad-volam

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֖ה יִלָּחֵ֣ם לָכֶ֑ם וְאַתֶּ֖ם תַּחֲרִשֽׁוּן׃ {פ}
Translated: יהוה will battle for you; you hold your peace!”
Transliteration: yehovah yilachem lakhem veatem tacharishun {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תִּצְעַ֖ק אֵלָ֑י דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶל־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְיִסָּֽעוּ׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Why do you cry out to Me? Tell the Israelites to go forward.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh mah-titseak elay daver el-veney-yisherael veyisau

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה הָרֵ֣ם אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֗ וּנְטֵ֧ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֛ עַל־הַיָּ֖ם וּבְקָעֵ֑הוּ וְיָבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָֽׁה׃
Translated: And you lift up your rod and hold out your arm over the sea and split it, so that the Israelites may march into the sea on dry ground.
Transliteration: veatah harem et-matekha uneteh et-yadekha al-hayam uvekaehu veyavou veney-yisherael vetvokhe hayam vayavashah

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִ֤י מְחַזֵּק֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב מִצְרַ֔יִם וְיָבֹ֖אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכׇל־חֵיל֔וֹ בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
Translated: And I will stiffen the hearts of the Egyptians so that they go in after them; and I will gain glory through Pharaoh and all his warriors, his chariots, and his riders.
Transliteration: vaaniy hineniy mechazek et-lev mitserayiim veyavou achareyhem veikhavedah vefareoh uvekhׇl-cheylvo verikhevvo uvefarashayv

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּהִכָּבְדִ֣י בְּפַרְעֹ֔ה בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
Translated: Let the Egyptians know that I am יהוה, when I gain glory through Pharaoh, his chariots, and his riders.”
Transliteration: veyadeu mitserayiim khiy-aniy yehovah vehikhavediy vefareoh verikhevvo uvefarashayv

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֞ע מַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים הַהֹלֵךְ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּסַּ֞ע עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The messenger of God, who had been going ahead of the Israelite army, now moved and followed behind them; and the pillar of cloud shifted from in front of them and took up a place behind them,
Transliteration: vayisa maleakhe haElohim haholekhe lifeney machaneh yisherael vayelekhe meachareyhem vayisa amud heanan mifeneyhem vayaamod meachareyhem

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א בֵּ֣ין ׀ מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֗יִם וּבֵין֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְהִ֤י הֶֽעָנָן֙ וְהַחֹ֔שֶׁךְ וַיָּ֖אֶר אֶת־הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְלֹא־קָרַ֥ב זֶ֛ה אֶל־זֶ֖ה כׇּל־הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated: and it came between the army of the Egyptians and the army of Israel. Thus there was the cloud with the darkness, and it cast a spell upon the night, so that the one could not come near the other all through the night.
Transliteration: vayavo veyn machaneh mitserayiim uveyn machaneh yisherael vayehiy heanan vehachoshekhe vayaer et-halayelah velo-karav zeh el-zeh khׇl-halayelah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־יָדוֹ֮ עַל־הַיָּם֒ וַיּ֣וֹלֶךְ יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> אֶת־הַ֠יָּ֠ם בְּר֨וּחַ קָדִ֤ים עַזָּה֙ כׇּל־הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם לֶחָרָבָ֑ה וַיִּבָּקְע֖וּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: Then Moses held out his arm over the sea and יהוה drove back the sea with a strong east wind all that night, and turned the sea into dry ground. The waters were split,
Transliteration: vayet mosheh et-yadvo al-hayam vayyvolekhe yehovah <small></small> et-hayam verucha kadiym azah khׇl-halayelah vayashem et-hayam lecharavah vayivakeu hamayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חוֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם׃
Translated: and the Israelites went into the sea on dry ground, the waters forming a wall for them on their right and on their left.
Transliteration: vayavou veney-yisherael vetvokhe hayam vayavashah vehamayiim lahem chvomah miymiynam umishemolam

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֤וּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֚ל ס֣וּס פַּרְעֹ֔ה רִכְבּ֖וֹ וּפָרָשָׁ֑יו אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: The Egyptians came in pursuit after them into the sea, all of Pharaoh’s horses, chariots, and riders.
Transliteration: vayiredefu mitserayiim vayavou achareyhem khol sus fareoh rikhevvo ufarashayv el-tvokhe hayam

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בְּאַשְׁמֹ֣רֶת הַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּשְׁקֵ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ וְעָנָ֑ן וַיָּ֕הׇם אֵ֖ת מַחֲנֵ֥ה מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: At the morning watch, יהוה looked down upon the Egyptian army from a pillar of fire and cloud, and threw the Egyptian army into panic.
Transliteration: vayehiy veashemoret havoker vayashekef yehovah el-machaneh mitserayiim veamud esh veanan vayahׇm et machaneh mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֗סַר אֵ֚ת אֹפַ֣ן מַרְכְּבֹתָ֔יו וַֽיְנַהֲגֵ֖הוּ בִּכְבֵדֻ֑ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִצְרַ֗יִם אָנ֙וּסָה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה נִלְחָ֥ם לָהֶ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: [God] locked the wheels of their chariots so that they moved forward with difficulty. And the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the Israelites, for יהוה is fighting for them against Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayasar et ofan marekhevotayv vayenahagehu vikhevedut vayomer mitserayiim anusah mifeney yisherael khiy yehovah nilecham lahem vemitserayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה נְטֵ֥ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ עַל־הַיָּ֑ם וְיָשֻׁ֤בוּ הַמַּ֙יִם֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם עַל־רִכְבּ֖וֹ וְעַל־פָּרָשָֽׁיו׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the sea, that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians and upon their chariots and upon their riders.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh neteh et-yadekha al-hayam veyashuvu hamayiim al-mitserayiim al-rikhevvo veal-farashayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּט֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶת־יָד֜וֹ עַל־הַיָּ֗ם וַיָּ֨שׇׁב הַיָּ֜ם לִפְנ֥וֹת בֹּ֙קֶר֙ לְאֵ֣יתָנ֔וֹ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם נָסִ֣ים לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַיְנַעֵ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: Moses held out his arm over the sea, and at daybreak the sea returned to its normal state, and the Egyptians fled at its approach. But יהוה hurled the Egyptians into the sea.
Transliteration: vayet mosheh et-yadvo al-hayam vayashׇv hayam lifenvot voker leeytanvo umitserayiim nasiym likeratvo vayenaer yehovah et-mitserayiim vetvokhe hayam

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ הַמַּ֗יִם וַיְכַסּ֤וּ אֶת־הָרֶ֙כֶב֙ וְאֶת־הַפָּ֣רָשִׁ֔ים לְכֹל֙ חֵ֣יל פַּרְעֹ֔ה הַבָּאִ֥ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם בַּיָּ֑ם לֹֽא־נִשְׁאַ֥ר בָּהֶ֖ם עַד־אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: The waters turned back and covered the chariots and the riders—Pharaoh’s entire army that followed them into the sea; not one of them remained.
Transliteration: vayashuvu hamayiim vayekhasu et-harekhev veet-hafarashiym lekhol cheyl fareoh havaiym achareyhem vayam lo-nishear vahem ad-echad

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ הַיָּ֑ם וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם׃
Translated: But the Israelites had marched through the sea on dry ground, the waters forming a wall for them on their right and on their left.
