Transliteration: uveney yisherael halekhu vayavashah vetvokhe hayam vehamayiim lahem chomah miymiynam umishemolam

Hebrew: וַיּ֨וֹשַׁע יְהֹוָ֜ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֛וּא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיַּ֤רְא יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵ֖ת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: Thus יהוה delivered Israel that day from the Egyptians. Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the shore of the sea.
Transliteration: vayyvosha yehovah vayyvom hahu et-yisherael miyad mitserayiim vayare yisherael et-mitserayiim met al-shefat hayam

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַיָּ֣ד הַגְּדֹלָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ הָעָ֖ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיַּאֲמִ֙ינוּ֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה וּבְמֹשֶׁ֖ה עַבְדּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: And when Israel saw the wondrous power which יהוה had wielded against the Egyptians, the people feared יהוה; they had faith in יהוה and in God’s servant Moses.
Transliteration: vayare yisherael et-hayad hagedolah asher ashah yehovah vemitserayiim vayiyreu haam et-yehovah vayaamiynu vayhovah uvemosheh avedvo {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יָשִֽׁיר־מֹשֶׁה֩ וּבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֵאמֹ֑ר אָשִׁ֤ירָה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃
Translated:
Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to יהוה. They said:
I will sing to יהוה, for He has triumphed gloriously;
Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.
Transliteration: az yashiyr-mosheh uveney yisherael et-hashiyrah hazot layhovah vayomeru lemor ashiyrah layhovah khiy-gaoh gaah sus verokhevvo ramah vayam

Hebrew: עׇזִּ֤י וְזִמְרָת֙ יָ֔הּ וַֽיְהִי־לִ֖י לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה זֶ֤ה אֵלִי֙ וְאַנְוֵ֔הוּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י אָבִ֖י וַאֲרֹמְמֶֽנְהוּ׃
Translated:
יהוה is my strength and might;
He is become my deliverance.
This is my God and I will enshrine Him;
The God of my father’s [house], and I will exalt Him.
Transliteration: ׇziy vezimerat yah vayehiy-liy liyshuah zeh eliy veanevehu elohey aviy vaaromemenehu

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֑ה יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
יהוה, the Warrior—
יהוה is His name!
Transliteration: yehovah iysh milechamah yehovah shemvo

Hebrew: מַרְכְּבֹ֥ת פַּרְעֹ֛ה וְחֵיל֖וֹ יָרָ֣ה בַיָּ֑ם וּמִבְחַ֥ר שָֽׁלִשָׁ֖יו טֻבְּע֥וּ בְיַם־סֽוּף׃
Translated:
Pharaoh’s chariots and his army
He has cast into the sea;
And the pick of his officers
Are drowned in the Sea of Reeds.
Transliteration: marekhevot fareoh vecheylvo yarah vayam umivechar shalishayv tuveu veyam-suf

Hebrew: תְּהֹמֹ֖ת יְכַסְיֻ֑מוּ יָרְד֥וּ בִמְצוֹלֹ֖ת כְּמוֹ־אָֽבֶן׃
Translated:
The deeps covered them;
They went down into the depths like a stone.
Transliteration: tehomot yekhaseyumu yaredu vimetsvolot khemvo-aven

Hebrew: יְמִֽינְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֔ה נֶאְדָּרִ֖י בַּכֹּ֑חַ יְמִֽינְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה תִּרְעַ֥ץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
Your right hand, יהוה, glorious in power,
Your right hand, יהוה, shatters the foe!
Transliteration: yemiynekha yehovah needariy vakhocha yemiynekha yehovah tireats voeiv

Hebrew: וּבְרֹ֥ב גְּאוֹנְךָ֖ תַּהֲרֹ֣ס קָמֶ֑יךָ תְּשַׁלַּח֙ חֲרֹ֣נְךָ֔ יֹאכְלֵ֖מוֹ כַּקַּֽשׁ׃
Translated:
In Your great triumph You break Your opponents;
You send forth Your fury, it consumes them like straw.
Transliteration: uverov gevonekha taharos kameykha teshalach charonekha yokhelemvo khakash

Hebrew: וּבְר֤וּחַ אַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ נֶ֣עֶרְמוּ מַ֔יִם נִצְּב֥וּ כְמוֹ־נֵ֖ד נֹזְלִ֑ים קָֽפְא֥וּ תְהֹמֹ֖ת בְּלֶב־יָֽם׃
Translated:
At the blast of Your nostrils the waters piled up,
The floods stood straight like a wall;
The deeps froze in the heart of the sea.
Transliteration: uverucha afeykha neeremu mayiim nitsevu khemvo-ned nozeliym kafeu tehomot velev-yam

Hebrew: אָמַ֥ר אוֹיֵ֛ב אֶרְדֹּ֥ף אַשִּׂ֖יג אֲחַלֵּ֣ק שָׁלָ֑ל תִּמְלָאֵ֣מוֹ נַפְשִׁ֔י אָרִ֣יק חַרְבִּ֔י תּוֹרִישֵׁ֖מוֹ יָדִֽי׃
Translated:
The foe said,
“I will pursue, I will overtake,
I will divide the spoil;
My desire shall have its fill of them.
I will bare my sword—
My hand shall subdue them.”
Transliteration: amar voeiv eredof ashiyg achalek shalal timelaemvo nafeshiy ariyk chareviy tvoriyshemvo yadiy

Hebrew: נָשַׁ֥פְתָּ בְרוּחֲךָ֖ כִּסָּ֣מוֹ יָ֑ם צָֽלְלוּ֙ כַּֽעוֹפֶ֔רֶת בְּמַ֖יִם אַדִּירִֽים׃
Translated:
You made Your wind blow, the sea covered them;
They sank like lead in the majestic waters.
Transliteration: nashafeta veruchakha khisamvo yam tsalelu khavoferet vemayiim adiyriym

Hebrew: מִֽי־כָמֹ֤כָה בָּֽאֵלִם֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִ֥י כָּמֹ֖כָה נֶאְדָּ֣ר בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ נוֹרָ֥א תְהִלֹּ֖ת עֹ֥שֵׂה פֶֽלֶא׃
Translated:
Who is like You, יהוה, among the celestials;
Who is like You, majestic in holiness,
Awesome in splendor, working wonders!
Transliteration: miy-khamokhah vaelim yehovah miy khamokhah needar vakodesh nvora tehilot osheh fele

Hebrew: נָטִ֙יתָ֙ יְמִ֣ינְךָ֔ תִּבְלָעֵ֖מוֹ אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
You put out Your right hand,
The earth swallowed them.
Transliteration: natiyta yemiynekha tivelaemvo arets

Hebrew: נָחִ֥יתָ בְחַסְדְּךָ֖ עַם־ז֣וּ גָּאָ֑לְתָּ נֵהַ֥לְתָּ בְעׇזְּךָ֖ אֶל־נְוֵ֥ה קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
In Your love You lead the people You redeemed;
In Your strength You guide them to Your holy abode.
Transliteration: nachiyta vechasedekha am-zu gaaleta nehaleta veׇzekha el-neveh kׇdeshekha

Hebrew: שָֽׁמְע֥וּ עַמִּ֖ים יִרְגָּז֑וּן חִ֣יל אָחַ֔ז יֹשְׁבֵ֖י פְּלָֽשֶׁת׃
Translated:
The peoples hear, they tremble;
Agony grips the dwellers in Philistia.
Transliteration: shameu amiym yiregazun chiyl achaz yoshevey felashet

Hebrew: אָ֤ז נִבְהֲלוּ֙ אַלּוּפֵ֣י אֱד֔וֹם אֵילֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב יֹֽאחֲזֵ֖מוֹ רָ֑עַד נָמֹ֕גוּ כֹּ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֥י כְנָֽעַן׃
Translated:
Now are the clans of Edom dismayed;
The tribes of Moab—trembling grips them;
All the dwellers in Canaan are aghast.
Transliteration: az nivehalu alufey edvom eyley mvoav yochazemvo raad namogu khol yoshevey khenaan

Hebrew: תִּפֹּ֨ל עֲלֵיהֶ֤ם אֵימָ֙תָה֙ וָפַ֔חַד בִּגְדֹ֥ל זְרוֹעֲךָ֖ יִדְּמ֣וּ כָּאָ֑בֶן עַד־יַעֲבֹ֤ר עַמְּךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה עַֽד־יַעֲבֹ֖ר עַם־ז֥וּ קָנִֽיתָ׃
Translated:
Terror and dread descend upon them;
Through the might of Your arm they are still as stone—
Till Your people cross over, יהוה,
Till Your people cross whom You have ransomed.
Transliteration: tifol aleyhem eymatah vafachad vigedol zervoakha yidemu khaaven ad-yaavor amekha yehovah ad-yaavor am-zu kaniyta

Hebrew: תְּבִאֵ֗מוֹ וְתִטָּעֵ֙מוֹ֙ בְּהַ֣ר נַחֲלָֽתְךָ֔ מָכ֧וֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ֛ פָּעַ֖לְתָּ יְהֹוָ֑ה מִקְּדָ֕שׁ אֲדֹנָ֖י כּוֹנְנ֥וּ יָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You will bring them and plant them in Your own mountain,
The place You made to dwell in, יהוה,
The sanctuary, O my lord, which Your hands established.
Transliteration: teviemvo vetitaemvo vehar nachalatekha makhvon leshivetekha faaleta yehovah mikedash adonay khvonenu yadeykha

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> יִמְלֹ֖ךְ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated: יהוה will reign for ever and ever!
Transliteration: yehovah <small></small> yimelokhe leolam vaed

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בָא֩ ס֨וּס פַּרְעֹ֜ה בְּרִכְבּ֤וֹ וּבְפָרָשָׁיו֙ בַּיָּ֔ם וַיָּ֧שֶׁב יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵהֶ֖ם אֶת־מֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: For the horses of Pharaoh, with his chariots and riders, went into the sea; and יהוה turned back on them the waters of the sea; but the Israelites marched on dry ground in the midst of the sea.
Transliteration: khiy va sus fareoh verikhevvo uvefarashayv vayam vayashev yehovah alehem et-mey hayam uveney yisherael halekhu vayavashah vetvokhe hayam {f}

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּח֩ מִרְיָ֨ם הַנְּבִיאָ֜ה אֲח֧וֹת אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־הַתֹּ֖ף בְּיָדָ֑הּ וַתֵּצֶ֤אןָ כׇֽל־הַנָּשִׁים֙ אַחֲרֶ֔יהָ בְּתֻפִּ֖ים וּבִמְחֹלֹֽת׃
Translated: Then Miriam the prophet, Aaron’s sister, picked up a hand-drum, and all the women went out after her in dance with hand-drums.
Transliteration: vatikach mireyam haneviyah achvot aharon et-hatof veyadah vatetsena khׇl-hanashiym achareyha vetufiym uvimecholot

Hebrew: וַתַּ֥עַן לָהֶ֖ם מִרְיָ֑ם שִׁ֤ירוּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
And Miriam chanted for them:
Sing to יהוה, for He has triumphed gloriously;
Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.
Transliteration: vataan lahem mireyam shiyru layhovah khiy-gaoh gaah sus verokhevvo ramah vayam {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּסַּ֨ע מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִיַּם־ס֔וּף וַיֵּצְא֖וּ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־שׁ֑וּר וַיֵּלְכ֧וּ שְׁלֹֽשֶׁת־יָמִ֛ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְלֹא־מָ֥צְאוּ מָֽיִם׃
Translated: Then Moses caused Israel to set out from the Sea of Reeds. They went on into the wilderness of Shur; they traveled three days in the wilderness and found no water.
Transliteration: vayasa mosheh et-yisherael miyam-suf vayetseu el-midevar-shur vayelekhu sheloshet-yamiym vamidevar velo-matseu mayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ מָרָ֔תָה וְלֹ֣א יָֽכְל֗וּ לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת מַ֙יִם֙ מִמָּרָ֔ה כִּ֥י מָרִ֖ים הֵ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמָ֖הּ מָרָֽה׃
Translated: They came to Marah, but they could not drink the water of Marah because it was bitter; that is why it was named Marah.
Transliteration: vayavou maratah velo yakhelu lishetot mayiim mimarah khiy mariym hem al-khen kara-shemah marah

Hebrew: וַיִּלֹּ֧נוּ הָעָ֛ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹ֖ר מַה־נִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”
Transliteration: vayilonu haam al-mosheh lemor mah-nisheteh

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֣ק אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיּוֹרֵ֤הוּ יְהֹוָה֙ עֵ֔ץ וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֙ אֶל־הַמַּ֔יִם וַֽיִּמְתְּק֖וּ הַמָּ֑יִם שָׁ֣ם שָׂ֥ם ל֛וֹ חֹ֥ק וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט וְשָׁ֥ם נִסָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: So he cried out to יהוה, and יהוה showed him a piece of wood; he threw it into the water and the water became sweet. There [God] made for them a fixed rule; there they were put to the test.
Transliteration: vayitseak el-yehovah vayyvorehu yehovah ets vayashelekhe el-hamayiim vayimeteku hamayiim sham sham lvo chok umishefat vesham nisahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אִם־שָׁמ֨וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַ֜ע לְק֣וֹל ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ וְהַיָּשָׁ֤ר בְּעֵינָיו֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְהַֽאֲזַנְתָּ֙ לְמִצְוֺתָ֔יו וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֖ כׇּל־חֻקָּ֑יו כׇּֽל־הַמַּחֲלָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֤מְתִּי בְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לֹא־אָשִׂ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה רֹפְאֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: [God] said, “If you will heed your God יהוה diligently, doing what is upright in God’s sight, giving ear to God’s commandments and keeping all God’s laws, then I will not bring upon you any of the diseases that I brought upon the Egyptians, for I יהוה am your healer.”
Transliteration: vayomer im-shamvoa tishema lekvol yehovah eloheykha vehayashar veeynayv taasheh vehaazaneta lemitsevotayv veshamareta khׇl-chukayv khׇl-hamachalah asher-shametiy vemitserayiim lo-ashiym aleykha khiy aniy yehovah rofeekha {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֵילִ֔מָה וְשָׁ֗ם שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֛ה עֵינֹ֥ת מַ֖יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים תְּמָרִ֑ים וַיַּחֲנוּ־שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: And they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees; and they encamped there beside the water.
Transliteration: vayavou eylimah vesham sheteym eshereh eynot mayiim veshiveiym temariym vayachanu-sham al-hamayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵֽאֵילִ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־סִ֔ין אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּין־אֵילִ֖ם וּבֵ֣ין סִינָ֑י בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י לְצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Setting out from Elim, the whole Israelite community came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departure from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayiseu meeylim vayavou khׇl-adat veney-yisherael el-midevar-siyn asher veyn-eylim uveyn siynay vachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh hasheniy letsetam meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: (וילינו) [וַיִּלּ֜וֹנוּ] כׇּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: In the wilderness, the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron.
Transliteration: (vylynv) [vayilvonu] khׇl-adat veney-yisherael al-mosheh veal-aharon vamidevar

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֲלֵהֶ֜ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִֽי־יִתֵּ֨ן מוּתֵ֤נוּ בְיַד־יְהֹוָה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשִׁבְתֵּ֙נוּ֙ עַל־סִ֣יר הַבָּשָׂ֔ר בְּאׇכְלֵ֥נוּ לֶ֖חֶם לָשֹׂ֑בַע כִּֽי־הוֹצֵאתֶ֤ם אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לְהָמִ֛ית אֶת־כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֥ל הַזֶּ֖ה בָּרָעָֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: The Israelites said to them, “If only we had died by the hand of יהוה in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the fleshpots, when we ate our fill of bread! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to starve this whole congregation to death.”
Transliteration: vayomeru alehem veney yisherael miy-yiten mutenu veyad-yehovah veerets mitserayiim veshivetenu al-siyr havashar veׇkhelenu lechem lashova khiy-hvotsetem otanu el-hamidevar hazeh lehamiyt et-khׇl-hakahal hazeh varaav {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י מַמְטִ֥יר לָכֶ֛ם לֶ֖חֶם מִן־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְיָצָ֨א הָעָ֤ם וְלָֽקְטוּ֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ לְמַ֧עַן אֲנַסֶּ֛נּוּ הֲיֵלֵ֥ךְ בְּתוֹרָתִ֖י אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will rain down bread for you from the sky, and the people shall go out and gather each day that day’s portion—that I may thus test them, to see whether they will follow My instructions or not.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hineniy mametiyr lakhem lechem min-hashamayiim veyatsa haam velaketu devar-yvom veyvomvo lemaan anasenu haeilekhe vetvoratiy im-lo

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י וְהֵכִ֖ינוּ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־יָבִ֑יאוּ וְהָיָ֣ה מִשְׁנֶ֔ה עַ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־יִלְקְט֖וּ י֥וֹם <small>׀</small> יֽוֹם׃
Translated: But on the sixth day, when they apportion what they have brought in, it shall prove to be double the amount they gather each day.”
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hashishiy vehekhiynu et asher-yaviyu vehayah misheneh al asher-yileketu yvom <small></small> yvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶֽל־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֶ֕רֶב וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה הוֹצִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: So Moses and Aaron said to all the Israelites, “By evening you shall know it was יהוה who brought you out from the land of Egypt;
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh veaharon el-khׇl-veney yisherael erev viydaetem khiy yehovah hvotsiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וּבֹ֗קֶר וּרְאִיתֶם֙ אֶת־כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּשׇׁמְע֥וֹ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם עַל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה כִּ֥י (תלונו) [תַלִּ֖ינוּ] עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: and in the morning you shall behold the Presence of יהוה, because [God] has heard your grumblings against יהוה. For who are we that you should grumble against us?
Transliteration: uvoker ureiytem et-khevvod yehovah veshׇmevo et-telunoteykhem al-yehovah venachenu mah khiy (tlvnv) [taliynu] aleynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה בְּתֵ֣ת יְהֹוָה֩ לָכֶ֨ם בָּעֶ֜רֶב בָּשָׂ֣ר לֶאֱכֹ֗ל וְלֶ֤חֶם בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ לִשְׂבֹּ֔עַ בִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם מַלִּינִ֖ם עָלָ֑יו וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה לֹא־עָלֵ֥ינוּ תְלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם כִּ֥י עַל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Since it is יהוה,” Moses continued, “who will give you flesh to eat in the evening and bread in the morning to the full—because יהוה has heard the grumblings you utter—what is our part? Your grumbling is against יהוה, not against us!”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh vetet yehovah lakhem vaerev vashar leekhol velechem vavoker lishevoa vishemoa yehovah et-telunoteykhem asher-atem maliynim alayv venachenu mah lo-aleynu telunoteykhem khiy al-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֱמֹ֗ר אֶֽל־כׇּל־עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל קִרְב֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע אֵ֖ת תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Say to the whole Israelite community: Advance toward יהוה, who has heard your grumbling.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon emor el-khׇl-adat veney yisherael kirevu lifeney yehovah khiy shama et telunoteykhem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּדַבֵּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּפְנ֖וּ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְהִנֵּה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה נִרְאָ֖ה בֶּעָנָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: And as Aaron spoke to the whole Israelite community, they turned toward the wilderness, and there, in a cloud, appeared the Presence of יהוה.
Transliteration: vayehiy khedaver aharon el-khׇl-adat veney-yisherael vayifenu el-hamidevar vehineh khevvod yehovah nireah veanan {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֶת־תְּלוּנֹּת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ דַּבֵּ֨ר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר בֵּ֤ין הָֽעַרְבַּ֙יִם֙ תֹּאכְל֣וּ בָשָׂ֔ר וּבַבֹּ֖קֶר תִּשְׂבְּעוּ־לָ֑חֶם וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: “I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites. Speak to them and say: By evening you shall eat flesh, and in the morning you shall have your fill of bread; and you shall know that I יהוה am your God.”
Transliteration: shamaetiy et-telunot veney yisherael daver alehem lemor veyn haarevayiim tokhelu vashar uvavoker tisheveu-lachem viydaetem khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בָעֶ֔רֶב וַתַּ֣עַל הַשְּׂלָ֔ו וַתְּכַ֖ס אֶת־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וּבַבֹּ֗קֶר הָֽיְתָה֙ שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטַּ֔ל סָבִ֖יב לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: In the evening quail appeared and covered the camp; in the morning there was a fall of dew about the camp.
Transliteration: vayehiy vaerev vataal hashelav vatekhas et-hamachaneh uvavoker hayetah shikhevat hatal saviyv lamachaneh

Hebrew: וַתַּ֖עַל שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטָּ֑ל וְהִנֵּ֞ה עַל־פְּנֵ֤י הַמִּדְבָּר֙ דַּ֣ק מְחֻסְפָּ֔ס דַּ֥ק כַּכְּפֹ֖ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: When the fall of dew lifted, there, over the surface of the wilderness, lay a fine and flaky substance, as fine as frost on the ground.
Transliteration: vataal shikhevat hatal vehineh al-feney hamidevar dak mechusefas dak khakhefor al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־אָחִיו֙ מָ֣ן ה֔וּא כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ מַה־ה֑וּא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם ה֣וּא הַלֶּ֔חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated: When the Israelites saw it, they said to one another, “What is it?” —for they did not know what it was. And Moses said to them, “That is the bread which יהוה has given you to eat.
Transliteration: vayireu veney-yisherael vayomeru iysh el-achiyv man hu khiy lo yadeu mah-hu vayomer mosheh alehem hu halechem asher natan yehovah lakhem leׇkhelah

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה לִקְט֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ אִ֖ישׁ לְפִ֣י אׇכְל֑וֹ עֹ֣מֶר לַגֻּלְגֹּ֗לֶת מִסְפַּר֙ נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אִ֛ישׁ לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאׇהֳל֖וֹ תִּקָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: This is what יהוה has commanded: Each household shall gather as much as it requires to eat—an omer to a person for as many of you as there are; each household shall fetch according to those in its tent.”
Transliteration: zeh hadavar asher tsivah yehovah liketu mimenu iysh lefiy ׇkhelvo omer lagulegolet misefar nafeshoteykhem iysh laasher veׇholvo tikachu

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֖ן בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּלְקְט֔וּ הַמַּרְבֶּ֖ה וְהַמַּמְעִֽיט׃
Translated: The Israelites did so, some gathering much, some little.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen veney yisherael vayileketu hamareveh vehamameiyt

Hebrew: וַיָּמֹ֣דּוּ בָעֹ֔מֶר וְלֹ֤א הֶעְדִּיף֙ הַמַּרְבֶּ֔ה וְהַמַּמְעִ֖יט לֹ֣א הֶחְסִ֑יר אִ֥ישׁ לְפִֽי־אׇכְל֖וֹ לָקָֽטוּ׃
Translated: But when they measured it by the omer, anyone who had gathered much had no excess, and anyone who had gathered little had no deficiency: each household had gathered as much as it needed to eat.
Transliteration: vayamodu vaomer velo heediyf hamareveh vehamameiyt lo hechesiyr iysh lefiy-ׇkhelvo lakatu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֕ישׁ אַל־יוֹתֵ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: And Moses said to them, “Let no one leave any of it over until morning.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh alehem iysh al-yvoter mimenu ad-voker

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמְע֣וּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיּוֹתִ֨רוּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וַיָּ֥רֻם תּוֹלָעִ֖ים וַיִּבְאַ֑שׁ וַיִּקְצֹ֥ף עֲלֵהֶ֖ם מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: But they paid no attention to Moses; some of them left of it until morning, and it became infested with maggots and stank. And Moses was angry with them.
Transliteration: velo-shameu el-mosheh vayyvotiru anashiym mimenu ad-voker vayarum tvolaiym vayiveash vayiketsof alehem mosheh

Hebrew: וַיִּלְקְט֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֔קֶר אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִ֣י אׇכְל֑וֹ וְחַ֥ם הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ וְנָמָֽס׃
Translated: So they gathered it every morning, as much as each one needed to eat; for when the sun grew hot, it would melt.
Transliteration: vayileketu otvo vavoker vavoker iysh khefiy ׇkhelvo vecham hashemesh venamas

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֗י לָֽקְט֥וּ לֶ֙חֶם֙ מִשְׁנֶ֔ה שְׁנֵ֥י הָעֹ֖מֶר לָאֶחָ֑ד וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כׇּל־נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וַיַּגִּ֖ידוּ לְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: On the sixth day they gathered double the amount of food, two omers for each; and when all the chieftains of the community came and told Moses,
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hashishiy laketu lechem misheneh sheney haomer laechad vayavou khׇl-neshiyey haedah vayagiydu lemosheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם ה֚וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שַׁבָּת֧וֹן שַׁבַּת־קֹ֛דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה מָחָ֑ר אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאפ֞וּ אֵפ֗וּ וְאֵ֤ת אֲשֶֽׁר־תְּבַשְּׁלוּ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔לוּ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֹדֵ֔ף הַנִּ֧יחוּ לָכֶ֛ם לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת עַד־הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: he said to them, “This is what יהוה meant: Tomorrow is a day of rest, a holy sabbath of יהוה. Bake what you would bake and boil what you would boil; and all that is left put aside to be kept until morning.”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem hu asher diver yehovah shavatvon shavat-kodesh layhovah machar et asher-tofu efu veet asher-tevashelu vashelu veet khׇl-haodef haniychu lakhem lemishemeret ad-havoker

Hebrew: וַיַּנִּ֤יחוּ אֹתוֹ֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְלֹ֣א הִבְאִ֔ישׁ וְרִמָּ֖ה לֹא־הָ֥יְתָה בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: So they put it aside until morning, as Moses had ordered; and it did not turn foul, and there were no maggots in it.
Transliteration: vayaniychu otvo ad-havoker khaasher tsivah mosheh velo hiveiysh verimah lo-hayetah vvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אִכְלֻ֣הוּ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּֽי־שַׁבָּ֥ת הַיּ֖וֹם לַיהֹוָ֑ה הַיּ֕וֹם לֹ֥א תִמְצָאֻ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: Then Moses said, “Eat it today, for today is a sabbath of יהוה; you will not find it today on the plain.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh ikheluhu hayyvom khiy-shavat hayyvom layhovah hayyvom lo timetsauhu vashadeh

Hebrew: שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים תִּלְקְטֻ֑הוּ וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֛י שַׁבָּ֖ת לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Six days you shall gather it; on the seventh day, the sabbath, there will be none.”
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym tileketuhu uvayyvom hasheviyiy shavat lo yiheyeh-vvo

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י יָצְא֥וּ מִן־הָעָ֖ם לִלְקֹ֑ט וְלֹ֖א מָצָֽאוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Yet some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found nothing.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheviyiy yatseu min-haam lilekot velo matsau {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה עַד־אָ֙נָה֙ מֵֽאַנְתֶּ֔ם לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מִצְוֺתַ֖י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “How long will you all refuse to obey My commandments and My teachings?
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh ad-anah meanetem lishemor mitsevotay vetvorotay

Hebrew: רְא֗וּ כִּֽי־יְהֹוָה֮ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֣ם הַשַּׁבָּת֒ עַל־כֵּ֠ן ה֣וּא נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֖י לֶ֣חֶם יוֹמָ֑יִם שְׁב֣וּ ׀ אִ֣ישׁ תַּחְתָּ֗יו אַל־יֵ֥צֵא אִ֛ישׁ מִמְּקֹמ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: Mark that it is יהוה who, having given you the sabbath, therefore gives you two days’ food on the sixth day. Let everyone remain in place: let no one leave the vicinity on the seventh day.”
Transliteration: reu khiy-yehovah natan lakhem hashavat al-khen hu noten lakhem vayyvom hashishiy lechem yvomayiim shevu iysh tachetayv al-eitse iysh mimekomvo vayyvom hasheviyiy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבְּת֥וּ הָעָ֖ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
Translated: So the people remained inactive on the seventh day.
Transliteration: vayishevetu haam vayyvom hasheviiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֧וּ בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ מָ֑ן וְה֗וּא כְּזֶ֤רַע גַּד֙ לָבָ֔ן וְטַעְמ֖וֹ כְּצַפִּיחִ֥ת בִּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: The house of Israel named it manna; it was like coriander seed, white, and it tasted like wafers in honey.
Transliteration: vayikereu veyt-yisherael et-shemvo man vehu khezera gad lavan vetaemvo khetsafiychit videvash

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה מְלֹ֤א הָעֹ֙מֶר֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן ׀ יִרְא֣וּ אֶת־הַלֶּ֗חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶאֱכַ֤לְתִּי אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בְּהוֹצִיאִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Moses said, “This is what יהוה has commanded: Let one omer of it be kept throughout the ages, in order that they may see the bread that I fed you in the wilderness when I brought you out from the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh zeh hadavar asher tsivah yehovah melo haomer mimenu lemishemeret ledoroteykhem lemaan yireu et-halechem asher heekhaletiy etekhem vamidevar vehvotsiyiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֚ח צִנְצֶ֣נֶת אַחַ֔ת וְתֶן־שָׁ֥מָּה מְלֹֽא־הָעֹ֖מֶר מָ֑ן וְהַנַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And Moses said to Aaron, “Take a jar, put one omer of manna in it, and place it before יהוה, to be kept throughout the ages.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon kach tsinetsenet achat veten-shamah melo-haomer man vehanach otvo lifeney yehovah lemishemeret ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּנִּיחֵ֧הוּ אַהֲרֹ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדֻ֖ת לְמִשְׁמָֽרֶת׃
Translated: As יהוה had commanded Moses, Aaron placed it before the Pact, to be kept.
Transliteration: khaasher tsivah yehovah el-mosheh vayaniychehu aharon lifeney haedut lemishemaret

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָֽכְל֤וּ אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה עַד־בֹּאָ֖ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ נוֹשָׁ֑בֶת אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אָֽכְל֔וּ עַד־בֹּאָ֕ם אֶל־קְצֵ֖ה אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: And the Israelites ate manna forty years, until they came to a settled land; they ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael akhelu et-haman arevaiym shanah ad-voam el-erets nvoshavet et-haman akhelu ad-voam el-ketseh erets khenaan

Hebrew: וְהָעֹ֕מֶר עֲשִׂרִ֥ית הָאֵיפָ֖ה הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: The omer is a tenth of an ephah.
Transliteration: vehaomer ashiriyt haeyfah hu {f}

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּסְע֠וּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל מִמִּדְבַּר־סִ֛ין לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בִּרְפִידִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין מַ֖יִם לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת הָעָֽם׃
Translated: From the wilderness of Sin the whole Israelite community continued by stages as יהוה would command. They encamped at Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.
Transliteration: vayiseu khׇl-adat veney-yisherael mimidevar-siyn lemaseeyhem al-fiy yehovah vayachanu virefiydiym veeyn mayiim lishetot haam

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤רֶב הָעָם֙ עִם־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ תְּנוּ־לָ֥נוּ מַ֖יִם וְנִשְׁתֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תְּרִיבוּן֙ עִמָּדִ֔י מַה־תְּנַסּ֖וּן אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The people quarreled with Moses. “Give us water to drink,” they said; and Moses replied to them, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you try יהוה ?”
Transliteration: vayarev haam im-mosheh vayomeru tenu-lanu mayiim venisheteh vayomer lahem mosheh mah-teriyvun imadiy mah-tenasun et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּצְמָ֨א שָׁ֤ם הָעָם֙ לַמַּ֔יִם וַיָּ֥לֶן הָעָ֖ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ הֶעֱלִיתָ֣נוּ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לְהָמִ֥ית אֹתִ֛י וְאֶת־בָּנַ֥י וְאֶת־מִקְנַ֖י בַּצָּמָֽא׃
Translated: But the people thirsted there for water; and the people grumbled against Moses and said, “Why did you bring us up from Egypt, to kill us and our children and livestock with thirst?”
Transliteration: vayitsema sham haam lamayiim vayalen haam al-mosheh vayomer lamah zeh heeliytanu mimitserayiim lehamiyt otiy veet-vanay veet-mikenay vatsama

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֤ק מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה ע֥וֹד מְעַ֖ט וּסְקָלֻֽנִי׃
Translated: Moses cried out to יהוה, saying, “What shall I do with this people? Before long they will be stoning me!”
Transliteration: vayitseak mosheh el-yehovah lemor mah eesheh laam hazeh vod meat usekaluniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲבֹר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם וְקַ֥ח אִתְּךָ֖ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמַטְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכִּ֤יתָ בּוֹ֙ אֶת־הַיְאֹ֔ר קַ֥ח בְּיָדְךָ֖ וְהָלָֽכְתָּ׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Pass before the people; take with you some of the elders of Israel, and take along the rod with which you struck the Nile, and set out.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh avor lifeney haam vekach itekha mizikeney yisherael umatekha asher hikhiyta vvo et-hayeor kach veyadekha vehalakheta

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֣י עֹמֵד֩ לְפָנֶ֨יךָ שָּׁ֥ם <small>׀</small> עַֽל־הַצּוּר֮ בְּחֹרֵב֒ וְהִכִּ֣יתָ בַצּ֗וּר וְיָצְא֥וּ מִמֶּ֛נּוּ מַ֖יִם וְשָׁתָ֣ה הָעָ֑ם וַיַּ֤עַשׂ כֵּן֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: I will be standing there before you on the rock at Horeb. Strike the rock and water will issue from it, and the people will drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
Transliteration: hineniy omed lefaneykha sham <small></small> al-hatsur vechorev vehikhiyta vatsur veyatseu mimenu mayiim veshatah haam vayaash khen mosheh leeyney zikeney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֙ שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֔וֹם מַסָּ֖ה וּמְרִיבָ֑ה עַל־רִ֣יב ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְעַ֨ל נַסֹּתָ֤ם אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֲיֵ֧שׁ יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּקִרְבֵּ֖נוּ אִם־אָֽיִן׃ {פ}
Translated: The place was named Massah and Meribah, because the Israelites quarreled and because they tried יהוה, saying, “Is יהוה present among us or not?”
Transliteration: vayikera shem hamakvom masah umeriyvah al-riyv veney yisherael veal nasotam et-yehovah lemor haeish yehovah vekirevenu im-ayiin {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖א עֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיִּלָּ֥חֶם עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּרְפִידִֽם׃
Translated: Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.
Transliteration: vayavo amalek vayilachem im-yisherael virefiydim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ בְּחַר־לָ֣נוּ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְצֵ֖א הִלָּחֵ֣ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק מָחָ֗ר אָנֹכִ֤י נִצָּב֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַגִּבְעָ֔ה וּמַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדִֽי׃
Translated: Moses said to Joshua, “Pick some troops for us, and go out and do battle with Amalek. Tomorrow I will station myself on the top of the hill, with the rod of God in my hand.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-yehvoshua vechar-lanu anashiym vetse hilachem vaamalek machar anokhiy nitsav al-rosh hagiveah umateh haElohim veyadiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר אָֽמַר־לוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וְח֔וּר עָל֖וּ רֹ֥אשׁ הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
Translated: Joshua did as Moses told him and fought with Amalek, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
Transliteration: vayaash yehvoshua khaasher amar-lvo mosheh lehilachem vaamalek umosheh aharon vechur alu rosh hagiveah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֥ים מֹשֶׁ֛ה יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנִ֛יחַ יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֥ר עֲמָלֵֽק׃
Translated: Then, whenever Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed; but whenever he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
Transliteration: vehayah khaasher yariym mosheh yadvo vegavar yisherael vekhaasher yaniycha yadvo vegavar amalek

Hebrew: וִידֵ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ כְּבֵדִ֔ים וַיִּקְחוּ־אֶ֛בֶן וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ תַחְתָּ֖יו וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב עָלֶ֑יהָ וְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וְח֜וּר תָּֽמְכ֣וּ בְיָדָ֗יו מִזֶּ֤ה אֶחָד֙ וּמִזֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד וַיְהִ֥י יָדָ֛יו אֱמוּנָ֖ה עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: But Moses’ hands grew heavy; so they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it, while Aaron and Hur, one on each side, supported his hands; thus his hands remained steady until the sun set.
Transliteration: viydey mosheh khevediym vayikechu-even vayashiymu tachetayv vayeshev aleyha veaharon vechur tamekhu veyadayv mizeh echad umizeh echad vayehiy yadayv emunah ad-vo hashamesh

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲלֹ֧שׁ יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֥ק וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃ {פ}
Translated: And Joshua overwhelmed the people of Amalek with the sword.
Transliteration: vayachalosh yehvoshua et-amalek veet-amvo lefiy-charev {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כְּתֹ֨ב זֹ֤את זִכָּרוֹן֙ בַּסֵּ֔פֶר וְשִׂ֖ים בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ כִּֽי־מָחֹ֤ה אֶמְחֶה֙ אֶת־זֵ֣כֶר עֲמָלֵ֔ק מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Inscribe this in a document as a reminder, and read it aloud to Joshua: I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven!”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh khetov zot zikharvon vasefer veshiym veׇzeney yehvoshua khiy-machoh emecheh et-zekher amalek mitachat hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> נִסִּֽי׃
Translated: And Moses built an altar and named it Adonai-nissi.
Transliteration: vayiven mosheh mizevecha vayikera shemvo yehovah <small></small> nisiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־יָד֙ עַל־כֵּ֣ס יָ֔הּ מִלְחָמָ֥ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה בַּֽעֲמָלֵ֑ק מִדֹּ֖ר דֹּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: He said, “It means, ‘Hand upon the throne of יהוה !’ יהוה will be at war with Amalek throughout the ages.”
Transliteration: vayomer khiy-yad al-khes yah milechamah layhovah vaamalek midor dor {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע יִתְר֨וֹ כֹהֵ֤ן מִדְיָן֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ לְמֹשֶׁ֔ה וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַמּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־הוֹצִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Jethro priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel, God’s people, how יהוה had brought Israel out from Egypt.
Transliteration: vayishema yitervo khohen mideyan choten mosheh et khׇl-asher ashah Elohim lemosheh uleyisherael amvo khiy-hvotsiy yehovah et-yisherael mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֗ח יִתְרוֹ֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־צִפֹּרָ֖ה אֵ֣שֶׁת מֹשֶׁ֑ה אַחַ֖ר שִׁלּוּחֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: So Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after she had been sent home,
Transliteration: vayikach yitervo choten mosheh et-tsiforah eshet mosheh achar shilucheyha

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖ת שְׁנֵ֣י בָנֶ֑יהָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאֶחָד֙ גֵּֽרְשֹׁ֔ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר גֵּ֣ר הָיִ֔יתִי בְּאֶ֖רֶץ נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
Translated: and her two sons—of whom one was named Gershom, that is to say, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land”;
Transliteration: veet sheney vaneyha asher shem haechad gereshom khiy amar ger hayiytiy veerets nׇkheriyah

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥ם הָאֶחָ֖ד אֱלִיעֶ֑זֶר כִּֽי־אֱלֹהֵ֤י אָבִי֙ בְּעֶזְרִ֔י וַיַּצִּלֵ֖נִי מֵחֶ֥רֶב פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: and the other was named Eliezer, meaning, “The God of my father’s [house] was my help, delivering me from the sword of Pharaoh.”
Transliteration: veshem haechad eliyezer khiy-elohey aviy veezeriy vayatsileniy mecherev fareoh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א יִתְר֨וֹ חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֛ה וּבָנָ֥יו וְאִשְׁתּ֖וֹ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֗ר אֲשֶׁר־ה֛וּא חֹנֶ֥ה שָׁ֖ם הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought Moses’ sons and wife to him in the wilderness, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.
Transliteration: vayavo yitervo choten mosheh uvanayv veishetvo el-mosheh el-hamidevar asher-hu choneh sham har haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲנִ֛י חֹתֶנְךָ֥ יִתְר֖וֹ בָּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְאִ֨שְׁתְּךָ֔ וּשְׁנֵ֥י בָנֶ֖יהָ עִמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: He sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, with your wife and her two sons.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-mosheh aniy chotenekha yitervo va eleykha veishetekha usheney vaneyha imah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִקְרַ֣את חֹֽתְנ֗וֹ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ וַיִּשַּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁאֲל֥וּ אִישׁ־לְרֵעֵ֖הוּ לְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ הָאֹֽהֱלָה׃
Translated: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law; he bowed low and kissed him; each asked after the other’s welfare, and they went into the tent.
Transliteration: vayetse mosheh likerat chotenvo vayishetachu vayishak-lvo vayishealu iysh-lereehu leshalvom vayavou haohelah

Hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ לְחֹ֣תְנ֔וֹ אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְפַרְעֹ֣ה וּלְמִצְרַ֔יִם עַ֖ל אוֹדֹ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַתְּלָאָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מְצָאָ֣תַם בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וַיַּצִּלֵ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Moses then recounted to his father-in-law everything that יהוה had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardships that had befallen them on the way, and how יהוה had delivered them.
Transliteration: vayesafer mosheh lechotenvo et khׇl-asher ashah yehovah lefareoh ulemitserayiim al vodot yisherael et khׇl-hatelaah asher metsaatam vaderekhe vayatsilem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣חַדְּ יִתְר֔וֹ עַ֚ל כׇּל־הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִצִּיל֖וֹ מִיַּ֥ד מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And Jethro rejoiced over all the kindness that יהוה had shown Israel when delivering them from the Egyptians.
Transliteration: vayichade yitervo al khׇl-hatvovah asher-ashah yehovah leyisherael asher hitsiylvo miyad mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ יִתְרוֹ֒ בָּר֣וּךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּ֥יל אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִיַּ֥ד מִצְרַ֖יִם וּמִיַּ֣ד פַּרְעֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִצִּיל֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת יַד־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: “Blessed be יהוה,” Jethro said, “who delivered you from the Egyptians and from Pharaoh, and who delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
Transliteration: vayomer yitervo varukhe yehovah asher hitsiyl etekhem miyad mitserayiim umiyad fareoh asher hitsiyl et-haam mitachat yad-mitserayiim

Hebrew: עַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּֽי־גָד֥וֹל יְהֹוָ֖ה מִכׇּל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֣י בַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר זָד֖וּ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Now I know that יהוה is greater than all gods, yes, by the result of their very schemes against [the people].”
Transliteration: atah yadaetiy khiy-gadvol yehovah mikhׇl-haElohim khiy vadavar asher zadu aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח יִתְר֨וֹ חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֛ה עֹלָ֥ה וּזְבָחִ֖ים לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וַיָּבֹ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְכֹ֣ל ׀ זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֶאֱכׇל־לֶ֛חֶם עִם־חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices for God; and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to partake of the meal before God with Moses’ father-in-law.
Transliteration: vayikach yitervo choten mosheh olah uzevachiym lelohiym vayavo aharon vekhol zikeney yisherael leekhׇl-lechem im-choten mosheh lifeney haElohim

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִשְׁפֹּ֣ט אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד הָעָם֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִן־הַבֹּ֖קֶר עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Next day, Moses sat as magistrate among the people, while the people stood about Moses from morning until evening.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayeshev mosheh lishefot et-haam vayaamod haam al-mosheh min-havoker ad-haarev

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא עֹשֶׂ֖ה לָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָֽה־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה עֹשֶׂה֙ לָעָ֔ם מַדּ֗וּעַ אַתָּ֤ה יוֹשֵׁב֙ לְבַדֶּ֔ךָ וְכׇל־הָעָ֛ם נִצָּ֥ב עָלֶ֖יךָ מִן־בֹּ֥קֶר עַד־עָֽרֶב׃
Translated: But when Moses’ father-in-law saw how much he had to do for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing to the people? Why do you act alone, while all the people stand about you from morning until evening?”
Transliteration: vayare choten mosheh et khׇl-asher-hu osheh laam vayomer mah-hadavar hazeh asher atah osheh laam madua atah yvoshev levadekha vekhׇl-haam nitsav aleykha min-voker ad-arev

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה לְחֹתְנ֑וֹ כִּֽי־יָבֹ֥א אֵלַ֛י הָעָ֖ם לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Moses replied to his father-in-law, “It is because the people come to me to inquire of God.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh lechotenvo khiy-yavo elay haam liderosh Elohim

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֨ה לָהֶ֤ם דָּבָר֙ בָּ֣א אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁ֣פַטְתִּ֔י בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ וּבֵ֣ין רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְהוֹדַעְתִּ֛י אֶת־חֻקֵּ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וְאֶת־תּוֹרֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: When they have a dispute, it comes before me, and I decide between one party and another, and I make known the laws and teachings of God.”
Transliteration: khiy-yiheyeh lahem davar va elay veshafatetiy veyn iysh uveyn reehu vehvodaetiy et-chukey haElohim veet-tvorotayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֵלָ֑יו לֹא־טוֹב֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: But Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing you are doing is not right;
Transliteration: vayomer choten mosheh elayv lo-tvov hadavar asher atah osheh

Hebrew: נָבֹ֣ל תִּבֹּ֔ל גַּם־אַתָּ֕ה גַּם־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֤ד מִמְּךָ֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל עֲשֹׂ֖הוּ לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: you will surely wear yourself out, and these people as well. For the task is too heavy for you; you cannot do it alone.
Transliteration: navol tivol gam-atah gam-haam hazeh asher imakhe khiy-khaved mimekha hadavar lo-tukhal ashohu levadekha

Hebrew: עַתָּ֞ה שְׁמַ֤ע בְּקֹלִי֙ אִיעָ֣צְךָ֔ וִיהִ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים עִמָּ֑ךְ הֱיֵ֧ה אַתָּ֣ה לָעָ֗ם מ֚וּל הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ אַתָּ֛ה אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Now listen to me. I will give you counsel, and God be with you! You represent the people before God: you bring the disputes before God,
Transliteration: atah shema vekoliy iyatsekha viyhiy Elohim imakhe heeih atah laam mul haElohimm veheveta atah et-hadevariym el-haElohim

Hebrew: וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֣ה אֶתְהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַתּוֹרֹ֑ת וְהוֹדַעְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֗ם אֶת־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ יֵ֣לְכוּ בָ֔הּ וְאֶת־הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲשֽׂוּן׃
Translated: and enjoin upon them the laws and the teachings, and make known to them the way they are to go and the practices they are to follow.
Transliteration: vehizeharetah etehem et-hachukiym veet-hatvorot vehvodaeta lahem et-haderekhe eilekhu vah veet-hamaasheh asher yaashun

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה תֶחֱזֶ֣ה מִכׇּל־הָ֠עָ֠ם אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֜יִל יִרְאֵ֧י אֱלֹהִ֛ים אַנְשֵׁ֥י אֱמֶ֖ת שֹׂ֣נְאֵי בָ֑צַע וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ עֲלֵהֶ֗ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
Translated: You shall also seek out, from among all the people, capable individuals who fear God—trustworthy ones who spurn ill-gotten gain. Set these over them as chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, and
Transliteration: veatah techezeh mikhׇl-haam aneshey-chayiil yireey Elohim aneshey emet shoneey vatsa veshameta alehem sharey alafiym sharey mevot sharey chamishiym vesharey asharot

Hebrew: וְשָׁפְט֣וּ אֶת־הָעָם֮ בְּכׇל־עֵת֒ וְהָיָ֞ה כׇּל־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַגָּדֹל֙ יָבִ֣יאוּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְכׇל־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַקָּטֹ֖ן יִשְׁפְּטוּ־הֵ֑ם וְהָקֵל֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְנָשְׂא֖וּ אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated: let them judge the people at all times. Have them bring every major dispute to you, but let them decide every minor dispute themselves. Make it easier for yourself by letting them share the burden with you.
Transliteration: veshafetu et-haam vekhׇl-et vehayah khׇl-hadavar hagadol yaviyu eleykha vekhׇl-hadavar hakaton yishefetu-hem vehakel mealeykha venasheu itakhe

Hebrew: אִ֣ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְצִוְּךָ֣ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְיָֽכׇלְתָּ֖ עֲמֹ֑ד וְגַם֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה עַל־מְקֹמ֖וֹ יָבֹ֥א בְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: If you do this—and God so commands you—you will be able to bear up; and all these people too will go home unwearied.”
Transliteration: im et-hadavar hazeh taasheh vetsivekha Elohim veyakhׇleta amod vegam khׇl-haam hazeh al-mekomvo yavo veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע מֹשֶׁ֖ה לְק֣וֹל חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמָֽר׃
Translated: Moses heeded his father-in-law and did just as he had said.
Transliteration: vayishema mosheh lekvol chotenvo vayaash khol asher amar

Hebrew: וַיִּבְחַ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֙יִל֙ מִכׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם רָאשִׁ֖ים עַל־הָעָ֑ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
Translated: Moses chose capable individuals out of all Israel, and appointed them heads over the people—chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens;
Transliteration: vayivechar mosheh aneshey-chayiil mikhׇl-yisherael vayiten otam rashiym al-haam sharey alafiym sharey mevot sharey chamishiym vesharey asharot

Hebrew: וְשָׁפְט֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם בְּכׇל־עֵ֑ת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַקָּשֶׁה֙ יְבִיא֣וּן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְכׇל־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַקָּטֹ֖ן יִשְׁפּוּט֥וּ הֵֽם׃
Translated: and they judged the people at all times: the difficult matters they would bring to Moses, and all the minor matters they would decide themselves.
Transliteration: veshafetu et-haam vekhׇl-et et-hadavar hakasheh yeviyun el-mosheh vekhׇl-hadavar hakaton yishefutu hem

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ ל֖וֹ אֶל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Moses bade his father-in-law farewell, and he went his way to his own land.
Transliteration: vayeshalach mosheh et-chotenvo vayelekhe lvo el-aretsvo {f}

Hebrew: בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י לְצֵ֥את בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה בָּ֖אוּ מִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translated: On the third new moon after the Israelites had gone forth from the land of Egypt, on that very day, they entered the wilderness of Sinai.
Transliteration: vachodesh hasheliyshiy letset veney-yisherael meerets mitserayiim vayyvom hazeh vau midevar siynay

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֣וּ מֵרְפִידִ֗ים וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ מִדְבַּ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיִּֽחַן־שָׁ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נֶ֥גֶד הָהָֽר׃
Translated: Having journeyed from Rephidim, they entered the wilderness of Sinai and encamped in the wilderness. Israel encamped there in front of the mountain,
Transliteration: vayiseu merefiydiym vayavou midevar siynay vayachanu vamidevar vayichan-sham yisherael neged hahar

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֥ה עָלָ֖ה אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֵלָ֤יו יְהֹוָה֙ מִן־הָהָ֣ר לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לְבֵ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְתַגֵּ֖יד לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and Moses went up to God. יהוה called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus shall you say to the house of Jacob and declare to the children of Israel:
Transliteration: umosheh alah el-haElohim vayikera elayv yehovah min-hahar lemor khoh tomar leveyt yaakov vetageyd liveney yisherael

Hebrew: אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי לְמִצְרָ֑יִם וָאֶשָּׂ֤א אֶתְכֶם֙ עַל־כַּנְפֵ֣י נְשָׁרִ֔ים וָאָבִ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Me.
Transliteration: atem reiytem asher ashiytiy lemitserayiim vaesha etekhem al-khanefey neshariym vaavi etekhem elay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ בְּקֹלִ֔י וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֑י וִהְיִ֨יתֶם לִ֤י סְגֻלָּה֙ מִכׇּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים כִּי־לִ֖י כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Now then, if you will obey Me faithfully and keep My covenant, you shall be My treasured possession among all the peoples. Indeed, all the earth is Mine,
Transliteration: veatah im-shamvoa tishemeu vekoliy ushemaretem et-veriytiy viheyiytem liy segulah mikhׇl-haamiym khiy-liy khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֧ם תִּהְיוּ־לִ֛י מַמְלֶ֥כֶת כֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְג֣וֹי קָד֑וֹשׁ אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: but you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the children of Israel.”
Transliteration: veatem tiheyu-liy mamelekhet khohaniym vegvoy kadvosh eleh hadevariym asher tedaver el-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֖א לְזִקְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיָּ֣שֶׂם לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Moses came and summoned the elders of the people and put before them all that יהוה had commanded him.
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh vayikera lezikeney haam vayashem lifeneyhem et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh asher tsivahu yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ כׇל־הָעָ֤ם יַחְדָּו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וַיָּ֧שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: All those assembled answered as one, saying, “All that יהוה has spoken we will do!” And Moses brought back the people’s words to יהוה.
Transliteration: vayaanu khׇl-haam yachedav vayomeru khol asher-diver yehovah naasheh vayashev mosheh et-diverey haam el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י בָּ֣א אֵלֶ֘יךָ֮ בְּעַ֣ב הֶֽעָנָן֒ בַּעֲב֞וּר יִשְׁמַ֤ע הָעָם֙ בְּדַבְּרִ֣י עִמָּ֔ךְ וְגַם־בְּךָ֖ יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לְעוֹלָ֑ם וַיַּגֵּ֥ד מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will come to you in a thick cloud, in order that the people may hear when I speak with you and so trust you ever after.” Then Moses reported the people’s words to יהוה,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hineh anokhiy va eleykha veav heanan vaavur yishema haam vedaveriy imakhe vegam-vekha yaamiynu levolam vayaged mosheh et-diverey haam el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ לֵ֣ךְ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ם הַיּ֖וֹם וּמָחָ֑ר וְכִבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and יהוה said to Moses, “Go to the people and warn them to stay pure today and tomorrow. Let them wash their clothes.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh lekhe el-haam vekidashetam hayyvom umachar vekhivesu shimelotam

Hebrew: וְהָי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כִּ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֗י יֵרֵ֧ד יְהֹוָ֛ה לְעֵינֵ֥י כׇל־הָעָ֖ם עַל־הַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translated: Let them be ready for the third day; for on the third day יהוה will come down, in the sight of all the people, on Mount Sinai.
Transliteration: vehayu nekhoniym layyvom hasheliyshiy khiy vayyvom hashelishiy eired yehovah leeyney khׇl-haam al-har siynay

Hebrew: וְהִגְבַּלְתָּ֤ אֶת־הָעָם֙ סָבִ֣יב לֵאמֹ֔ר הִשָּׁמְר֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם עֲל֥וֹת בָּהָ֖ר וּנְגֹ֣עַ בְּקָצֵ֑הוּ כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהָ֖ר מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: You shall set bounds for the people round about, saying, ‘Beware of going up the mountain or touching the border of it. Whoever touches the mountain shall be put to death
Transliteration: vehigevaleta et-haam saviyv lemor hishameru lakhem alvot vahar unegoa vekatsehu khׇl-hanogea vahar mvot yumat

Hebrew: לֹא־תִגַּ֨ע בּ֜וֹ יָ֗ד כִּֽי־סָק֤וֹל יִסָּקֵל֙ אוֹ־יָרֹ֣ה יִיָּרֶ֔ה אִם־בְּהֵמָ֥ה אִם־אִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יִחְיֶ֑ה בִּמְשֹׁךְ֙ הַיֹּבֵ֔ל הֵ֖מָּה יַעֲל֥וּ בָהָֽר׃
Translated: without being touched—by being either stoned or shot; beast or person, a trespasser shall not live.’ When the ram’s horn sounds a long blast, they may go up on the mountain.”
Transliteration: lo-tiga vvo yad khiy-sakvol yisakel vo-yaroh yiyareh im-vehemah im-iysh lo yicheyeh vimeshokhe hayovel hemah yaalu vahar

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רֶד מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִן־הָהָ֖ר אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיְקַדֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַֽיְכַבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Moses came down from the mountain to the people and warned the people to stay pure, and they washed their clothes.
Transliteration: vayered mosheh min-hahar el-haam vayekadesh et-haam vayekhavesu shimelotam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם הֱי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים אַֽל־תִּגְּשׁ֖וּ אֶל־אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day: [the men among] you should not go near a woman.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-haam heyu nekhoniym lisheloshet yamiym al-tigeshu el-ishah

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י בִּֽהְיֹ֣ת הַבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְהִי֩ קֹלֹ֨ת וּבְרָקִ֜ים וְעָנָ֤ן כָּבֵד֙ עַל־הָהָ֔ר וְקֹ֥ל שֹׁפָ֖ר חָזָ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: On the third day, as morning dawned, there was thunder, and lightning, and a dense cloud upon the mountain, and a very loud blast of the horn; and all the people who were in the camp trembled.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheliyshiy viheyot havoker vayehiy kolot uverakiym veanan khaved al-hahar vekol shofar chazak meod vayecherad khׇl-haam asher vamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הָעָ֛ם לִקְרַ֥את הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ בְּתַחְתִּ֥ית הָהָֽר׃
Translated: Moses led the people out of the camp toward God, and they took their places at the foot of the mountain.
Transliteration: vayyvotse mosheh et-haam likerat haElohimm min-hamachaneh vayiteyatsevu vetachetiyt hahar

Hebrew: וְהַ֤ר סִינַי֙ עָשַׁ֣ן כֻּלּ֔וֹ מִ֠פְּנֵ֠י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרַ֥ד עָלָ֛יו יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּאֵ֑שׁ וַיַּ֤עַל עֲשָׁנוֹ֙ כְּעֶ֣שֶׁן הַכִּבְשָׁ֔ן וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כׇּל־הָהָ֖ר מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Now Mount Sinai was all in smoke, for יהוה had come down upon it in fire; the smoke rose like the smoke of a kiln, and the whole mountain trembled violently.
Transliteration: vehar siynay ashan khulvo mifeney asher yarad alayv yehovah vaesh vayaal ashanvo kheeshen hakhiveshan vayecherad khׇl-hahar meod

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ ק֣וֹל הַשֹּׁפָ֔ר הוֹלֵ֖ךְ וְחָזֵ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד מֹשֶׁ֣ה יְדַבֵּ֔ר וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יַעֲנֶ֥נּוּ בְקֽוֹל׃
Translated: The blare of the horn grew louder and louder. As Moses spoke, God answered him in thunder.
Transliteration: vayehiy kvol hashofar hvolekhe vechazek meod mosheh yedaver vehaElohim yaanenu vekvol

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רֶד יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־הַ֥ר סִינַ֖י אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַיִּקְרָ֨א יְהֹוָ֧ה לְמֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָהָ֖ר וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: יהוה came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain, and יהוה called Moses to the top of the mountain and Moses went up.
Transliteration: vayered yehovah al-har siynay el-rosh hahar vayikera yehovah lemosheh el-rosh hahar vayaal mosheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה רֵ֖ד הָעֵ֣ד בָּעָ֑ם פֶּן־יֶהֶרְס֤וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ לִרְא֔וֹת וְנָפַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ רָֽב׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Go down, warn the people not to break through to יהוה to gaze, lest many of them perish.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh red haed vaam fen-yeheresu el-yehovah lirevot venafal mimenu rav

Hebrew: וְגַ֧ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים הַנִּגָּשִׁ֥ים אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה יִתְקַדָּ֑שׁוּ פֶּן־יִפְרֹ֥ץ בָּהֶ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priests also, who come near יהוה, must stay pure, lest יהוה break out against them.”
Transliteration: vegam hakhohaniym hanigashiym el-yehovah yitekadashu fen-yiferots vahem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל הָעָ֔ם לַעֲלֹ֖ת אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינָ֑י כִּֽי־אַתָּ֞ה הַעֵדֹ֤תָה בָּ֙נוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַגְבֵּ֥ל אֶת־הָהָ֖ר וְקִדַּשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But Moses said to יהוה, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You warned us saying, ‘Set bounds about the mountain and sanctify it.’”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-yehovah lo-yukhal haam laalot el-har siynay khiy-atah haedotah vanu lemor hagevel et-hahar vekidashetvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֤יו יְהֹוָה֙ לֶךְ־רֵ֔ד וְעָלִ֥יתָ אַתָּ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהָעָ֗ם אַל־יֶֽהֶרְס֛וּ לַעֲלֹ֥ת אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה פֶּן־יִפְרׇץ־בָּֽם׃
Translated: So יהוה said to him, “Go down, and come back together with Aaron; but let not the priests or the people break through to come up to יהוה, lest [God] break out against them.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv yehovah lekhe-red vealiyta atah veaharon imakhe vehakhohaniym vehaam al-yeheresu laalot el-yehovah fen-yiferׇts-vam

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רֶד מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
Transliteration: vayered mosheh el-haam vayomer alehem {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לֵאמֹֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: God spoke all these words, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver Elohim et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh lemor {s}

Hebrew: אָֽנֹכִ֖י֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצֵאתִ֛יךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֣֥ית עֲבָדִ֑͏ֽים׃
Translated: I יהוה am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:
Transliteration: anokhiy yehovah eloheykha asher hvotsetiykha meerets mitserayiim miveyt avadi͏ym

Translated: You shall have no other gods besides Me.
Transliteration: lo-yiheye͏h-lekha Elohimm acheriym al-fana͏ay

Hebrew: לֹֽ֣א־תַעֲשֶֽׂ֨ה־לְךָ֥֣ פֶ֣֙סֶל֙ ׀ וְכׇל־תְּמוּנָ֔֡ה אֲשֶׁ֤֣ר בַּשָּׁמַ֣֙יִם֙ ׀ מִמַּ֔֡עַל וַֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר֩ בָּאָ֖֨רֶץ מִתָּ֑͏ַ֜חַת וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּמַּ֖֣יִם ׀ מִתַּ֥֣חַת לָאָֽ֗רֶץ׃
Translated: You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, or any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters under the earth.
Transliteration: lo-taasheh-lekha fesel vekhׇl-temunah asher vashamayiyim mimaal vaasher vaarets mita͏achat vaasher vamayiyim mitachat laarets

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥֣ה לָהֶ֖ם֮ וְלֹ֣א תׇעׇבְדֵ֑ם֒ כִּ֣י אָֽנֹכִ֞י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵ֣ל קַנָּ֔א פֹּ֠קֵ֠ד עֲוֺ֨ן אָבֹ֧ת עַל־בָּנִ֛ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֥ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִ֖ים לְשֹׂנְאָֽ֑י׃
Translated: You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I your God יהוה am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me.
Transliteration: lo-tishetachaveh lahem velo tׇׇvedem khiy anokhiy yehovah eloheykha el kana foked avon avot al-vaniym al-shileshiym veal-riveiym leshoneay

Hebrew: וְעֹ֥֤שֶׂה חֶ֖֙סֶד֙ לַאֲלָפִ֑֔ים לְאֹהֲבַ֖י וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מִצְוֺתָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
Transliteration: veosheh chesed laalafiym leohavay uleshomerey mitsevotay {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַשָּׁ֑וְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יְנַקֶּה֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ לַשָּֽׁוְא׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall not swear falsely by the name of your God יהוה; for יהוה will not clear one who swears falsely by God’s name.
Transliteration: lo tisha et-shem-yehovah eloheykha lashave khiy lo yenakeh yehovah et asher-yisha et-shemvo lashave {f}

Hebrew: זָכ֛וֹר֩ אֶת־י֥֨וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖֜ת לְקַדְּשֽׁ֗וֹ׃
Translated: Remember the sabbath day and keep it holy.
Transliteration: zakhvor et-yvom hashavat lekadeshvo

Translated: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym taavod veashiyta khׇֿl-melakhetekha

Translated: but the seventh day is a sabbath of your God יהוה: you shall not do any work—you, your son or daughter, your male or female slave, or your cattle, or the stranger who is within your settlements.
Transliteration: veyvom hasheviyiy shavat layhovah eloheykha lo-taasheh khׇl-melakhah atah uvinekha͏-uvitekha avedekha vaamatekha uvehemetekha vegerekha asher visheareykha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שֵֽׁשֶׁת־יָמִים֩ עָשָׂ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־הַיָּם֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖נַח בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י עַל־כֵּ֗ן בֵּרַ֧ךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת וַֽיְקַדְּשֵֽׁהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: For in six days יהוה made heaven and earth and sea—and all that is in them—and then rested on the seventh day; therefore יהוה blessed the sabbath day and hallowed it.
Transliteration: khiy sheshet-yamiym ashah yehovah et-hashamayiim veet-haarets et-hayam veet-khׇl-asher-vam vayanach vayyvom hasheviyiy al-khen verakhe yehovah et-yvom hashavat vayekadeshehu {s}

Hebrew: כַּבֵּ֥ד אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ וְאֶת־אִמֶּ֑ךָ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יַאֲרִכ֣וּן יָמֶ֔יךָ עַ֚ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Honor your father and your mother, that you may long endure on the land that your God יהוה is assigning to you.
Transliteration: khaved et-aviykha veet-imekha lemaan yaarikhun yameykha al haadamah asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥֖א תִּֿרְצָ֖͏ֽח׃ {ס} לֹ֣֖א תִּֿנְאָ֑͏ֽף׃ {ס} לֹ֣֖א תִּֿגְנֹֽ֔ב׃ {ס} לֹֽא־תַעֲנֶ֥ה בְרֵעֲךָ֖ עֵ֥ד שָֽׁקֶר׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
Transliteration: lo tֿiretsa͏ch {s} lo tֿinea͏f {s} lo tֿigenov {s} lo-taaneh vereakha ed shaker {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תַחְמֹ֖ד בֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ {ס} לֹֽא־תַחְמֹ֞ד אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֶ֗ךָ וְעַבְדּ֤וֹ וַאֲמָתוֹ֙ וְשׁוֹר֣וֹ וַחֲמֹר֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְרֵעֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall not covet your neighbor’s house: you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or male or female slave, or ox or ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.
Transliteration: lo tachemod veyt reekha {s} lo-tachemod eshet reekha veavedvo vaamatvo veshvorvo vachamorvo vekhol asher lereekha {f}

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָעָם֩ רֹאִ֨ים אֶת־הַקּוֹלֹ֜ת וְאֶת־הַלַּפִּידִ֗ם וְאֵת֙ ק֣וֹל הַשֹּׁפָ֔ר וְאֶת־הָהָ֖ר עָשֵׁ֑ן וַיַּ֤רְא הָעָם֙ וַיָּנֻ֔עוּ וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ מֵֽרָחֹֽק׃
Translated: All the people witnessed the thunder and lightning, the blare of the horn and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they fell back and stood at a distance.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haam roiym et-hakvolot veet-halafiydim veet kvol hashofar veet-hahar ashen vayare haam vayanuu vayaamedu merachok

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה דַּבֵּר־אַתָּ֥ה עִמָּ֖נוּ וְנִשְׁמָ֑עָה וְאַל־יְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּ֛נוּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים פֶּן־נָמֽוּת׃
Translated: “You speak to us,” they said to Moses, “and we will obey; but let not God speak to us, lest we die.”
Transliteration: vayomeru el-mosheh daver-atah imanu venishemaah veal-yedaver imanu Elohim fen-namut

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָ֒אוּ֒ כִּ֗י לְבַֽעֲבוּר֙ נַסּ֣וֹת אֶתְכֶ֔ם בָּ֖א הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וּבַעֲב֗וּר תִּהְיֶ֧ה יִרְאָת֛וֹ עַל־פְּנֵיכֶ֖ם לְבִלְתִּ֥י תֶחֱטָֽאוּ׃
Translated: Moses answered the people, “Be not afraid; for God has come only in order to test you, and in order that the fear of God may be ever with you, so that you do not go astray.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-haam al-tiyrau khiy levaavur nasvot etekhem va haElohim uvaavur tiheyeh yireatvo al-feneykhem leviletiy techetau

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד הָעָ֖ם מֵרָחֹ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ נִגַּ֣שׁ אֶל־הָֽעֲרָפֶ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: So the people remained at a distance, while Moses approached the thick cloud where God was.
Transliteration: vayaamod haam merachok umosheh nigash el-haarafel asher-sham haElohim {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֹּ֥ה תֹאמַ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם כִּ֚י מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: Thus shall you say to the Israelites: You yourselves saw that I spoke to you from the very heavens:
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh khoh tomar el-veney yisherael atem reiytem khiy min-hashamayiim divaretiy imakhem

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּן אִתִּ֑י אֱלֹ֤הֵי כֶ֙סֶף֙ וֵאלֹהֵ֣י זָהָ֔ב לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: With Me, therefore, you shall not make any gods of silver, nor shall you make for yourselves any gods of gold.
Transliteration: lo taashun itiy elohey khesef velohey zahav lo taashu lakhem

Hebrew: מִזְבַּ֣ח אֲדָמָה֮ תַּעֲשֶׂה־לִּי֒ וְזָבַחְתָּ֣ עָלָ֗יו אֶת־עֹלֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁלָמֶ֔יךָ אֶת־צֹֽאנְךָ֖ וְאֶת־בְּקָרֶ֑ךָ בְּכׇל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַזְכִּ֣יר אֶת־שְׁמִ֔י אָב֥וֹא אֵלֶ֖יךָ וּבֵרַכְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated: Make for Me an altar of earth and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being, your sheep and your oxen; in every place where I cause My name to be mentioned I will come to you and bless you.
Transliteration: mizevach adamah taasheh-liy vezavacheta alayv et-oloteykha veet-shelameykha et-tsonekha veet-vekarekha vekhׇl-hamakvom asher azekhiyr et-shemiy avvo eleykha uverakhetiykha

Hebrew: וְאִם־מִזְבַּ֤ח אֲבָנִים֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֔י לֹֽא־תִבְנֶ֥ה אֶתְהֶ֖ן גָּזִ֑ית כִּ֧י חַרְבְּךָ֛ הֵנַ֥פְתָּ עָלֶ֖יהָ וַתְּחַֽלְלֶֽהָ׃
Translated: And if you make for Me an altar of stones, do not build it of hewn stones; for by wielding your tool upon them you have profaned them.
Transliteration: veim-mizevach avaniym taasheh-liy lo-tiveneh etehen gaziyt khiy charevekha henafeta aleyha vatechaleleha

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תַעֲלֶ֥ה בְמַעֲלֹ֖ת עַֽל־מִזְבְּחִ֑י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־תִגָּלֶ֥ה עֶרְוָתְךָ֖ עָלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Do not ascend My altar by steps, that your nakedness may not be exposed upon it.
Transliteration: velo-taaleh vemaalot al-mizevechiy asher lo-tigaleh erevatekha alayv {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּשִׂ֖ים לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: These are the rules that you shall set before them:
Transliteration: veeleh hamishefatiym asher tashiym lifeneyhem

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תִקְנֶה֙ עֶ֣בֶד עִבְרִ֔י שֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים יַעֲבֹ֑ד וּבַ֨שְּׁבִעִ֔ת יֵצֵ֥א לַֽחׇפְשִׁ֖י חִנָּֽם׃
Translated: When you acquire a Hebrew slave, that person shall serve six years—and shall go free in the seventh year, without payment.
Transliteration: khiy tikeneh eved iveriy shesh shaniym yaavod uvasheviit eitse lachׇfeshiy chinam

Hebrew: אִם־בְּגַפּ֥וֹ יָבֹ֖א בְּגַפּ֣וֹ יֵצֵ֑א אִם־בַּ֤עַל אִשָּׁה֙ ה֔וּא וְיָצְאָ֥ה אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If [a male slave] came single, he shall leave single; if he had a wife, his wife shall leave with him.
Transliteration: im-vegafvo yavo vegafvo eitse im-vaal ishah hu veyatseah ishetvo imvo

Hebrew: אִם־אֲדֹנָיו֙ יִתֶּן־ל֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֔ה וְיָלְדָה־ל֥וֹ בָנִ֖ים א֣וֹ בָנ֑וֹת הָאִשָּׁ֣ה וִילָדֶ֗יהָ תִּהְיֶה֙ לַֽאדֹנֶ֔יהָ וְה֖וּא יֵצֵ֥א בְגַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If his master gave him a wife, and she has borne him children, the wife and her children shall belong to the master, and he shall leave alone.
Transliteration: im-adonayv yiten-lvo ishah veyaledah-lvo vaniym vo vanvot haishah viyladeyha tiheyeh ladoneyha vehu eitse vegafvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־אָמֹ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ הָעֶ֔בֶד אָהַ֙בְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֔י אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֖י וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑י לֹ֥א אֵצֵ֖א חׇפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated: But if the slave declares, “I love my master, and my wife and children: I do not wish to go free,”
Transliteration: veim-amor yomar haeved ahavetiy et-adoniy et-ishetiy veet-vanay lo etse chׇfeshiy

Hebrew: וְהִגִּישׁ֤וֹ אֲדֹנָיו֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהִגִּישׁוֹ֙ אֶל־הַדֶּ֔לֶת א֖וֹ אֶל־הַמְּזוּזָ֑ה וְרָצַ֨ע אֲדֹנָ֤יו אֶת־אׇזְנוֹ֙ בַּמַּרְצֵ֔עַ וַעֲבָד֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: his master shall take him before God. He shall be brought to the door or the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall then remain his master’s slave for life.
Transliteration: vehigiyshvo adonayv el-haElohimm vehigiyshvo el-hadelet vo el-hamezuzah veratsa adonayv et-ׇzenvo vamaretsea vaavadvo leolam {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִמְכֹּ֥ר אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־בִּתּ֖וֹ לְאָמָ֑ה לֹ֥א תֵצֵ֖א כְּצֵ֥את הָעֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: When a parent sells a daughter as a slave, she shall not go free as other slaves do.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yimekhor iysh et-vitvo leamah lo tetse khetset haavadiym

Hebrew: אִם־רָעָ֞ה בְּעֵינֵ֧י אֲדֹנֶ֛יהָ אֲשֶׁר־[ל֥וֹ] (לא) יְעָדָ֖הּ וְהֶפְדָּ֑הּ לְעַ֥ם נׇכְרִ֛י לֹא־יִמְשֹׁ֥ל לְמׇכְרָ֖הּ בְּבִגְדוֹ־בָֽהּ׃
Translated: If she proves to be displeasing to her master, who designated her for himself, he must let her be redeemed; he shall not have the right to sell her to outsiders, since he broke faith with her.
Transliteration: im-raah veeyney adoneyha asher-[lvo] (l) yeadah vehefedah leam nׇkheriy lo-yimeshol lemׇkherah vevigedvo-vah

Hebrew: וְאִם־לִבְנ֖וֹ יִֽיעָדֶ֑נָּה כְּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַבָּנ֖וֹת יַעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And if the master designated her for a son, he shall deal with her as is the practice with free maidens.
Transliteration: veim-livenvo yiyadenah khemishefat havanvot yaasheh-lah

Hebrew: אִם־אַחֶ֖רֶת יִֽקַּֽח־ל֑וֹ שְׁאֵרָ֛הּ כְּסוּתָ֥הּ וְעֹנָתָ֖הּ לֹ֥א יִגְרָֽע׃
Translated: If he takes another [into the household as his wife], he must not withhold from this one her food, her clothing, or her conjugal rights.
Transliteration: im-acheret yikach-lvo sheerah khesutah veonatah lo yigera

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־שְׁלׇשׁ־אֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לָ֑הּ וְיָצְאָ֥ה חִנָּ֖ם אֵ֥ין כָּֽסֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: If he fails her in these three ways, she shall go free, without payment.
Transliteration: veim-shelׇsh-eleh lo yaasheh lah veyatseah chinam eyn khasef {s}

Hebrew: מַכֵּ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ וָמֵ֖ת מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: One who fatally strikes another party shall be put to death.
Transliteration: makheh iysh vamet mvot yumat

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א צָדָ֔ה וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אִנָּ֣ה לְיָד֑וֹ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י לְךָ֙ מָק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנ֖וּס שָֽׁמָּה׃ {ס}
Translated: If [a man] did so but not by design—it came about by an act of God—I will assign you a place to which he can flee.
Transliteration: vaasher lo tsadah vehaElohim inah leyadvo veshametiy lekha makvom asher yanus shamah {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָזִ֥ד אִ֛ישׁ עַל־רֵעֵ֖הוּ לְהׇרְג֣וֹ בְעׇרְמָ֑ה מֵעִ֣ם מִזְבְּחִ֔י תִּקָּחֶ֖נּוּ לָמֽוּת׃ {ס}
Translated: When one party schemes against another and kills through treachery, you shall take that person from My very altar to be put to death.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yazid iysh al-reehu lehׇregvo veׇremah meim mizevechiy tikachenu lamut {s}

Hebrew: וּמַכֵּ֥ה אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: One who strikes one’s father or mother shall be put to death.
Transliteration: umakheh aviyv veimvo mvot yumat {s}

Hebrew: וְגֹנֵ֨ב אִ֧ישׁ וּמְכָר֛וֹ וְנִמְצָ֥א בְיָד֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: One who kidnaps another party—whether having sold or still holding the victim—shall be put to death.
Transliteration: vegonev iysh umekharvo venimetsa veyadvo mvot yumat {s}

Hebrew: וּמְקַלֵּ֥ל אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: One who insults one’s father or mother shall be put to death.
Transliteration: umekalel aviyv veimvo mvot yumat {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יְרִיבֻ֣ן אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְהִכָּה־אִישׁ֙ אֶת־רֵעֵ֔הוּ בְּאֶ֖בֶן א֣וֹ בְאֶגְרֹ֑ף וְלֹ֥א יָמ֖וּת וְנָפַ֥ל לְמִשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translated: When [two] parties quarrel and one strikes the other with stone or fist, and the victim does not die but has to take to bed.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yeriyvun anashiym vehikhah-iysh et-reehu veeven vo veegerof velo yamut venafal lemishekhav

Hebrew: אִם־יָק֞וּם וְהִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּח֛וּץ עַל־מִשְׁעַנְתּ֖וֹ וְנִקָּ֣ה הַמַּכֶּ֑ה רַ֥ק שִׁבְתּ֛וֹ יִתֵּ֖ן וְרַפֹּ֥א יְרַפֵּֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: if that victim then gets up and walks outdoors upon a staff, the assailant shall go unpunished—except for paying for the idleness and the cure.
Transliteration: im-yakum vehitehalekhe vachuts al-misheanetvo venikah hamakheh rak shivetvo yiten verafo yerafe {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּה֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶת־עַבְדּ֜וֹ א֤וֹ אֶת־אֲמָתוֹ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔בֶט וּמֵ֖ת תַּ֣חַת יָד֑וֹ נָקֹ֖ם יִנָּקֵֽם׃
Translated: When a slave-owning party strikes a slave, male or female, with a rod, who dies there and then, this must be avenged.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yakheh iysh et-avedvo vo et-amatvo vashevet umet tachat yadvo nakom yinakem

Hebrew: אַ֥ךְ אִם־י֛וֹם א֥וֹ יוֹמַ֖יִם יַעֲמֹ֑ד לֹ֣א יֻקַּ֔ם כִּ֥י כַסְפּ֖וֹ הֽוּא׃ {ס}
Translated: But if the victim survives a day or two, this is not to be avenged, since the one is the other’s property.
Transliteration: akhe im-yvom vo yvomayiim yaamod lo yukam khiy khasefvo hu {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִנָּצ֣וּ אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וְנָ֨גְפ֜וּ אִשָּׁ֤ה הָרָה֙ וְיָצְא֣וּ יְלָדֶ֔יהָ וְלֹ֥א יִהְיֶ֖ה אָס֑וֹן עָנ֣וֹשׁ יֵעָנֵ֗שׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׁ֤ית עָלָיו֙ בַּ֣עַל הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וְנָתַ֖ן בִּפְלִלִֽים׃
Translated: When [two or more] parties fight, and one of them pushes a pregnant woman and a miscarriage results, but no other damage ensues, the one responsible shall be fined according as the woman’s husband may exact, the payment to be based on reckoning.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yinatsu anashiym venagefu ishah harah veyatseu yeladeyha velo yiheyeh asvon anvosh eianesh khaasher yashiyt alayv vaal haishah venatan vifeliliym

Hebrew: וְאִם־אָס֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֥ה נֶ֖פֶשׁ תַּ֥חַת נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated: But if other damage ensues, the penalty shall be life for life,
Transliteration: veim-asvon yiheyeh venatatah nefesh tachat nafesh

Hebrew: עַ֚יִן תַּ֣חַת עַ֔יִן שֵׁ֖ן תַּ֣חַת שֵׁ֑ן יָ֚ד תַּ֣חַת יָ֔ד רֶ֖גֶל תַּ֥חַת רָֽגֶל׃
Translated: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
Transliteration: ayiin tachat ayiin shen tachat shen yad tachat yad regel tachat ragel

Hebrew: כְּוִיָּה֙ תַּ֣חַת כְּוִיָּ֔ה פֶּ֖צַע תַּ֣חַת פָּ֑צַע חַבּוּרָ֕ה תַּ֖חַת חַבּוּרָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.
Transliteration: kheviyah tachat kheviyah fetsa tachat fatsa chavurah tachat chavurah {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּ֨ה אִ֜ישׁ אֶת־עֵ֥ין עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־אֶת־עֵ֥ין אֲמָת֖וֹ וְשִֽׁחֲתָ֑הּ לַֽחׇפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת עֵינֽוֹ׃
Translated: When a slave-owning party strikes the eye of a slave, male or female, and destroys it, that person shall let the slave go free on account of the eye.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yakheh iysh et-eyn avedvo vo-et-eyn amatvo veshichatah lachׇfeshiy yeshalechenu tachat eynvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־שֵׁ֥ן עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־שֵׁ֥ן אֲמָת֖וֹ יַפִּ֑יל לַֽחׇפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת שִׁנּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: If the owner knocks out the tooth of a slave, male or female, that person shall let the slave go free on account of the tooth.
Transliteration: veim-shen avedvo vo-shen amatvo yafiyl lachׇfeshiy yeshalechenu tachat shinvo {f}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִגַּ֨ח שׁ֥וֹר אֶת־אִ֛ישׁ א֥וֹ אֶת־אִשָּׁ֖ה וָמֵ֑ת סָק֨וֹל יִסָּקֵ֜ל הַשּׁ֗וֹר וְלֹ֤א יֵאָכֵל֙ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וּבַ֥עַל הַשּׁ֖וֹר נָקִֽי׃
Translated: When an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be stoned and its flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox is not to be punished.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yigach shvor et-iysh vo et-ishah vamet sakvol yisakel hashvor velo eiakhel et-vesharvo uvaal hashvor nakiy

Hebrew: וְאִ֡ם שׁוֹר֩ נַגָּ֨ח ה֜וּא מִתְּמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֗ם וְהוּעַ֤ד בִּבְעָלָיו֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְרֶ֔נּוּ וְהֵמִ֥ית אִ֖ישׁ א֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֑ה הַשּׁוֹר֙ יִסָּקֵ֔ל וְגַם־בְּעָלָ֖יו יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: If, however, that ox has been in the habit of goring, and its owner, though warned, has failed to guard it, and it kills a man or a woman—the ox shall be stoned and its owner, too, shall be put to death.
Transliteration: veim shvor nagach hu mitemol shileshom vehuad vivealayv velo yishemerenu vehemiyt iysh vo ishah hashvor yisakel vegam-vealayv yumat

Hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֖פֶר יוּשַׁ֣ת עָלָ֑יו וְנָתַן֙ פִּדְיֹ֣ן נַפְשׁ֔וֹ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יוּשַׁ֖ת עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: If ransom is imposed, the owner must pay whatever is imposed to redeem the owner’s own life.
Transliteration: im-khofer yushat alayv venatan fideyon nafeshvo khekhol asher-yushat alayv

Hebrew: אוֹ־בֵ֥ן יִגָּ֖ח אוֹ־בַ֣ת יִגָּ֑ח כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט הַזֶּ֖ה יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated: So, too, if it gores a minor, male or female, [its owner] shall be dealt with according to the same rule.
Transliteration: vo-ven yigach vo-vat yigach khamishefat hazeh eiasheh lvo

Hebrew: אִם־עֶ֛בֶד יִגַּ֥ח הַשּׁ֖וֹר א֣וֹ אָמָ֑ה כֶּ֣סֶף ׀ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שְׁקָלִ֗ים יִתֵּן֙ לַֽאדֹנָ֔יו וְהַשּׁ֖וֹר יִסָּקֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: But if the ox gores a slave, male or female, [its owner] shall pay thirty shekels of silver to the master, and the ox shall be stoned.
Transliteration: im-eved yigach hashvor vo amah khesef sheloshiym shekaliym yiten ladonayv vehashvor yisakel {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִפְתַּ֨ח אִ֜ישׁ בּ֗וֹר א֠וֹ כִּֽי־יִכְרֶ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ בֹּ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יְכַסֶּ֑נּוּ וְנָֽפַל־שָׁ֥מָּה שּׁ֖וֹר א֥וֹ חֲמֽוֹר׃
Translated: When any party opens a pit, or when any party digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or an ass falls into it,
Transliteration: vekhiy-yifetach iysh vvor vo khiy-yikhereh iysh vor velo yekhasenu venafal-shamah shvor vo chamvor

Hebrew: בַּ֤עַל הַבּוֹר֙ יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם כֶּ֖סֶף יָשִׁ֣יב לִבְעָלָ֑יו וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: the one responsible for the pit must make restitution—paying the price to the owner, but keeping the dead animal.
Transliteration: vaal havvor yeshalem khesef yashiyv livealayv vehamet yiheyeh-lvo {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִגֹּ֧ף שֽׁוֹר־אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־שׁ֥וֹר רֵעֵ֖הוּ וָמֵ֑ת וּמָ֨כְר֜וּ אֶת־הַשּׁ֤וֹר הַחַי֙ וְחָצ֣וּ אֶת־כַּסְפּ֔וֹ וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַמֵּ֖ת יֶֽחֱצֽוּן׃
Translated: When any party’s ox injures a neighbor’s ox and it dies, they shall sell the live ox and divide its price; they shall also divide the dead animal.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yigof shvor-iysh et-shvor reehu vamet umakheru et-hashvor hachay vechatsu et-khasefvo vegam et-hamet yechetsun

Hebrew: א֣וֹ נוֹדַ֗ע כִּ֠י שׁ֣וֹר נַגָּ֥ח הוּא֙ מִתְּמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְרֶ֖נּוּ בְּעָלָ֑יו שַׁלֵּ֨ם יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שׁוֹר֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: If, however, it is known that the ox was in the habit of goring, and its owner has failed to guard it, that person must restore ox for ox, but shall keep the dead animal.
Transliteration: vo nvoda khiy shvor nagach hu mitemvol shileshom velo yishemerenu vealayv shalem yeshalem shvor tachat hashvor vehamet yiheyeh-lvo {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יִגְנֹֽב־אִישׁ֙ שׁ֣וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֔ה וּטְבָח֖וֹ א֣וֹ מְכָר֑וֹ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בָקָ֗ר יְשַׁלֵּם֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְאַרְבַּע־צֹ֖אן תַּ֥חַת הַשֶּֽׂה׃
Translated: When any party steals an ox or a sheep, and slaughters it or sells it, that person shall pay five oxen for the ox, and four sheep for the sheep.—
Transliteration: khiy yigenov-iysh shvor vo-sheh utevachvo vo mekharvo chamishah vakar yeshalem tachat hashvor veareva-tson tachat hasheh

Hebrew: אִם־בַּמַּחְתֶּ֛רֶת יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב וְהֻכָּ֣ה וָמֵ֑ת אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ דָּמִֽים׃
Translated: If the thief is seized while tunneling and beaten to death, there is no bloodguilt in that case.
Transliteration: im-vamacheteret yimatse haganav vehukhah vamet eyn lvo damiym

Hebrew: אִם־זָרְחָ֥ה הַשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ עָלָ֖יו דָּמִ֣ים ל֑וֹ שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם אִם־אֵ֣ין ל֔וֹ וְנִמְכַּ֖ר בִּגְנֵבָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: If the sun had already risen, there is bloodguilt in that case.—[The thief] must make restitution, and if lacking the means, shall be sold for the theft.
Transliteration: im-zarechah hashemesh alayv damiym lvo shalem yeshalem im-eyn lvo venimekhar vigenevatvo

Hebrew: אִֽם־הִמָּצֵא֩ תִמָּצֵ֨א בְיָד֜וֹ הַגְּנֵבָ֗ה מִשּׁ֧וֹר עַד־חֲמ֛וֹר עַד־שֶׂ֖ה חַיִּ֑ים שְׁנַ֖יִם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: But if what was stolen—whether ox or ass or sheep—is found alive and in hand, that person shall pay double.
Transliteration: im-himatse timatse veyadvo hagenevah mishvor ad-chamvor ad-sheh chayiym shenayiim yeshalem {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יַבְעֶר־אִישׁ֙ שָׂדֶ֣ה אוֹ־כֶ֔רֶם וְשִׁלַּח֙ אֶת־בְּעִירֹ֔ה וּבִעֵ֖ר בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה אַחֵ֑ר מֵיטַ֥ב שָׂדֵ֛הוּ וּמֵיטַ֥ב כַּרְמ֖וֹ יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: When any party who owns livestock lets it loose to graze in another’s land, and so allows a field or a vineyard to be grazed bare, restitution must be made for the impairment of that field or vineyard.
Transliteration: khiy yaveer-iysh shadeh vo-kherem veshilach et-veiyroh uvier vishedeh acher meytav shadehu umeytav kharemvo yeshalem {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֨א אֵ֜שׁ וּמָצְאָ֤ה קֹצִים֙ וְנֶאֱכַ֣ל גָּדִ֔ישׁ א֥וֹ הַקָּמָ֖ה א֣וֹ הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם הַמַּבְעִ֖ר אֶת־הַבְּעֵרָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: When a fire is started and spreads to thorns, so that stacked, standing, or growing grain is consumed, the one who started the fire must make restitution.
Transliteration: khiy-tetse esh umatseah kotsiym veneekhal gadiysh vo hakamah vo hashadeh shalem yeshalem hamaveir et-haveerah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ כֶּ֤סֶף אֽוֹ־כֵלִים֙ לִשְׁמֹ֔ר וְגֻנַּ֖ב מִבֵּ֣ית הָאִ֑ישׁ אִם־יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנָֽיִם׃
Translated: When any party gives money or goods to another for safekeeping, and they are stolen from that other party’s house: if caught, the thief shall pay double;
Transliteration: khiy-yiten iysh el-reehu khesef vo-kheliym lishemor vegunav miveyt haiysh im-yimatse haganav yeshalem shenayiim

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֤א יִמָּצֵא֙ הַגַּנָּ֔ב וְנִקְרַ֥ב בַּֽעַל־הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֥אכֶת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: if the thief is not caught, the owner of the house shall depose before God and deny laying hands on the other’s property.
Transliteration: im-lo yimatse haganav venikerav vaal-havayiit el-haElohimm im-lo shalach yadvo vimelekhet reehu

Hebrew: עַֽל־כׇּל־דְּבַר־פֶּ֡שַׁע עַל־שׁ֡וֹר עַל־חֲ֠מ֠וֹר עַל־שֶׂ֨ה עַל־שַׂלְמָ֜ה עַל־כׇּל־אֲבֵדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ כִּי־ה֣וּא זֶ֔ה עַ֚ד הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים יָבֹ֖א דְּבַר־שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַרְשִׁיעֻן֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: (In all charges of misappropriation—pertaining to an ox, an ass, a sheep, a garment, or any other loss, whereof one party alleges, “This is it”—the case of both parties shall come before God: the one whom God declares guilty shall pay double to the other.)
Transliteration: al-khׇl-devar-fesha al-shvor al-chamvor al-sheh al-shalemah al-khׇl-avedah asher yomar khiy-hu zeh ad haElohimm yavo devar-sheneyhem asher yareshiyun Elohim yeshalem shenayiim lereehu {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ חֲמ֨וֹר אוֹ־שׁ֥וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֛ה וְכׇל־בְּהֵמָ֖ה לִשְׁמֹ֑ר וּמֵ֛ת אוֹ־נִשְׁבַּ֥ר אוֹ־נִשְׁבָּ֖ה אֵ֥ין רֹאֶֽה׃
Translated: When any party gives to another an ass, an ox, a sheep or any other animal to guard, and it dies or is injured or is carried off, with no witness about,
Transliteration: khiy-yiten iysh el-reehu chamvor vo-shvor vo-sheh vekhׇl-vehemah lishemor umet vo-nishevar vo-nishevah eyn roeh

Hebrew: שְׁבֻעַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה תִּהְיֶה֙ בֵּ֣ין שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֣אכֶת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְלָקַ֥ח בְּעָלָ֖יו וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translated: an oath before יהוה shall decide between the two of them that the one has not laid hands on the property of the other; the owner must acquiesce, and no restitution shall be made.
Transliteration: shevuat yehovah tiheyeh veyn sheneyhem im-lo shalach yadvo vimelekhet reehu velakach vealayv velo yeshalem

Hebrew: וְאִם־גָּנֹ֥ב יִגָּנֵ֖ב מֵעִמּ֑וֹ יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לִבְעָלָֽיו׃
