Translated: But if [the animal] was stolen from the guardian, restitution shall be made to its owner.
Transliteration: veim-ganov yiganev meimvo yeshalem livealayv

Hebrew: אִם־טָרֹ֥ף יִטָּרֵ֖ף יְבִאֵ֣הוּ עֵ֑ד הַטְּרֵפָ֖ה לֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: If it was torn by beasts, the guardian shall bring it as evidence—not needing to replace what has been torn by beasts.
Transliteration: im-tarof yitaref yeviehu ed haterefah lo yeshalem {f}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִשְׁאַ֥ל אִ֛ישׁ מֵעִ֥ם רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְנִשְׁבַּ֣ר אוֹ־מֵ֑ת בְּעָלָ֥יו אֵין־עִמּ֖וֹ שַׁלֵּ֥ם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translated: When any party borrows [an animal] from another and it dies or is injured, its owner not being with it, restitution must be made.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yisheal iysh meim reehu venishevar vo-met vealayv eyn-imvo shalem yeshalem

Hebrew: אִם־בְּעָלָ֥יו עִמּ֖וֹ לֹ֣א יְשַׁלֵּ֑ם אִם־שָׂכִ֣יר ה֔וּא בָּ֖א בִּשְׂכָרֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: If its owner was with it, no restitution need be made; but if it was hired, that payment is due.
Transliteration: im-vealayv imvo lo yeshalem im-shakhiyr hu va vishekharvo {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יְפַתֶּ֣ה אִ֗ישׁ בְּתוּלָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־אֹרָ֖שָׂה וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ מָהֹ֛ר יִמְהָרֶ֥נָּה לּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: If a man seduces a virgin for whom the bride-price has not been paid, and lies with her, he must make her his wife by payment of a bride-price.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yefateh iysh vetulah asher lo-orashah veshakhav imah mahor yimeharenah lvo leishah

Hebrew: אִם־מָאֵ֧ן יְמָאֵ֛ן אָבִ֖יהָ לְתִתָּ֣הּ ל֑וֹ כֶּ֣סֶף יִשְׁקֹ֔ל כְּמֹ֖הַר הַבְּתוּלֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: If her father refuses to give her to him, he must still weigh out silver in accordance with the bride-price for virgins.
Transliteration: im-maen yemaen aviyha letitah lvo khesef yishekol khemohar havetulot {s}

Hebrew: מְכַשֵּׁפָ֖ה לֹ֥א תְחַיֶּֽה׃
Translated: You shall not tolerate a sorceress.
Transliteration: mekhashefah lo techayeh

Hebrew: כׇּל־שֹׁכֵ֥ב עִם־בְּהֵמָ֖ה מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: Whoever lies with a beast shall be put to death.
Transliteration: khׇl-shokhev im-vehemah mvot yumat {s}

Hebrew: זֹבֵ֥חַ לָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יׇֽחֳרָ֑ם בִּלְתִּ֥י לַיהֹוָ֖ה לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Whoever sacrifices to a god other than יהוה alone shall be proscribed.
Transliteration: zovecha laElohim yׇchoram viletiy layhovah levadvo

Hebrew: וְגֵ֥ר לֹא־תוֹנֶ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תִלְחָצֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall not wrong or oppress a stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: veger lo-tvoneh velo tilechatsenu khiy-geriym heyiytem veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: כׇּל־אַלְמָנָ֥ה וְיָת֖וֹם לֹ֥א תְעַנּֽוּן׃
Translated: You [communal leaders] shall not ill-treat any widow or orphan.
Transliteration: khׇl-alemanah veyatvom lo teanun

Hebrew: אִם־עַנֵּ֥ה תְעַנֶּ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ כִּ֣י אִם־צָעֹ֤ק יִצְעַק֙ אֵלַ֔י שָׁמֹ֥עַ אֶשְׁמַ֖ע צַעֲקָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: If you do mistreat them, I will heed their outcry as soon as they cry out to Me,
Transliteration: im-aneh teaneh otvo khiy im-tsaok yitseak elay shamoa eshema tsaakatvo

Hebrew: וְחָרָ֣ה אַפִּ֔י וְהָרַגְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם בֶּחָ֑רֶב וְהָי֤וּ נְשֵׁיכֶם֙ אַלְמָנ֔וֹת וּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם יְתֹמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: and My anger shall blaze forth and I will put you to the sword, and your own wives shall become widows and your children orphans.
Transliteration: vecharah afiy veharagetiy etekhem vecharev vehayu nesheykhem alemanvot uveneykhem yetomiym {f}

Hebrew: אִם־כֶּ֣סֶף ׀ תַּלְוֶ֣ה אֶת־עַמִּ֗י אֶת־הֶֽעָנִי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה ל֖וֹ כְּנֹשֶׁ֑ה לֹֽא־תְשִׂימ֥וּן עָלָ֖יו נֶֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated: If you lend money to My people, to the poor among you, do not act toward them as a creditor; exact no interest from them.
Transliteration: im-khesef taleveh et-amiy et-heaniy imakhe lo-tiheyeh lvo khenosheh lo-teshiymun alayv neshekhe

Hebrew: אִם־חָבֹ֥ל תַּחְבֹּ֖ל שַׂלְמַ֣ת רֵעֶ֑ךָ עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ תְּשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: If you take your neighbor’s garment in pledge, you must return it before the sun sets;
Transliteration: im-chavol tachevol shalemat reekha ad-vo hashemesh teshiyvenu lvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הִ֤וא כְסוּתֹה֙ לְבַדָּ֔הּ הִ֥וא שִׂמְלָת֖וֹ לְעֹר֑וֹ בַּמֶּ֣ה יִשְׁכָּ֔ב וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־יִצְעַ֣ק אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁמַעְתִּ֖י כִּֽי־חַנּ֥וּן אָֽנִי׃ {ס}
Translated: it is the only available clothing—it is what covers the skin. In what else shall [your neighbor] sleep? Therefore, if that person cries out to Me, I will pay heed, for I am compassionate.
Transliteration: khiy hiv khesutoh levadah hiv shimelatvo leorvo vameh yishekhav vehayah khiy-yitseak elay veshamaetiy khiy-chanun aniy {s}

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֹ֣א תְקַלֵּ֑ל וְנָשִׂ֥יא בְעַמְּךָ֖ לֹ֥א תָאֹֽר׃
Translated: You shall not revile God, nor put a curse upon a chieftain among your people.
Transliteration: Elohim lo tekalel venashiy veamekha lo taor

Hebrew: מְלֵאָתְךָ֥ וְדִמְעֲךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְאַחֵ֑ר בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנֶ֖יךָ תִּתֶּן־לִֽי׃
Translated: You shall not put off the skimming of the first yield of your vats. You shall give Me the male first-born among your children.
Transliteration: meleatekha vedimeakha lo teacher vekhvor vaneykha titen-liy

Hebrew: כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְשֹׁרְךָ֖ לְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה עִם־אִמּ֔וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֖י תִּתְּנוֹ־לִֽי׃
Translated: You shall do the same with your cattle and your flocks: seven days the male first-born shall remain with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
Transliteration: khen-taasheh leshorekha letsonekha shiveat yamiym yiheyeh im-imvo vayyvom hashemiyniy titenvo-liy

Hebrew: וְאַנְשֵׁי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ תִּהְי֣וּן לִ֑י וּבָשָׂ֨ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֤ה טְרֵפָה֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ לַכֶּ֖לֶב תַּשְׁלִכ֥וּן אֹתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall be holy people to Me: you must not eat flesh torn by beasts in the field; you shall cast it to the dogs.
Transliteration: veaneshey-kodesh tiheyun liy uvashar vashadeh terefah lo tokhelu lakhelev tashelikhun otvo {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֖א שֵׁ֣מַע שָׁ֑וְא אַל־תָּ֤שֶׁת יָֽדְךָ֙ עִם־רָשָׁ֔ע לִהְיֹ֖ת עֵ֥ד חָמָֽס׃
Translated: You must not carry false rumors; you shall not join hands with the guilty to act as a malicious witness:
Transliteration: lo tisha shema shave al-tashet yadekha im-rasha liheyot ed chamas

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרֵֽי־רַבִּ֖ים לְרָעֹ֑ת וְלֹא־תַעֲנֶ֣ה עַל־רִ֗ב לִנְטֹ֛ת אַחֲרֵ֥י רַבִּ֖ים לְהַטֹּֽת׃
Translated: You shall neither side with the mighty to do wrong—you shall not give perverse testimony in a dispute so as to pervert it in favor of the mighty—
Transliteration: lo-tiheyeh acharey-raviym leraot velo-taaneh al-riv linetot acharey raviym lehatot

Hebrew: וְדָ֕ל לֹ֥א תֶהְדַּ֖ר בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: nor shall you show deference to a poor person in a dispute.
Transliteration: vedal lo tehedar veriyvvo {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִפְגַּ֞ע שׁ֧וֹר אֹֽיִבְךָ֛ א֥וֹ חֲמֹר֖וֹ תֹּעֶ֑ה הָשֵׁ֥ב תְּשִׁיבֶ֖נּוּ לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: When you encounter your enemy’s ox or ass wandering, you must take it back.
Transliteration: khiy tifega shvor oyiivekha vo chamorvo toeh hashev teshiyvenu lvo {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִרְאֶ֞ה חֲמ֣וֹר שֹׂנַאֲךָ֗ רֹבֵץ֙ תַּ֣חַת מַשָּׂא֔וֹ וְחָדַלְתָּ֖ מֵעֲזֹ֣ב ל֑וֹ עָזֹ֥ב תַּעֲזֹ֖ב עִמּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: When you see the ass of your enemy lying under its burden and would refrain from raising it, you must nevertheless help raise it.
Transliteration: khiy-tireeh chamvor shonaakha rovets tachat mashavo vechadaleta meazov lvo azov taazov imvo {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תַטֶּ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט אֶבְיֹנְךָ֖ בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall not subvert the rights of your needy in their disputes.
Transliteration: lo tateh mishefat eveyonekha veriyvvo

Hebrew: מִדְּבַר־שֶׁ֖קֶר תִּרְחָ֑ק וְנָקִ֤י וְצַדִּיק֙ אַֽל־תַּהֲרֹ֔ג כִּ֥י לֹא־אַצְדִּ֖יק רָשָֽׁע׃
Translated: Keep far from a false charge; do not bring death on those who are innocent and in the right, for I will not acquit the wrongdoer.
Transliteration: midevar-sheker tirechak venakiy vetsadiyk al-taharog khiy lo-atsediyk rasha

Hebrew: וְשֹׁ֖חַד לֹ֣א תִקָּ֑ח כִּ֤י הַשֹּׁ֙חַד֙ יְעַוֵּ֣ר פִּקְחִ֔ים וִֽיסַלֵּ֖ף דִּבְרֵ֥י צַדִּיקִֽים׃
Translated: Do not take bribes, for bribes blind the clear-sighted and upset the pleas of those who are in the right.
Transliteration: veshochad lo tikach khiy hashochad yeaver fikechiym viysalef diverey tsadiykiym

Hebrew: וְגֵ֖ר לֹ֣א תִלְחָ֑ץ וְאַתֶּ֗ם יְדַעְתֶּם֙ אֶת־נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַגֵּ֔ר כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the feelings of the stranger, having yourselves been strangers in the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: veger lo tilechats veatem yedaetem et-nefesh hager khiy-geriym heyiytem veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים תִּזְרַ֣ע אֶת־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its yield;
Transliteration: veshesh shaniym tizera et-aretsekha veasafeta et-tevuatah

Hebrew: וְהַשְּׁבִיעִ֞ת תִּשְׁמְטֶ֣נָּה וּנְטַשְׁתָּ֗הּ וְאָֽכְלוּ֙ אֶבְיֹנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֔ךָ וְיִתְרָ֕ם תֹּאכַ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְכַרְמְךָ֖ לְזֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: but in the seventh you shall let it rest and lie fallow. Let the needy among your people eat of it, and what they leave let the wild beasts eat. You shall do the same with your vineyards and your olive groves.
Transliteration: vehasheviyit tishemetenah unetashetah veakhelu eveyoney amekha veyiteram tokhal chayat hashadeh khen-taasheh lekharemekha lezeytekha

Hebrew: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת לְמַ֣עַן יָנ֗וּחַ שֽׁוֹרְךָ֙ וַחֲמֹרֶ֔ךָ וְיִנָּפֵ֥שׁ בֶּן־אֲמָתְךָ֖ וְהַגֵּֽר׃
Translated: Six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor, in order that your ox and your ass may rest, and that your home-born slave and the stranger may be refreshed.
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym taasheh maasheykha uvayyvom hasheviyiy tishevot lemaan yanucha shvorekha vachamorekha veyinafesh ven-amatekha vehager

Hebrew: וּבְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם תִּשָּׁמֵ֑רוּ וְשֵׁ֨ם אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ לֹ֣א תַזְכִּ֔ירוּ לֹ֥א יִשָּׁמַ֖ע עַל־פִּֽיךָ׃
Translated: Be on guard concerning all that I have told you. Make no mention of the names of other gods; they shall not be heard on your lips.
Transliteration: uvekhol asher-amaretiy aleykhem tishameru veshem Elohim acheriym lo tazekhiyru lo yishama al-fiykha

Hebrew: שָׁלֹ֣שׁ רְגָלִ֔ים תָּחֹ֥ג לִ֖י בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Three times a year you shall hold a festival for Me:
Transliteration: shalosh regaliym tachog liy vashanah

Hebrew: אֶת־חַ֣ג הַמַּצּוֹת֮ תִּשְׁמֹר֒ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִים֩ תֹּאכַ֨ל מַצּ֜וֹת כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֗ךָ לְמוֹעֵד֙ חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֔יב כִּי־ב֖וֹ יָצָ֣אתָ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹא־יֵרָא֥וּ פָנַ֖י רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days as I have commanded you—at the set time in the month of Abib, for in it you went forth from Egypt; and none shall appear before Me empty-handed;
Transliteration: et-chag hamatsvot tishemor shiveat yamiym tokhal matsvot khaasher tsiviytikha lemvoed chodesh haaviyv khiy-vvo yatsata mimitserayiim velo-eirau fanay reykam

Hebrew: וְחַ֤ג הַקָּצִיר֙ בִּכּוּרֵ֣י מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּזְרַ֖ע בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְחַ֤ג הָֽאָסִף֙ בְּצֵ֣את הַשָּׁנָ֔ה בְּאׇסְפְּךָ֥ אֶֽת־מַעֲשֶׂ֖יךָ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: and the Feast of the Harvest, of the first fruits of your work, of what you sow in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in the results of your work from the field.
Transliteration: vechag hakatsiyr vikhurey maasheykha asher tizera vashadeh vechag haasif vetset hashanah veׇsefekha et-maasheykha min-hashadeh

Hebrew: שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה יֵרָאֶה֙ כׇּל־זְכ֣וּרְךָ֔ אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י הָאָדֹ֥ן <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign, יהוה.
Transliteration: shalosh feamiym vashanah eiraeh khׇl-zekhurekha el-feney haadon <small></small> yehovah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִזְבַּ֥ח עַל־חָמֵ֖ץ דַּם־זִבְחִ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָלִ֥ין חֵֽלֶב־חַגִּ֖י עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the fat of My festal offering shall not be left lying until morning.
Transliteration: lo-tizevach al-chamets dam-zivechiy velo-yaliyn chelev-chagiy ad-voker

Hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֗ית בִּכּוּרֵי֙ אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ תָּבִ֕יא בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹֽא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of your God יהוה. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
Transliteration: reshiyt vikhurey adematekha taviy veyt yehovah eloheykha lo-tevashel gediy vachalev imvo {f}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י שֹׁלֵ֤חַ מַלְאָךְ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמׇרְךָ֖ בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְלַהֲבִ֣יאֲךָ֔ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲכִנֹֽתִי׃
Translated: I am sending a messenger before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have made ready.
Transliteration: hineh anokhiy sholecha maleakhe lefaneykha lishemׇrekha vadarekhe velahaviyakha el-hamakvom asher hakhinotiy

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֧מֶר מִפָּנָ֛יו וּשְׁמַ֥ע בְּקֹל֖וֹ אַל־תַּמֵּ֣ר בּ֑וֹ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יִשָּׂא֙ לְפִשְׁעֲכֶ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁמִ֖י בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Pay heed to him and obey him. Do not defy him, for he will not pardon your offenses, since My Name is in him;
Transliteration: hishamer mifanayv ushema vekolvo al-tamer vvo khiy lo yisha lefisheakhem khiy shemiy vekirevvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע֙ בְּקֹל֔וֹ וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְאָֽיַבְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֹ֣יְבֶ֔יךָ וְצַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־צֹרְרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: but if you obey him and do all that I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and a foe to your foes.
Transliteration: khiy im-shamvoa tishema vekolvo veashiyta khol asher adaver veayavetiy et-oyeveykha vetsaretiy et-tsorereykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יֵלֵ֣ךְ מַלְאָכִי֮ לְפָנֶ֒יךָ֒ וֶהֱבִֽיאֲךָ֗ אֶל־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהַפְּרִזִּי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י וְהִכְחַדְתִּֽיו׃
Translated: When My messenger goes before you and brings you to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I annihilate them,
Transliteration: khiy-eilekhe maleakhiy lefaneykha veheviyakha el-haemoriy vehachitiy vehaferiziy vehakhenaaniy hachiviy vehayevusiy vehikhechadetiyv

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֤ה לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א תׇֽעׇבְדֵ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂ֖ה כְּמַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כִּ֤י הָרֵס֙ תְּהָ֣רְסֵ֔ם וְשַׁבֵּ֥ר תְּשַׁבֵּ֖ר מַצֵּבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: you shall not bow down to their gods in worship or follow their practices, but shall tear them down and smash their pillars to bits.
Transliteration: lo-tishetachaveh leloheyhem velo tׇׇvedem velo taasheh khemaasheyhem khiy hares teharesem veshaver teshaver matsevoteyhem

Hebrew: וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵרַ֥ךְ אֶֽת־לַחְמְךָ֖ וְאֶת־מֵימֶ֑יךָ וַהֲסִרֹתִ֥י מַחֲלָ֖ה מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall serve your God יהוה, who will bless your bread and your water. And I will remove sickness from your midst.
Transliteration: vaavadetem et yehovah eloheykhem uverakhe et-lachemekha veet-meymeykha vahasirotiy machalah mikirevekha {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֛ה מְשַׁכֵּלָ֥ה וַעֲקָרָ֖ה בְּאַרְצֶ֑ךָ אֶת־מִסְפַּ֥ר יָמֶ֖יךָ אֲמַלֵּֽא׃
Translated: No woman in your land shall miscarry or be barren. I will let you enjoy the full count of your days.
Transliteration: lo tiheyeh meshakhelah vaakarah vearetsekha et-misefar yameykha amale

Hebrew: אֶת־אֵֽימָתִי֙ אֲשַׁלַּ֣ח לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְהַמֹּתִי֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּבֹ֖א בָּהֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֧י אֶת־כׇּל־אֹיְבֶ֛יךָ אֵלֶ֖יךָ עֹֽרֶף׃
Translated: I will send forth My terror before you, and I will throw into panic all the people among whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn tail before you.
Transliteration: et-eymatiy ashalach lefaneykha vehamotiy et-khׇl-haam asher tavo vahem venatatiy et-khׇl-oyeveykha eleykha oref

Hebrew: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְגֵרְשָׁ֗ה אֶת־הַחִוִּ֧י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֖י מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: I will send a plague ahead of you, and it shall drive out before you the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites.
Transliteration: veshalachetiy et-hatsireah lefaneykha vegereshah et-hachiviy et-hakhenaaniy veet-hachitiy milefaneykha

Hebrew: לֹ֧א אֲגָרְשֶׁ֛נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת פֶּן־תִּהְיֶ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְרַבָּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: I will not drive them out before you in a single year, lest the land become desolate and the wild beasts multiply to your hurt.
Transliteration: lo agareshenu mifaneykha veshanah echat fen-tiheyeh haarets shemamah veravah aleykha chayat hashadeh

Hebrew: מְעַ֥ט מְעַ֛ט אֲגָרְשֶׁ֖נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּפְרֶ֔ה וְנָחַלְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: I will drive them out before you little by little, until you have increased and possess the land.
Transliteration: meat meat agareshenu mifaneykha ad asher tifereh venachaleta et-haarets

Hebrew: וְשַׁתִּ֣י אֶת־גְּבֻלְךָ֗ מִיַּם־סוּף֙ וְעַד־יָ֣ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּמִמִּדְבָּ֖ר עַד־הַנָּהָ֑ר כִּ֣י ׀ אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּיֶדְכֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וְגֵרַשְׁתָּ֖מוֹ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: I will set your borders from the Sea of Reeds to the Sea of Philistia, and from the wilderness to the Euphrates; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hands, and you will drive them out before you.
Transliteration: veshatiy et-gevulekha miyam-suf vead-yam felishetiym umimidevar ad-hanahar khiy eten veyedekhem et yoshevey haarets vegerashetamvo mifaneykha

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִכְרֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם וְלֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶ֖ם בְּרִֽית׃
Translated: You shall make no covenant with them and their gods.
Transliteration: lo-tikherot lahem veleloheyhem veriyt

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יֵשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאַרְצְךָ֔ פֶּן־יַחֲטִ֥יאוּ אֹתְךָ֖ לִ֑י כִּ֤י תַעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: They shall not remain in your land, lest they cause you to sin against Me; for you will serve their gods—and it will prove a snare to you.
Transliteration: lo eishevu vearetsekha fen-yachatiyu otekha liy khiy taavod et-eloheyhem khiy-yiheyeh lekha lemvokesh {f}

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מֹשֶׁ֨ה אָמַ֜ר עֲלֵ֣ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה אַתָּה֙ וְאַהֲרֹן֙ נָדָ֣ב וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם מֵרָחֹֽק׃
Translated: Then [God] said to Moses, “Come up to יהוה, with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel, and bow low from afar.
Transliteration: veel-mosheh amar aleh el-yehovah atah veaharon nadav vaaviyhu veshiveiym mizikeney yisherael vehishetachaviytem merachok

Hebrew: וְנִגַּ֨שׁ מֹשֶׁ֤ה לְבַדּוֹ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהֵ֖ם לֹ֣א יִגָּ֑שׁוּ וְהָעָ֕ם לֹ֥א יַעֲל֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Moses alone shall come near יהוה; but the others shall not come near, nor shall the people come up with him.”
Transliteration: venigash mosheh levadvo el-yehovah vehem lo yigashu vehaam lo yaalu imvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר לָעָם֙ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים וַיַּ֨עַן כׇּל־הָעָ֜ם ק֤וֹל אֶחָד֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Moses went and repeated to the people all the commands of יהוה and all the rules; and all the people answered with one voice, saying, “All the things that יהוה has commanded we will do!”
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh vayesafer laam et khׇl-diverey yehovah veet khׇl-hamishefatiym vayaan khׇl-haam kvol echad vayomeru khׇl-hadevariym asher-diver yehovah naasheh

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבֵּ֖חַ תַּ֣חַת הָהָ֑ר וּשְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה לִשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moses then wrote down all the commands of יהוה. Early in the morning, he set up an altar at the foot of the mountain, with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vayikhetov mosheh et khׇl-diverey yehovah vayashekhem vavoker vayiven mizevecha tachat hahar usheteym eshereh matsevah lisheneym ashar shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֶֽת־נַעֲרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ עֹלֹ֑ת וַֽיִּזְבְּח֞וּ זְבָחִ֧ים שְׁלָמִ֛ים לַיהֹוָ֖ה פָּרִֽים׃
Translated: He designated some assistants among the Israelites, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed bulls as offerings of well-being to יהוה.
Transliteration: vayishelach et-naarey veney yisherael vayaalu olot vayizevechu zevachiym shelamiym layhovah fariym

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ חֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם בָּאַגָּנֹ֑ת וַחֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם זָרַ֖ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Moses took one part of the blood and put it in basins, and the other part of the blood he dashed against the altar.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh chatsiy hadam vayashem vaaganot vachatsiy hadam zarak al-hamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ סֵ֣פֶר הַבְּרִ֔ית וַיִּקְרָ֖א בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֥ה וְנִשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated: Then he took the record of the covenant and read it aloud to the people. And they said, “All that יהוה has spoken we will faithfully do!”
Transliteration: vayikach sefer haveriyt vayikera veׇzeney haam vayomeru khol asher-diver yehovah naasheh venishema

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וַיִּזְרֹ֖ק עַל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה דַֽם־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם עַ֥ל כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Moses took the blood and dashed it on the people and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that יהוה now makes with you concerning all these commands.”
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-hadam vayizerok al-haam vayomer hineh dam-haveriyt asher kharat yehovah imakhem al khׇl-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן נָדָב֙ וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel ascended;
Transliteration: vayaal mosheh veaharon nadav vaaviyhu veshiveiym mizikeney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֕וּ אֵ֖ת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְתַ֣חַת רַגְלָ֗יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂה֙ לִבְנַ֣ת הַסַּפִּ֔יר וּכְעֶ֥צֶם הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָטֹֽהַר׃
Translated: and they saw the God of Israel—under whose feet was the likeness of a pavement of sapphire, like the very sky for purity.
Transliteration: vayireu et elohey yisherael vetachat ragelayv khemaasheh livenat hasafiyr ukheetsem hashamayiim latohar

Hebrew: וְאֶל־אֲצִילֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֖ח יָד֑וֹ וַיֶּֽחֱזוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Yet [God] did not raise a hand against the leaders of the Israelites; they beheld God, and they ate and drank.
Transliteration: veel-atsiyley veney yisherael lo shalach yadvo vayechezu et-haElohimm vayokhelu vayishetu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲלֵ֥ה אֵלַ֛י הָהָ֖רָה וֶהְיֵה־שָׁ֑ם וְאֶתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ אֶת־לֻחֹ֣ת הָאֶ֗בֶן וְהַתּוֹרָה֙ וְהַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּתַ֖בְתִּי לְהוֹרֹתָֽם׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and wait there, and I will give you the stone tablets with the teachings and commandments which I have inscribed to instruct them.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh aleh elay haharah veheeih-sham veetenah lekha et-luchot haeven vehatvorah vehamitsevah asher khatavetiy lehvorotam

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם מֹשֶׁ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ מְשָׁרְת֑וֹ וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: So Moses and his attendant Joshua arose, and Moses ascended the mountain of God.
Transliteration: vayakׇm mosheh viyhvoshua mesharetvo vayaal mosheh el-har haElohim

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֤ים אָמַר֙ שְׁבוּ־לָ֣נוּ בָזֶ֔ה עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־נָשׁ֖וּב אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֨ה אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְחוּר֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם מִי־בַ֥עַל דְּבָרִ֖ים יִגַּ֥שׁ אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: To the elders he had said, “Wait here for us until we return to you. You have Aaron and Hur with you; let anyone who has a legal matter approach them.”
Transliteration: veel-hazekeniym amar shevu-lanu vazeh ad asher-nashuv aleykhem vehineh aharon vechur imakhem miy-vaal devariym yigash alehem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְכַ֥ס הֶעָנָ֖ן אֶת־הָהָֽר׃
Translated: When Moses had ascended the mountain, the cloud covered the mountain.
Transliteration: vayaal mosheh el-hahar vayekhas heanan et-hahar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכֹּ֤ן כְּבוֹד־יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַיְכַסֵּ֥הוּ הֶעָנָ֖ן שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י מִתּ֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָֽן׃
Translated: The Presence of יהוה abode on Mount Sinai, and the cloud hid it for six days. On the seventh day [God] called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.
Transliteration: vayishekhon khevvod-yehovah al-har siynay vayekhasehu heanan sheshet yamiym vayikera el-mosheh vayyvom hasheviyiy mitvokhe heanan

Hebrew: וּמַרְאֵה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּאֵ֥שׁ אֹכֶ֖לֶת בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Now the Presence of יהוה appeared in the sight of the Israelites as a consuming fire on the top of the mountain.
Transliteration: umareeh khevvod yehovah kheesh okhelet verosh hahar leeyney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָ֖ן וַיַּ֣עַל אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְהִ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ בָּהָ֔ר אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָֽיְלָה׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses went inside the cloud and ascended the mountain; and Moses remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh vetvokhe heanan vayaal el-hahar vayehiy mosheh vahar arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְיִקְחוּ־לִ֖י תְּרוּמָ֑ה מֵאֵ֤ת כׇּל־אִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִדְּבֶ֣נּוּ לִבּ֔וֹ תִּקְח֖וּ אֶת־תְּרוּמָתִֽי׃
Translated: Tell the Israelite people to bring Me gifts; you shall accept gifts for Me from every person whose heart is so moved.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veyikechu-liy terumah meet khׇl-iysh asher yidevenu livvo tikechu et-terumatiy

Hebrew: וְזֹאת֙ הַתְּרוּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּקְח֖וּ מֵאִתָּ֑ם זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: And these are the gifts that you shall accept from them: gold, silver, and copper;
Transliteration: vezot haterumah asher tikechu meitam zahav vakhesef unechoshet

Hebrew: וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ וְעִזִּֽים׃
Translated: blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair;
Transliteration: utekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh veiziym

Hebrew: וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאׇדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים וַעֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּֽים׃
Translated: tanned ram skins, dolphin skins, and acacia wood;
Transliteration: veorot eylim meׇdamiym veorot techashiym vaatsey shitiym

Hebrew: שֶׁ֖מֶן לַמָּאֹ֑ר בְּשָׂמִים֙ לְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
Translated: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;
Transliteration: shemen lamaor veshamiym leshemen hamishechah veliketoret hasamiym

Hebrew: אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֕הַם וְאַבְנֵ֖י מִלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפֹ֖ד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
Transliteration: aveney-shoham veaveney miluiym laefod velachoshen

Hebrew: וְעָ֥שׂוּ לִ֖י מִקְדָּ֑שׁ וְשָׁכַנְתִּ֖י בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: And let them make Me a sanctuary that I may dwell among them.
Transliteration: veashu liy mikedash veshakhanetiy vetvokham

Hebrew: כְּכֹ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ מַרְאֶ֣ה אוֹתְךָ֔ אֵ֚ת תַּבְנִ֣ית הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת תַּבְנִ֣ית כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְכֵ֖ן תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Exactly as I show you—the pattern of the Tabernacle and the pattern of all its furnishings—so shall you make it.
Transliteration: khekhol asher aniy mareeh votekha et taveniyt hamishekhan veet taveniyt khׇl-khelayv vekhen taashu {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשׂ֥וּ אֲר֖וֹן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֨יִם וָחֵ֜צִי אׇרְכּ֗וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה וָחֵ֙צִי֙ רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: They shall make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
Transliteration: veashu arvon atsey shitiym amatayiim vachetsiy ׇrekhvo veamah vachetsiy rׇchevvo veamah vachetsiy komatvo

Hebrew: וְצִפִּיתָ֤ אֹתוֹ֙ זָהָ֣ב טָה֔וֹר מִבַּ֥יִת וּמִח֖וּץ תְּצַפֶּ֑נּוּ וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ עָלָ֛יו זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Overlay it with pure gold—overlay it inside and out—and make upon it a gold molding round about.
Transliteration: vetsifiyta otvo zahav tahvor mivayiit umichuts tetsafenu veashiyta alayv zer zahav saviyv

Hebrew: וְיָצַ֣קְתָּ לּ֗וֹ אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב וְנָ֣תַתָּ֔ה עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פַּעֲמֹתָ֑יו וּשְׁתֵּ֣י טַבָּעֹ֗ת עַל־צַלְעוֹ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּי֙ טַבָּעֹ֔ת עַל־צַלְע֖וֹ הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: Cast four gold rings for it, to be attached to its four feet, two rings on one of its side walls and two on the other.
Transliteration: veyatsaketa lvo areva taveot zahav venatatah al areva faamotayv ushetey tavaot al-tsalevo haechat ushetey tavaot al-tsalevo hasheniyt

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בַדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold;
Transliteration: veashiyta vadey atsey shitiym vetsifiyta otam zahav

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתָ֤ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ בַּטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֖ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הָאָרֹ֑ן לָשֵׂ֥את אֶת־הָאָרֹ֖ן בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: then insert the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark, for carrying the ark.
Transliteration: veheveta et-havadiym vatavaot al tsaleot haaron lashet et-haaron vahem

Hebrew: בְּטַבְּעֹת֙ הָאָרֹ֔ן יִהְי֖וּ הַבַּדִּ֑ים לֹ֥א יָסֻ֖רוּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark: they shall not be removed from it.
Transliteration: vetaveot haaron yiheyu havadiym lo yasuru mimenu

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֖ אֶל־הָאָרֹ֑ן אֵ֚ת הָעֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶתֵּ֖ן אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And deposit in the Ark [the tablets of] the Pact which I will give you.
Transliteration: venatata el-haaron et haedut asher eten eleykha

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ כַפֹּ֖רֶת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר אַמָּתַ֤יִם וָחֵ֙צִי֙ אׇרְכָּ֔הּ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי רׇחְבָּֽהּ׃
Translated: You shall make a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
Transliteration: veashiyta khaforet zahav tahvor amatayiim vachetsiy ׇrekhah veamah vachetsiy rׇchevah

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ שְׁנַ֥יִם כְּרֻבִ֖ים זָהָ֑ב מִקְשָׁה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם מִשְּׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
Translated: Make two cherubim of gold—make them of hammered work—at the two ends of the cover.
Transliteration: veashiyta shenayiim kheruviym zahav mikeshah taasheh otam misheney ketsvot hakhaforet

Hebrew: וַ֠עֲשֵׂ֠ה כְּר֨וּב אֶחָ֤ד מִקָּצָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וּכְרוּב־אֶחָ֥ד מִקָּצָ֖ה מִזֶּ֑ה מִן־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י קְצוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: Make one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; of one piece with the cover shall you make the cherubim at its two ends.
Transliteration: vaasheh kheruv echad mikatsah mizeh ukheruv-echad mikatsah mizeh min-hakhaforet taashu et-hakheruviym al-sheney ketsvotayv

Hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ הַכְּרֻבִים֩ פֹּרְשֵׂ֨י כְנָפַ֜יִם לְמַ֗עְלָה סֹכְכִ֤ים בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם֙ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת וּפְנֵיהֶ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו אֶ֨ל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת יִהְי֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הַכְּרֻבִֽים׃
Translated: The cherubim shall have their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They shall confront each other, the faces of the cherubim being turned toward the cover.
Transliteration: vehayu hakheruviym foreshey khenafayiim lemaelah sokhekhiym vekhanefeyhem al-hakhaforet ufeneyhem iysh el-achiyv el-hakhaforet yiheyu feney hakheruviym

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֧ אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עַל־הָאָרֹ֖ן מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְאֶל־הָ֣אָרֹ֔ן תִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶתֵּ֖ן אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Place the cover on top of the Ark, after depositing inside the Ark the Pact that I will give you.
Transliteration: venatata et-hakhaforet al-haaron milemaelah veel-haaron titen et-haedut asher eten eleykha

Hebrew: וְנוֹעַדְתִּ֣י לְךָ֮ שָׁם֒ וְדִבַּרְתִּ֨י אִתְּךָ֜ מֵעַ֣ל הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת מִבֵּין֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הַכְּרֻבִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵדֻ֑ת אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֲצַוֶּ֛ה אוֹתְךָ֖ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: There I will meet with you, and I will impart to you—from above the cover, from between the two cherubim that are on top of the Ark of the Pact—all that I will command you concerning the Israelite people.
Transliteration: venvoadetiy lekha sham vedivaretiy itekha meal hakhaforet miveyn sheney hakheruviym asher al-arvon haedut et khׇl-asher atsaveh votekha el-veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ שֻׁלְחָ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֤יִם אׇרְכּוֹ֙ וְאַמָּ֣ה רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.
Transliteration: veashiyta shulechan atsey shitiym amatayiim ׇrekhvo veamah rׇchevvo veamah vachetsiy komatvo

Hebrew: וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.
Transliteration: vetsifiyta otvo zahav tahvor veashiyta lvo zer zahav saviyv

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ לּ֥וֹ מִסְגֶּ֛רֶת טֹ֖פַח סָבִ֑יב וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ זֵר־זָהָ֛ב לְמִסְגַּרְתּ֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Make a rim of a hand’s breadth around it, and make a gold molding for its rim round about.
Transliteration: veashiyta lvo misegeret tofach saviyv veashiyta zer-zahav lemisegaretvo saviyv

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ אַרְבַּ֖ע טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וְנָתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע הַפֵּאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַרְבַּ֥ע רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated: Make four gold rings for it, and attach the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
Transliteration: veashiyta lvo areva taveot zahav venatata et-hatavaot al areva hafeot asher leareva ragelayv

Hebrew: לְעֻמַּת֙ הַמִּסְגֶּ֔רֶת תִּהְיֶ֖יןָ הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
Translated: The rings shall be next to the rim, as holders for poles to carry the table.
Transliteration: leumat hamisegeret tiheyeyna hatavaot levatiym levadiym lashet et-hashulechan

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְנִשָּׂא־בָ֖ם אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
Translated: Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold; by these the table shall be carried.
Transliteration: veashiyta et-havadiym atsey shitiym vetsifiyta otam zahav venisha-vam et-hashulechan

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ קְּעָרֹתָ֜יו וְכַפֹּתָ֗יו וּקְשׂוֹתָיו֙ וּמְנַקִּיֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻסַּ֖ךְ בָּהֵ֑ן זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Make its bowls, ladles, jars and jugs with which to offer libations; make them of pure gold.
Transliteration: veashiyta kearotayv vekhafotayv ukeshvotayv umenakiyotayv asher yusakhe vahen zahav tahvor taasheh otam

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֧ עַֽל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֛ן לֶ֥חֶם פָּנִ֖ים לְפָנַ֥י תָּמִֽיד׃ {פ}
Translated: And on the table you shall set the bread of display, to be before Me always.
Transliteration: venatata al-hashulechan lechem faniym lefanay tamiyd {f}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מְנֹרַ֖ת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר מִקְשָׁ֞ה תֵּעָשֶׂ֤ה הַמְּנוֹרָה֙ יְרֵכָ֣הּ וְקָנָ֔הּ גְּבִיעֶ֛יהָ כַּפְתֹּרֶ֥יהָ וּפְרָחֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּ֥נָּה יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: You shall make a lampstand of pure gold; the lampstand shall be made of hammered work; its base and its shaft, its cups, calyxes, and petals shall be of one piece.
Transliteration: veashiyta menorat zahav tahvor mikeshah teasheh hamenvorah yerekhah vekanah geviyeyha khafetoreyha uferacheyha mimenah yiheyu

Hebrew: וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה קָנִ֔ים יֹצְאִ֖ים מִצִּדֶּ֑יהָ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה ׀ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֗ה מִצִּדָּהּ֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֔ה מִצִּדָּ֖הּ הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translated: Six branches shall issue from its sides; three branches from one side of the lampstand and three branches from the other side of the lampstand.
Transliteration: veshishah kaniym yotseiym mitsideyha sheloshah keney menorah mitsidah haechad usheloshah keney menorah mitsidah hasheniy

Hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְ֠בִעִ֠ים מְֽשֻׁקָּדִ֞ים בַּקָּנֶ֣ה הָאֶחָד֮ כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפֶ֒רַח֒ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְבִעִ֗ים מְשֻׁקָּדִ֛ים בַּקָּנֶ֥ה הָאֶחָ֖ד כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפָ֑רַח כֵּ֚ן לְשֵׁ֣שֶׁת הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
Translated: On one branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, and on the next branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.
Transliteration: sheloshah geviiym meshukadiym vakaneh haechad khafetor vaferach usheloshah geviiym meshukadiym vakaneh haechad khafetor vafarach khen lesheshet hakaniym hayotseiym min-hamenorah

Hebrew: וּבַמְּנֹרָ֖ה אַרְבָּעָ֣ה גְבִעִ֑ים מְשֻׁ֨קָּדִ֔ים כַּפְתֹּרֶ֖יהָ וּפְרָחֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: And on the lampstand itself there shall be four cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals:
Transliteration: uvamenorah arevaah geviiym meshukadiym khafetoreyha uferacheyha

Hebrew: וְכַפְתֹּ֡ר תַּ֩חַת֩ שְׁנֵ֨י הַקָּנִ֜ים מִמֶּ֗נָּה וְכַפְתֹּר֙ תַּ֣חַת שְׁנֵ֤י הַקָּנִים֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְכַפְתֹּ֕ר תַּחַת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַקָּנִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑נָּה לְשֵׁ֙שֶׁת֙ הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
Translated: a calyx, of one piece with it, under a pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the second pair of branches, and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the last pair of branches; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.
Transliteration: vekhafetor tachat sheney hakaniym mimenah vekhafetor tachat sheney hakaniym mimenah vekhafetor tachat-sheney hakaniym mimenah lesheshet hakaniym hayotseiym min-hamenorah

Hebrew: כַּפְתֹּרֵיהֶ֥ם וּקְנֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּ֣נָּה יִהְי֑וּ כֻּלָּ֛הּ מִקְשָׁ֥ה אַחַ֖ת זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: Their calyxes and their stems shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it a single hammered piece of pure gold.
Transliteration: khafetoreyhem ukenotam mimenah yiheyu khulah mikeshah achat zahav tahvor

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֖יהָ שִׁבְעָ֑ה וְהֶֽעֱלָה֙ אֶת־נֵ֣רֹתֶ֔יהָ וְהֵאִ֖יר עַל־עֵ֥בֶר פָּנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Make its seven lamps—the lamps shall be so mounted as to give the light on its front side—
Transliteration: veashiyta et-neroteyha shiveah veheelah et-neroteyha veheiyr al-ever faneyha

Hebrew: וּמַלְקָחֶ֥יהָ וּמַחְתֹּתֶ֖יהָ זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: and its tongs and fire pans of pure gold.
Transliteration: umalekacheyha umachetoteyha zahav tahvor

Hebrew: כִּכָּ֛ר זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: It shall be made, with all these furnishings, out of a talent of pure gold.
Transliteration: khikhar zahav tahvor yaasheh otah et khׇl-hakheliym haeleh

Hebrew: וּרְאֵ֖ה וַעֲשֵׂ֑ה בְּתַ֨בְנִיתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה מׇרְאֶ֖ה בָּהָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Note well, and follow the patterns for them that are being shown you on the mountain.
Transliteration: ureeh vaasheh vetaveniytam asher-atah mׇreeh vahar {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֥ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עֶ֣שֶׂר יְרִיעֹ֑ת שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י כְּרֻבִ֛ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: As for the tabernacle, make it of ten strips of cloth; make these of fine twisted linen, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, with a design of cherubim worked into them.
Transliteration: veet-hamishekhan taasheh esher yeriyot shesh mׇshezar utekhelet vearegaman vetolaat shaniy kheruviym maasheh choshev taasheh otam

Hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ ׀ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לְכׇל־הַיְרִיעֹֽת׃
Translated: The length of each cloth shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, all the cloths to have the same measurements.
Transliteration: orekhe hayeriyah haachat shemoneh veesheriym vaamah verochav areva vaamah hayeriyah haechat midah achat lekhׇl-hayeriyot

Hebrew: חֲמֵ֣שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֗ת תִּֽהְיֶ֙יןָ֙ חֹֽבְרֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֑הּ וְחָמֵ֤שׁ יְרִיעֹת֙ חֹֽבְרֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Five of the cloths shall be joined to one another, and the other five cloths shall be joined to one another.
Transliteration: chamesh hayeriyot tiheyeyna choverot ishah el-achotah vechamesh yeriyot choverot ishah el-achotah

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ לֻֽלְאֹ֣ת תְּכֵ֗לֶת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָאֶחָ֔ת מִקָּצָ֖ה בַּחֹבָ֑רֶת וְכֵ֤ן תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ בִּשְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה בַּמַּחְבֶּ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: Make loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set; and do likewise on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:
Transliteration: veashiyta luleot tekhelet al shefat hayeriyah haechat mikatsah vachovaret vekhen taasheh vishefat hayeriyah hakiytsvonah vamacheveret hasheniyt

Hebrew: חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת תַּעֲשֶׂה֮ בַּיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָת֒ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַיְרִיעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּמַּחְבֶּ֣רֶת הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית מַקְבִּילֹת֙ הַלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: make fifty loops on the one cloth, and fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops to be opposite one another.
Transliteration: chamishiym lulaot taasheh vayeriyah haechat vachamishiym lulaot taasheh viketseh hayeriyah asher vamacheveret hasheniyt makeviylot halulaot ishah el-achotah

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים קַרְסֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב וְחִבַּרְתָּ֨ אֶת־הַיְרִיעֹ֜ת אִשָּׁ֤ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָהּ֙ בַּקְּרָסִ֔ים וְהָיָ֥ה הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: And make fifty gold clasps, and couple the cloths to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle becomes one whole.
Transliteration: veashiyta chamishiym karesey zahav vechivareta et-hayeriyot ishah el-achotah vakerasiym vehayah hamishekhan echad

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ יְרִיעֹ֣ת עִזִּ֔ים לְאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַשְׁתֵּי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה יְרִיעֹ֖ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: You shall then make cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; make the cloths eleven in number.
Transliteration: veashiyta yeriyot iziym leohel al-hamishekhan ashetey-eshereh yeriyot taasheh otam

Hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ ׀ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְעַשְׁתֵּ֥י עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה יְרִיעֹֽת׃
Translated: The length of each cloth shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, the eleven cloths to have the same measurements.
Transliteration: orekhe hayeriyah haachat sheloshiym vaamah verochav areva vaamah hayeriyah haechat midah achat leashetey eshereh yeriyot

Hebrew: וְחִבַּרְתָּ֞ אֶת־חֲמֵ֤שׁ הַיְרִיעֹת֙ לְבָ֔ד וְאֶת־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָ֑ד וְכָפַלְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔ית אֶל־מ֖וּל פְּנֵ֥י הָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: Join five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves; and fold over the sixth cloth at the front of the tent.
Transliteration: vechivareta et-chamesh hayeriyot levad veet-shesh hayeriyot levad vekhafaleta et-hayeriyah hashishiyt el-mul feney haohel

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת הַקִּיצֹנָ֖ה בַּחֹבָ֑רֶת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת עַ֚ל שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַחֹבֶ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: Make fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the cloth of the other set.
Transliteration: veashiyta chamishiym lulaot al shefat hayeriyah haechat hakiytsonah vachovaret vachamishiym lulaot al shefat hayeriyah hachoveret hasheniyt

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ קַרְסֵ֥י נְחֹ֖שֶׁת חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים וְהֵבֵאתָ֤ אֶת־הַקְּרָסִים֙ בַּלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת וְחִבַּרְתָּ֥ אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְהָיָ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Make fifty copper clasps, and fit the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together so that it becomes one whole.
Transliteration: veashiyta karesey nechoshet chamishiym veheveta et-hakerasiym valulaot vechivareta et-haohel vehayah echad

Hebrew: וְסֶ֙רַח֙ הָעֹדֵ֔ף בִּירִיעֹ֖ת הָאֹ֑הֶל חֲצִ֤י הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָעֹדֶ֔פֶת תִּסְרַ֕ח עַ֖ל אֲחֹרֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: As for the overlapping excess of the cloths of the tent, the extra half-cloth shall overlap the back of the tabernacle,
Transliteration: veserach haodef viyriyot haohel chatsiy hayeriyah haodefet tiserach al achorey hamishekhan

Hebrew: וְהָאַמָּ֨ה מִזֶּ֜ה וְהָאַמָּ֤ה מִזֶּה֙ בָּעֹדֵ֔ף בְּאֹ֖רֶךְ יְרִיעֹ֣ת הָאֹ֑הֶל יִהְיֶ֨ה סָר֜וּחַ עַל־צִדֵּ֧י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה לְכַסֹּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: while the extra cubit at either end of each length of tent cloth shall hang down to the bottom of the two sides of the tabernacle and cover it.
Transliteration: vehaamah mizeh vehaamah mizeh vaodef veorekhe yeriyot haohel yiheyeh sarucha al-tsidey hamishekhan mizeh umizeh lekhasotvo

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ מִכְסֶה֙ לָאֹ֔הֶל עֹרֹ֥ת אֵילִ֖ם מְאׇדָּמִ֑ים וּמִכְסֵ֛ה עֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃ {פ}
Translated: And make for the tent a covering of tanned ram skins, and a covering of dolphin skins above.
Transliteration: veashiyta mikheseh laohel orot eylim meׇdamiym umikheseh orot techashiym milemaelah {f}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים עֹמְדִֽים׃
Translated: You shall make the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.
Transliteration: veashiyta et-hakerashiym lamishekhan atsey shitiym omediym

Hebrew: עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמּ֖וֹת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ וְאַמָּה֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הָֽאַמָּ֔ה רֹ֖חַב הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: The length of each plank shall be ten cubits and the width of each plank a cubit and a half.
Transliteration: esher amvot orekhe hakaresh veamah vachatsiy haamah rochav hakeresh haechad

Hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֣י יָד֗וֹת לַקֶּ֙רֶשׁ֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד מְשֻׁ֨לָּבֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֑הּ כֵּ֣ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל קַרְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: Each plank shall have two tenons, parallel to each other; do the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: shetey yadvot lakeresh haechad meshulavot ishah el-achotah khen taasheh lekhol kareshey hamishekhan

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֶשְׂרִ֣ים קֶ֔רֶשׁ לִפְאַ֖ת נֶ֥גְבָּה תֵימָֽנָה׃
Translated: Of the planks of the Tabernacle, make twenty planks on the south side:
Transliteration: veashiyta et-hakerashiym lamishekhan esheriym keresh lifeat negevah teymanah

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אַדְנֵי־כֶ֔סֶף תַּעֲשֶׂ֕ה תַּ֖חַת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ שְׁנֵ֨י אֲדָנִ֜ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֤רֶשׁ הָאֶחָד֙ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י יְדֹתָ֔יו וּשְׁנֵ֧י אֲדָנִ֛ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י יְדֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under the one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;
Transliteration: vearevaiym adeney-khesef taasheh tachat esheriym hakaresh sheney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lishetey yedotayv usheney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lishetey yedotayv

Hebrew: וּלְצֶ֧לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית לִפְאַ֣ת צָפ֑וֹן עֶשְׂרִ֖ים קָֽרֶשׁ׃
Translated: and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, on the north side, twenty planks,
Transliteration: uletsela hamishekhan hasheniyt lifeat tsafvon esheriym karesh

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under the one plank and two sockets under each following plank.
Transliteration: vearevaiym adeneyhem khasef sheney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad usheney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad

Hebrew: וּֽלְיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֥ה קְרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, make six planks;
Transliteration: uleyarekhetey hamishekhan yamah taasheh shishah kerashiym

Hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֤י קְרָשִׁים֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לִמְקֻצְעֹ֖ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן בַּיַּרְכָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: and make two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.
Transliteration: usheney kerashiym taasheh limekutseot hamishekhan vayarekhatayiim

Hebrew: וְיִֽהְי֣וּ תֹֽאֲמִם֮ מִלְּמַ֒טָּה֒ וְיַחְדָּ֗ו יִהְי֤וּ תַמִּים֙ עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַטַּבַּ֖עַת הָאֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֚ן יִהְיֶ֣ה לִשְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם לִשְׁנֵ֥י הַמִּקְצֹעֹ֖ת יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: They shall match at the bottom, and terminate alike at the top inside one ring; thus shall it be with both of them: they shall form the two corners.
Transliteration: veyiheyu toamim milematah veyachedav yiheyu tamiym al-roshvo el-hatavaat haechat khen yiheyeh lisheneyhem lisheney hamiketsoot yiheyu

Hebrew: וְהָיוּ֙ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה קְרָשִׁ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֲדָנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Thus there shall be eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two sockets under the first plank, and two sockets under each of the other planks.
Transliteration: vehayu shemonah kerashiym veadeneyhem khesef shishah ashar adaniym sheney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad usheney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בְרִיחִ֖ם עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חֲמִשָּׁ֕ה לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: You shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,
Transliteration: veashiyta veriychim atsey shitiym chamishah lekareshey tsela-hamishekhan haechad

Hebrew: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֔ם לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֗ם לְקַרְשֵׁי֙ צֶ֣לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לַיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם יָֽמָּה׃
Translated: five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear to the west.
Transliteration: vachamishah veriychim lekareshey tsela-hamishekhan hasheniyt vachamishah veriychim lekareshey tsela hamishekhan layarekhatayiim yamah

Hebrew: וְהַבְּרִ֥יחַ הַתִּיכֹ֖ן בְּת֣וֹךְ הַקְּרָשִׁ֑ים מַבְרִ֕חַ מִן־הַקָּצֶ֖ה אֶל־הַקָּצֶֽה׃
Translated: The center bar halfway up the planks shall run from end to end.
Transliteration: vehaveriycha hatiykhon vetvokhe hakerashiym mavericha min-hakatseh el-hakatseh

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֞ים תְּצַפֶּ֣ה זָהָ֗ב וְאֶת־טַבְּעֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה זָהָ֔ב בָּתִּ֖ים לַבְּרִיחִ֑ם וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֶת־הַבְּרִיחִ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Overlay the planks with gold, and make their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and overlay the bars with gold.
Transliteration: veet-hakerashiym tetsafeh zahav veet-taveoteyhem taasheh zahav vatiym laveriychim vetsifiyta et-haveriychim zahav

Hebrew: וַהֲקֵמֹתָ֖ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן כְּמִ֨שְׁפָּט֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הׇרְאֵ֖יתָ בָּהָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Then set up the Tabernacle according to the manner of it that you were shown on the mountain.
Transliteration: vahakemota et-hamishekhan khemishefatvo asher hׇreeyta vahar {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ פָרֹ֗כֶת תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֛ב יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖הּ כְּרֻבִֽים׃
Translated: You shall make a curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen; it shall have a design of cherubim worked into it.
Transliteration: veashiyta farokhet tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar maasheh choshev yaasheh otah kheruviym

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֗הּ עַל־אַרְבָּעָה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים מְצֻפִּ֣ים זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב עַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה אַדְנֵי־כָֽסֶף׃
Translated: Hang it upon four posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold and having hooks of gold, [set] in four sockets of silver.
Transliteration: venatatah otah al-arevaah amudey shitiym metsufiym zahav vaveyhem zahav al-arevaah adeney-khasef

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֶת־הַפָּרֹ֘כֶת֮ תַּ֣חַת הַקְּרָסִים֒ וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ שָׁ֙מָּה֙ מִבֵּ֣ית לַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֵ֖ת אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת וְהִבְדִּילָ֤ה הַפָּרֹ֙כֶת֙ לָכֶ֔ם בֵּ֣ין הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וּבֵ֖ין קֹ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Hang the curtain under the clasps, and carry the Ark of the Pact there, behind the curtain, so that the curtain shall serve you as a partition between the Holy and the Holy of Holies.
Transliteration: venatatah et-hafarokhet tachat hakerasiym veheveta shamah miveyt lafarokhet et arvon haedut vehivediylah hafarokhet lakhem veyn hakodesh uveyn kodesh hakodashiym

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת עַ֖ל אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵדֻ֑ת בְּקֹ֖דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Place the cover upon the Ark of the Pact in the Holy of Holies.
Transliteration: venatata et-hakhaforet al arvon haedut vekodesh hakodashiym

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ מִח֣וּץ לַפָּרֹ֔כֶת וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ נֹ֣כַח הַשֻּׁלְחָ֔ן עַ֛ל צֶ֥לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן תֵּימָ֑נָה וְהַ֨שֻּׁלְחָ֔ן תִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־צֶ֥לַע צָפֽוֹן׃
Translated: Place the table outside the curtain, and the lampstand by the south wall of the Tabernacle opposite the table, which is to be placed by the north wall.
Transliteration: veshameta et-hashulechan michuts lafarokhet veet-hamenorah nokhach hashulechan al tsela hamishekhan teymanah vehashulechan titen al-tsela tsafvon

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ מָסָךְ֙ לְפֶ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽם׃
Translated: You shall make a screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery.
Transliteration: veashiyta masakhe lefetach haohel tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar maasheh rokem

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לַמָּסָ֗ךְ חֲמִשָּׁה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וְצִפִּיתָ֤ אֹתָם֙ זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְיָצַקְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֔ם חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אַדְנֵ֥י נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
Translated: Make five posts of acacia wood for the screen and overlay them with gold—their hooks being of gold—and cast for them five sockets of copper.
Transliteration: veashiyta lamasakhe chamishah amudey shitiym vetsifiyta otam zahav vaveyhem zahav veyatsaketa lahem chamishah adeney nechoshet {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חָמֵשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת אֹ֜רֶךְ וְחָמֵ֧שׁ אַמּ֣וֹת רֹ֗חַב רָב֤וּעַ יִהְיֶה֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar is to be square—and three cubits high.
Transliteration: veashiyta et-hamizevecha atsey shitiym chamesh amvot orekhe vechamesh amvot rochav ravua yiheyeh hamizevecha veshalosh amvot komatvo

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ קַרְנֹתָ֗יו עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנֹּתָ֔יו מִמֶּ֖נּוּ תִּהְיֶ֣יןָ קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: Make its horns on the four corners, the horns to be of one piece with it; and overlay it with copper.
Transliteration: veashiyta karenotayv al areva finotayv mimenu tiheyeyna karenotayv vetsifiyta otvo nechoshet

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ סִּֽירֹתָיו֙ לְדַשְּׁנ֔וֹ וְיָעָיו֙ וּמִזְרְקֹתָ֔יו וּמִזְלְגֹתָ֖יו וּמַחְתֹּתָ֑יו לְכׇל־כֵּלָ֖יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: Make the pails for removing its ashes, as well as its scrapers, basins, flesh hooks, and fire pans—make all its utensils of copper.
Transliteration: veashiyta siyrotayv ledashenvo veyaayv umizerekotayv umizelegotayv umachetotayv lekhׇl-khelayv taasheh nechoshet

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ לּוֹ֙ מִכְבָּ֔ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֶ֣שֶׁת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־הָרֶ֗שֶׁת אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת נְחֹ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֥ע קְצוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: Make for it a grating of meshwork in copper; and on the mesh make four copper rings at its four corners.
Transliteration: veashiyta lvo mikhevar maasheh reshet nechoshet veashiyta al-hareshet areva taveot nechoshet al areva ketsvotayv

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֗הּ תַּ֛חַת כַּרְכֹּ֥ב הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ מִלְּמָ֑טָּה וְהָיְתָ֣ה הָרֶ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ד חֲצִ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Set the mesh below, under the ledge of the altar, so that it extends to the middle of the altar.
Transliteration: venatatah otah tachat kharekhov hamizevecha milematah vehayetah hareshet ad chatsiy hamizevecha

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ בַדִּים֙ לַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: And make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with copper.
Transliteration: veashiyta vadiym lamizevecha vadey atsey shitiym vetsifiyta otam nechoshet

Hebrew: וְהוּבָ֥א אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו בַּטַּבָּעֹ֑ת וְהָי֣וּ הַבַּדִּ֗ים עַל־שְׁתֵּ֛י צַלְעֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בִּשְׂאֵ֥ת אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles remain on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
Transliteration: vehuva et-vadayv vatavaot vehayu havadiym al-shetey tsaleot hamizevecha visheet otvo

Hebrew: נְב֥וּב לֻחֹ֖ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹת֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶרְאָ֥ה אֹתְךָ֛ בָּהָ֖ר כֵּ֥ן יַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Make it hollow, of boards. As you were shown on the mountain, so shall they be made.
Transliteration: nevuv luchot taasheh otvo khaasher hereah otekha vahar khen yaashu {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ אֵ֖ת חֲצַ֣ר הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן לִפְאַ֣ת נֶֽגֶב־תֵּ֠ימָ֠נָה קְלָעִ֨ים לֶחָצֵ֜ר שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר מֵאָ֤ה בָֽאַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ לַפֵּאָ֖ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
Translated: You shall make the enclosure of the Tabernacle: On the south side, a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the length of the enclosure on that side—
Transliteration: veashiyta et chatsar hamishekhan lifeat negev-teymanah kelaiym lechatser shesh mׇshezar meah vaamah orekhe lafeah haechat

Hebrew: וְעַמֻּדָ֣יו עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
Transliteration: veamudayv esheriym veadeneyhem esheriym nechoshet vavey haamudiym vachashukeyhem khasef

Hebrew: וְכֵ֨ן לִפְאַ֤ת צָפוֹן֙ בָּאֹ֔רֶךְ קְלָעִ֖ים מֵ֣אָה אֹ֑רֶךְ וְעַמֻּדָ֣ו עֶשְׂרִ֗ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֤ם עֶשְׂרִים֙ נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָֽעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: Again a hundred cubits of hangings for its length along the north side—with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
Transliteration: vekhen lifeat tsafvon vaorekhe kelaiym meah orekhe veamudav esheriym veadeneyhem esheriym nechoshet vavey haamudiym vachashukeyhem khasef

Hebrew: וְרֹ֤חַב הֶֽחָצֵר֙ לִפְאַת־יָ֔ם קְלָעִ֖ים חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֲשָׂרָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
Translated: For the width of the enclosure, on the west side, fifty cubits of hangings, with their ten posts and their ten sockets.
Transliteration: verochav hechatser lifeat-yam kelaiym chamishiym amah amudeyhem asharah veadeneyhem asharah

Hebrew: וְרֹ֣חַב הֶֽחָצֵ֗ר לִפְאַ֛ת קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָ֖חָה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: For the width of the enclosure on the front, or east side, fifty cubits:
Transliteration: verochav hechatser lifeat kedemah mizerachah chamishiym amah

Hebrew: וַחֲמֵ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֛ה קְלָעִ֖ים לַכָּתֵ֑ף עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
Transliteration: vachamesh eshereh amah kelaiym lakhatef amudeyhem sheloshah veadeneyhem sheloshah

Hebrew: וְלַכָּתֵף֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔ית חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה קְלָעִ֑ים עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
Transliteration: velakhatef hasheniyt chamesh eshereh kelaiym amudeyhem sheloshah veadeneyhem sheloshah

Hebrew: וּלְשַׁ֨עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֜ר מָסָ֣ךְ ׀ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אַמָּ֗ה תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑ם עַמֻּֽדֵיהֶם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם אַרְבָּעָֽה׃
Translated: and for the gate of the enclosure, a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery, with their four posts and their four sockets.
Transliteration: uleshaar hechatser masakhe esheriym amah tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar maasheh rokem amudeyhem arevaah veadeneyhem arevaah

Hebrew: כׇּל־עַמּוּדֵ֨י הֶֽחָצֵ֤ר סָבִיב֙ מְחֻשָּׁקִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף וָוֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: All the posts round the enclosure shall be banded with silver and their hooks shall be of silver; their sockets shall be of copper.
Transliteration: khׇl-amudey hechatser saviyv mechushakiym khesef vaveyhem khasef veadeneyhem nechoshet

Hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ הֶֽחָצֵר֩ מֵאָ֨ה בָֽאַמָּ֜ה וְרֹ֣חַב ׀ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֗ים וְקֹמָ֛ה חָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: The length of the enclosure shall be a hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout; and the height five cubits—[with hangings] of fine twisted linen. The sockets shall be of copper:
Transliteration: orekhe hechatser meah vaamah verochav chamishiym vachamishiym vekomah chamesh amvot shesh mׇshezar veadeneyhem nechoshet

Hebrew: לְכֹל֙ כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן בְּכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָת֑וֹ וְכׇל־יְתֵדֹתָ֛יו וְכׇל־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
Translated: all the utensils of the Tabernacle, for all its service, as well as all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of copper.
Transliteration: lekhol kheley hamishekhan vekhol avodatvo vekhׇl-yetedotayv vekhׇl-yitedot hechatser nechoshet {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה תְּצַוֶּ֣ה ׀ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ שֶׁ֣מֶן זַ֥יִת זָ֛ךְ כָּתִ֖ית לַמָּא֑וֹר לְהַעֲלֹ֥ת נֵ֖ר תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated: You shall further instruct the Israelites to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.
Transliteration: veatah tetsaveh et-veney yisherael veyikechu eleykha shemen zayiit zakhe khatiyt lamavor lehaalot ner tamiyd

Hebrew: בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֩ מִח֨וּץ לַפָּרֹ֜כֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָעֵדֻ֗ת יַעֲרֹךְ֩ אֹת֨וֹ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו מֵעֶ֥רֶב עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹ֣רֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Aaron and his sons shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain which is over [the Ark of] the Pact, [to burn] from evening to morning before יהוה. It shall be a due from the Israelites for all time, throughout the ages.
Transliteration: veohel mvoed michuts lafarokhet asher al-haedut yaarokhe otvo aharon uvanayv meerev ad-voker lifeney yehovah chukat volam ledorotam meet veney yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֡ה הַקְרֵ֣ב אֵלֶ֩יךָ֩ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֨ן אָחִ֜יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו אִתּ֗וֹ מִתּ֛וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִ֑י אַהֲרֹ֕ן נָדָ֧ב וַאֲבִיה֛וּא אֶלְעָזָ֥ר וְאִיתָמָ֖ר בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: You shall bring forward your brother Aaron, with his sons, from among the Israelites, to serve Me as priests: Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron.
Transliteration: veatah hakerev eleykha et-aharon achiykha veet-vanayv itvo mitvokhe veney yisherael lekhahanvo-liy aharon nadav vaaviyhu eleazar veiytamar veney aharon

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֑יךָ לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃
Translated: Make sacral vestments for your brother Aaron, for dignity and adornment.
Transliteration: veashiyta vigedey-kodesh leaharon achiykha lekhavvod uletifearet

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה תְּדַבֵּר֙ אֶל־כׇּל־חַכְמֵי־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִלֵּאתִ֖יו ר֣וּחַ חׇכְמָ֑ה וְעָשׂ֞וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֧י אַהֲרֹ֛ן לְקַדְּשׁ֖וֹ לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
Translated: Next you shall instruct all who are skillful, whom I have endowed with the gift of skill, to make Aaron’s vestments, for consecrating him to serve Me as priest.
Transliteration: veatah tedaver el-khׇl-chakhemey-lev asher miletiyv rucha chׇkhemah veashu et-vigedey aharon lekadeshvo lekhahanvo-liy

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה הַבְּגָדִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשׂ֗וּ חֹ֤שֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד֙ וּמְעִ֔יל וּכְתֹ֥נֶת תַּשְׁבֵּ֖ץ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת וְאַבְנֵ֑ט וְעָשׂ֨וּ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֜דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִ֛יךָ וּלְבָנָ֖יו לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
Translated: These are the vestments they are to make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a fringed tunic, a headdress, and a sash. They shall make those sacral vestments for your brother Aaron and his sons, for priestly service to Me;
Transliteration: veeleh havegadiym asher yaashu choshen veefvod umeiyl ukhetonet tashevets mitsenefet veavenet veashu vigedey-kodesh leaharon achiykha ulevanayv lekhahanvo-liy

Hebrew: וְהֵם֙ יִקְח֣וּ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֶת־הַתְּכֵ֖לֶת וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֑ן וְאֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: they, therefore, shall receive the gold, the blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and the fine linen.
Transliteration: vehem yikechu et-hazahav veet-hatekhelet veet-haaregaman veet-tvolaat hashaniy veet-hashesh {f}

Hebrew: וְעָשׂ֖וּ אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד זָ֠הָ֠ב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן תּוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated: They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen, worked into designs.
Transliteration: veashu et-haefod zahav tekhelet vearegaman tvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar maasheh choshev

Hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֧י כְתֵפֹ֣ת חֹֽבְרֹ֗ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֛וֹ אֶל־שְׁנֵ֥י קְצוֹתָ֖יו וְחֻבָּֽר׃
Translated: It shall have two shoulder-pieces attached; they shall be attached at its two ends.
Transliteration: shetey khetefot choverot yiheyeh-lvo el-sheney ketsvotayv vechuvar

Hebrew: וְחֵ֤שֶׁב אֲפֻדָּתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֔יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ מִמֶּ֣נּוּ יִהְיֶ֑ה זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָֽר׃
Translated: And the decorated band that is upon it shall be made like it, of one piece with it: of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
Transliteration: vecheshev afudatvo asher alayv khemaashehu mimenu yiheyeh zahav tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar

Hebrew: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֖י אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֑הַם וּפִתַּחְתָּ֣ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁמ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then take two lazuli stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:
Transliteration: velakacheta et-shetey aveney-shoham ufitacheta aleyhem shemvot veney yisherael

Hebrew: שִׁשָּׁה֙ מִשְּׁמֹתָ֔ם עַ֖ל הָאֶ֣בֶן הָאֶחָ֑ת וְאֶת־שְׁמ֞וֹת הַשִּׁשָּׁ֧ה הַנּוֹתָרִ֛ים עַל־הָאֶ֥בֶן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית כְּתוֹלְדֹתָֽם׃
Translated: six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the order of their birth.
Transliteration: shishah mishemotam al haeven haechat veet-shemvot hashishah hanvotariym al-haeven hasheniyt khetvoledotam

Hebrew: מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חָרַשׁ֮ אֶ֒בֶן֒ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֗ם תְּפַתַּח֙ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֔ים עַל־שְׁמֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מֻסַבֹּ֛ת מִשְׁבְּצ֥וֹת זָהָ֖ב תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: On the two stones you shall make seal engravings—the work of a lapidary—of the names of the sons of Israel. Having bordered them with frames of gold,
Transliteration: maasheh charash even fituchey chotam tefatach et-shetey haavaniym al-shemot veney yisherael musavot mishevetsvot zahav taasheh otam

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֞ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֗ים עַ֚ל כִּתְפֹ֣ת הָֽאֵפֹ֔ד אַבְנֵ֥י זִכָּרֹ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנָשָׂא֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־שְׁמוֹתָ֜ם לִפְנֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־שְׁתֵּ֥י כְתֵפָ֖יו לְזִכָּרֹֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: attach the two stones to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones for remembrance of the Israelite people, whose names Aaron shall carry upon his two shoulder-pieces for remembrance before יהוה.
Transliteration: veshameta et-shetey haavaniym al khitefot haefod aveney zikharon liveney yisherael venasha aharon et-shemvotam lifeney yehovah al-shetey khetefayv lezikharon {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִשְׁבְּצֹ֖ת זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Then make frames of gold
Transliteration: veashiyta mishevetsot zahav

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֤י שַׁרְשְׁרֹת֙ זָהָ֣ב טָה֔וֹר מִגְבָּלֹ֛ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה אֶת־שַׁרְשְׁרֹ֥ת הָעֲבֹתֹ֖ת עַל־הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: and two chains of pure gold; braid these like corded work, and fasten the corded chains to the frames.
Transliteration: ushetey sharesherot zahav tahvor migevalot taasheh otam maasheh avot venatatah et-sharesherot haavotot al-hamishevetsot {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חֹ֤שֶׁן מִשְׁפָּט֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חֹשֵׁ֔ב כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אֵפֹ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֑נּוּ זָ֠הָ֠ב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֖ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall make a breastpiece of decision, worked into a design; make it in the style of the ephod: make it of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
Transliteration: veashiyta choshen mishefat maasheh choshev khemaasheh efod taashenu zahav tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar taasheh otvo

Hebrew: רָב֥וּעַ יִֽהְיֶ֖ה כָּפ֑וּל זֶ֥רֶת אׇרְכּ֖וֹ וְזֶ֥רֶת רׇחְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: It shall be square and doubled, a span in length and a span in width.
Transliteration: ravua yiheyeh khaful zeret ׇrekhvo vezeret rׇchevvo

Hebrew: וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ בוֹ֙ מִלֻּ֣אַת אֶ֔בֶן אַרְבָּעָ֖ה טוּרִ֣ים אָ֑בֶן ט֗וּר אֹ֤דֶם פִּטְדָה֙ וּבָרֶ֔קֶת הַטּ֖וּר הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Set in it mounted stones, in four rows of stones. The first row shall be a row of carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald;
Transliteration: umileta vvo miluat even arevaah turiym aven tur odem fitedah uvareket hatur haechad

Hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשֵּׁנִ֑י נֹ֥פֶךְ סַפִּ֖יר וְיָהֲלֹֽם׃
Translated: the second row: a turquoise, a sapphire, and an amethyst;
Transliteration: vehatur hasheniy nofekhe safiyr veyahalom

Hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י לֶ֥שֶׁם שְׁב֖וֹ וְאַחְלָֽמָה׃
Translated: the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and a crystal;
Transliteration: vehatur hasheliyshiy leshem shevvo veachelamah

Hebrew: וְהַטּוּר֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔י תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ וְשֹׁ֖הַם וְיָשְׁפֵ֑ה מְשֻׁבָּצִ֥ים זָהָ֛ב יִהְי֖וּ בְּמִלּוּאֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and the fourth row: a beryl, a lapis lazuli, and a jasper. They shall be framed with gold in their mountings.
Transliteration: vehatur hareviyiy tareshiysh veshoham veyashefeh meshuvatsiym zahav yiheyu vemiluotam

Hebrew: וְ֠הָאֲבָנִ֠ים תִּֽהְיֶ֜יןָ עַל־שְׁמֹ֧ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה עַל־שְׁמֹתָ֑ם פִּתּוּחֵ֤י חוֹתָם֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־שְׁמ֔וֹ תִּֽהְיֶ֕יןָ לִשְׁנֵ֥י עָשָׂ֖ר שָֽׁבֶט׃
Translated: The stones shall correspond [in number] to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, corresponding to their names. They shall be engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.
Transliteration: vehaavaniym tiheyeyna al-shemot veney-yisherael sheteym eshereh al-shemotam fituchey chvotam iysh al-shemvo tiheyeyna lisheney ashar shavet

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ עַל־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן שַֽׁרְשֹׁ֥ת גַּבְלֻ֖ת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: On the breastpiece make braided chains of corded work in pure gold.
Transliteration: veashiyta al-hachoshen shareshot gavelut maasheh avot zahav tahvor

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ עַל־הַחֹ֔שֶׁן שְׁתֵּ֖י טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָ֑ב וְנָתַתָּ֗ אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ הַטַּבָּע֔וֹת עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: Make two rings of gold on the breastpiece, and fasten the two rings at the two ends of the breastpiece,
Transliteration: veashiyta al-hachoshen shetey tavevot zahav venatata et-shetey hatavavot al-sheney ketsvot hachoshen

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֗ה אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ עֲבֹתֹ֣ת הַזָּהָ֔ב עַל־שְׁתֵּ֖י הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת אֶל־קְצ֖וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: attaching the two golden cords to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.
Transliteration: venatatah et-shetey avotot hazahav al-shetey hatavaot el-ketsvot hachoshen

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת שְׁתֵּ֤י קְצוֹת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָעֲבֹתֹ֔ת תִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֑וֹת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־כִּתְפ֥וֹת הָאֵפֹ֖ד אֶל־מ֥וּל פָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: Then fasten the two ends of the cords to the two frames, which you shall attach to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, at the front.
Transliteration: veet shetey ketsvot shetey haavotot titen al-shetey hamishevetsvot venatatah al-khitefvot haefod el-mul fanayv

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֗יתָ שְׁתֵּי֙ טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָ֔ב וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֣וֹת הַחֹ֑שֶׁן עַל־שְׂפָת֕וֹ אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר הָאֵפֹ֖ד בָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated: Make two rings of gold and attach them to the two ends of the breastpiece, at its inner edge, which faces the ephod.
Transliteration: veashiyta shetey tavevot zahav veshameta otam al-sheney ketsvot hachoshen al-shefatvo asher el-ever haefod vayetah

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֘יתָ֮ שְׁתֵּ֣י טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָב֒ וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֡ם עַל־שְׁתֵּי֩ כִתְפ֨וֹת הָאֵפ֤וֹד מִלְּמַ֙טָּה֙ מִמּ֣וּל פָּנָ֔יו לְעֻמַּ֖ת מַחְבַּרְתּ֑וֹ מִמַּ֕עַל לְחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֽוֹד׃
Translated: And make two other rings of gold and fasten them on the front of the ephod, low on the two shoulder-pieces, close to its seam above the decorated band.
Transliteration: veashiyta shetey tavevot zahav venatatah otam al-shetey khitefvot haefvod milematah mimul fanayv leumat machevaretvo mimaal lecheshev haefvod

Hebrew: וְיִרְכְּס֣וּ אֶת־הַ֠חֹ֠שֶׁן מִֽטַּבְּעֹתָ֞ו אֶל־טַבְּעֹ֤ת הָאֵפוֹד֙ בִּפְתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת לִֽהְי֖וֹת עַל־חֵ֣שֶׁב הָאֵפ֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־יִזַּ֣ח הַחֹ֔שֶׁן מֵעַ֖ל הָאֵפֽוֹד׃
Translated: The breastpiece shall be held in place by a cord of blue from its rings to the rings of the ephod, so that the breastpiece rests on the decorated band and does not come loose from the ephod.
Transliteration: veyirekhesu et-hachoshen mitaveotav el-taveot haefvod vifetiyl tekhelet liheyvot al-cheshev haefvod velo-yizach hachoshen meal haefvod

Hebrew: וְנָשָׂ֣א אַ֠הֲרֹ֠ן אֶת־שְׁמ֨וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בְּחֹ֧שֶׁן הַמִּשְׁפָּ֛ט עַל־לִבּ֖וֹ בְּבֹא֣וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְזִכָּרֹ֥ן לִפְנֵֽי־יְהֹוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated: Aaron shall carry the names of the sons of Israel on the breastpiece of decision over his heart, when he enters the sanctuary, for remembrance before יהוה at all times.
Transliteration: venasha aharon et-shemvot veney-yisherael vechoshen hamishefat al-livvo vevovo el-hakodesh lezikharon lifeney-yehovah tamiyd

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֞ אֶל־חֹ֣שֶׁן הַמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט אֶת־הָאוּרִים֙ וְאֶת־הַתֻּמִּ֔ים וְהָיוּ֙ עַל־לֵ֣ב אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּבֹא֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְנָשָׂ֣א אַ֠הֲרֹ֠ן אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֨ט בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל עַל־לִבּ֛וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃ {ס}
Translated: Inside the breastpiece of decision you shall place the Urim and Thummim, so that they are over Aaron’s heart when he comes before יהוה. Thus Aaron shall carry the instrument of decision for the Israelites over his heart before יהוה at all times.
Transliteration: venatata el-choshen hamishefat et-hauriym veet-hatumiym vehayu al-lev aharon vevovo lifeney yehovah venasha aharon et-mishefat veney-yisherael al-livvo lifeney yehovah tamiyd {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ אֶת־מְעִ֥יל הָאֵפ֖וֹד כְּלִ֥יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
Translated: You shall make the robe of the ephod of pure blue.
Transliteration: veashiyta et-meiyl haefvod kheliyl tekhelet

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה פִֽי־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ בְּתוֹכ֑וֹ שָׂפָ֡ה יִֽהְיֶה֩ לְפִ֨יו סָבִ֜יב מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֗ג כְּפִ֥י תַחְרָ֛א יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִקָּרֵֽעַ׃
Translated: The opening for the head shall be in the middle of it; the opening shall have a binding of woven work round about—it shall be like the opening of a coat of mail—so that it does not tear.
Transliteration: vehayah fiy-roshvo vetvokhvo shafah yiheyeh lefiyv saviyv maasheh oreg khefiy tachera yiheyeh-lvo lo yikarea

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־שׁוּלָ֗יו רִמֹּנֵי֙ תְּכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י עַל־שׁוּלָ֖יו סָבִ֑יב וּפַעֲמֹנֵ֥י זָהָ֛ב בְּתוֹכָ֖ם סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: On its hem make pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, all around the hem, with bells of gold between them all around:
Transliteration: veashiyta al-shulayv rimoney tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy al-shulayv saviyv ufaamoney zahav vetvokham saviyv

Hebrew: פַּעֲמֹ֤ן זָהָב֙ וְרִמּ֔וֹן פַּֽעֲמֹ֥ן זָהָ֖ב וְרִמּ֑וֹן עַל־שׁוּלֵ֥י הַמְּעִ֖יל סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe.
Transliteration: faamon zahav verimvon faamon zahav verimvon al-shuley hameiyl saviyv

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה עַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לְשָׁרֵ֑ת וְנִשְׁמַ֣ע ק֠וֹל֠וֹ בְּבֹא֨וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ לִפְנֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה וּבְצֵאת֖וֹ וְלֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃ {ס}
Translated: Aaron shall wear it while officiating, so that the sound of it is heard when he comes into the sanctuary before יהוה and when he goes out—that he may not die.
Transliteration: vehayah al-aharon lesharet venishema kvolvo vevovo el-hakodesh lifeney yehovah uvetsetvo velo yamut {s}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ צִּ֖יץ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וּפִתַּחְתָּ֤ עָלָיו֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֔ם קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall make a frontlet of pure gold and engrave on it the seal inscription: “Holy to יהוה.”
Transliteration: veashiyta tsiyts zahav tahvor ufitacheta alayv fituchey chotam kodesh layhovah

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־פְּתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְהָיָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּצְנָ֑פֶת אֶל־מ֥וּל פְּנֵֽי־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Suspend it on a cord of blue, so that it may remain on the headdress; it shall remain on the front of the headdress.
Transliteration: veshameta otvo al-fetiyl tekhelet vehayah al-hamitsenafet el-mul feney-hamitsenefet yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֮ עַל־מֵ֣צַח אַהֲרֹן֒ וְנָשָׂ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַקְדִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְכׇֽל־מַתְּנֹ֖ת קׇדְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם וְהָיָ֤ה עַל־מִצְחוֹ֙ תָּמִ֔יד לְרָצ֥וֹן לָהֶ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may take away any sin arising from the holy things that the Israelites consecrate, from any of their sacred donations; it shall be on his forehead at all times, to win acceptance for them before יהוה.
Transliteration: vehayah al-metsach aharon venasha aharon et-avon hakodashiym asher yakediyshu veney yisherael lekhׇl-matenot kׇdesheyhem vehayah al-mitsechvo tamiyd leratsvon lahem lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְשִׁבַּצְתָּ֙ הַכְּתֹ֣נֶת שֵׁ֔שׁ וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת שֵׁ֑שׁ וְאַבְנֵ֥ט תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה רֹקֵֽם׃
Translated: You shall make the fringed tunic of fine linen. You shall make the headdress of fine linen. You shall make the sash of embroidered work.
Transliteration: veshivatseta hakhetonet shesh veashiyta mitsenefet shesh veavenet taasheh maasheh rokem

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה כֻתֳּנֹ֔ת וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם אַבְנֵטִ֑ים וּמִגְבָּעוֹת֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃
Translated: And for Aaron’s sons also you shall make tunics, and make sashes for them, and make turbans for them, for dignity and adornment.
Transliteration: veliveney aharon taasheh khutonot veashiyta lahem avenetiym umigevavot taasheh lahem lekhavvod uletifearet

Hebrew: וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֔יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֨ אֹתָ֜ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֧ אֶת־יָדָ֛ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם וְכִהֲנ֥וּ לִֽי׃
Translated: Put these on your brother Aaron and on his sons as well; anoint them, and ordain them and consecrate them to serve Me as priests.
Transliteration: vehilevasheta otam et-aharon achiykha veet-vanayv itvo umashacheta otam umileta et-yadam vekidasheta otam vekhihanu liy

Hebrew: וַעֲשֵׂ֤ה לָהֶם֙ מִכְנְסֵי־בָ֔ד לְכַסּ֖וֹת בְּשַׂ֣ר עֶרְוָ֑ה מִמׇּתְנַ֥יִם וְעַד־יְרֵכַ֖יִם יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: You shall also make for them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; they shall extend from the hips to the thighs.
Transliteration: vaasheh lahem mikhenesey-vad lekhasvot veshar erevah mimׇtenayiim vead-yerekhayiim yiheyu

Hebrew: וְהָיוּ֩ עַל־אַהֲרֹ֨ן וְעַל־בָּנָ֜יו בְּבֹאָ֣ם ׀ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד א֣וֹ בְגִשְׁתָּ֤ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְלֹא־יִשְׂא֥וּ עָוֺ֖ן וָמֵ֑תוּ חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם ל֖וֹ וּלְזַרְע֥וֹ אַחֲרָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: They shall be worn by Aaron and his sons when they enter the Tent of Meeting or when they approach the altar to officiate in the sanctuary, so that they do not incur punishment and die. It shall be a law for all time for him and for his offspring to come.
Transliteration: vehayu al-aharon veal-vanayv vevoam el-ohel mvoed vo vegishetam el-hamizevecha lesharet vakodesh velo-yisheu avon vametu chukat volam lvo ulezarevo acharayv {s}

Hebrew: וְזֶ֨ה הַדָּבָ֜ר אֲשֶֽׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם לְקַדֵּ֥שׁ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֣ן לִ֑י לְ֠קַ֠ח פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֧ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר וְאֵילִ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: This is what you shall do to them in consecrating them to serve Me as priests: Take a young bull of the herd and two rams without blemish;
Transliteration: vezeh hadavar asher-taasheh lahem lekadesh otam lekhahen liy lekach far echad ven-vakar veeylim shenayiim temiymim

Hebrew: וְלֶ֣חֶם מַצּ֗וֹת וְחַלֹּ֤ת מַצֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן סֹ֥לֶת חִטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: also unleavened bread, unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil—make these of choice wheat flour.
Transliteration: velechem matsvot vechalot matsot velulot vashemen urekiykey matsvot meshuchiym vashamen solet chitiym taasheh otam

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֤ אוֹתָם֙ עַל־סַ֣ל אֶחָ֔ד וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּסָּ֑ל וְאֶ֨ת־הַפָּ֔ר וְאֵ֖ת שְׁנֵ֥י הָאֵילִֽם׃
Translated: Place these in one basket and present them in the basket, along with the bull and the two rams.
Transliteration: venatata votam al-sal echad vehikeraveta otam vasal veet-hafar veet sheney haeylim
