Hebrew: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ תַּקְרִ֔יב אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְרָחַצְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: Lead Aaron and his sons up to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.
Transliteration: veet-aharon veet-vanayv takeriyv el-fetach ohel mvoed verachatseta otam vamayiim

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הַבְּגָדִ֗ים וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֔נֶת וְאֵת֙ מְעִ֣יל הָאֵפֹ֔ד וְאֶת־הָאֵפֹ֖ד וְאֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן וְאָפַדְתָּ֣ ל֔וֹ בְּחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֹֽד׃
Translated: Then take the vestments, and clothe Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastpiece, and gird him with the decorated band of the ephod.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-havegadiym vehilevasheta et-aharon et-hakhutonet veet meiyl haefod veet-haefod veet-hachoshen veafadeta lvo vecheshev haefod

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְנָתַתָּ֛ אֶת־נֵ֥זֶר הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ עַל־הַמִּצְנָֽפֶת׃
Translated: Put the headdress on his head, and place the holy diadem upon the headdress.
Transliteration: veshameta hamitsenefet al-roshvo venatata et-nezer hakodesh al-hamitsenafet

Hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְיָצַקְתָּ֖ עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֖ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-shemen hamishechah veyatsaketa al-roshvo umashacheta otvo

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תַּקְרִ֑יב וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֖ם כֻּתֳּנֹֽת׃
Translated: Then bring his sons forward; clothe them with tunics
Transliteration: veet-vanayv takeriyv vehilevashetam khutonot

Hebrew: וְחָגַרְתָּ֩ אֹתָ֨ם אַבְנֵ֜ט אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֗יו וְחָבַשְׁתָּ֤ לָהֶם֙ מִגְבָּעֹ֔ת וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם כְּהֻנָּ֖ה לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ יַֽד־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְיַד־בָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: and wind turbans upon them. And gird both Aaron and his sons with sashes. And so they shall have priesthood as their right for all time. You shall then ordain Aaron and his sons.
Transliteration: vechagareta otam avenet aharon uvanayv vechavasheta lahem migevaot vehayetah lahem khehunah lechukat volam umileta yad-aharon veyad-vanayv

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַפָּ֔ר לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הַפָּֽר׃
Translated: Lead the bull up to the front of the Tent of Meeting, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the head of the bull.
Transliteration: vehikeraveta et-hafar lifeney ohel mvoed vesamakhe aharon uvanayv et-yedeyhem al-rosh hafar

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַפָּ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: Slaughter the bull before יהוה, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,
Transliteration: veshachateta et-hafar lifeney yehovah fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־קַרְנֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בְּאֶצְבָּעֶ֑ךָ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַדָּ֣ם תִּשְׁפֹּ֔ךְ אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: and take some of the bull’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; then pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
Transliteration: velakacheta midam hafar venatatah al-karenot hamizevecha veetsevaekha veet-khׇl-hadam tishefokhe el-yesvod hamizevecha

Hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֗ אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַחֵ֘לֶב֮ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֒רֶב֒ וְאֵ֗ת הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֑ן וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֖ הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
Translated: Take all the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, and the two kidneys with the fat on them, and turn them into smoke upon the altar.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-khׇl-hachelev hamekhaseh et-hakerev veet hayoteret al-hakhaved veet shetey hakhelayot veet-hachelev asher aleyhen vehiketareta hamizevechah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּשַׂ֤ר הַפָּר֙ וְאֶת־עֹר֣וֹ וְאֶת־פִּרְשׁ֔וֹ תִּשְׂרֹ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה חַטָּ֖את הֽוּא׃
Translated: The rest of the flesh of the bull, its hide, and its dung shall be put to the fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.
Transliteration: veet-veshar hafar veet-orvo veet-fireshvo tisherof vaesh michuts lamachaneh chatat hu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַ֥יִל הָאֶחָ֖ד תִּקָּ֑ח וְסָ֨מְכ֜וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
Translated: Next take the one ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.
Transliteration: veet-haayiil haechad tikach vesamekhu aharon uvanayv et-yedeyhem al-rosh haayiil

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָ֑יִל וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ וְזָרַקְתָּ֥ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Slaughter the ram, and take its blood and dash it against all sides of the altar.
Transliteration: veshachateta et-haayiil velakacheta et-damvo vezaraketa al-hamizevecha saviyv

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־הָאַ֔יִל תְּנַתֵּ֖חַ לִנְתָחָ֑יו וְרָחַצְתָּ֤ קִרְבּוֹ֙ וּכְרָעָ֔יו וְנָתַתָּ֥ עַל־נְתָחָ֖יו וְעַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: Cut up the ram into sections, wash its entrails and legs, and put them with its quarters and its head.
Transliteration: veet-haayiil tenatecha linetachayv verachatseta kirevvo ukheraayv venatata al-netachayv veal-roshvo

Hebrew: וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֤ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאַ֙יִל֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֥ה ה֖וּא לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה רֵ֣יחַ נִיח֔וֹחַ אִשֶּׁ֥ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: Turn all of the ram into smoke upon the altar. It is a burnt offering to יהוה, a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: vehiketareta et-khׇl-haayiil hamizevechah olah hu layhovah reycha niychvocha isheh layhovah hu

Hebrew: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת הָאַ֣יִל הַשֵּׁנִ֑י וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
Translated: Then take the other ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.
Transliteration: velakacheta et haayiil hasheniy vesamakhe aharon uvanayv et-yedeyhem al-rosh haayiil

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֣ אֶת־הָאַ֗יִל וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ מִדָּמוֹ֙ וְנָֽתַתָּ֡ה עַל־תְּנוּךְ֩ אֹ֨זֶן אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְעַל־תְּנ֨וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן בָּנָיו֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְלָ֖ם הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְזָרַקְתָּ֧ אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Slaughter the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the ridge of Aaron’s right ear and on the ridges of his sons’ right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and dash the rest of the blood against every side of the altar round about.
Transliteration: veshachateta et-haayiil velakacheta midamvo venatatah al-tenukhe ozen aharon veal-tenukhe ozen vanayv hayemaniyt veal-vohen yadam hayemaniyt veal-vohen ragelam hayemaniyt vezaraketa et-hadam al-hamizevecha saviyv

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ מִן־הַדָּ֨ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֘חַ֮ וּמִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֒ וְהִזֵּיתָ֤ עַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְעַל־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְעַל־בָּנָ֛יו וְעַל־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וְקָדַ֥שׁ הוּא֙ וּבְגָדָ֔יו וּבָנָ֛יו וּבִגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle upon Aaron and his vestments, and also upon his sons and his sons’ vestments. Thus shall he and his vestments be holy, as well as his sons and his sons’ vestments.
Transliteration: velakacheta min-hadam asher al-hamizevecha umishemen hamishechah vehizeyta al-aharon veal-vegadayv veal-vanayv veal-vigedey vanayv itvo vekadash hu uvegadayv uvanayv uvigedey vanayv itvo

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ מִן־הָ֠אַ֠יִל הַחֵ֨לֶב וְהָֽאַלְיָ֜ה וְאֶת־הַחֵ֣לֶב ׀ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֗רֶב וְאֵ֨ת יֹתֶ֤רֶת הַכָּבֵד֙ וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֗ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֑ין כִּ֛י אֵ֥יל מִלֻּאִ֖ים הֽוּא׃
Translated: You shall take from the ram the fat parts—the broad tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, the two kidneys with the fat on them—and the right thigh; for this is a ram of ordination.
Transliteration: velakacheta min-haayiil hachelev vehaaleyah veet-hachelev hamekhaseh et-hakerev veet yoteret hakhaved veet shetey hakhelayot veet-hachelev asher aleyhen veet shvok hayamiyn khiy eyl miluiym hu

Hebrew: וְכִכַּ֨ר לֶ֜חֶם אַחַ֗ת וְֽחַלַּ֨ת לֶ֥חֶם שֶׁ֛מֶן אַחַ֖ת וְרָקִ֣יק אֶחָ֑ד מִסַּל֙ הַמַּצּ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Add one flat loaf of bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, from the basket of unleavened bread that is before יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhikhar lechem achat vechalat lechem shemen achat verakiyk echad misal hamatsvot asher lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ הַכֹּ֔ל עַ֚ל כַּפֵּ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְעַ֖ל כַּפֵּ֣י בָנָ֑יו וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Place all these on the palms of Aaron and his sons, and offer them as an elevation offering before יהוה.
Transliteration: veshameta hakhol al khafey aharon veal khafey vanayv vehenafeta otam tenufah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ מִיָּדָ֔ם וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֥ הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חָה עַל־הָעֹלָ֑ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיח֙וֹחַ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אִשֶּׁ֥ה ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Take them from their hands and turn them into smoke upon the altar with the burnt offering, as a pleasing odor before יהוה; it is an offering by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: velakacheta otam miyadam vehiketareta hamizevechah al-haolah lereycha niychvocha lifeney yehovah isheh hu layhovah

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הֶֽחָזֶ֗ה מֵאֵ֤יל הַמִּלֻּאִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמָנָֽה׃
Translated: Then take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination and offer it as an elevation offering before יהוה; it shall be your portion.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-hechazeh meeyl hamiluiym asher leaharon vehenafeta otvo tenufah lifeney yehovah vehayah lekha lemanah

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֞ אֵ֣ת ׀ חֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוּנַ֖ף וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר הוּרָ֑ם מֵאֵיל֙ הַמִּלֻּאִ֔ים מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְבָנָֽיו׃
Translated: You shall consecrate the breast that was offered as an elevation offering and the thigh that was offered as a gift offering from the ram of ordination—from that which was Aaron’s and from that which was his sons’—
Transliteration: vekidasheta et chazeh hatenufah veet shvok haterumah asher hunaf vaasher huram meeyl hamiluiym measher leaharon umeasher levanayv

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ לְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וּלְבָנָ֜יו לְחׇק־עוֹלָ֗ם מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י תְרוּמָ֖ה ה֑וּא וּתְרוּמָ֞ה יִהְיֶ֨ה מֵאֵ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִזִּבְחֵ֣י שַׁלְמֵיהֶ֔ם תְּרוּמָתָ֖ם לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and those parts shall be a due for all time from the Israelites to Aaron and his sons. For they are a gift; and so shall they be a gift from the Israelites, their gift to יהוה out of their sacrifices of well-being.
Transliteration: vehayah leaharon ulevanayv lechׇk-volam meet veney yisherael khiy terumah hu uterumah yiheyeh meet veney-yisherael mizivechey shalemeyhem terumatam layhovah

Hebrew: וּבִגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן יִהְי֥וּ לְבָנָ֖יו אַחֲרָ֑יו לְמׇשְׁחָ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם וּלְמַלֵּא־בָ֖ם אֶת־יָדָֽם׃
Translated: The sacral vestments of Aaron shall pass on to his sons after him, for them to be anointed and ordained in.
Transliteration: uvigedey hakodesh asher leaharon yiheyu levanayv acharayv lemׇshechah vahem ulemale-vam et-yadam

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יִלְבָּשָׁ֧ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן תַּחְתָּ֖יו מִבָּנָ֑יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֛א אֶל־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֥ת בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: He among his sons who becomes priest in his stead, who enters the Tent of Meeting to officiate within the sanctuary, shall wear them seven days.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym yilevasham hakhohen tachetayv mivanayv asher yavo el-ohel mvoed lesharet vakodesh

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת אֵ֥יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֖ים תִּקָּ֑ח וּבִשַּׁלְתָּ֥ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בְּמָקֹ֥ם קָדֹֽשׁ׃
Translated: You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in the sacred precinct;
Transliteration: veet eyl hamiluiym tikach uvishaleta et-vesharvo vemakom kadosh

Hebrew: וְאָכַ֨ל אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר הָאַ֔יִל וְאֶת־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסָּ֑ל פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: veakhal aharon uvanayv et-veshar haayiil veet-halechem asher vasal fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְאָכְל֤וּ אֹתָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כֻּפַּ֣ר בָּהֶ֔ם לְמַלֵּ֥א אֶת־יָדָ֖ם לְקַדֵּ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑ם וְזָ֥ר לֹא־יֹאכַ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֵֽם׃
Translated: These things shall be eaten only by those for whom expiation was made with them when they were ordained and consecrated; they may not be eaten by a lay person, for they are holy.
Transliteration: veakhelu otam asher khufar vahem lemale et-yadam lekadesh otam vezar lo-yokhal khiy-kodesh hem

Hebrew: וְֽאִם־יִוָּתֵ֞ר מִבְּשַׂ֧ר הַמִּלֻּאִ֛ים וּמִן־הַלֶּ֖חֶם עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר וְשָׂרַפְתָּ֤ אֶת־הַנּוֹתָר֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֽוּא׃
Translated: And if any of the flesh of ordination, or any of the bread, is left until morning, you shall put what is left to the fire; it shall not be eaten, for it is holy.
Transliteration: veim-yivater miveshar hamiluiym umin-halechem ad-havoker vesharafeta et-hanvotar vaesh lo eiakhel khiy-kodesh hu

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ לְאַהֲרֹ֤ן וּלְבָנָיו֙ כָּ֔כָה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּ֖יתִי אֹתָ֑כָה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תְּמַלֵּ֥א יָדָֽם׃
Translated: Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, just as I have commanded you. You shall ordain them through seven days,
Transliteration: veashiyta leaharon ulevanayv khakhah khekhol asher-tsiviytiy otakhah shiveat yamiym temale yadam

Hebrew: וּפַ֨ר חַטָּ֜את תַּעֲשֶׂ֤ה לַיּוֹם֙ עַל־הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים וְחִטֵּאתָ֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּכַפֶּרְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו וּמָֽשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֹת֖וֹ לְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: and each day you shall prepare a bull as a sin offering for expiation; you shall purge the altar by performing purification upon it, and you shall anoint it to consecrate it.
Transliteration: ufar chatat taasheh layyvom al-hakhifuriym vechiteta al-hamizevecha vekhaferekha alayv umashacheta otvo lekadeshvo

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים תְּכַפֵּר֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֖ אֹת֑וֹ וְהָיָ֤ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֔ים כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בַּמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: Seven days you shall perform purification for the altar to consecrate it, and the altar shall become most holy; whatever touches the altar shall become consecrated.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym tekhafer al-hamizevecha vekidasheta otvo vehayah hamizevecha kodesh kׇdashiym khׇl-hanogea vamizevecha yikedash {s}

Hebrew: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה שְׁנַ֥יִם לַיּ֖וֹם תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated: Now this is what you shall offer upon the altar: two yearling lambs each day, regularly.
Transliteration: vezeh asher taasheh al-hamizevecha khevashiym veney-shanah shenayiim layyvom tamiyd

Hebrew: אֶת־הַכֶּ֥בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה בַבֹּ֑קֶר וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight.
Transliteration: et-hakhevesh haechad taasheh vavoker veet hakhevesh hasheniy taasheh veyn haarevayiim

Hebrew: וְעִשָּׂרֹ֨ן סֹ֜לֶת בָּל֨וּל בְּשֶׁ֤מֶן כָּתִית֙ רֶ֣בַע הַהִ֔ין וְנֵ֕סֶךְ רְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִ֖ין יָ֑יִן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: There shall be a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in, and a libation of a quarter hin of wine for one lamb;
Transliteration: veisharon solet valul veshemen khatiyt reva hahiyn venesekhe reviyit hahiyn yayiin lakhevesh haechad

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֣ין הָעַרְבָּ֑יִם כְּמִנְחַ֨ת הַבֹּ֤קֶר וּכְנִסְכָּהּ֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֔הּ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight, repeating with it the meal offering of the morning with its libation—an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to יהוה,
Transliteration: veet hakhevesh hasheniy taasheh veyn haarevayiim kheminechat havoker ukhenisekhah taasheh-lah lereycha niychocha isheh layhovah

Hebrew: עֹלַ֤ת תָּמִיד֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אִוָּעֵ֤ד לָכֶם֙ שָׁ֔מָּה לְדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: a regular burnt offering throughout the generations, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before יהוה. For there I will meet with you, and there I will speak with you,
Transliteration: olat tamiyd ledoroteykhem fetach ohel-mvoed lifeney yehovah asher ivaed lakhem shamah ledaver eleykha sham

Hebrew: וְנֹעַדְתִּ֥י שָׁ֖מָּה לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנִקְדַּ֖שׁ בִּכְבֹדִֽי׃
Translated: and there I will meet with the Israelites, and it shall be sanctified by My Presence.
Transliteration: venoadetiy shamah liveney yisherael venikedash vikhevodiy

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתִּ֛י אֶת־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֧ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֛יו אֲקַדֵּ֖שׁ לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
Translated: I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I will consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve Me as priests.
Transliteration: vekidashetiy et-ohel mvoed veet-hamizevecha veet-aharon veet-vanayv akadesh lekhahen liy

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣כַנְתִּ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: I will abide among the Israelites, and I will be their God.
Transliteration: veshakhanetiy vetvokhe veney yisherael vehayiytiy lahem lelohiym

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֧אתִי אֹתָ֛ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לְשׇׁכְנִ֣י בְתוֹכָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: And they shall know that I יהוה am their God, who brought them out from the land of Egypt that I might abide among them—I, their God יהוה.
Transliteration: veyadeu khiy aniy yehovah eloheyhem asher hvotsetiy otam meerets mitserayiim leshׇkheniy vetvokham aniy yehovah eloheyhem {f}

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ מִקְטַ֣ר קְטֹ֑רֶת עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall make an altar for burning incense; make it of acacia wood.
Transliteration: veashiyta mizevecha miketar ketoret atsey shitiym taasheh otvo

Hebrew: אַמָּ֨ה אׇרְכּ֜וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה רׇחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֣וּעַ יִהְיֶ֔ה וְאַמָּתַ֖יִם קֹמָת֑וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: It shall be a cubit long and a cubit wide—it shall be square—and two cubits high, its horns of one piece with it.
Transliteration: amah ׇrekhvo veamah rׇchevvo ravua yiheyeh veamatayiim komatvo mimenu karenotayv

Hebrew: וְצִפִּיתָ֨ אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Overlay it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and make a gold molding for it round about.
Transliteration: vetsifiyta otvo zahav tahvor et-gagvo veet-kiyrotayv saviyv veet-karenotayv veashiyta lvo zer zahav saviyv

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ ׀ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו וְהָיָה֙ לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: And make two gold rings for it under its molding; make them on its two side walls, on opposite sides. They shall serve as holders for poles with which to carry it.
Transliteration: ushetey taveot zahav taasheh-lvo mitachat lezervo al shetey tsaleotayv taasheh al-sheney tsidayv vehayah levatiym levadiym lashet otvo vahemah

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
Transliteration: veashiyta et-havadiym atsey shitiym vetsifiyta otam zahav

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֑ת לִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Place it in front of the curtain that is over the Ark of the Pact—in front of the cover that is over the Pact—where I will meet with you.
Transliteration: venatatah otvo lifeney hafarokhet asher al-aron haedut lifeney hakhaforet asher al-haedut asher ivaed lekha shamah

Hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֥יר עָלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֖ן קְטֹ֣רֶת סַמִּ֑ים בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֗קֶר בְּהֵיטִיב֛וֹ אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֖ת יַקְטִירֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: On it Aaron shall burn aromatic incense: he shall burn it every morning when he tends the lamps,
Transliteration: vehiketiyr alayv aharon ketoret samiym vavoker vavoker veheytiyvvo et-hanerot yaketiyrenah

Hebrew: וּבְהַעֲלֹ֨ת אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֛ת בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם יַקְטִירֶ֑נָּה קְטֹ֧רֶת תָּמִ֛יד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: and Aaron shall burn it at twilight when he lights the lamps—a regular incense offering before יהוה throughout the ages.
Transliteration: uvehaalot aharon et-hanerot veyn haarevayiim yaketiyrenah ketoret tamiyd lifeney yehovah ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲל֥וּ עָלָ֛יו קְטֹ֥רֶת זָרָ֖ה וְעֹלָ֣ה וּמִנְחָ֑ה וְנֵ֕סֶךְ לֹ֥א תִסְּכ֖וּ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: You shall not offer alien incense on it, or a burnt offering or a meal offering; neither shall you pour a libation on it.
Transliteration: lo-taalu alayv ketoret zarah veolah uminechah venesekhe lo tisekhu alayv

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־קַרְנֹתָ֔יו אַחַ֖ת בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה מִדַּ֞ם חַטַּ֣את הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים אַחַ֤ת בַּשָּׁנָה֙ יְכַפֵּ֤ר עָלָיו֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם קֹֽדֶשׁ־קׇדָשִׁ֥ים ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Once a year Aaron shall perform purification upon its horns with blood of the sin offering of purification; purification shall be performed upon it once a year throughout the ages. It is most holy to יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhifer aharon al-karenotayv achat vashanah midam chatat hakhifuriym achat vashanah yekhafer alayv ledoroteykhem kodesh-kׇdashiym hu layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִשָּׂ֞א אֶת־רֹ֥אשׁ בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לִפְקֻדֵיהֶם֒ וְנָ֨תְנ֜וּ אִ֣ישׁ כֹּ֧פֶר נַפְשׁ֛וֹ לַיהֹוָ֖ה בִּפְקֹ֣ד אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בָהֶ֛ם נֶ֖גֶף בִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: When you take a census of the Israelite men according to their army enrollment, each shall pay יהוה a ransom for himself on being enrolled, that no plague may come upon them through their being enrolled.
Transliteration: khiy tisha et-rosh veney-yisherael lifekudeyhem venatenu iysh khofer nafeshvo layhovah vifekod otam velo-yiheyeh vahem negef vifekod otam

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה ׀ יִתְּנ֗וּ כׇּל־הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מַחֲצִ֥ית הַשֶּׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֤ים גֵּרָה֙ הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל מַחֲצִ֣ית הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל תְּרוּמָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: This is what everyone who is entered in the records shall pay: a half-shekel by the sanctuary weight—twenty gerahs to the shekel—a half-shekel as an offering to יהוה.
Transliteration: zeh yitenu khׇl-haover al-hafekudiym machatsiyt hashekel veshekel hakodesh esheriym gerah hashekel machatsiyt hashekel terumah layhovah

Hebrew: כֹּ֗ל הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה יִתֵּ֖ן תְּרוּמַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Everyone who is entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, shall give יהוה’s offering:
Transliteration: khol haover al-hafekudiym miven esheriym shanah vamaelah yiten terumat yehovah

Hebrew: הֶֽעָשִׁ֣יר לֹֽא־יַרְבֶּ֗ה וְהַדַּל֙ לֹ֣א יַמְעִ֔יט מִֽמַּחֲצִ֖ית הַשָּׁ֑קֶל לָתֵת֙ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: the rich shall not pay more and the poor shall not pay less than half a shekel when giving יהוה’s offering as expiation for your persons.
Transliteration: heashiyr lo-yareveh vehadal lo yameiyt mimachatsiyt hashakel latet et-terumat yehovah lekhafer al-nafeshoteykhem

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ אֶת־כֶּ֣סֶף הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֔וֹ עַל־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָיָה֩ לִבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל לְזִכָּרוֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall take the expiation money from the Israelites and assign it to the service of the Tent of Meeting; it shall serve the Israelites as a reminder before יהוה, as expiation for your persons.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-khesef hakhifuriym meet veney yisherael venatata otvo al-avodat ohel mvoed vehayah liveney yisherael lezikharvon lifeney yehovah lekhafer al-nafeshoteykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ כִּיּ֥וֹר נְחֹ֛שֶׁת וְכַנּ֥וֹ נְחֹ֖שֶׁת לְרׇחְצָ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֗וֹ בֵּֽין־אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְנָתַתָּ֥ שָׁ֖מָּה מָֽיִם׃
Translated: Make a laver of copper and a stand of copper for it, for washing; and place it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar. Put water in it,
Transliteration: veashiyta khiyyvor nechoshet vekhanvo nechoshet lerׇchetsah venatata otvo veyn-ohel mvoed uveyn hamizevecha venatata shamah mayiim

Hebrew: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּבָנָ֖יו מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: and let Aaron and his sons wash their hands and feet [in water drawn] from it.
Transliteration: verachatsu aharon uvanayv mimenu et-yedeyhem veet-rageleyhem

Hebrew: בְּבֹאָ֞ם אֶל־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד יִרְחֲצוּ־מַ֖יִם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ א֣וֹ בְגִשְׁתָּ֤ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לְשָׁרֵ֔ת לְהַקְטִ֥יר אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When they enter the Tent of Meeting they shall wash with water, that they may not die; or when they approach the altar to serve, to turn into smoke an offering by fire to יהוה,
Transliteration: vevoam el-ohel mvoed yirechatsu-mayiim velo yamutu vo vegishetam el-hamizevecha lesharet lehaketiyr isheh layhovah

Hebrew: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ יְדֵיהֶ֥ם וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ וְהָיְתָ֨ה לָהֶ֧ם חׇק־עוֹלָ֛ם ל֥וֹ וּלְזַרְע֖וֹ לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: they shall wash their hands and feet, that they may not die. It shall be a law for all time for them—for him and his offspring—throughout the ages.
Transliteration: verachatsu yedeyhem verageleyhem velo yamutu vehayetah lahem chׇk-volam lvo ulezarevo ledorotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֮ בְּשָׂמִ֣ים רֹאשׁ֒ מׇר־דְּרוֹר֙ חֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וְקִנְּמׇן־בֶּ֥שֶׂם מַחֲצִית֖וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם וּקְנֵה־בֹ֖שֶׂם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: Next take choice spices: five hundred weight of solidified myrrh, half as much—two hundred and fifty—of fragrant cinnamon, two hundred and fifty of aromatic cane,
Transliteration: veatah kach-lekha veshamiym rosh mׇr-dervor chamesh mevot vekinemׇn-veshem machatsiytvo chamishiym umatayiim ukeneh-voshem chamishiym umatayiim

Hebrew: וְקִדָּ֕ה חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְשֶׁ֥מֶן זַ֖יִת הִֽין׃
Translated: five hundred—by the sanctuary weight—of cassia, and a hin of olive oil.
Transliteration: vekidah chamesh mevot veshekel hakodesh veshemen zayiit hiyn

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ אֹת֗וֹ שֶׁ֚מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֔דֶשׁ רֹ֥קַח מִרְקַ֖חַת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑חַ שֶׁ֥מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Make of this a sacred anointing oil, a compound of ingredients expertly blended, to serve as sacred anointing oil.
Transliteration: veashiyta otvo shemen mishechat-kodesh rokach mirekachat maasheh rokecha shemen mishechat-kodesh yiheyeh

Hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ ב֖וֹ אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְאֵ֖ת אֲר֥וֹן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
Translated: With it anoint the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Pact,
Transliteration: umashacheta vvo et-ohel mvoed veet arvon haedut

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֖ה וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
Translated: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and all its fittings, the altar of incense,
Transliteration: veet-hashulechan veet-khׇl-khelayv veet-hamenorah veet-kheleyha veet mizevach haketoret

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
Translated: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand.
Transliteration: veet-mizevach haolah veet-khׇl-khelayv veet-hakhiyor veet-khanvo

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְהָי֖וּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֑ים כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהֶ֖ם יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃
Translated: Thus you shall consecrate them so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be consecrated.
Transliteration: vekidasheta otam vehayu kodesh kׇdashiym khׇl-hanogea vahem yikedash

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תִּמְשָׁ֑ח וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
Translated: You shall also anoint Aaron and his sons, consecrating them to serve Me as priests.
Transliteration: veet-aharon veet-vanayv timeshach vekidasheta otam lekhahen liy

Hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר שֶׁ֠מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֨דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה זֶ֛ה לִ֖י לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And speak to the Israelite people, as follows: This shall be an anointing oil sacred to Me throughout the ages.
Transliteration: veel-veney yisherael tedaver lemor shemen mishechat-kodesh yiheyeh zeh liy ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: עַל־בְּשַׂ֤ר אָדָם֙ לֹ֣א יִיסָ֔ךְ וּ֨בְמַתְכֻּנְתּ֔וֹ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ כָּמֹ֑הוּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ ה֔וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: It must not be rubbed on any person’s body, and you must not make anything like it in the same proportions; it is sacred, to be held sacred by you.
Transliteration: al-veshar adam lo yiysakhe uvematekhunetvo lo taashu khamohu kodesh hu kodesh yiheyeh lakhem

Hebrew: אִ֚ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִרְקַ֣ח כָּמֹ֔הוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִתֵּ֛ן מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַל־זָ֑ר וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Any party who compounds its like, or puts any of it on a lay person, shall be cut off from kin.
Transliteration: iysh asher yirekach khamohu vaasher yiten mimenu al-zar venikherat meamayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֜ה קַח־לְךָ֣ סַמִּ֗ים נָטָ֤ף <small>׀</small> וּשְׁחֵ֙לֶת֙ וְחֶלְבְּנָ֔ה סַמִּ֖ים וּלְבֹנָ֣ה זַכָּ֑ה בַּ֥ד בְּבַ֖ד יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses: Take the herbs stacte, onycha, and galbanum—these herbs together with pure frankincense; let there be an equal part of each.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh kach-lekha samiym nataf <small></small> ushechelet vechelevenah samiym ulevonah zakhah vad vevad yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֹתָהּ֙ קְטֹ֔רֶת רֹ֖קַח מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רוֹקֵ֑חַ מְמֻלָּ֖ח טָה֥וֹר קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: Make them into incense, a compound expertly blended, refined, pure, sacred.
Transliteration: veashiyta otah ketoret rokach maasheh rvokecha memulach tahvor kodesh

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁחַקְתָּ֣ מִמֶּ֘נָּה֮ הָדֵק֒ וְנָתַתָּ֨ה מִמֶּ֜נָּה לִפְנֵ֤י הָעֵדֻת֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָׁ֑מָּה קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֖ים תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Beat some of it into powder, and put some before the Pact in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.
Transliteration: veshachaketa mimenah hadek venatatah mimenah lifeney haedut veohel mvoed asher ivaed lekha shamah kodesh kׇdashiym tiheyeh lakhem

Hebrew: וְהַקְּטֹ֙רֶת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה בְּמַ֨תְכֻּנְתָּ֔הּ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶ֑ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But when you make this incense, you must not make any in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be held by you sacred to יהוה.
Transliteration: vehaketoret asher taasheh vematekhunetah lo taashu lakhem kodesh tiheyeh lekha layhovah

Hebrew: אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה כָמ֖וֹהָ לְהָרִ֣יחַ בָּ֑הּ וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Any party who makes any like it, to smell of it, shall be cut off from kin.
Transliteration: iysh asher-yaasheh khamvoha lehariycha vah venikherat meamayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: רְאֵ֖ה קָרָ֣אתִֽי בְשֵׁ֑ם בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: See, I have singled out by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
Transliteration: reeh karatiy veshem vetsaleel ven-uriy ven-chur lemateh yehudah

Hebrew: וָאֲמַלֵּ֥א אֹת֖וֹ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּחׇכְמָ֛ה וּבִתְבוּנָ֥ה וּבְדַ֖עַת וּבְכׇל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: I have endowed him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft;
Transliteration: vaamale otvo rucha Elohim vechׇkhemah uvitevunah uvedaat uvekhׇl-melakhah

Hebrew: לַחְשֹׁ֖ב מַחֲשָׁבֹ֑ת לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת בַּזָּהָ֥ב וּבַכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,
Transliteration: lacheshov machashavot laashvot vazahav uvakhesef uvanechoshet

Hebrew: וּבַחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת אֶ֛בֶן לְמַלֹּ֖את וּבַחֲרֹ֣שֶׁת עֵ֑ץ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּכׇל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of craft.
Transliteration: uvacharoshet even lemalot uvacharoshet ets laashvot vekhׇl-melakhah

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י הִנֵּ֧ה נָתַ֣תִּי אִתּ֗וֹ אֵ֣ת אׇהֳלִיאָ֞ב בֶּן־אֲחִֽיסָמָךְ֙ לְמַטֵּה־דָ֔ן וּבְלֵ֥ב כׇּל־חֲכַם־לֵ֖ב נָתַ֣תִּי חׇכְמָ֑ה וְעָשׂ֕וּ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִֽךָ׃
Translated: Moreover, I have assigned to him Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and I have also granted skill to all who are skillful, that they may make everything that I have commanded you:
Transliteration: vaaniy hineh natatiy itvo et ׇholiyav ven-achiysamakhe lemateh-dan uvelev khׇl-chakham-lev natatiy chׇkhemah veashu et khׇl-asher tsiviytikha

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד וְאֶת־הָֽאָרֹן֙ לָֽעֵדֻ֔ת וְאֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֖רֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־כְּלֵ֥י הָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: the Tent of Meeting, the Ark for the Pact and the cover upon it, and all the furnishings of the Tent;
Transliteration: et ohel mvoed veet-haaron laedut veet-hakhaforet asher alayv veet khׇl-kheley haohel

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְאֶת־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֥ה הַטְּהֹרָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
Translated: the table and its utensils, the pure lampstand and all its fittings, and the altar of incense;
Transliteration: veet-hashulechan veet-khelayv veet-hamenorah hatehorah veet-khׇl-kheleyha veet mizevach haketoret

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיּ֖וֹר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
Translated: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand;
Transliteration: veet-mizevach haolah veet-khׇl-khelayv veet-hakhiyyvor veet-khanvo

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖ת בִּגְדֵ֣י הַשְּׂרָ֑ד וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
Translated: the service vestments, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons, for their service as priests;
Transliteration: veet vigedey hasherad veet-vigedey hakodesh leaharon hakhohen veet-vigedey vanayv lekhahen

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת שֶׁ֧מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֛ה וְאֶת־קְטֹ֥רֶת הַסַּמִּ֖ים לַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּיתִ֖ךָ יַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: as well as the anointing oil and the aromatic incense for the sanctuary. Just as I have commanded you, they shall do.
Transliteration: veet shemen hamishechah veet-ketoret hasamiym lakodesh khekhol asher-tsiviytikha yaashu {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses:
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַ֥ךְ אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֖י תִּשְׁמֹ֑רוּ כִּי֩ א֨וֹת הִ֜וא בֵּינִ֤י וּבֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם לָדַ֕עַת כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say: Nevertheless, you must keep My sabbaths, for this is a sign between Me and you throughout the ages, that you may know that I יהוה have consecrated you.
Transliteration: veatah daver el-veney yisherael lemor akhe et-shavetotay tishemoru khiy vot hiv veyniy uveyneykhem ledoroteykhem ladaat khiy aniy yehovah mekadishekhem

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת כִּ֛י קֹ֥דֶשׁ הִ֖וא לָכֶ֑ם מְחַֽלְלֶ֙יהָ֙ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֔ת כִּ֗י כׇּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה בָהּ֙ מְלָאכָ֔ה וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated: You shall keep the sabbath, for it is holy for you. One who profanes it shall be put to death: whoever does work on it, that person shall be cut off from among kin.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-hashavat khiy kodesh hiv lakhem mechaleleyha mvot yumat khiy khׇl-haosheh vah melakhah venikheretah hanefesh hahiv mikerev ameyha

Hebrew: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י שַׁבַּ֧ת שַׁבָּת֛וֹן קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָ֑ה כׇּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֧ה מְלָאכָ֛ה בְּי֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: Six days may work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, holy to יהוה; whoever does work on the sabbath day shall be put to death.
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym eiasheh melakhah uvayyvom hasheviyiy shavat shavatvon kodesh layhovah khׇl-haosheh melakhah veyvom hashavat mvot yumat

Hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת לַעֲשׂ֧וֹת אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֛ת לְדֹרֹתָ֖ם בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: The Israelite people shall keep the sabbath, observing the sabbath throughout the ages as a covenant for all time:
Transliteration: veshameru veney-yisherael et-hashavat laashvot et-hashavat ledorotam veriyt volam

Hebrew: בֵּינִ֗י וּבֵין֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל א֥וֹת הִ֖וא לְעֹלָ֑ם כִּי־שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י שָׁבַ֖ת וַיִּנָּפַֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: it shall be a sign for all time between Me and the people of Israel. For in six days יהוה made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day [God] ceased from work and was refreshed.
Transliteration: veyniy uveyn veney yisherael vot hiv leolam khiy-sheshet yamiym ashah yehovah et-hashamayiim veet-haarets uvayyvom hasheviyiy shavat vayinafash {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כְּכַלֹּתוֹ֙ לְדַבֵּ֤ר אִתּוֹ֙ בְּהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י שְׁנֵ֖י לֻחֹ֣ת הָעֵדֻ֑ת לֻחֹ֣ת אֶ֔בֶן כְּתֻבִ֖ים בְּאֶצְבַּ֥ע אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Upon finishing speaking with him on Mount Sinai, [God] gave Moses the two tablets of the Pact, stone tablets inscribed with the finger of God.
Transliteration: vayiten el-mosheh khekhalotvo ledaver itvo vehar siynay sheney luchot haedut luchot even khetuviym veetseva Elohim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא הָעָ֔ם כִּֽי־בֹשֵׁ֥שׁ מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָרֶ֣דֶת מִן־הָהָ֑ר וַיִּקָּהֵ֨ל הָעָ֜ם עַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ ק֣וּם ׀ עֲשֵׂה־לָ֣נוּ אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֵֽלְכוּ֙ לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ כִּי־זֶ֣ה ׀ מֹשֶׁ֣ה הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶֽעֱלָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְנוּ מֶה־הָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
Translated: When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, the people gathered against Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us a god who shall go before us, for that fellow Moses—the man who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.”
Transliteration: vayare haam khiy-voshesh mosheh laredet min-hahar vayikahel haam al-aharon vayomeru elayv kum asheh-lanu Elohim asher eilekhu lefaneynu khiy-zeh mosheh haiysh asher heelanu meerets mitserayiim lo yadaenu meh-hayah lvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אַהֲרֹ֔ן פָּֽרְקוּ֙ נִזְמֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י נְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם בְּנֵיכֶ֖ם וּבְנֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָבִ֖יאוּ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: Aaron said to them, “[You men,] take off the gold rings that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem aharon fareku nizemey hazahav asher veׇzeney nesheykhem veneykhem uvenoteykhem vehaviyu elay

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפָּֽרְקוּ֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אֶת־נִזְמֵ֥י הַזָּהָ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיָּבִ֖יאוּ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: And all the people took off the gold rings that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
Transliteration: vayitefareku khׇl-haam et-nizemey hazahav asher veׇzeneyhem vayaviyu el-aharon

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח מִיָּדָ֗ם וַיָּ֤צַר אֹתוֹ֙ בַּחֶ֔רֶט וַֽיַּעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ עֵ֣גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֤לֶּה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱל֖וּךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: This he took from them and cast in a mold, and made it into a molten calf. And they exclaimed, “This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!”
Transliteration: vayikach miyadam vayatsar otvo vacheret vayaashehu egel masekhah vayomeru eleh eloheykha yisherael asher heelukha meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא אַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לְפָנָ֑יו וַיִּקְרָ֤א אַֽהֲרֹן֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר חַ֥ג לַיהֹוָ֖ה מָחָֽר׃
Translated: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron announced: “Tomorrow shall be a festival of יהוה!”
Transliteration: vayare aharon vayiven mizevecha lefanayv vayikera aharon vayomar chag layhovah machar

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֙ימוּ֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיַּעֲל֣וּ עֹלֹ֔ת וַיַּגִּ֖שׁוּ שְׁלָמִ֑ים וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב הָעָם֙ לֶֽאֱכֹ֣ל וְשָׁת֔וֹ וַיָּקֻ֖מוּ לְצַחֵֽק׃ {פ}
Translated: Early next day, the people offered up burnt offerings and brought sacrifices of well-being; they sat down to eat and drink, and then rose to dance.
Transliteration: vayashekhiymu mimׇchorat vayaalu olot vayagishu shelamiym vayeshev haam leekhol veshatvo vayakumu letsachek {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה לֶךְ־רֵ֕ד כִּ֚י שִׁחֵ֣ת עַמְּךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱלֵ֖יתָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, “Hurry down, for your people, whom you brought out of the land of Egypt, have acted basely.
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lekhe-red khiy shichet amekha asher heeleyta meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: סָ֣רוּ מַהֵ֗ר מִן־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ם עָשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם עֵ֖גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־לוֹ֙ וַיִּזְבְּחוּ־ל֔וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֤לֶּה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶֽעֱל֖וּךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They have been quick to turn aside from the way that I enjoined upon them. They have made themselves a molten calf and bowed low to it and sacrificed to it, saying: ‘This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!’”
Transliteration: saru maher min-haderekhe asher tsiviytim ashu lahem egel masekhah vayishetachavu-lvo vayizevechu-lvo vayomeru eleh eloheykha yisherael asher heelukha meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֖רֶף הֽוּא׃
Translated: יהוה further said to Moses, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh raiytiy et-haam hazeh vehineh am-kesheh-oref hu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הַנִּ֣יחָה לִּ֔י וְיִֽחַר־אַפִּ֥י בָהֶ֖ם וַאֲכַלֵּ֑ם וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ לְג֥וֹי גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: Now, let Me be, that My anger may blaze forth against them and that I may destroy them, and make of you a great nation.”
Transliteration: veatah haniychah liy veyichar-afiy vahem vaakhalem veeesheh votekha legvoy gadvol

Hebrew: וַיְחַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לָמָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ יֶחֱרֶ֤ה אַפְּךָ֙ בְּעַמֶּ֔ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵ֙אתָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּכֹ֥חַ גָּד֖וֹל וּבְיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
Translated: But Moses implored his God יהוה, saying, “Let not Your anger, יהוה, blaze forth against Your people, whom You delivered from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand.
Transliteration: vayechal mosheh et-feney yehovah elohayv vayomer lamah yehovah yechereh afekha veamekha asher hvotseta meerets mitserayiim vekhocha gadvol uveyad chazakah

Hebrew: לָ֩מָּה֩ יֹאמְר֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם לֵאמֹ֗ר בְּרָעָ֤ה הֽוֹצִיאָם֙ לַהֲרֹ֤ג אֹתָם֙ בֶּֽהָרִ֔ים וּ֨לְכַלֹּתָ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה שׁ֚וּב מֵחֲר֣וֹן אַפֶּ֔ךָ וְהִנָּחֵ֥ם עַל־הָרָעָ֖ה לְעַמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Let not the Egyptians say, ‘It was with evil intent that he delivered them, only to kill them off in the mountains and annihilate them from the face of the earth.’ Turn from Your blazing anger, and renounce the plan to punish Your people.
Transliteration: lamah yomeru mitserayiim lemor veraah hvotsiyam laharog otam vehariym ulekhalotam meal feney haadamah shuv mecharvon afekha vehinachem al-haraah leamekha

Hebrew: זְכֹ֡ר לְאַבְרָהָם֩ לְיִצְחָ֨ק וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתָּ לָהֶם֮ בָּךְ֒ וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַרְבֶּה֙ אֶֽת־זַרְעֲכֶ֔ם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֖י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְכׇל־הָאָ֨רֶץ הַזֹּ֜את אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֗רְתִּי אֶתֵּן֙ לְזַרְעֲכֶ֔ם וְנָחֲל֖וּ לְעֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, how You swore to them by Your Self and said to them: I will make your offspring as numerous as the stars of heaven, and I will give to your offspring this whole land of which I spoke, to possess forever.”
Transliteration: zekhor leaveraham leyitsechak uleyisherael avadeykha asher nishevaeta lahem vakhe vatedaver alehem areveh et-zareakhem khekhvokhevey hashamayiim vekhׇl-haarets hazot asher amaretiy eten lezareakhem venachalu leolam

Hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֖חֶם יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לְעַמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: And יהוה renounced the punishment planned for God’s people.
Transliteration: vayinachem yehovah al-haraah asher diver laashvot leamvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּ֜פֶן וַיֵּ֤רֶד מֹשֶׁה֙ מִן־הָהָ֔ר וּשְׁנֵ֛י לֻחֹ֥ת הָעֵדֻ֖ת בְּיָד֑וֹ לֻחֹ֗ת כְּתֻבִים֙ מִשְּׁנֵ֣י עֶבְרֵיהֶ֔ם מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה הֵ֥ם כְּתֻבִֽים׃
Translated: Thereupon Moses turned and went down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, tablets inscribed on both their surfaces: they were inscribed on the one side and on the other.
Transliteration: vayifen vayered mosheh min-hahar usheney luchot haedut veyadvo luchot khetuviym misheney evereyhem mizeh umizeh hem khetuviym

Hebrew: וְהַ֨לֻּחֹ֔ת מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים הֵ֑מָּה וְהַמִּכְתָּ֗ב מִכְתַּ֤ב אֱלֹהִים֙ ה֔וּא חָר֖וּת עַל־הַלֻּחֹֽת׃
Translated: The tablets were God’s work, and the writing was God’s writing, incised upon the tablets.
Transliteration: vehaluchot maasheh Elohim hemah vehamikhetav mikhetav Elohim hu charut al-haluchot

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֧ע יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־ק֥וֹל הָעָ֖ם בְּרֵעֹ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה ק֥וֹל מִלְחָמָ֖ה בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: When Joshua heard the sound of the people in its boisterousness, he said to Moses, “There is a cry of war in the camp.”
Transliteration: vayishema yehvoshua et-kvol haam vereoh vayomer el-mosheh kvol milechamah vamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֵ֥ין קוֹל֙ עֲנ֣וֹת גְּבוּרָ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין ק֖וֹל עֲנ֣וֹת חֲלוּשָׁ֑ה ק֣וֹל עַנּ֔וֹת אָנֹכִ֖י שֹׁמֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
But he answered,
“It is not the sound of the tune of triumph,
Or the sound of the tune of defeat;
It is the sound of song that I hear!”
Transliteration: vayomer eyn kvol anvot gevurah veeyn kvol anvot chalushah kvol anvot anokhiy shomea

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר קָרַב֙ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיַּ֥רְא אֶת־הָעֵ֖גֶל וּמְחֹלֹ֑ת וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֣ף מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיַּשְׁלֵ֤ךְ מִיָּדָו֙ אֶת־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת וַיְשַׁבֵּ֥ר אֹתָ֖ם תַּ֥חַת הָהָֽר׃
Translated: As soon as Moses came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, he became enraged; and he hurled the tablets from his hands and shattered them at the foot of the mountain.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher karav el-hamachaneh vayare et-haegel umecholot vayichar-af mosheh vayashelekhe miyadav et-haluchot vayeshaver otam tachat hahar

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־הָעֵ֨גֶל אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ וַיִּשְׂרֹ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ וַיִּטְחַ֖ן עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁר־דָּ֑ק וַיִּ֙זֶר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַמַּ֔יִם וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He took the calf that they had made and burned it; he ground it to powder and strewed it upon the water and so made the Israelites drink it.
Transliteration: vayikach et-haegel asher ashu vayisherof vaesh vayitechan ad asher-dak vayizer al-feney hamayiim vayasheke et-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן מֶֽה־עָשָׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־הֵבֵ֥אתָ עָלָ֖יו חֲטָאָ֥ה גְדֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought such great sin upon them?”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon meh-ashah lekha haam hazeh khiy-heveta alayv chataah gedolah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַהֲרֹ֔ן אַל־יִ֥חַר אַ֖ף אֲדֹנִ֑י אַתָּה֙ יָדַ֣עְתָּ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י בְרָ֖ע הֽוּא׃
Translated: Aaron said, “Let not my lord be enraged. You know that this people is bent on evil.
Transliteration: vayomer aharon al-yichar af adoniy atah yadaeta et-haam khiy vera hu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לִ֔י עֲשֵׂה־לָ֣נוּ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֵלְכ֖וּ לְפָנֵ֑ינוּ כִּי־זֶ֣ה ׀ מֹשֶׁ֣ה הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶֽעֱלָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְנוּ מֶה־הָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
Translated: They said to me, ‘Make us a god to lead us; for that fellow Moses—the man who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.’
Transliteration: vayomeru liy asheh-lanu Elohim asher eilekhu lefaneynu khiy-zeh mosheh haiysh asher heelanu meerets mitserayiim lo yadaenu meh-hayah lvo

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֤ר לָהֶם֙ לְמִ֣י זָהָ֔ב הִתְפָּרָ֖קוּ וַיִּתְּנוּ־לִ֑י וָאַשְׁלִכֵ֣הוּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וַיֵּצֵ֖א הָעֵ֥גֶל הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off!’ They gave it to me and I hurled it into the fire and out came this calf!”
Transliteration: vaomar lahem lemiy zahav hitefaraku vayitenu-liy vaashelikhehu vaesh vayetse haegel hazeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י פָרֻ֖עַ ה֑וּא כִּֽי־פְרָעֹ֣ה אַהֲרֹ֔ן לְשִׁמְצָ֖ה בְּקָמֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Moses saw that the people were out of control—since Aaron had let them get out of control—so that they were a menace to any who might oppose them.
Transliteration: vayare mosheh et-haam khiy farua hu khiy-feraoh aharon leshimetsah vekameyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֥י לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וַיֵּאָסְפ֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
Translated: Moses stood up in the gate of the camp and said, “Whoever is for יהוה, come here!” And all the men of Levi rallied to him.
Transliteration: vayaamod mosheh veshaar hamachaneh vayomer miy layhovah elay vayeasefu elayv khׇl-veney leviy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׂ֥ימוּ אִישׁ־חַרְבּ֖וֹ עַל־יְרֵכ֑וֹ עִבְר֨וּ וָשׁ֜וּבוּ מִשַּׁ֤עַר לָשַׁ֙עַר֙ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְהִרְג֧וּ אִֽישׁ־אֶת־אָחִ֛יו וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־קְרֹבֽוֹ׃
Translated: He said to them, “Thus says יהוה, the God of Israel: Each of you put sword on thigh, go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay sibling, neighbor, and kin.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael shiymu iysh-charevvo al-yerekhvo iveru vashuvu mishaar lashaar vamachaneh vehiregu iysh-et-achiyv veiysh et-reehu veiysh et-kerovvo

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־לֵוִ֖י כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּפֹּ֤ל מִן־הָעָם֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כִּשְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אַלְפֵ֖י אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The men of Levi did as Moses had bidden; and some three thousand of the people fell that day.
Transliteration: vayaashu veney-leviy khidevar mosheh vayifol min-haam vayyvom hahu khisheloshet alefey iysh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה מִלְא֨וּ יֶדְכֶ֤ם הַיּוֹם֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ בִּבְנ֖וֹ וּבְאָחִ֑יו וְלָתֵ֧ת עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם בְּרָכָֽה׃
Translated: And Moses said, “Dedicate yourselves to יהוה this day—for each of you has been against blood relations—that [God] may bestow a blessing upon you today.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh mileu yedekhem hayyvom layhovah khiy iysh vivenvo uveachiyv velatet aleykhem hayyvom verakhah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם אַתֶּ֥ם חֲטָאתֶ֖ם חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֑ה וְעַתָּה֙ אֶֽעֱלֶ֣ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה אוּלַ֥י אֲכַפְּרָ֖ה בְּעַ֥ד חַטַּאתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: The next day Moses said to the people, “You have been guilty of a great sin. Yet I will now go up to יהוה; perhaps I may win forgiveness for your sin.”
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayomer mosheh el-haam atem chatatem chataah gedolah veatah eeleh el-yehovah ulay akhaferah vead chatatekhem

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שׇׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אָ֣נָּ֗א חָטָ֞א הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֔ה וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Moses went back to יהוה and said, “Alas, this people is guilty of a great sin in making for themselves a god of gold.
Transliteration: vayashׇv mosheh el-yehovah vayomar ana chata haam hazeh chataah gedolah vayaashu lahem elohey zahav

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה אִם־תִּשָּׂ֣א חַטָּאתָ֑ם וְאִם־אַ֕יִן מְחֵ֣נִי נָ֔א מִֽסִּפְרְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּתָֽבְתָּ׃
Translated: Now, if You will forgive their sin [well and good]; but if not, erase me from the record which You have written!”
Transliteration: veatah im-tisha chatatam veim-ayiin mecheniy na misiferekha asher khataveta

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה מִ֚י אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָֽטָא־לִ֔י אֶמְחֶ֖נּוּ מִסִּפְרִֽי׃
Translated: But יהוה said to Moses, “Only one who has sinned against Me will I erase from My record.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh miy asher chata-liy emechenu misiferiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה לֵ֣ךְ ׀ נְחֵ֣ה אֶת־הָעָ֗ם אֶ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ לָ֔ךְ הִנֵּ֥ה מַלְאָכִ֖י יֵלֵ֣ךְ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וּבְי֣וֹם פׇּקְדִ֔י וּפָקַדְתִּ֥י עֲלֵהֶ֖ם חַטָּאתָֽם׃
Translated: Go now, lead the people where I told you. See, My messenger shall go before you. But when I make an accounting, I will bring them to account for their sins.”
Transliteration: veatah lekhe necheh et-haam el asher-divaretiy lakhe hineh maleakhiy eilekhe lefaneykha uveyvom fׇkediy ufakadetiy alehem chatatam

Hebrew: וַיִּגֹּ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הָעָ֑ם עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הָעֵ֔גֶל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה אַהֲרֹֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Then יהוה sent a plague upon the people, for what they did with the calf that Aaron made.
Transliteration: vayigof yehovah et-haam al asher ashu et-haegel asher ashah aharon {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ לֵ֣ךְ עֲלֵ֣ה מִזֶּ֔ה אַתָּ֣ה וְהָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶֽעֱלִ֖יתָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֠שְׁבַּ֠עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֨ם לְיִצְחָ֤ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹב֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Set out from here, you and the people that you have brought up from the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your offspring will I give it’—
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lekhe aleh mizeh atah vehaam asher heeliyta meerets mitserayiim el-haarets asher nishevaetiy leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov lemor lezareakha etenenah

Hebrew: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י לְפָנֶ֖יךָ מַלְאָ֑ךְ וְגֵֽרַשְׁתִּ֗י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י וְהַֽחִתִּי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
Translated: I will send a messenger before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—
Transliteration: veshalachetiy lefaneykha maleakhe vegerashetiy et-hakhenaaniy haemoriy vehachitiy vehaferiziy hachiviy vehayevusiy

Hebrew: אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ כִּי֩ לֹ֨א אֶֽעֱלֶ֜ה בְּקִרְבְּךָ֗ כִּ֤י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֙רֶף֙ אַ֔תָּה פֶּן־אֲכֶלְךָ֖ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: a land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go in your midst, since you are a stiffnecked people, lest I destroy you on the way.”
Transliteration: el-erets zavat chalav udevash khiy lo eeleh vekirevekha khiy am-kesheh-oref atah fen-akhelekha vadarekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע הָעָ֗ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הָרָ֛ע הַזֶּ֖ה וַיִּתְאַבָּ֑לוּ וְלֹא־שָׁ֛תוּ אִ֥ישׁ עֶדְי֖וֹ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: When the people heard this harsh word, they went into mourning, and none put on finery.
Transliteration: vayishema haam et-hadavar hara hazeh vayiteavalu velo-shatu iysh edeyvo alayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֱמֹ֤ר אֶל־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אַתֶּ֣ם עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֔רֶף רֶ֧גַע אֶחָ֛ד אֶֽעֱלֶ֥ה בְקִרְבְּךָ֖ וְכִלִּיתִ֑יךָ וְעַתָּ֗ה הוֹרֵ֤ד עֶדְיְךָ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְאֵדְעָ֖ה מָ֥ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Say to the Israelite people, ‘You are a stiffnecked people. If I were to go in your midst for one moment, I would destroy you. Now, then, leave off your finery, and I will consider what to do to you.’”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh emor el-veney-yisherael atem am-kesheh-oref rega echad eeleh vekirevekha vekhiliytiykha veatah hvored edeyekha mealeykha veedeah mah eesheh-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְנַצְּל֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־עֶדְיָ֖ם מֵהַ֥ר חוֹרֵֽב׃
Translated: So the Israelites remained stripped of their finery from Mount Horeb on.
Transliteration: vayitenatselu veney-yisherael et-edeyam mehar chvorev

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁה֩ יִקַּ֨ח אֶת־הָאֹ֜הֶל וְנָֽטָה־ל֣וֹ ׀ מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֗ה הַרְחֵק֙ מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְקָ֥רָא ל֖וֹ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָיָה֙ כׇּל־מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה יֵצֵא֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Now Moses would take the Tent and pitch it outside the camp, at some distance from the camp. It was called the Tent of Meeting, and whoever sought יהוה would go out to the Tent of Meeting that was outside the camp.
Transliteration: umosheh yikach et-haohel venatah-lvo michuts lamachaneh harechek min-hamachaneh vekara lvo ohel mvoed vehayah khׇl-mevakesh yehovah eitse el-ohel mvoed asher michuts lamachaneh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כְּצֵ֤את מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָאֹ֔הֶל יָק֙וּמוּ֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם וְנִ֨צְּב֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ פֶּ֣תַח אׇהֳל֑וֹ וְהִבִּ֙יטוּ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַד־בֹּא֖וֹ הָאֹֽהֱלָה׃
Translated: Whenever Moses went out to the Tent, all the people would rise and stand, at the entrance of each tent, and gaze after Moses until he had entered the Tent.
Transliteration: vehayah khetset mosheh el-haohel yakumu khׇl-haam venitsevu iysh fetach ׇholvo vehiviytu acharey mosheh ad-vovo haohelah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כְּבֹ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ הָאֹ֔הֱלָה יֵרֵד֙ עַמּ֣וּד הֶֽעָנָ֔ן וְעָמַ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וְדִבֶּ֖ר עִם־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: And when Moses entered the Tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the Tent, while [God] spoke with Moses.
Transliteration: vehayah khevo mosheh haohelah eired amud heanan veamad fetach haohel vediver im-mosheh

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֤ה כׇל־הָעָם֙ אֶת־עַמּ֣וּד הֶֽעָנָ֔ן עֹמֵ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וְקָ֤ם כׇּל־הָעָם֙ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ פֶּ֥תַח אׇהֳלֽוֹ׃
Translated: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud poised at the entrance of the Tent, all the people would rise and bow low, at the entrance of each tent.
Transliteration: veraah khׇl-haam et-amud heanan omed fetach haohel vekam khׇl-haam vehishetachavu iysh fetach ׇholvo

Hebrew: וְדִבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ פָּנִ֣ים אֶל־פָּנִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יְדַבֵּ֥ר אִ֖ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְשָׁב֙ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וּמְשָׁ֨רְת֜וֹ יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ בִּן־נוּן֙ נַ֔עַר לֹ֥א יָמִ֖ישׁ מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֹֽהֶל׃ {פ}
Translated: יהוה would speak to Moses face to face, as one person speaks to another. And he would then return to the camp; but his attendant, Joshua son of Nun, [serving as] deputy, would not stir out of the Tent.
Transliteration: vediver yehovah el-mosheh faniym el-faniym khaasher yedaver iysh el-reehu veshav el-hamachaneh umesharetvo yehvoshua vin-nun naar lo yamiysh mitvokhe haohel {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה רְ֠אֵ֠ה אַתָּ֞ה אֹמֵ֤ר אֵלַי֙ הַ֚עַל אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאַתָּה֙ לֹ֣א הֽוֹדַעְתַּ֔נִי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־תִּשְׁלַ֖ח עִמִּ֑י וְאַתָּ֤ה אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ יְדַעְתִּ֣יךָֽ בְשֵׁ֔ם וְגַם־מָצָ֥אתָ חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינָֽי׃
Translated: Moses said to יהוה, “See, You say to me, ‘Lead this people forward,’ but You have not made known to me whom You will send with me. Further, You have said, ‘I have singled you out by name, and you have, indeed, gained My favor.’
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-yehovah reeh atah omer elay haal et-haam hazeh veatah lo hvodaetaniy et asher-tishelach imiy veatah amareta yedaetiykha veshem vegam-matsata chen veeynay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה אִם־נָא֩ מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֜ן בְּעֵינֶ֗יךָ הוֹדִעֵ֤נִי נָא֙ אֶת־דְּרָכֶ֔ךָ וְאֵדָ֣עֲךָ֔ לְמַ֥עַן אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וּרְאֵ֕ה כִּ֥י עַמְּךָ֖ הַגּ֥וֹי הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Now, if I have truly gained Your favor, pray let me know Your ways, that I may know You and continue in Your favor. Consider, too, that this nation is Your people.”
Transliteration: veatah im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha hvodieniy na et-derakhekha veedaakha lemaan emetsa-chen veeyneykha ureeh khiy amekha hagvoy hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר פָּנַ֥י יֵלֵ֖כוּ וַהֲנִחֹ֥תִי לָֽךְ׃
Translated: And [God] said, “I will go in the lead and will lighten your burden.”
Transliteration: vayomar fanay eilekhu vahanichotiy lakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו אִם־אֵ֤ין פָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ הֹלְכִ֔ים אַֽל־תַּעֲלֵ֖נוּ מִזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And he replied, “Unless You go in the lead, do not make us leave this place.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv im-eyn faneykha holekhiym al-taalenu mizeh

Hebrew: וּבַמֶּ֣ה ׀ יִוָּדַ֣ע אֵפ֗וֹא כִּֽי־מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמֶּ֔ךָ הֲל֖וֹא בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֣ עִמָּ֑נוּ וְנִפְלִ֙ינוּ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמְּךָ֔ מִכׇּ֨ל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: For how shall it be known that Your people have gained Your favor unless You go with us, so that we may be distinguished, Your people and I, from every people on the face of the earth?”
Transliteration: uvameh yivada efvo khiy-matsatiy chen veeyneykha aniy veamekha halvo velekhetekha imanu venifeliynu aniy veamekha mikhׇl-haam asher al-feney haadamah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֑ה כִּֽי־מָצָ֤אתָ חֵן֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י וָאֵדָעֲךָ֖ בְּשֵֽׁם׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have asked; for you have truly gained My favor and I have singled you out by name.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh gam et-hadavar hazeh asher divareta eesheh khiy-matsata chen veeynay vaedaakha veshem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַרְאֵ֥נִי נָ֖א אֶת־כְּבֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: He said, “Oh, let me behold Your Presence!”
Transliteration: vayomar hareeniy na et-khevodekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֲנִ֨י אַעֲבִ֤יר כׇּל־טוּבִי֙ עַל־פָּנֶ֔יךָ וְקָרָ֧אתִֽי בְשֵׁ֛ם יְהֹוָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְחַנֹּתִי֙ אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָחֹ֔ן וְרִחַמְתִּ֖י אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲרַחֵֽם׃
Translated: And [God] answered, “I will make all My goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim before you the name יהוה, and the grace that I grant and the compassion that I show,”
Transliteration: vayomer aniy aaviyr khׇl-tuviy al-faneykha vekaratiy veshem yehovah lefaneykha vechanotiy et-asher achon verichametiy et-asher arachem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לִרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־פָּנָ֑י כִּ֛י לֹֽא־יִרְאַ֥נִי הָאָדָ֖ם וָחָֽי׃
Translated: continuing, “But you cannot see My face, for a human being may not see Me and live.”
Transliteration: vayomer lo tukhal lireot et-fanay khiy lo-yireaniy haadam vachay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנֵּ֥ה מָק֖וֹם אִתִּ֑י וְנִצַּבְתָּ֖ עַל־הַצּֽוּר׃
Translated: And יהוה said, “See, there is a place near Me. Station yourself on the rock
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah hineh makvom itiy venitsaveta al-hatsur

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּעֲבֹ֣ר כְּבֹדִ֔י וְשַׂמְתִּ֖יךָ בְּנִקְרַ֣ת הַצּ֑וּר וְשַׂכֹּתִ֥י כַפִּ֛י עָלֶ֖יךָ עַד־עׇבְרִֽי׃
Translated: and, as My Presence passes by, I will put you in a cleft of the rock and shield you with My hand until I have passed by.
Transliteration: vehayah vaavor khevodiy veshametiykha venikerat hatsur veshakhotiy khafiy aleykha ad-ׇveriy

Hebrew: וַהֲסִרֹתִי֙ אֶת־כַּפִּ֔י וְרָאִ֖יתָ אֶת־אֲחֹרָ֑י וּפָנַ֖י לֹ֥א יֵרָאֽוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Then I will take My hand away and you will see My back; but My face must not be seen.”
Transliteration: vahasirotiy et-khafiy veraiyta et-achoray ufanay lo eirau {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה פְּסׇל־לְךָ֛ שְׁנֵֽי־לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִ֖ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֑ים וְכָתַבְתִּי֙ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת אֶ֨ת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֛וּ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֥ת הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שִׁבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: “Carve two tablets of stone like the first, and I will inscribe upon the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you shattered.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh fesׇl-lekha sheney-luchot avaniym kharishoniym vekhatavetiy al-haluchot et-hadevariym asher hayu al-haluchot harishoniym asher shivareta

Hebrew: וֶהְיֵ֥ה נָכ֖וֹן לַבֹּ֑קֶר וְעָלִ֤יתָ בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וְנִצַּבְתָּ֥ לִ֛י שָׁ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָהָֽר׃
Translated: Be ready by morning, and in the morning come up to Mount Sinai and present yourself there to Me, on the top of the mountain.
Transliteration: veheeih nakhvon lavoker vealiyta vavoker el-har siynay venitsaveta liy sham al-rosh hahar

Hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ לֹֽא־יַעֲלֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ וְגַם־אִ֥ישׁ אַל־יֵרָ֖א בְּכׇל־הָהָ֑ר גַּם־הַצֹּ֤אן וְהַבָּקָר֙ אַל־יִרְע֔וּ אֶל־מ֖וּל הָהָ֥ר הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: No one else shall come up with you, and no one else shall be seen anywhere on the mountain; neither shall the flocks and the herds graze at the foot of this mountain.”
Transliteration: veiysh lo-yaaleh imakhe vegam-iysh al-eira vekhׇl-hahar gam-hatson vehavakar al-yireu el-mul hahar hahu

Hebrew: וַיִּפְסֹ֡ל שְׁנֵֽי־לֻחֹ֨ת אֲבָנִ֜ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֗ים וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם מֹשֶׁ֤ה בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וַיַּ֙עַל֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָד֔וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִֽים׃
Translated: So Moses carved two tablets of stone, like the first, and early in the morning he went up on Mount Sinai, as יהוה had commanded him, taking the two stone tablets with him.
Transliteration: vayifesol sheney-luchot avaniym kharishoniym vayashekhem mosheh vavoker vayaal el-har siynay khaasher tsivah yehovah otvo vayikach veyadvo sheney luchot avaniym

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רֶד יְהֹוָה֙ בֶּֽעָנָ֔ן וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֥ב עִמּ֖וֹ שָׁ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֥א בְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: יהוה came down in a cloud—and stood with him there, proclaiming the name יהוה.
Transliteration: vayered yehovah veanan vayiteyatsev imvo sham vayikera veshem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֨ר יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> עַל־פָּנָיו֮ וַיִּקְרָא֒ יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֥ל רַח֖וּם וְחַנּ֑וּן אֶ֥רֶךְ אַפַּ֖יִם וְרַב־חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated: יהוה passed before him and proclaimed: “!יהוה! יהוה a God compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in kindness and faithfulness,
Transliteration: vayaavor yehovah <small></small> al-fanayv vayikera yehovah <small></small> yehovah el rachum vechanun erekhe afayiim verav-chesed veemet

Hebrew: נֹצֵ֥ר חֶ֙סֶד֙ לָאֲלָפִ֔ים נֹשֵׂ֥א עָוֺ֛ן וָפֶ֖שַׁע וְחַטָּאָ֑ה וְנַקֵּה֙ לֹ֣א יְנַקֶּ֔ה פֹּקֵ֣ד ׀ עֲוֺ֣ן אָב֗וֹת עַל־בָּנִים֙ וְעַל־בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֖ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִֽים׃
Translated: extending kindness to the thousandth generation, forgiving iniquity, transgression, and sin—yet not remitting all punishment, but visiting the iniquity of parents upon children and children’s children, upon the third and fourth generations.”
Transliteration: notser chesed laalafiym noshe avon vafesha vechataah venakeh lo yenakeh foked avon avvot al-vaniym veal-veney vaniym al-shileshiym veal-riveiym

Hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֖ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּקֹּ֥ד אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: Moses hastened to bow low to the ground in homage,
Transliteration: vayemaher mosheh vayikod aretsah vayishetachu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר אִם־נָא֩ מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲדֹנָ֔י יֵֽלֶךְ־נָ֥א אֲדֹנָ֖י בְּקִרְבֵּ֑נוּ כִּ֤י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֙רֶף֙ ה֔וּא וְסָלַחְתָּ֛ לַעֲוֺנֵ֥נוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵ֖נוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: and said, “If I have gained Your favor, O my lord, pray, let my lord go in our midst, even though this is a stiffnecked people. Pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your own!”
Transliteration: vayomer im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha adonay eilekhe-na adonay vekirevenu khiy am-kesheh-oref hu vesalacheta laavonenu ulechatatenu unechaletanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִי֮ כֹּרֵ֣ת בְּרִית֒ נֶ֤גֶד כׇּֽל־עַמְּךָ֙ אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה נִפְלָאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־נִבְרְא֥וּ בְכׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ וּבְכׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וְרָאָ֣ה כׇל־הָ֠עָ֠ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֨ה בְקִרְבּ֜וֹ אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־נוֹרָ֣א ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י עֹשֶׂ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: [God] said: I hereby make a covenant. Before all your people I will work such wonders as have not been wrought on all the earth or in any nation; and all the people who are with you shall see how awesome are יהוה’s deeds which I will perform for you.
Transliteration: vayomer hineh anokhiy khoret veriyt neged khׇl-amekha eesheh nifelaot asher lo-nivereu vekhׇl-haarets uvekhׇl-hagvoyim veraah khׇl-haam asher-atah vekirevvo et-maasheh yehovah khiy-nvora hu asher aniy osheh imakhe

Hebrew: שְׁמׇ֨ר־לְךָ֔ אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוְּךָ֣ הַיּ֑וֹם הִנְנִ֧י גֹרֵ֣שׁ מִפָּנֶ֗יךָ אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וְהַחִתִּי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
Translated: Mark well what I command you this day. I will drive out before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
Transliteration: shemׇr-lekha et asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom hineniy goresh mifaneykha et-haemoriy vehakhenaaniy vehachitiy vehaferiziy vehachiviy vehayevusiy

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ פֶּן־תִּכְרֹ֤ת בְּרִית֙ לְיוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה בָּ֣א עָלֶ֑יהָ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְמוֹקֵ֖שׁ בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Beware of making a covenant with the inhabitants of the land against which you are advancing, lest they be a snare in your midst.
Transliteration: hishamer lekha fen-tikherot veriyt leyvoshev haarets asher atah va aleyha fen-yiheyeh lemvokesh vekirevekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָם֙ תִּתֹּצ֔וּן וְאֶת־מַצֵּבֹתָ֖ם תְּשַׁבֵּר֑וּן וְאֶת־אֲשֵׁרָ֖יו תִּכְרֹתֽוּן׃
Translated: No, you must tear down their altars, smash their pillars, and cut down their sacred posts;
Transliteration: khiy et-mizevechotam titotsun veet-matsevotam teshaverun veet-asherayv tikherotun

Hebrew: כִּ֛י לֹ֥א תִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לְאֵ֣ל אַחֵ֑<big>ר</big> כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ קַנָּ֣א שְׁמ֔וֹ אֵ֥ל קַנָּ֖א הֽוּא׃
Translated: for you must not worship any other god, because יהוה, whose name is Impassioned, is an impassioned God.
Transliteration: khiy lo tishetachaveh leel ache<big>r</big> khiy yehovah kana shemvo el kana hu

Hebrew: פֶּן־תִּכְרֹ֥ת בְּרִ֖ית לְיוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֑רֶץ וְזָנ֣וּ ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֗ם וְזָבְחוּ֙ לֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם וְקָרָ֣א לְךָ֔ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ מִזִּבְחֽוֹ׃
Translated: You must not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, for they will lust after their gods and sacrifice to their gods and invite you, and you will eat of their sacrifices.
Transliteration: fen-tikherot veriyt leyvoshev haarets vezanu acharey eloheyhem vezavechu leloheyhem vekara lekha veakhaleta mizivechvo

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ מִבְּנֹתָ֖יו לְבָנֶ֑יךָ וְזָנ֣וּ בְנֹתָ֗יו אַחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ן וְהִזְנוּ֙ אֶת־בָּנֶ֔יךָ אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: And when you take [wives into your households] from among their daughters for your sons, their daughters will lust after their gods and will cause your sons to lust after their gods.
Transliteration: velakacheta mivenotayv levaneykha vezanu venotayv acharey eloheyhen vehizenu et-vaneykha acharey eloheyhen

Hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֥י מַסֵּכָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: You shall not make molten gods for yourselves.
Transliteration: elohey masekhah lo taasheh-lakhe

Hebrew: אֶת־חַ֣ג הַמַּצּוֹת֮ תִּשְׁמֹר֒ שִׁבְעַ֨ת יָמִ֜ים תֹּאכַ֤ל מַצּוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ךָ לְמוֹעֵ֖ד חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָאָבִ֑יב כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֔יב יָצָ֖אתָ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days, as I have commanded you—at the set time of the month of Abib, for in the month of Abib you went forth from Egypt.
Transliteration: et-chag hamatsvot tishemor shiveat yamiym tokhal matsvot asher tsiviytikha lemvoed chodesh haaviyv khiy vechodesh haaviyv yatsata mimitserayiim

Hebrew: כׇּל־פֶּ֥טֶר רֶ֖חֶם לִ֑י וְכׇֽל־מִקְנְךָ֙ תִּזָּכָ֔ר פֶּ֖טֶר שׁ֥וֹר וָשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Every first issue of the womb is Mine, from all your livestock that drop a male as firstling, whether cattle or sheep.
Transliteration: khׇl-feter rechem liy vekhׇl-mikenekha tizakhar feter shvor vasheh

Hebrew: וּפֶ֤טֶר חֲמוֹר֙ תִּפְדֶּ֣ה בְשֶׂ֔ה וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה וַעֲרַפְתּ֑וֹ כֹּ֣ל בְּכ֤וֹר בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ תִּפְדֶּ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יֵרָא֥וּ פָנַ֖י רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated: But the firstling of an ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every male first-born among your children. None shall appear before Me empty-handed.
Transliteration: ufeter chamvor tifedeh vesheh veim-lo tifedeh vaarafetvo khol vekhvor vaneykha tifedeh velo-eirau fanay reykam

Hebrew: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּעֲבֹ֔ד וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת בֶּחָרִ֥ישׁ וּבַקָּצִ֖יר תִּשְׁבֹּֽת׃
Translated: Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor; you shall cease from labor even at plowing time and harvest time.
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym taavod uvayyvom hasheviyiy tishevot vechariysh uvakatsiyr tishevot

Hebrew: וְחַ֤ג שָׁבֻעֹת֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לְךָ֔ בִּכּוּרֵ֖י קְצִ֣יר חִטִּ֑ים וְחַג֙ הָֽאָסִ֔יף תְּקוּפַ֖ת הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
Translated: You shall observe the Feast of Weeks, of the first fruits of the wheat harvest; and the Feast of Ingathering at the turn of the year.
Transliteration: vechag shavuot taasheh lekha vikhurey ketsiyr chitiym vechag haasiyf tekufat hashanah

Hebrew: שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה יֵרָאֶה֙ כׇּל־זְכ֣וּרְךָ֔ אֶת־פְּנֵ֛י הָֽאָדֹ֥ן <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign יהוה, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: shalosh feamiym vashanah eiraeh khׇl-zekhurekha et-feney haadon <small></small> yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אוֹרִ֤ישׁ גּוֹיִם֙ מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ וְהִרְחַבְתִּ֖י אֶת־גְּבֻלֶ֑ךָ וְלֹא־יַחְמֹ֥ד אִישׁ֙ אֶֽת־אַרְצְךָ֔ בַּעֲלֹֽתְךָ֗ לֵרָאוֹת֙ אֶת־פְּנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃
Translated: I will drive out nations from your path and enlarge your territory; no one will covet your land when you go up to appear before your God יהוה three times a year.
Transliteration: khiy-voriysh gvoyim mifaneykha vehirechavetiy et-gevulekha velo-yachemod iysh et-aretsekha vaalotekha leravot et-feney yehovah eloheykha shalosh feamiym vashanah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁחַ֥ט עַל־חָמֵ֖ץ דַּם־זִבְחִ֑י וְלֹא־יָלִ֣ין לַבֹּ֔קֶר זֶ֖בַח חַ֥ג הַפָּֽסַח׃
Translated: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the sacrifice of the Feast of Passover shall not be left lying until morning.
Transliteration: lo-tishechat al-chamets dam-zivechiy velo-yaliyn lavoker zevach chag hafasach

Hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֗ית בִּכּוּרֵי֙ אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ תָּבִ֕יא בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of your God יהוה. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
Transliteration: reshiyt vikhurey adematekha taviy veyt yehovah eloheykha lo-tevashel gediy vachalev imvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כְּתׇב־לְךָ֖ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֞י עַל־פִּ֣י ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה כָּרַ֧תִּי אִתְּךָ֛ בְּרִ֖ית וְאֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses: Write down these commandments, for in accordance with these commandments I make a covenant with you and with Israel.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh khetׇv-lekha et-hadevariym haeleh khiy al-fiy hadevariym haeleh kharatiy itekha veriyt veet-yisherael

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֣ם עִם־יְהֹוָ֗ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אָכַ֔ל וּמַ֖יִם לֹ֣א שָׁתָ֑ה וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֗ת אֵ֚ת דִּבְרֵ֣י הַבְּרִ֔ית עֲשֶׂ֖רֶת הַדְּבָרִֽים׃
Translated: And he was there with יהוה forty days and forty nights; he ate no bread and drank no water; and he wrote down on the tablets the terms of the covenant, the Ten Commandments.
Transliteration: vayehiy-sham im-yehovah arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah lechem lo akhal umayiim lo shatah vayikhetov al-haluchot et diverey haveriyt asheret hadevariym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּרֶ֤דֶת מֹשֶׁה֙ מֵהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וּשְׁנֵ֨י לֻחֹ֤ת הָֽעֵדֻת֙ בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּרִדְתּ֖וֹ מִן־הָהָ֑ר וּמֹשֶׁ֣ה לֹֽא־יָדַ֗ע כִּ֥י קָרַ֛ן ע֥וֹר פָּנָ֖יו בְּדַבְּר֥וֹ אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Moses came down from Mount Sinai. And as Moses came down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, Moses was not aware that the skin of his face was radiant, since he had spoken with God.
Transliteration: vayehiy veredet mosheh mehar siynay usheney luchot haedut veyad-mosheh veridetvo min-hahar umosheh lo-yada khiy karan vor fanayv vedavervo itvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְכׇל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה קָרַ֖ן ע֣וֹר פָּנָ֑יו וַיִּֽירְא֖וּ מִגֶּ֥שֶׁת אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: Aaron and all the Israelites saw that the skin of Moses’ face was radiant; and they shrank from coming near him.
Transliteration: vayare aharon vekhׇl-veney yisherael et-mosheh vehineh karan vor fanayv vayiyreu migeshet elayv

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיָּשֻׁ֧בוּ אֵלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֥ן וְכׇל־הַנְּשִׂאִ֖ים בָּעֵדָ֑ה וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: But Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the chieftains in the assembly returned to him, and Moses spoke to them.
Transliteration: vayikera alehem mosheh vayashuvu elayv aharon vekhׇl-haneshiiym vaedah vayedaver mosheh alehem

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֥ן נִגְּשׁ֖וּ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְצַוֵּ֕ם אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אִתּ֖וֹ בְּהַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translated: Afterward all the Israelites came near, and he instructed them concerning all that יהוה had imparted to him on Mount Sinai.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen nigeshu khׇl-veney yisherael vayetsavem et khׇl-asher diver yehovah itvo vehar siynay

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִדַּבֵּ֖ר אִתָּ֑ם וַיִּתֵּ֥ן עַל־פָּנָ֖יו מַסְוֶֽה׃
Translated: And when Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
Transliteration: vayekhal mosheh midaver itam vayiten al-fanayv maseveh

Hebrew: וּבְבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ יָסִ֥יר אֶת־הַמַּסְוֶ֖ה עַד־צֵאת֑וֹ וְיָצָ֗א וְדִבֶּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְצֻוֶּֽה׃
Translated: Whenever Moses went in before יהוה to converse, he would leave the veil off until he came out; and when he came out and told the Israelites what he had been commanded,
Transliteration: uvevo mosheh lifeney yehovah ledaver itvo yasiyr et-hamaseveh ad-tsetvo veyatsa vediver el-veney yisherael et asher yetsuveh

Hebrew: וְרָא֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה כִּ֣י קָרַ֔ן ע֖וֹר פְּנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְהֵשִׁ֨יב מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־הַמַּסְוֶה֙ עַל־פָּנָ֔יו עַד־בֹּא֖וֹ לְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: the Israelites would see how radiant the skin of Moses’ face was. Moses would then put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with God.
Transliteration: verau veney-yisherael et-feney mosheh khiy karan vor feney mosheh veheshiyv mosheh et-hamaseveh al-fanayv ad-vovo ledaver itvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־עֲדַ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Moses then convoked the whole Israelite community and said to them: These are the things that יהוה has commanded you to do:
Transliteration: vayakehel mosheh et-khׇl-adat veney yisherael vayomer alehem eleh hadevariym asher-tsivah yehovah laashot otam

Hebrew: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ תֵּעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ שַׁבַּ֥ת שַׁבָּת֖וֹן לַיהֹוָ֑ה כׇּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה ב֛וֹ מְלָאכָ֖ה יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a sabbath of complete rest, holy to יהוה; whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym teasheh melakhah uvayyvom hasheviyiy yiheyeh lakhem kodesh shavat shavatvon layhovah khׇl-haosheh vvo melakhah yumat

Hebrew: לֹא־תְבַעֲר֣וּ אֵ֔שׁ בְּכֹ֖ל מֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּי֖וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall kindle no fire throughout your settlements on the sabbath day.
Transliteration: lo-tevaaru esh vekhol moshevoteykhem veyvom hashavat {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Moses said further to the whole community of Israelites: This is what יהוה has commanded:
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-khׇl-adat veney-yisherael lemor zeh hadavar asher-tsivah yehovah lemor

Hebrew: קְח֨וּ מֵֽאִתְּכֶ֤ם תְּרוּמָה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כֹּ֚ל נְדִ֣יב לִבּ֔וֹ יְבִיאֶ֕הָ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: Take from among you gifts to יהוה; everyone whose heart is so moved shall bring them—gifts for יהוה: gold, silver, and copper;
Transliteration: kechu meitekhem terumah layhovah khol nediyv livvo yeviyeha et terumat yehovah zahav vakhesef unechoshet

Hebrew: וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ וְעִזִּֽים׃
Translated: blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, and goats’ hair;
Transliteration: utekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh veiziym

Hebrew: וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאׇדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים וַעֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּֽים׃
Translated: tanned ram skins, dolphin skins, and acacia wood;
Transliteration: veorot eylim meׇdamiym veorot techashiym vaatsey shitiym

Hebrew: וְשֶׁ֖מֶן לַמָּא֑וֹר וּבְשָׂמִים֙ לְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
Translated: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;
Transliteration: veshemen lamavor uveshamiym leshemen hamishechah veliketoret hasamiym
