Hebrew: וְאַ֨בְנֵי־שֹׁ֔הַם וְאַבְנֵ֖י מִלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and the breastpiece.
Transliteration: veaveney-shoham veaveney miluiym laefvod velachoshen

Hebrew: וְכׇל־חֲכַם־לֵ֖ב בָּכֶ֑ם יָבֹ֣אוּ וְיַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And let all among you who are skilled come and make all that יהוה has commanded:
Transliteration: vekhׇl-chakham-lev vakhem yavou veyaashu et khׇl-asher tsivah yehovah

Hebrew: אֶ֨ת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן אֶֽת־אׇהֳל֖וֹ וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֑הוּ אֶת־קְרָסָיו֙ וְאֶת־קְרָשָׁ֔יו אֶת־בְּרִיחָ֕ו אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנָֽיו׃
Translated: the Tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its clasps and its planks, its bars, its posts, and its sockets;
Transliteration: et-hamishekhan et-ׇholvo veet-mikhesehu et-kerasayv veet-kerashayv et-veriychav et-amudayv veet-adanayv

Hebrew: אֶת־הָאָרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֑רֶת וְאֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֥כֶת הַמָּסָֽךְ׃
Translated: the ark and its poles, the cover, and the curtain for the screen;
Transliteration: et-haaron veet-vadayv et-hakhaforet veet farokhet hamasakhe

Hebrew: אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִֽים׃
Translated: the table, and its poles and all its utensils; and the bread of display;
Transliteration: et-hashulechan veet-vadayv veet-khׇl-khelayv veet lechem hafaniym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מְנֹרַ֧ת הַמָּא֛וֹר וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֥מֶן הַמָּאֽוֹר׃
Translated: the lampstand for lighting, its furnishings and its lamps, and the oil for lighting;
Transliteration: veet-menorat hamavor veet-kheleyha veet-neroteyha veet shemen hamavor

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַקְּטֹ֙רֶת֙ וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֔יו וְאֵת֙ שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת קְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֑ים וְאֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לְפֶ֥תַח הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: the altar of incense and its poles; the anointing oil and the aromatic incense; and the entrance screen for the entrance of the Tabernacle;
Transliteration: veet-mizevach haketoret veet-vadayv veet shemen hamishechah veet ketoret hasamiym veet-masakhe hafetach lefetach hamishekhan

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֗ה וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֤ר הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
Translated: the altar of burnt offering, its copper grating, its poles, and all its furnishings; the laver and its stand;
Transliteration: et mizevach haolah veet-mikhevar hanechoshet asher-lvo et-vadayv veet-khׇl-khelayv et-hakhiyor veet-khanvo

Hebrew: אֵ֚ת קַלְעֵ֣י הֶחָצֵ֔ר אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֕ת מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֥עַר הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translated: the hangings of the enclosure, its posts and its sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court;
Transliteration: et kaleey hechatser et-amudayv veet-adaneyha veet masakhe shaar hechatser

Hebrew: אֶת־יִתְדֹ֧ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְאֶת־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר וְאֶת־מֵיתְרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: the pegs for the Tabernacle, the pegs for the enclosure, and their cords;
Transliteration: et-yitedot hamishekhan veet-yitedot hechatser veet-meytereyhem

Hebrew: אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַשְּׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
Translated: the service vestments for officiating in the sanctuary, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons for priestly service.
Transliteration: et-vigedey hasherad lesharet vakodesh et-vigedey hakodesh leaharon hakhohen veet-vigedey vanayv lekhahen

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥צְא֛וּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִלִּפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: So the whole community of the Israelites left Moses’ presence.
Transliteration: vayetseu khׇl-adat veney-yisherael milifeney mosheh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ כׇּל־אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נָדְבָ֨ה רוּח֜וֹ אֹת֗וֹ הֵ֠בִ֠יאוּ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֜ה לִמְלֶ֨אכֶת אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּלְכׇל־עֲבֹ֣דָת֔וֹ וּלְבִגְדֵ֖י הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: And everyone who excelled in ability and everyone whose spirit was moved came, bringing to יהוה an offering for the work of the Tent of Meeting and for all its service and for the sacral vestments.
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-iysh asher-neshavo livvo vekhol asher nadevah ruchvo otvo heviyu et-terumat yehovah limelekhet ohel mvoed ulekhׇl-avodatvo ulevigedey hakodesh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים עַל־הַנָּשִׁ֑ים כֹּ֣ל ׀ נְדִ֣יב לֵ֗ב הֵ֠בִ֠יאוּ חָ֣ח וָנֶ֜זֶם וְטַבַּ֤עַת וְכוּמָז֙ כׇּל־כְּלִ֣י זָהָ֔ב וְכׇל־אִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵנִ֛יף תְּנוּפַ֥ת זָהָ֖ב לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Men and women, all whose hearts moved them, all who would make an elevation offering of gold to יהוה, came bringing brooches, earrings, rings, and pendants —gold objects of all kinds.
Transliteration: vayavou haanashiym al-hanashiym khol nediyv lev heviyu chach vanezem vetavaat vekhumaz khׇl-kheliy zahav vekhׇl-iysh asher heniyf tenufat zahav layhovah

Hebrew: וְכׇל־אִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נִמְצָ֣א אִתּ֗וֹ תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ וְעִזִּ֑ים וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאׇדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
Translated: And everyone who possessed blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair, tanned ram skins, and dolphin skins, brought them;
Transliteration: vekhׇl-iysh asher-nimetsa itvo tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh veiziym veorot eylim meׇdamiym veorot techashiym heviyu

Hebrew: כׇּל־מֵרִ֗ים תְּר֤וּמַת כֶּ֙סֶף֙ וּנְחֹ֔שֶׁת הֵבִ֕יאוּ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נִמְצָ֨א אִתּ֜וֹ עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֛ים לְכׇל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
Translated: everyone who would make gifts of silver or copper brought them as gifts for יהוה; and everyone who possessed acacia wood for any work of the service brought that.
Transliteration: khׇl-meriym terumat khesef unechoshet heviyu et terumat yehovah vekhol asher nimetsa itvo atsey shitiym lekhׇl-melekhet haavodah heviyu

Hebrew: וְכׇל־אִשָּׁ֥ה חַכְמַת־לֵ֖ב בְּיָדֶ֣יהָ טָו֑וּ וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ מַטְוֶ֗ה אֶֽת־הַתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן אֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃
Translated: And all the skilled women spun with their own hands, and brought what they had spun, in blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and in fine linen.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-ishah chakhemat-lev veyadeyha tavu vayaviyu mateveh et-hatekhelet veet-haaregaman et-tvolaat hashaniy veet-hashesh

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־הַנָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָשָׂ֥א לִבָּ֛ן אֹתָ֖נָה בְּחׇכְמָ֑ה טָו֖וּ אֶת־הָעִזִּֽים׃
Translated: And all the women who excelled in that skill spun the goats’ hair.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanashiym asher nasha livan otanah vechׇkhemah tavu et-haiziym

Hebrew: וְהַנְּשִׂאִ֣ם הֵבִ֔יאוּ אֵ֚ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַשֹּׁ֔הַם וְאֵ֖ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: And the chieftains brought lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece;
Transliteration: vehaneshiim heviyu et aveney hashoham veet aveney hamiluiym laefvod velachoshen

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַבֹּ֖שֶׂם וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑מֶן לְמָא֕וֹר וּלְשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
Translated: and spices and oil for lighting, for the anointing oil, and for the aromatic incense.
Transliteration: veet-havoshem veet-hashamen lemavor uleshemen hamishechah veliketoret hasamiym

Hebrew: כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֣ב לִבָּם֮ אֹתָם֒ לְהָבִיא֙ לְכׇל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֑ה הֵבִ֧יאוּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל נְדָבָ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus the Israelites, all the men and women whose hearts moved them to bring anything for the work that יהוה, through Moses, had commanded to be done, brought it as a freewill offering to יהוה.
Transliteration: khׇl-iysh veishah asher nadav livam otam lehaviy lekhׇl-hamelakhah asher tsivah yehovah laashvot veyad-mosheh heviyu veney-yisherael nedavah layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רְא֛וּ קָרָ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּשֵׁ֑ם בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: And Moses said to the Israelites: See, יהוה has singled out by name Bezalel, son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-veney yisherael reu kara yehovah veshem vetsaleel ven-uriy ven-chur lemateh yehudah

Hebrew: וַיְמַלֵּ֥א אֹת֖וֹ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּחׇכְמָ֛ה בִּתְבוּנָ֥ה וּבְדַ֖עַת וּבְכׇל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: endowing him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft,
Transliteration: vayemale otvo rucha Elohim vechׇkhemah vitevunah uvedaat uvekhׇl-melakhah

Hebrew: וְלַחְשֹׁ֖ב מַֽחֲשָׁבֹ֑ת לַעֲשֹׂ֛ת בַּזָּהָ֥ב וּבַכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: and inspiring him to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,
Transliteration: velacheshov machashavot laashot vazahav uvakhesef uvanechoshet

Hebrew: וּבַחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת אֶ֛בֶן לְמַלֹּ֖את וּבַחֲרֹ֣שֶׁת עֵ֑ץ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּכׇל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת מַחֲשָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated: to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of designer’s craft—
Transliteration: uvacharoshet even lemalot uvacharoshet ets laashvot vekhׇl-melekhet machashavet

Hebrew: וּלְהוֹרֹ֖ת נָתַ֣ן בְּלִבּ֑וֹ ה֕וּא וְאׇֽהֳלִיאָ֥ב בֶּן־אֲחִיסָמָ֖ךְ לְמַטֵּה־דָֽן׃
Translated: and to give directions. He and Oholiab son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan
Transliteration: ulehvorot natan velivvo hu veׇholiyav ven-achiysamakhe lemateh-dan

Hebrew: מִלֵּ֨א אֹתָ֜ם חׇכְמַת־לֵ֗ב לַעֲשׂוֹת֮ כׇּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת חָרָ֣שׁ <small>׀</small> וְחֹשֵׁב֒ וְרֹקֵ֞ם בַּתְּכֵ֣לֶת וּבָֽאַרְגָּמָ֗ן בְּתוֹלַ֧עַת הַשָּׁנִ֛י וּבַשֵּׁ֖שׁ וְאֹרֵ֑ג עֹשֵׂי֙ כׇּל־מְלָאכָ֔ה וְחֹשְׁבֵ֖י מַחֲשָׁבֹֽת׃
Translated: have been endowed with the skill to do any work—of the carver, the designer, the embroiderer in blue, purple, crimson yarns, and in fine linen, and of the weaver—as workers in all crafts and as makers of designs.
Transliteration: mile otam chׇkhemat-lev laashvot khׇl-melekhet charash <small></small> vechoshev verokem vatekhelet uvaaregaman vetvolaat hashaniy uvashesh veoreg oshey khׇl-melakhah vechoshevey machashavot

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂה֩ בְצַלְאֵ֨ל וְאׇהֳלִיאָ֜ב וְכֹ֣ל ׀ אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֗ב אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֜ה חׇכְמָ֤ה וּתְבוּנָה֙ בָּהֵ֔מָּה לָדַ֣עַת לַעֲשֹׂ֔ת אֶֽת־כׇּל־מְלֶ֖אכֶת עֲבֹדַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Let, then, Bezalel and Oholiab and all the skilled persons whom יהוה has endowed with skill and ability to perform expertly all the tasks connected with the service of the sanctuary carry out all that יהוה has commanded.
Transliteration: veashah vetsaleel veׇholiyav vekhol iysh chakham-lev asher natan yehovah chׇkhemah utevunah vahemah ladaat laashot et-khׇl-melekhet avodat hakodesh lekhol asher-tsivah yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶל־בְּצַלְאֵל֮ וְאֶל־אׇֽהֳלִיאָב֒ וְאֶל֙ כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה חׇכְמָ֖ה בְּלִבּ֑וֹ כֹּ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֔וֹ לְקׇרְבָ֥ה אֶל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Moses then called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every skilled person whom יהוה had endowed with skill, everyone who excelled in ability, to undertake the task and carry it out.
Transliteration: vayikera mosheh el-vetsaleel veel-ׇholiyav veel khׇl-iysh chakham-lev asher natan yehovah chׇkhemah velivvo khol asher neshavo livvo lekׇrevah el-hamelakhah laashot otah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַתְּרוּמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵבִ֜יאוּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִמְלֶ֛אכֶת עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לַעֲשֹׂ֣ת אֹתָ֑הּ וְ֠הֵ֠ם הֵבִ֨יאוּ אֵלָ֥יו ע֛וֹד נְדָבָ֖ה בַּבֹּ֥קֶר בַּבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: They took over from Moses all the gifts that the Israelites had brought, to carry out the tasks connected with the service of the sanctuary. But when these continued to bring freewill offerings to him morning after morning,
Transliteration: vayikechu milifeney mosheh et khׇl-haterumah asher heviyu veney yisherael limelekhet avodat hakodesh laashot otah vehem heviyu elayv vod nedavah vavoker vavoker

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כׇּל־הַ֣חֲכָמִ֔ים הָעֹשִׂ֕ים אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אִֽישׁ־אִ֥ישׁ מִמְּלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥מָּה עֹשִֽׂים׃
Translated: all the artisans who were engaged in the tasks of the sanctuary came, from the task upon which each one was engaged,
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-hachakhamiym haoshiym et khׇl-melekhet hakodesh iysh-iysh mimelakhetvo asher-hemah oshiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה לֵּאמֹ֔ר מַרְבִּ֥ים הָעָ֖ם לְהָבִ֑יא מִדֵּ֤י הָֽעֲבֹדָה֙ לַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: and said to Moses, “The people are bringing more than is needed for the tasks entailed in the work that יהוה has commanded to be done.”
Transliteration: vayomeru el-mosheh lemor mareviym haam lehaviy midey haavodah lamelakhah asher-tsivah yehovah laashot otah

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיַּעֲבִ֨ירוּ ק֥וֹל בַּֽמַּחֲנֶה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אַל־יַעֲשׂוּ־ע֛וֹד מְלָאכָ֖ה לִתְרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַיִּכָּלֵ֥א הָעָ֖ם מֵהָבִֽיא׃
Translated: Moses thereupon had this proclamation made throughout the camp: “Let no man or woman make further effort toward gifts for the sanctuary!” So the people stopped bringing:
Transliteration: vayetsav mosheh vayaaviyru kvol vamachaneh lemor iysh veishah al-yaashu-vod melakhah literumat hakodesh vayikhale haam mehaviy

Hebrew: וְהַמְּלָאכָ֗ה הָיְתָ֥ה דַיָּ֛ם לְכׇל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אֹתָ֑הּ וְהוֹתֵֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: their efforts had been more than enough for all the tasks to be done.
Transliteration: vehamelakhah hayetah dayam lekhׇl-hamelakhah laashvot otah vehvoter {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ כׇל־חֲכַם־לֵ֜ב בְּעֹשֵׂ֧י הַמְּלָאכָ֛ה אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן עֶ֣שֶׂר יְרִיעֹ֑ת שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י כְּרֻבִ֛ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Then all the skilled among those engaged in the work made the tabernacle of ten strips of cloth, which they made of fine twisted linen, blue, purple, and crimson yarns; into these they worked a design of cherubim.
Transliteration: vayaashu khׇl-chakham-lev veoshey hamelakhah et-hamishekhan esher yeriyot shesh mׇshezar utekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy kheruviym maasheh choshev ashah otam

Hebrew: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לְכׇל־הַיְרִיעֹֽת׃
Translated: The length of each cloth was twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth was four cubits, all cloths having the same measurements.
Transliteration: orekhe hayeriyah haachat shemoneh veesheriym vaamah verochav areva vaamah hayeriyah haechat midah achat lekhׇl-hayeriyot

Hebrew: וַיְחַבֵּר֙ אֶת־חֲמֵ֣שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת וְחָמֵ֤שׁ יְרִיעֹת֙ חִבַּ֔ר אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָֽת׃
Translated: They joined five of the cloths to one another, and they joined the other five cloths to one another.
Transliteration: vayechaver et-chamesh hayeriyot achat el-echat vechamesh yeriyot chivar achat el-echat

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ לֻֽלְאֹ֣ת תְּכֵ֗לֶת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת מִקָּצָ֖ה בַּמַּחְבָּ֑רֶת כֵּ֤ן עָשָׂה֙ בִּשְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה בַּמַּחְבֶּ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: They made loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and did the same on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:
Transliteration: vayaash luleot tekhelet al shefat hayeriyah haechat mikatsah vamachevaret khen ashah vishefat hayeriyah hakiytsvonah vamacheveret hasheniyt

Hebrew: חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֮ בַּיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָת֒ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַיְרִיעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּמַּחְבֶּ֣רֶת הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית מַקְבִּילֹת֙ הַלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָֽת׃
Translated: they made fifty loops on the one cloth, and they made fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops being opposite one another.
Transliteration: chamishiym lulaot ashah vayeriyah haechat vachamishiym lulaot ashah viketseh hayeriyah asher vamacheveret hasheniyt makeviylot halulaot achat el-echat

Hebrew: וַיַּ֕עַשׂ חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים קַרְסֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב וַיְחַבֵּ֨ר אֶת־הַיְרִיעֹ֜ת אַחַ֤ת אֶל־אַחַת֙ בַּקְּרָסִ֔ים וַיְהִ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: And they made fifty gold clasps and coupled the units to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle became one whole.
Transliteration: vayaash chamishiym karesey zahav vayechaver et-hayeriyot achat el-achat vakerasiym vayehiy hamishekhan echad {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ יְרִיעֹ֣ת עִזִּ֔ים לְאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַשְׁתֵּֽי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה יְרִיעֹ֖ת עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: They made cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; they made the cloths eleven in number.
Transliteration: vayaash yeriyot iziym leohel al-hamishekhan ashetey-eshereh yeriyot ashah otam

Hebrew: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע אַמּ֔וֹת רֹ֖חַב הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְעַשְׁתֵּ֥י עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה יְרִיעֹֽת׃
Translated: The length of each cloth was thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth was four cubits, the eleven cloths having the same measurements.
Transliteration: orekhe hayeriyah haachat sheloshiym vaamah veareva amvot rochav hayeriyah haechat midah achat leashetey eshereh yeriyot

Hebrew: וַיְחַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־חֲמֵ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָ֑ד וְאֶת־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָֽד׃
Translated: They joined five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves.
Transliteration: vayechaver et-chamesh hayeriyot levad veet-shesh hayeriyot levad

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ לֻֽלָאֹ֣ת חֲמִשִּׁ֗ים עַ֚ל שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּיצֹנָ֖ה בַּמַּחְבָּ֑רֶת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֙ עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַחֹבֶ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: They made fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and they made fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set.
Transliteration: vayaash lulaot chamishiym al shefat hayeriyah hakiytsonah vamachevaret vachamishiym lulaot ashah al-shefat hayeriyah hachoveret hasheniyt

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ קַרְסֵ֥י נְחֹ֖שֶׁת חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים לְחַבֵּ֥ר אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל לִהְיֹ֥ת אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: They made fifty copper clasps to couple the tent together so that it might become one whole.
Transliteration: vayaash karesey nechoshet chamishiym lechaver et-haohel liheyot echad

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מִכְסֶה֙ לָאֹ֔הֶל עֹרֹ֥ת אֵילִ֖ם מְאׇדָּמִ֑ים וּמִכְסֵ֛ה עֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃ {ס}
Translated: And they made a covering of tanned ram skins for the tent, and a covering of dolphin skins above.
Transliteration: vayaash mikheseh laohel orot eylim meׇdamiym umikheseh orot techashiym milemaelah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים עֹמְדִֽים׃
Translated: They made the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hakerashiym lamishekhan atsey shitiym omediym

Hebrew: עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמֹּ֖ת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ וְאַמָּה֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הָֽאַמָּ֔ה רֹ֖חַב הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: The length of each plank was ten cubits, the width of each plank a cubit and a half.
Transliteration: esher amot orekhe hakaresh veamah vachatsiy haamah rochav hakeresh haechad

Hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֣י יָדֹ֗ת לַקֶּ֙רֶשׁ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד מְשֻׁ֨לָּבֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֣ן עָשָׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל קַרְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: Each plank had two tenons, parallel to each other; they did the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: shetey yadot lakeresh haechad meshulavot achat el-echat khen ashah lekhol kareshey hamishekhan

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֶשְׂרִ֣ים קְרָשִׁ֔ים לִפְאַ֖ת נֶ֥גֶב תֵּימָֽנָה׃
Translated: Of the planks of the Tabernacle, they made twenty planks for the south side,
Transliteration: vayaash et-hakerashiym lamishekhan esheriym kerashiym lifeat negev teymanah

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אַדְנֵי־כֶ֔סֶף עָשָׂ֕ה תַּ֖חַת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים הַקְּרָשִׁ֑ים שְׁנֵ֨י אֲדָנִ֜ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֤רֶשׁ הָאֶחָד֙ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י יְדֹתָ֔יו וּשְׁנֵ֧י אֲדָנִ֛ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י יְדֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;
Transliteration: vearevaiym adeney-khesef ashah tachat esheriym hakerashiym sheney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lishetey yedotayv usheney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lishetey yedotayv

Hebrew: וּלְצֶ֧לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית לִפְאַ֣ת צָפ֑וֹן עָשָׂ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים קְרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, the north side, twenty planks,
Transliteration: uletsela hamishekhan hasheniyt lifeat tsafvon ashah esheriym kerashiym

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under one plank and two sockets under each following plank.
Transliteration: vearevaiym adeneyhem khasef sheney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad usheney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad

Hebrew: וּֽלְיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה עָשָׂ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֥ה קְרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, they made six planks;
Transliteration: uleyarekhetey hamishekhan yamah ashah shishah kerashiym

Hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֤י קְרָשִׁים֙ עָשָׂ֔ה לִמְקֻצְעֹ֖ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן בַּיַּרְכָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: and they made two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.
Transliteration: usheney kerashiym ashah limekutseot hamishekhan vayarekhatayiim

Hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ תוֹאֲמִם֮ מִלְּמַ֒טָּה֒ וְיַחְדָּ֗ו יִהְי֤וּ תַמִּים֙ אֶל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַטַּבַּ֖עַת הָאֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֚ן עָשָׂ֣ה לִשְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם לִשְׁנֵ֖י הַמִּקְצֹעֹֽת׃
Translated: They matched at the bottom, but terminated as one at the top into one ring; they did so with both of them at the two corners.
Transliteration: vehayu tvoamim milematah veyachedav yiheyu tamiym el-roshvo el-hatavaat haechat khen ashah lisheneyhem lisheney hamiketsoot

Hebrew: וְהָיוּ֙ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה קְרָשִׁ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֲדָנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֤י אֲדָנִים֙ שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Thus there were eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two under each plank.
Transliteration: vehayu shemonah kerashiym veadeneyhem khesef shishah ashar adaniym sheney adaniym sheney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בְּרִיחֵ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חֲמִשָּׁ֕ה לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הָאֶחָֽת׃
Translated: They made bars of acacia wood, five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,
Transliteration: vayaash veriychey atsey shitiym chamishah lekareshey tsela-hamishekhan haechat

Hebrew: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֔ם לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית וַחֲמִשָּׁ֤ה בְרִיחִם֙ לְקַרְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לַיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם יָֽמָּה׃
Translated: five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear, to the west;
Transliteration: vachamishah veriychim lekareshey tsela-hamishekhan hasheniyt vachamishah veriychim lekareshey hamishekhan layarekhatayiim yamah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣יחַ הַתִּיכֹ֑ן לִבְרֹ֙חַ֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַקְּרָשִׁ֔ים מִן־הַקָּצֶ֖ה אֶל־הַקָּצֶֽה׃
Translated: they made the center bar to run, halfway up the planks, from end to end.
Transliteration: vayaash et-haveriycha hatiykhon liverocha vetvokhe hakerashiym min-hakatseh el-hakatseh

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֞ים צִפָּ֣ה זָהָ֗ב וְאֶת־טַבְּעֹתָם֙ עָשָׂ֣ה זָהָ֔ב בָּתִּ֖ים לַבְּרִיחִ֑ם וַיְצַ֥ף אֶת־הַבְּרִיחִ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: They overlaid the planks with gold, and made their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and they overlaid the bars with gold.
Transliteration: veet-hakerashiym tsifah zahav veet-taveotam ashah zahav vatiym laveriychim vayetsaf et-haveriychim zahav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ אֶת־הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֛ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖הּ כְּרֻבִֽים׃
Translated: They made the curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, working into it a design of cherubim.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hafarokhet tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar maasheh choshev ashah otah kheruviym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לָ֗הּ אַרְבָּעָה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַפֵּ֣ם זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וַיִּצֹ֣ק לָהֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה אַדְנֵי־כָֽסֶף׃
Translated: They made for it four posts of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold, with their hooks of gold; and they cast for them four silver sockets.
Transliteration: vayaash lah arevaah amudey shitiym vayetsafem zahav vaveyhem zahav vayitsok lahem arevaah adeney-khasef

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מָסָךְ֙ לְפֶ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽם׃
Translated: They made the screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery;
Transliteration: vayaash masakhe lefetach haohel tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar maasheh rokem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַמּוּדָ֤יו חֲמִשָּׁה֙ וְאֶת־וָ֣וֵיהֶ֔ם וְצִפָּ֧ה רָאשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {פ}
Translated: and five posts for it with their hooks. They overlaid their tops and their bands with gold; but the five sockets were of copper.
Transliteration: veet-amudayv chamishah veet-vaveyhem vetsifah rasheyhem vachashukeyhem zahav veadeneyhem chamishah nechoshet {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל אֶת־הָאָרֹ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֨יִם וָחֵ֜צִי אׇרְכּ֗וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה וָחֵ֙צִי֙ רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
Transliteration: vayaash vetsaleel et-haaron atsey shitiym amatayiim vachetsiy ׇrekhvo veamah vachetsiy rׇchevvo veamah vachetsiy komatvo

Hebrew: וַיְצַפֵּ֛הוּ זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר מִבַּ֣יִת וּמִח֑וּץ וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He overlaid it with pure gold, inside and out; and he made a gold molding for it round about.
Transliteration: vayetsafehu zahav tahvor mivayiit umichuts vayaash lvo zer zahav saviyv

Hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֗וֹ אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פַּעֲמֹתָ֑יו וּשְׁתֵּ֣י טַבָּעֹ֗ת עַל־צַלְעוֹ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּי֙ טַבָּעֹ֔ת עַל־צַלְע֖וֹ הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: He cast four gold rings for it, for its four feet: two rings on one of its side walls and two rings on the other.
Transliteration: vayitsok lvo areva taveot zahav al areva faamotayv ushetey tavaot al-tsalevo haechat ushetey tavaot al-tsalevo hasheniyt

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: He made poles of acacia wood, overlaid them with gold,
Transliteration: vayaash vadey atsey shitiym vayetsaf otam zahav

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֤א אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ בַּטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֖ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הָאָרֹ֑ן לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הָאָרֹֽן׃
Translated: and inserted the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark for carrying the ark.
Transliteration: vayave et-havadiym vatavaot al tsaleot haaron lashet et-haaron

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ כַּפֹּ֖רֶת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר אַמָּתַ֤יִם וָחֵ֙צִי֙ אׇרְכָּ֔הּ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי רׇחְבָּֽהּ׃
Translated: He made a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
Transliteration: vayaash khaforet zahav tahvor amatayiim vachetsiy ׇrekhah veamah vachetsiy rׇchevah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ שְׁנֵ֥י כְרֻבִ֖ים זָהָ֑ב מִקְשָׁה֙ עָשָׂ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם מִשְּׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
Translated: He made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work, at the two ends of the cover:
Transliteration: vayaash sheney kheruviym zahav mikeshah ashah otam misheney ketsvot hakhaforet

Hebrew: כְּרוּב־אֶחָ֤ד מִקָּצָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וּכְרוּב־אֶחָ֥ד מִקָּצָ֖ה מִזֶּ֑ה מִן־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים מִשְּׁנֵ֥י (קצוותו) [קְצוֹתָֽיו]׃
Translated: one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; he made the cherubim of one piece with the cover, at its two ends.
Transliteration: kheruv-echad mikatsah mizeh ukheruv-echad mikatsah mizeh min-hakhaforet ashah et-hakheruviym misheney (ktsvvtv) [ketsvotayv]

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ הַכְּרֻבִים֩ פֹּרְשֵׂ֨י כְנָפַ֜יִם לְמַ֗עְלָה סֹֽכְכִ֤ים בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם֙ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת וּפְנֵיהֶ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו אֶ֨ל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת הָי֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הַכְּרֻבִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: The cherubim had their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They faced each other; the faces of the cherubim were turned toward the cover.
Transliteration: vayiheyu hakheruviym foreshey khenafayiim lemaelah sokhekhiym vekhanefeyhem al-hakhaforet ufeneyhem iysh el-achiyv el-hakhaforet hayu feney hakheruviym {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֤יִם אׇרְכּוֹ֙ וְאַמָּ֣ה רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: He made the table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high;
Transliteration: vayaash et-hashulechan atsey shitiym amatayiim ׇrekhvo veamah rׇchevvo veamah vachetsiy komatvo

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ף אֹת֖וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: he overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold molding around it.
Transliteration: vayetsaf otvo zahav tahvor vayaash lvo zer zahav saviyv

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ ל֥וֹ מִסְגֶּ֛רֶת טֹ֖פַח סָבִ֑יב וַיַּ֧עַשׂ זֵר־זָהָ֛ב לְמִסְגַּרְתּ֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He made a rim of a hand’s breadth around it and made a gold molding for its rim round about.
Transliteration: vayaash lvo misegeret tofach saviyv vayaash zer-zahav lemisegaretvo saviyv

Hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֔וֹ אַרְבַּ֖ע טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע הַפֵּאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַרְבַּ֥ע רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated: He cast four gold rings for it and attached the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
Transliteration: vayitsok lvo areva taveot zahav vayiten et-hatavaot al areva hafeot asher leareva ragelayv

Hebrew: לְעֻמַּת֙ הַמִּסְגֶּ֔רֶת הָי֖וּ הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת בָּתִּים֙ לַבַּדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
Translated: The rings were next to the rim, as holders for the poles to carry the table.
Transliteration: leumat hamisegeret hayu hatavaot vatiym lavadiym lashet et-hashulechan

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָ֑ב לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
Translated: He made the poles of acacia wood for carrying the table, and overlaid them with gold.
Transliteration: vayaash et-havadiym atsey shitiym vayetsaf otam zahav lashet et-hashulechan

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶֽת־הַכֵּלִ֣ים ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֗ן אֶת־קְעָרֹתָ֤יו וְאֶת־כַּפֹּתָיו֙ וְאֵת֙ מְנַקִּיֹּתָ֔יו וְאֶ֨ת־הַקְּשָׂוֺ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻסַּ֖ךְ בָּהֵ֑ן זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃ {פ}
Translated: The utensils that were to be upon the table—its bowls, ladles, jugs, and jars with which to offer libations—he made of pure gold.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hakheliym asher al-hashulechan et-kearotayv veet-khafotayv veet menakiyotayv veet-hakeshavot asher yusakhe vahen zahav tahvor {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֖ה זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר מִקְשָׁ֞ה עָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ יְרֵכָ֣הּ וְקָנָ֔הּ גְּבִיעֶ֛יהָ כַּפְתֹּרֶ֥יהָ וּפְרָחֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּ֥נָּה הָיֽוּ׃
Translated: He made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand—its base and its shaft—of hammered work; its cups, calyxes, and petals were of one piece with it.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hamenorah zahav tahvor mikeshah ashah et-hamenorah yerekhah vekanah geviyeyha khafetoreyha uferacheyha mimenah hayu

Hebrew: וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה קָנִ֔ים יֹצְאִ֖ים מִצִּדֶּ֑יהָ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה ׀ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֗ה מִצִּדָּהּ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֔ה מִצִּדָּ֖הּ הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translated: Six branches issued from its sides: three branches from one side of the lampstand, and three branches from the other side of the lampstand.
Transliteration: veshishah kaniym yotseiym mitsideyha sheloshah keney menorah mitsidah haechad usheloshah keney menorah mitsidah hasheniy

Hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְ֠בִעִ֠ים מְֽשֻׁקָּדִ֞ים בַּקָּנֶ֣ה הָאֶחָד֮ כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפֶ֒רַח֒ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְבִעִ֗ים מְשֻׁקָּדִ֛ים בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפָ֑רַח כֵּ֚ן לְשֵׁ֣שֶׁת הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
Translated: There were three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, on one branch; and there were three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, on the next branch; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.
Transliteration: sheloshah geviiym meshukadiym vakaneh haechad khafetor vaferach usheloshah geviiym meshukadiym vekaneh echad khafetor vafarach khen lesheshet hakaniym hayotseiym min-hamenorah

Hebrew: וּבַמְּנֹרָ֖ה אַרְבָּעָ֣ה גְבִעִ֑ים מְשֻׁ֨קָּדִ֔ים כַּפְתֹּרֶ֖יהָ וּפְרָחֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: On the lampstand itself there were four cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals:
Transliteration: uvamenorah arevaah geviiym meshukadiym khafetoreyha uferacheyha

Hebrew: וְכַפְתֹּ֡ר תַּ֩חַת֩ שְׁנֵ֨י הַקָּנִ֜ים מִמֶּ֗נָּה וְכַפְתֹּר֙ תַּ֣חַת שְׁנֵ֤י הַקָּנִים֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְכַפְתֹּ֕ר תַּֽחַת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַקָּנִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑נָּה לְשֵׁ֙שֶׁת֙ הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated: a calyx, of one piece with it, under a pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the second pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the last pair of branches; so for all six branches issuing from it.
Transliteration: vekhafetor tachat sheney hakaniym mimenah vekhafetor tachat sheney hakaniym mimenah vekhafetor tachat-sheney hakaniym mimenah lesheshet hakaniym hayotseiym mimenah

Hebrew: כַּפְתֹּרֵיהֶ֥ם וּקְנֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּ֣נָּה הָי֑וּ כֻּלָּ֛הּ מִקְשָׁ֥ה אַחַ֖ת זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: Their calyxes and their stems were of one piece with it, the whole of it a single hammered piece of pure gold.
Transliteration: khafetoreyhem ukenotam mimenah hayu khulah mikeshah achat zahav tahvor

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֖יהָ שִׁבְעָ֑ה וּמַלְקָחֶ֥יהָ וּמַחְתֹּתֶ֖יהָ זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: He made its seven lamps, its tongs, and its fire pans of pure gold.
Transliteration: vayaash et-neroteyha shiveah umalekacheyha umachetoteyha zahav tahvor

Hebrew: כִּכָּ֛ר זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר עָשָׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־כֵּלֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated: He made it and all its furnishings out of a talent of pure gold.
Transliteration: khikhar zahav tahvor ashah otah veet khׇl-kheleyha {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹ֖רֶת עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּ֣ה אׇרְכּוֹ֩ וְאַמָּ֨ה רׇחְבּ֜וֹ רָב֗וּעַ וְאַמָּתַ֙יִם֙ קֹֽמָת֔וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הָי֥וּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: He made the incense altar of acacia wood, a cubit long and a cubit wide—square—and two cubits high; its horns were of one piece with it.
Transliteration: vayaash et-mizevach haketoret atsey shitiym amah ׇrekhvo veamah rׇchevvo ravua veamatayiim komatvo mimenu hayu karenotayv

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ף אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He overlaid it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and he made a gold molding for it round about.
Transliteration: vayetsaf otvo zahav tahvor et-gagvo veet-kiyrotayv saviyv veet-karenotayv vayaash lvo zer zahav saviyv

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב עָֽשָׂה־ל֣וֹ ׀ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו עַ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: He made two gold rings for it under its molding, on its two walls—on opposite sides—as holders for the poles with which to carry it.
Transliteration: ushetey taveot zahav ashah-lvo mitachat lezervo al shetey tsaleotayv al sheney tsidayv levatiym levadiym lashet otvo vahem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
Transliteration: vayaash et-havadiym atsey shitiym vayetsaf otam zahav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶת־שֶׁ֤מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֙ קֹ֔דֶשׁ וְאֶת־קְטֹ֥רֶת הַסַּמִּ֖ים טָה֑וֹר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽחַ׃ {ס}
Translated: He prepared the sacred anointing oil and the pure aromatic incense, expertly blended.
Transliteration: vayaash et-shemen hamishechah kodesh veet-ketoret hasamiym tahvor maasheh rokecha {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חָמֵשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת אׇרְכּ֜וֹ וְחָֽמֵשׁ־אַמּ֤וֹת רׇחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֔וּעַ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: He made the altar for burnt offering of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—square—and three cubits high.
Transliteration: vayaash et-mizevach haolah atsey shitiym chamesh amvot ׇrekhvo vechamesh-amvot rׇchevvo ravua veshalosh amvot komatvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ קַרְנֹתָ֗יו עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנֹּתָ֔יו מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הָי֣וּ קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וַיְצַ֥ף אֹת֖וֹ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: He made horns for it on its four corners, the horns being of one piece with it; and he overlaid it with copper.
Transliteration: vayaash karenotayv al areva finotayv mimenu hayu karenotayv vayetsaf otvo nechoshet

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶֽת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ אֶת־הַסִּירֹ֤ת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִים֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָקֹ֔ת אֶת־הַמִּזְלָגֹ֖ת וְאֶת־הַמַּחְתֹּ֑ת כׇּל־כֵּלָ֖יו עָשָׂ֥ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: He made all the utensils of the altar—the pails, the scrapers, the basins, the flesh hooks, and the fire pans; he made all these utensils of copper.
Transliteration: vayaash et-khׇl-kheley hamizevecha et-hasiyrot veet-hayaiym veet-hamizerakot et-hamizelagot veet-hamachetot khׇl-khelayv ashah nechoshet

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ מִכְבָּ֔ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֶ֣שֶׁת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת תַּ֧חַת כַּרְכֻּבּ֛וֹ מִלְּמַ֖טָּה עַד־חֶצְיֽוֹ׃
Translated: He made for the altar a grating of meshwork in copper, extending below, under its ledge, to its middle.
Transliteration: vayaash lamizevecha mikhevar maasheh reshet nechoshet tachat kharekhuvvo milematah ad-chetseyvo

Hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֞ק אַרְבַּ֧ע טַבָּעֹ֛ת בְּאַרְבַּ֥ע הַקְּצָוֺ֖ת לְמִכְבַּ֣ר הַנְּחֹ֑שֶׁת בָּתִּ֖ים לַבַּדִּֽים׃
Translated: He cast four rings, at the four corners of the copper grating, as holders for the poles.
Transliteration: vayitsok areva tavaot veareva haketsavot lemikhevar hanechoshet vatiym lavadiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with copper;
Transliteration: vayaash et-havadiym atsey shitiym vayetsaf otam nechoshet

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֨א אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֜ים בַּטַּבָּעֹ֗ת עַ֚ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶ֑ם נְב֥וּב לֻחֹ֖ת עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: and he inserted the poles into the rings on the side walls of the altar, to carry it by them. He made it hollow, of boards.
Transliteration: vayave et-havadiym vatavaot al tsaleot hamizevecha lashet otvo vahem nevuv luchot ashah otvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַשׂ אֵ֚ת הַכִּיּ֣וֹר נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וְאֵ֖ת כַּנּ֣וֹ נְחֹ֑שֶׁת בְּמַרְאֹת֙ הַצֹּ֣בְאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר צָֽבְא֔וּ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: He made the laver of copper and its stand of copper, from the mirrors of the women who performed tasks at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: vayaash et hakhiyyvor nechoshet veet khanvo nechoshet vemareot hatsoveot asher tsaveu fetach ohel mvoed {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֑ר לִפְאַ֣ת ׀ נֶ֣גֶב תֵּימָ֗נָה קַלְעֵ֤י הֶֽחָצֵר֙ שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֔ר מֵאָ֖ה בָּאַמָּֽה׃
Translated: He made the enclosure: On the south side, a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the enclosure—
Transliteration: vayaash et-hechatser lifeat negev teymanah kaleey hechatser shesh mׇshezar meah vaamah

Hebrew: עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָעַמּוּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: with their twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts being silver.
Transliteration: amudeyhem esheriym veadeneyhem esheriym nechoshet vavey haamudiym vachashukeyhem khasef

Hebrew: וְלִפְאַ֤ת צָפוֹן֙ מֵאָ֣ה בָֽאַמָּ֔ה עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָֽעַמּוּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: On the north side, a hundred cubits—with their twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts being silver.
Transliteration: velifeat tsafvon meah vaamah amudeyhem esheriym veadeneyhem esheriym nechoshet vavey haamudiym vachashukeyhem khasef

Hebrew: וְלִפְאַת־יָ֗ם קְלָעִים֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֲשָׂרָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָ֑ה וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשׁוּקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: On the west side, fifty cubits of hangings—with their ten posts and their ten sockets, the hooks and bands of the posts being silver.
Transliteration: velifeat-yam kelaiym chamishiym vaamah amudeyhem asharah veadeneyhem asharah vavey haamudiym vachashukeyhem khasef

Hebrew: וְלִפְאַ֛ת קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָ֖חָה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: And on the front side, to the east, fifty cubits:
Transliteration: velifeat kedemah mizerachah chamishiym amah

Hebrew: קְלָעִ֛ים חֲמֵשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֖ה אֶל־הַכָּתֵ֑ף עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets,
Transliteration: kelaiym chamesh-eshereh amah el-hakhatef amudeyhem sheloshah veadeneyhem sheloshah

Hebrew: וְלַכָּתֵ֣ף הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית מִזֶּ֤ה וּמִזֶּה֙ לְשַׁ֣עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֔ר קְלָעִ֕ים חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה אַמָּ֑ה עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: and fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank—on each side of the gate of the enclosure —with their three posts and their three sockets.
Transliteration: velakhatef hasheniyt mizeh umizeh leshaar hechatser kelaiym chamesh eshereh amah amudeyhem sheloshah veadeneyhem sheloshah

Hebrew: כׇּל־קַלְעֵ֧י הֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב שֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָֽר׃
Translated: All the hangings around the enclosure were of fine twisted linen.
Transliteration: khׇl-kaleey hechatser saviyv shesh mׇshezar

Hebrew: וְהָאֲדָנִ֣ים לָֽעַמֻּדִים֮ נְחֹ֒שֶׁת֒ וָוֵ֨י הָֽעַמּוּדִ֜ים וַחֲשׁוּקֵיהֶם֙ כֶּ֔סֶף וְצִפּ֥וּי רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף וְהֵם֙ מְחֻשָּׁקִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף כֹּ֖ל עַמֻּדֵ֥י הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translated: The sockets for the posts were of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts were of silver, the overlay of their tops was of silver; all the posts of the enclosure were banded with silver.—
Transliteration: vehaadaniym laamudiym nechoshet vavey haamudiym vachashukeyhem khesef vetsifuy rasheyhem khasef vehem mechushakiym khesef khol amudey hechatser

Hebrew: וּמָסַ֞ךְ שַׁ֤עַר הֶחָצֵר֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֔ם תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וְקוֹמָ֤ה בְרֹ֙חַב֙ חָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֔וֹת לְעֻמַּ֖ת קַלְעֵ֥י הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translated: The screen of the gate of the enclosure, done in embroidery, was of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen. It was twenty cubits long. Its height—or width—was five cubits, like that of the hangings of the enclosure.
Transliteration: umasakhe shaar hechatser maasheh rokem tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar veesheriym amah orekhe vekvomah verochav chamesh amvot leumat kaleey hechatser

Hebrew: וְעַמֻּֽדֵיהֶם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף וְצִפּ֧וּי רָאשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: The posts were four; their four sockets were of copper, their hooks of silver; and the overlay of their tops was of silver, as were also their bands.—
Transliteration: veamudeyhem arevaah veadeneyhem arevaah nechoshet vaveyhem khesef vetsifuy rasheyhem vachashukeyhem khasef

Hebrew: וְֽכׇל־הַיְתֵדֹ֞ת לַמִּשְׁכָּ֧ן וְלֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the pegs of the Tabernacle and of the enclosure round about were of copper.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hayetedot lamishekhan velechatser saviyv nechoshet {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֤י הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר פֻּקַּ֖ד עַל־פִּ֣י מֹשֶׁ֑ה עֲבֹדַת֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: These are the records of the Tabernacle, the Tabernacle of the Pact, which were drawn up at Moses’ bidding—the work of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
Transliteration: eleh fekudey hamishekhan mishekhan haedut asher fukad al-fiy mosheh avodat haleviyim veyad iytamar ven-aharon hakhohen

Hebrew: וּבְצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֑ה עָשָׂ֕ה אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Now Bezalel, son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, had made all that יהוה had commanded Moses;
Transliteration: uvetsaleel ven-uriy ven-chur lemateh yehudah ashah et khׇl-asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וְאִתּ֗וֹ אׇהֳלִיאָ֞ב בֶּן־אֲחִיסָמָ֛ךְ לְמַטֵּה־דָ֖ן חָרָ֣שׁ וְחֹשֵׁ֑ב וְרֹקֵ֗ם בַּתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וּבָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן וּבְתוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וּבַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: at his side was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, carver and designer, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and crimson yarns and in fine linen.
Transliteration: veitvo ׇholiyav ven-achiysamakhe lemateh-dan charash vechoshev verokem vatekhelet uvaaregaman uvetvolaat hashaniy uvashesh {s}

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַזָּהָ֗ב הֶֽעָשׂוּי֙ לַמְּלָאכָ֔ה בְּכֹ֖ל מְלֶ֣אכֶת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַיְהִ֣י ׀ זְהַ֣ב הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה תֵּ֤שַׁע וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ כִּכָּ֔ר וּשְׁבַ֨ע מֵא֧וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: All the gold that was used for the work, in all the work of the sanctuary—the elevation offering of gold—came to 29 talents and 730 shekels by the sanctuary weight.
Transliteration: khׇl-hazahav heashuy lamelakhah vekhol melekhet hakodesh vayehiy zehav hatenufah tesha veesheriym khikhar usheva mevot usheloshiym shekel veshekel hakodesh

Hebrew: וְכֶ֛סֶף פְּקוּדֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה מְאַ֣ת כִּכָּ֑ר וְאֶ֩לֶף֩ וּשְׁבַ֨ע מֵא֜וֹת וַחֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: The silver of those of the community who were recorded came to 100 talents and 1,775 shekels by the sanctuary weight:
Transliteration: vekhesef fekudey haedah meat khikhar veelef usheva mevot vachamishah veshiveiym shekel veshekel hakodesh

Hebrew: בֶּ֚קַע לַגֻּלְגֹּ֔לֶת מַחֲצִ֥ית הַשֶּׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְכֹ֨ל הָעֹבֵ֜ר עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֗ים מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה לְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: a half-shekel a head, half a shekel by the sanctuary weight, for each one who was entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, 603,550 men.
Transliteration: veka lagulegolet machatsiyt hashekel veshekel hakodesh lekhol haover al-hafekudiym miven esheriym shanah vamaelah leshesh-mevot elef usheloshet alafiym vachamesh mevot vachamishiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מְאַת֙ כִּכַּ֣ר הַכֶּ֔סֶף לָצֶ֗קֶת אֵ֚ת אַדְנֵ֣י הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֵ֖ת אַדְנֵ֣י הַפָּרֹ֑כֶת מְאַ֧ת אֲדָנִ֛ים לִמְאַ֥ת הַכִּכָּ֖ר כִּכָּ֥ר לָאָֽדֶן׃
Translated: The 100 talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary and the sockets for the curtain, 100 sockets to the 100 talents, a talent a socket.
Transliteration: vayehiy meat khikhar hakhesef latseket et adeney hakodesh veet adeney hafarokhet meat adaniym limeat hakhikhar khikhar laaden

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאֶ֜לֶף וּשְׁבַ֤ע הַמֵּאוֹת֙ וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה וְשִׁבְעִ֔ים עָשָׂ֥ה וָוִ֖ים לָעַמּוּדִ֑ים וְצִפָּ֥ה רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם וְחִשַּׁ֥ק אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And of the 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the posts, overlay for their tops, and bands around them.
Transliteration: veet-haelef usheva hamevot vachamishah veshiveiym ashah vaviym laamudiym vetsifah rasheyhem vechishak otam

Hebrew: וּנְחֹ֥שֶׁת הַתְּנוּפָ֖ה שִׁבְעִ֣ים כִּכָּ֑ר וְאַלְפַּ֥יִם וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֖וֹת שָֽׁקֶל׃
Translated: The copper from the elevation offering came to 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.
Transliteration: unechoshet hatenufah shiveiym khikhar vealefayiim veareva-mevot shakel

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ בָּ֗הּ אֶת־אַדְנֵי֙ פֶּ֚תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְאֵת֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַנְּחֹ֔שֶׁת וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֥ר הַנְּחֹ֖שֶׁת אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־כְּלֵ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Of it he made the sockets for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting; the copper altar and its copper grating and all the utensils of the altar;
Transliteration: vayaash vah et-adeney fetach ohel mvoed veet mizevach hanechoshet veet-mikhevar hanechoshet asher-lvo veet khׇl-kheley hamizevecha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אַדְנֵ֤י הֶֽחָצֵר֙ סָבִ֔יב וְאֶת־אַדְנֵ֖י שַׁ֣עַר הֶחָצֵ֑ר וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־יִתְדֹ֧ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְאֶת־כׇּל־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: the sockets of the enclosure round about and the sockets of the gate of the enclosure; and all the pegs of the Tabernacle and all the pegs of the enclosure round about.
Transliteration: veet-adeney hechatser saviyv veet-adeney shaar hechatser veet khׇl-yitedot hamishekhan veet-khׇl-yitedot hechatser saviyv

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַתְּכֵ֤לֶת וְהָֽאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת הַשָּׁנִ֔י עָשׂ֥וּ בִגְדֵי־שְׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֞וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: Of the blue, purple, and crimson yarns they also made the service vestments for officiating in the sanctuary; they made Aaron’s sacral vestments—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: umin-hatekhelet vehaaregaman vetvolaat hashaniy ashu vigedey-sherad lesharet vakodesh vayaashu et-vigedey hakodesh asher leaharon khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָֽר׃
Translated: The ephod was made of gold, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen.
Transliteration: vayaash et-haefod zahav tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar

Hebrew: וַֽיְרַקְּע֞וּ אֶת־פַּחֵ֣י הַזָּהָב֮ וְקִצֵּ֣ץ פְּתִילִם֒ לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת בְּת֤וֹךְ הַתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וּבְת֣וֹךְ הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן וּבְת֛וֹךְ תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וּבְת֣וֹךְ הַשֵּׁ֑שׁ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה חֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated: They hammered out sheets of gold and cut threads to be worked into designs among the blue, the purple, and the crimson yarns, and the fine linen.
Transliteration: vayerakeu et-fachey hazahav vekitsets fetiylim laashvot vetvokhe hatekhelet uvetvokhe haaregaman uvetvokhe tvolaat hashaniy uvetvokhe hashesh maasheh choshev

Hebrew: כְּתֵפֹ֥ת עָֽשׂוּ־ל֖וֹ חֹבְרֹ֑ת עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י (קצוותו) [קְצוֹתָ֖יו] חֻבָּֽר׃
Translated: They made for it attaching shoulder-pieces; they were attached at its two ends.
Transliteration: khetefot ashu-lvo choverot al-sheney (ktsvvtv) [ketsvotayv] chuvar

Hebrew: וְחֵ֨שֶׁב אֲפֻדָּת֜וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֗יו מִמֶּ֣נּוּ הוּא֮ כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֒הוּ֒ זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: The decorated band that was upon it was made like it, of one piece with it; of gold, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vecheshev afudatvo asher alayv mimenu hu khemaashehu zahav tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ אֶת־אַבְנֵ֣י הַשֹּׁ֔הַם מֻֽסַבֹּ֖ת מִשְׁבְּצֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב מְפֻתָּחֹת֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חוֹתָ֔ם עַל־שְׁמ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: They bordered the lazuli stones with frames of gold, engraved with seal engravings of the names of the sons of Israel.
Transliteration: vayaashu et-aveney hashoham musavot mishevetsot zahav mefutachot fituchey chvotam al-shemvot veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שֶׂם אֹתָ֗ם עַ֚ל כִּתְפֹ֣ת הָאֵפֹ֔ד אַבְנֵ֥י זִכָּר֖וֹן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: They were set on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones of remembrance for the Israelites—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayashem otam al khitefot haefod aveney zikharvon liveney yisherael khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ אֶת־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֵפֹ֑ד זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָֽר׃
Translated: The breastpiece was made in the style of the ephod: of gold, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hachoshen maasheh choshev khemaasheh efod zahav tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy veshesh mׇshezar

Hebrew: רָב֧וּעַ הָיָ֛ה כָּפ֖וּל עָשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן זֶ֧רֶת אׇרְכּ֛וֹ וְזֶ֥רֶת רׇחְבּ֖וֹ כָּפֽוּל׃
Translated: It was square; they made the breastpiece doubled—a span in length and a span in width, doubled.
Transliteration: ravua hayah khaful ashu et-hachoshen zeret ׇrekhvo vezeret rׇchevvo khaful

Hebrew: וַיְמַ֨לְאוּ־ב֔וֹ אַרְבָּעָ֖ה ט֣וּרֵי אָ֑בֶן ט֗וּר אֹ֤דֶם פִּטְדָה֙ וּבָרֶ֔קֶת הַטּ֖וּר הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: They set in it four rows of stones. The first row was a row of carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald;
Transliteration: vayemaleu-vvo arevaah turey aven tur odem fitedah uvareket hatur haechad

Hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשֵּׁנִ֑י נֹ֥פֶךְ סַפִּ֖יר וְיָהֲלֹֽם׃
Translated: the second row: a turquoise, a sapphire, and an amethyst;
Transliteration: vehatur hasheniy nofekhe safiyr veyahalom

Hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י לֶ֥שֶׁם שְׁב֖וֹ וְאַחְלָֽמָה׃
Translated: the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and a crystal;
Transliteration: vehatur hasheliyshiy leshem shevvo veachelamah

Hebrew: וְהַטּוּר֙ הָֽרְבִיעִ֔י תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ שֹׁ֖הַם וְיָשְׁפֵ֑ה מֽוּסַבֹּ֛ת מִשְׁבְּצֹ֥ת זָהָ֖ב בְּמִלֻּאֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and the fourth row: a beryl, a lapis lazuli, and a jasper. They were encircled in their mountings with frames of gold.
Transliteration: vehatur hareviyiy tareshiysh shoham veyashefeh musavot mishevetsot zahav vemiluotam

Hebrew: וְ֠הָאֲבָנִ֠ים עַל־שְׁמֹ֨ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל הֵ֛נָּה שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה עַל־שְׁמֹתָ֑ם פִּתּוּחֵ֤י חֹתָם֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־שְׁמ֔וֹ לִשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר שָֽׁבֶט׃
Translated: The stones corresponded [in number] to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, corresponding to their names; engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.
Transliteration: vehaavaniym al-shemot veney-yisherael henah sheteym eshereh al-shemotam fituchey chotam iysh al-shemvo lisheneym ashar shavet

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֧וּ עַל־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן שַׁרְשְׁרֹ֥ת גַּבְלֻ֖ת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: On the breastpiece they made braided chains of corded work in pure gold.
Transliteration: vayaashu al-hachoshen sharesherot gavelut maasheh avot zahav tahvor

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֗וּ שְׁתֵּי֙ מִשְׁבְּצֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב וּשְׁתֵּ֖י טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּ אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: They made two frames of gold and two rings of gold, and fastened the two rings at the two ends of the breastpiece,
Transliteration: vayaashu shetey mishevetsot zahav ushetey taveot zahav vayitenu et-shetey hatavaot al-sheney ketsvot hachoshen

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּ שְׁתֵּי֙ הָעֲבֹתֹ֣ת הַזָּהָ֔ב עַל־שְׁתֵּ֖י הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת עַל־קְצ֖וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: attaching the two golden cords to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.
Transliteration: vayitenu shetey haavotot hazahav al-shetey hatavaot al-ketsvot hachoshen

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת שְׁתֵּ֤י קְצוֹת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָֽעֲבֹתֹ֔ת נָתְנ֖וּ עַל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצֹ֑ת וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֛ם עַל־כִּתְפֹ֥ת הָאֵפֹ֖ד אֶל־מ֥וּל פָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: They then fastened the two ends of the cords to the two frames, attaching them to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, at the front.
Transliteration: veet shetey ketsvot shetey haavotot natenu al-shetey hamishevetsot vayitenum al-khitefot haefod el-mul fanayv

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֗וּ שְׁתֵּי֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב וַיָּשִׂ֕ימוּ עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֣וֹת הַחֹ֑שֶׁן עַל־שְׂפָת֕וֹ אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר הָאֵפֹ֖ד בָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated: They made two rings of gold and attached them to the two ends of the breastpiece, at its inner edge, which faced the ephod.
Transliteration: vayaashu shetey taveot zahav vayashiymu al-sheney ketsvot hachoshen al-shefatvo asher el-ever haefod vayetah

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֮ שְׁתֵּ֣י טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָב֒ וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֡ם עַל־שְׁתֵּי֩ כִתְפֹ֨ת הָאֵפֹ֤ד מִלְּמַ֙טָּה֙ מִמּ֣וּל פָּנָ֔יו לְעֻמַּ֖ת מַחְבַּרְתּ֑וֹ מִמַּ֕עַל לְחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֹֽד׃
Translated: They made two other rings of gold and fastened them on the front of the ephod, low on the two shoulder-pieces, close to its seam above the decorated band.
Transliteration: vayaashu shetey taveot zahav vayitenum al-shetey khitefot haefod milematah mimul fanayv leumat machevaretvo mimaal lecheshev haefod

Hebrew: וַיִּרְכְּס֣וּ אֶת־הַחֹ֡שֶׁן מִטַּבְּעֹתָיו֩ אֶל־טַבְּעֹ֨ת הָאֵפֹ֜ד בִּפְתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֗לֶת לִֽהְיֹת֙ עַל־חֵ֣שֶׁב הָאֵפֹ֔ד וְלֹֽא־יִזַּ֣ח הַחֹ֔שֶׁן מֵעַ֖ל הָאֵפֹ֑ד כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: The breastpiece was held in place by a cord of blue from its rings to the rings of the ephod, so that the breastpiece rested on the decorated band and did not come loose from the ephod—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayirekhesu et-hachoshen mitaveotayv el-taveot haefod vifetiyl tekhelet liheyot al-cheshev haefod velo-yizach hachoshen meal haefod khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מְעִ֥יל הָאֵפֹ֖ד מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֑ג כְּלִ֖יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
Translated: The robe for the ephod was made of woven work, of pure blue.
Transliteration: vayaash et-meiyl haefod maasheh oreg kheliyl tekhelet

Hebrew: וּפִֽי־הַמְּעִ֥יל בְּתוֹכ֖וֹ כְּפִ֣י תַחְרָ֑א שָׂפָ֥ה לְפִ֛יו סָבִ֖יב לֹ֥א יִקָּרֵֽעַ׃
Translated: The opening of the robe, in the middle of it, was like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around the opening, so that it would not tear.
Transliteration: ufiy-hameiyl vetvokhvo khefiy tachera shafah lefiyv saviyv lo yikarea

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ עַל־שׁוּלֵ֣י הַמְּעִ֔יל רִמּוֹנֵ֕י תְּכֵ֥לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֖ן וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֑י מׇשְׁזָֽר׃
Translated: On the hem of the robe they made pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, twisted.
Transliteration: vayaashu al-shuley hameiyl rimvoney tekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy mׇshezar

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ פַעֲמֹנֵ֖י זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ אֶת־הַפַּֽעֲמֹנִ֜ים בְּת֣וֹךְ הָרִמֹּנִ֗ים עַל־שׁוּלֵ֤י הַמְּעִיל֙ סָבִ֔יב בְּת֖וֹךְ הָרִמֹּנִֽים׃
Translated: They also made bells of pure gold, and attached the bells between the pomegranates, all around the hem of the robe, between the pomegranates:
Transliteration: vayaashu faamoney zahav tahvor vayitenu et-hafaamoniym vetvokhe harimoniym al-shuley hameiyl saviyv vetvokhe harimoniym

Hebrew: פַּעֲמֹ֤ן וְרִמֹּן֙ פַּעֲמֹ֣ן וְרִמֹּ֔ן עַל־שׁוּלֵ֥י הַמְּעִ֖יל סָבִ֑יב לְשָׁרֵ֕ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe for officiating in—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: faamon verimon faamon verimon al-shuley hameiyl saviyv lesharet khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֛וּ אֶת־הַכׇּתְנֹ֥ת שֵׁ֖שׁ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֑ג לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָֽיו׃
Translated: They made the tunics of fine linen, of woven work, for Aaron and his sons;
Transliteration: vayaashu et-hakhׇtenot shesh maasheh oreg leaharon ulevanayv

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַמִּצְנֶ֣פֶת שֵׁ֔שׁ וְאֶת־פַּאֲרֵ֥י הַמִּגְבָּעֹ֖ת שֵׁ֑שׁ וְאֶת־מִכְנְסֵ֥י הַבָּ֖ד שֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָֽר׃
Translated: and the headdress of fine linen, and the decorated turbans of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twisted linen;
Transliteration: veet hamitsenefet shesh veet-faarey hamigevaot shesh veet-mikhenesey havad shesh mׇshezar

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הָאַבְנֵ֞ט שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: and sashes of fine twisted linen, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, done in embroidery—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: veet-haavenet shesh mׇshezar utekhelet vearegaman vetvolaat shaniy maasheh rokem khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֛וּ אֶת־צִ֥יץ נֵֽזֶר־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וַיִּכְתְּב֣וּ עָלָ֗יו מִכְתַּב֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חוֹתָ֔ם קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They made the frontlet for the holy diadem of pure gold, and incised upon it the seal inscription: “Holy to יהוה.”
Transliteration: vayaashu et-tsiyts nezer-hakodesh zahav tahvor vayikhetevu alayv mikhetav fituchey chvotam kodesh layhovah

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ עָלָיו֙ פְּתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת לָתֵ֥ת עַל־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת מִלְמָ֑עְלָה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: They attached to it a cord of blue to fix it upon the headdress above—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayitenu alayv fetiyl tekhelet latet al-hamitsenefet milemaelah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֕כֶל כׇּל־עֲבֹדַ֕ת מִשְׁכַּ֖ן אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus was completed all the work of the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting. The Israelites did so; just as יהוה had commanded Moses, so they did.
Transliteration: vatekhel khׇl-avodat mishekhan ohel mvoed vayaashu veney yisherael khekhol asher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh khen ashu {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֤יאוּ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו קְרָסָ֣יו קְרָשָׁ֔יו בְּרִיחָ֖ו וְעַמֻּדָ֥יו וַאֲדָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Then they brought the Tabernacle to Moses, with the Tent and all its furnishings: its clasps, its planks, its bars, its posts, and its sockets;
Transliteration: vayaviyu et-hamishekhan el-mosheh et-haohel veet-khׇl-khelayv kerasayv kerashayv veriychav veamudayv vaadanayv

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֞ה עוֹרֹ֤ת הָֽאֵילִם֙ הַמְאׇדָּמִ֔ים וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֖ה עֹרֹ֣ת הַתְּחָשִׁ֑ים וְאֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֥כֶת הַמָּסָֽךְ׃
Translated: the covering of tanned ram skins, the covering of dolphin skins, and the curtain for the screen;
Transliteration: veet-mikheseh vorot haeylim hameׇdamiym veet-mikheseh orot hatechashiym veet farokhet hamasakhe

Hebrew: אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן הָעֵדֻ֖ת וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
Translated: the Ark of the Pact and its poles, and the cover;
Transliteration: et-arvon haedut veet-vadayv veet hakhaforet

Hebrew: אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ אֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִֽים׃
Translated: the table and all its utensils, and the bread of display;
Transliteration: et-hashulechan et-khׇl-khelayv veet lechem hafaniym

Hebrew: אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֨ה הַטְּהֹרָ֜ה אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֗יהָ נֵרֹ֛ת הַמַּֽעֲרָכָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֥מֶן הַמָּאֽוֹר׃
Translated: the pure lampstand, its lamps—lamps in due order—and all its fittings, and the oil for lighting;
Transliteration: et-hamenorah hatehorah et-neroteyha nerot hamaarakhah veet-khׇl-kheleyha veet shemen hamavor

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֵת֙ שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת קְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֑ים וְאֵ֕ת מָסַ֖ךְ פֶּ֥תַח הָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: the altar of gold, the oil for anointing, the aromatic incense, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent;
Transliteration: veet mizevach hazahav veet shemen hamishechah veet ketoret hasamiym veet masakhe fetach haohel

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַנְּחֹ֗שֶׁת וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֤ר הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
Translated: the copper altar with its copper grating, its poles and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand;
Transliteration: et mizevach hanechoshet veet-mikhevar hanechoshet asher-lvo et-vadayv veet-khׇl-khelayv et-hakhiyor veet-khanvo

Hebrew: אֵת֩ קַלְעֵ֨י הֶחָצֵ֜ר אֶת־עַמֻּדֶ֣יהָ וְאֶת־אֲדָנֶ֗יהָ וְאֶת־הַמָּסָךְ֙ לְשַׁ֣עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֔ר אֶת־מֵיתָרָ֖יו וִיתֵדֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֗ת כׇּל־כְּלֵ֛י עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן לְאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: the hangings of the enclosure, its posts and its sockets, the screen for the gate of the enclosure, its cords and its pegs—all the furnishings for the service of the Tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting;
Transliteration: et kaleey hechatser et-amudeyha veet-adaneyha veet-hamasakhe leshaar hechatser et-meytarayv viytedoteyha veet khׇl-kheley avodat hamishekhan leohel mvoed

Hebrew: אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַשְּׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
Translated: the service vestments for officiating in the sanctuary, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest, and the vestments of his sons for priestly service.
Transliteration: et-vigedey hasherad lesharet vakodesh et-vigedey hakodesh leaharon hakhohen veet-vigedey vanayv lekhahen

Hebrew: כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה כֵּ֤ן עָשׂוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת כׇּל־הָעֲבֹדָֽה׃
Translated: Just as יהוה had commanded Moses, so the Israelites had done all the work.
Transliteration: khekhol asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh khen ashu veney yisherael et khׇl-haavodah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־כׇּל־הַמְּלָאכָ֗ה וְהִנֵּה֙ עָשׂ֣וּ אֹתָ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה כֵּ֣ן עָשׂ֑וּ וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֹתָ֖ם מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: And when Moses saw that they had performed all the tasks—as יהוה had commanded, so they had done—Moses blessed them.
Transliteration: vayare mosheh et-khׇl-hamelakhah vehineh ashu otah khaasher tsivah yehovah khen ashu vayevarekhe otam mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: בְּיוֹם־הַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ תָּקִ֕ים אֶת־מִשְׁכַּ֖ן אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: On the first day of the first month you shall set up the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: veyvom-hachodesh harishvon veechad lachodesh takiym et-mishekhan ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ שָׁ֔ם אֵ֖ת אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת וְסַכֹּתָ֥ עַל־הָאָרֹ֖ן אֶת־הַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
Translated: Place there the Ark of the Pact, and screen off the ark with the curtain.
Transliteration: veshameta sham et arvon haedut vesakhota al-haaron et-hafarokhet

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתָ֙ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֔ן וְעָרַכְתָּ֖ אֶת־עֶרְכּ֑וֹ וְהֵבֵאתָ֙ אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֔ה וְהַעֲלֵיתָ֖ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Bring in the table and lay out its due setting; bring in the lampstand and light its lamps;
Transliteration: veheveta et-hashulechan vearakheta et-erekhvo veheveta et-hamenorah vehaaleyta et-neroteyha

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֞ה אֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַזָּהָב֙ לִקְטֹ֔רֶת לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵדֻ֑ת וְשַׂמְתָּ֛ אֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: and place the gold altar of incense before the Ark of the Pact. Then put up the screen for the entrance of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: venatatah et-mizevach hazahav liketoret lifeney arvon haedut veshameta et-masakhe hafetach lamishekhan

Hebrew: וְנָ֣תַתָּ֔ה אֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֑ה לִפְנֵ֕י פֶּ֖תַח מִשְׁכַּ֥ן אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: You shall place the altar of burnt offering before the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: venatatah et mizevach haolah lifeney fetach mishekhan ohel-mvoed

Hebrew: וְנָֽתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֔ר בֵּֽין־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְנָתַתָּ֥ שָׁ֖ם מָֽיִם׃
Translated: Place the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
Transliteration: venatata et-hakhiyor veyn-ohel mvoed uveyn hamizevecha venatata sham mayiim

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֖ר סָבִ֑יב וְנָ֣תַתָּ֔ אֶת־מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֥עַר הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translated: Set up the enclosure round about, and put in place the screen for the gate of the enclosure.
Transliteration: veshameta et-hechatser saviyv venatata et-masakhe shaar hechatser

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֑וֹ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֖יו וְהָ֥יָה קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: You shall take the anointing oil and anoint the Tabernacle and all that is in it to consecrate it and all its furnishings, so that it shall be holy.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-shemen hamishechah umashacheta et-hamishekhan veet-khׇl-asher-vvo vekidasheta otvo veet-khׇl-khelayv vehayah kodesh

Hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֛ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְהָיָ֥ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Then anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils to consecrate the altar, so that the altar shall be most holy.
Transliteration: umashacheta et-mizevach haolah veet-khׇl-khelayv vekidasheta et-hamizevecha vehayah hamizevecha kodesh kׇdashiym

Hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּ֑וֹ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֖ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And anoint the laver and its stand to consecrate it.
Transliteration: umashacheta et-hakhiyor veet-khanvo vekidasheta otvo

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֤ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֔יו אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְרָחַצְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall bring Aaron and his sons forward to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and wash them with the water.
Transliteration: vehikeraveta et-aharon veet-vanayv el-fetach ohel mvoed verachatseta otam vamayiim

Hebrew: וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֙ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֖ת בִּגְדֵ֣י הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹת֖וֹ וְכִהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
Translated: Put the sacral vestments on Aaron, and anoint him and consecrate him, that he may serve Me as priest.
Transliteration: vehilevasheta et-aharon et vigedey hakodesh umashacheta otvo vekidasheta otvo vekhihen liy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תַּקְרִ֑יב וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם כֻּתֳּנֹֽת׃
Translated: Then bring his sons forward, put tunics on them,
Transliteration: veet-vanayv takeriyv vehilevasheta otam khutonot

Hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֣ אֹתָ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר מָשַׁ֙חְתָּ֙ אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וְכִהֲנ֖וּ לִ֑י וְ֠הָיְתָ֠ה לִהְיֹ֨ת לָהֶ֧ם מׇשְׁחָתָ֛ם לִכְהֻנַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and anoint them as you have anointed their father, that they may serve Me as priests. This their anointing shall serve them for everlasting priesthood throughout the ages.
Transliteration: umashacheta otam khaasher mashacheta et-aviyhem vekhihanu liy vehayetah liheyot lahem mׇshechatam likhehunat volam ledorotam

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֑ה כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֹת֖וֹ כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃ {ס}
Translated: This Moses did; just as יהוה had commanded him, so he did.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh khekhol asher tsivah yehovah otvo khen ashah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בַּחֹ֧דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֛וֹן בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הוּקַ֖ם הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: In the first month of the second year, on the first of the month, the Tabernacle was set up.
Transliteration: vayehiy vachodesh harishvon vashanah hasheniyt veechad lachodesh hukam hamishekhan

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קֶם מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ן וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־אֲדָנָ֔יו וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ אֶת־קְרָשָׁ֔יו וַיִּתֵּ֖ן אֶת־בְּרִיחָ֑יו וַיָּ֖קֶם אֶת־עַמּוּדָֽיו׃
Translated: Moses set up the Tabernacle, placing its sockets, setting up its planks, inserting its bars, and erecting its posts.
Transliteration: vayakem mosheh et-hamishekhan vayiten et-adanayv vayashem et-kerashayv vayiten et-veriychayv vayakem et-amudayv

Hebrew: וַיִּפְרֹ֤שׂ אֶת־הָאֹ֙הֶל֙ עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וַיָּ֜שֶׂם אֶת־מִכְסֵ֥ה הָאֹ֛הֶל עָלָ֖יו מִלְמָ֑עְלָה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: He spread the tent over the Tabernacle, placing the covering of the tent on top of it—just as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayiferosh et-haohel al-hamishekhan vayashem et-mikheseh haohel alayv milemaelah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח וַיִּתֵּ֤ן אֶת־הָעֵדֻת֙ אֶל־הָ֣אָרֹ֔ן וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עַל־הָאָרֹ֑ן וַיִּתֵּ֧ן אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עַל־הָאָרֹ֖ן מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: He took the Pact and placed it in the ark; he fixed the poles to the ark, placed the cover on top of the ark,
Transliteration: vayikach vayiten et-haedut el-haaron vayashem et-havadiym al-haaron vayiten et-hakhaforet al-haaron milemaelah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֣א אֶת־הָאָרֹן֮ אֶל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֒ וַיָּ֗שֶׂם אֵ֚ת פָּרֹ֣כֶת הַמָּסָ֔ךְ וַיָּ֕סֶךְ עַ֖ל אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: and brought the ark inside the Tabernacle. Then he put up the curtain for screening, and screened off the Ark of the Pact—just as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayave et-haaron el-hamishekhan vayashem et farokhet hamasakhe vayasekhe al arvon haedut khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד עַ֛ל יֶ֥רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן צָפֹ֑נָה מִח֖וּץ לַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
Translated: He placed the table in the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain, on the north side of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: vayiten et-hashulechan veohel mvoed al yerekhe hamishekhan tsafonah michuts lafarokhet

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲרֹ֥ךְ עָלָ֛יו עֵ֥רֶךְ לֶ֖חֶם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: Upon it he laid out the setting of bread before יהוה —as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayaarokhe alayv erekhe lechem lifeney yehovah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד נֹ֖כַח הַשֻּׁלְחָ֑ן עַ֛ל יֶ֥רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן נֶֽגְבָּה׃
Translated: He placed the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting opposite the table, on the south side of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: vayashem et-hamenorah veohel mvoed nokhach hashulechan al yerekhe hamishekhan negevah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל הַנֵּרֹ֖ת לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: And he lit the lamps before יהוה —as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayaal hanerot lifeney yehovah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛שֶׂם אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הַזָּהָ֖ב בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לִפְנֵ֖י הַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
Translated: He placed the altar of gold in the Tent of Meeting, before the curtain.
Transliteration: vayashem et-mizevach hazahav veohel mvoed lifeney hafarokhet

Hebrew: וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר עָלָ֖יו קְטֹ֣רֶת סַמִּ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: On it he burned aromatic incense—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayaketer alayv ketoret samiym khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛שֶׂם אֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: Then he put up the screen for the entrance of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: vayashem et-masakhe hafetach lamishekhan

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֔ה שָׂ֕ם פֶּ֖תַח מִשְׁכַּ֣ן אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיַּ֣עַל עָלָ֗יו אֶת־הָעֹלָה֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: At the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting he placed the altar of burnt offering. On it he offered up the burnt offering and the meal offering—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: veet mizevach haolah sham fetach mishekhan ohel-mvoed vayaal alayv et-haolah veet-haminechah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֔ר בֵּֽין־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן שָׁ֛מָּה מַ֖יִם לְרׇחְצָֽה׃
Translated: He placed the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it for washing.
Transliteration: vayashem et-hakhiyor veyn-ohel mvoed uveyn hamizevecha vayiten shamah mayiim lerׇchetsah

Hebrew: וְרָחֲצ֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֑יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: From it Moses and Aaron and his sons would wash their hands and feet;
Transliteration: verachatsu mimenu mosheh veaharon uvanayv et-yedeyhem veet-rageleyhem

Hebrew: בְּבֹאָ֞ם אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד וּבְקׇרְבָתָ֛ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יִרְחָ֑צוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: they washed when they entered the Tent of Meeting and when they approached the altar—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vevoam el-ohel mvoed uvekׇrevatam el-hamizevecha yirechatsu khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קֶם אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֗ר סָבִיב֙ לַמִּשְׁכָּ֣ן וְלַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַיִּתֵּ֕ן אֶת־מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֣עַר הֶחָצֵ֑ר וַיְכַ֥ל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־הַמְּלָאכָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And he set up the enclosure around the Tabernacle and the altar, and put up the screen for the gate of the enclosure. When Moses had finished the work,
Transliteration: vayakem et-hechatser saviyv lamishekhan velamizevecha vayiten et-masakhe shaar hechatser vayekhal mosheh et-hamelakhah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֥ס הֶעָנָ֖ן אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וּכְב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה מָלֵ֖א אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the Presence of יהוה filled the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: vayekhas heanan et-ohel mvoed ukhevvod yehovah male et-hamishekhan

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכֹ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה לָבוֹא֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד כִּֽי־שָׁכַ֥ן עָלָ֖יו הֶעָנָ֑ן וּכְב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה מָלֵ֖א אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: Moses could not enter the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud had settled upon it and the Presence of יהוה filled the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: velo-yakhol mosheh lavvo el-ohel mvoed khiy-shakhan alayv heanan ukhevvod yehovah male et-hamishekhan

Hebrew: וּבְהֵעָל֤וֹת הֶֽעָנָן֙ מֵעַ֣ל הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן יִסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּכֹ֖ל מַסְעֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When the cloud lifted from the Tabernacle, the Israelites would set out, on their various journeys;
Transliteration: uvehealvot heanan meal hamishekhan yiseu veney yisherael vekhol maseeyhem

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֥א יֵעָלֶ֖ה הֶעָנָ֑ן וְלֹ֣א יִסְע֔וּ עַד־י֖וֹם הֵעָלֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: but if the cloud did not lift, they would not set out until such time as it did lift.
Transliteration: veim-lo eialeh heanan velo yiseu ad-yvom healotvo

Hebrew: כִּי֩ עֲנַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֤ה עַֽל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְאֵ֕שׁ תִּהְיֶ֥ה לַ֖יְלָה בּ֑וֹ לְעֵינֵ֥י כׇל־בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּכׇל־מַסְעֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: For over the Tabernacle a cloud of יהוה rested by day, and fire would appear in it by night, in the view of all the house of Israel throughout their journeys.
Transliteration: khiy anan yehovah al-hamishekhan yvomam veesh tiheyeh layelah vvo leeyney khׇl-veyt-yisherael vekhׇl-maseeyhem
